If you're looking for a full-service bakery, the way it's done old-school, then this is your place.  They serve every baked good you can think of, and if they don't have it, you can certainly special order it.   However, their selection is huge so I doubt you'd be special-ordering.

I go here because it's on my way to my mother-in-law's, and it's always nice to bring a sweet surprise to her.   I would love to have a bakery like this where I live (East side of town). 

Also, there's no aftertaste like you might experience at a grocery store bakery.  It is soooo very delicious.  Staff is certainly friendly too.

Warning, especially to first-time visitors:  I usually go in the bakery with one thing in mind, but end  up leaving with a few more items.
An amazing offering of pastries and baked goods for which I thought would only exist in the Midwest or East Coast. Get there early for the free smells and to chew the gum with the snow birds.

This is the most ridiculous place ever. It's supposed to be 24 hours. At night they all get high and leave everybody in the Drive-Thru where they run in and out of the store and start laughing as you drive away all pissed off. I will never go here again and I will never recommend anyone to this location again and I don't recommend anyone else going either.

Their curry is amazing. I have disliked Thai curry for a very long time, preferring Japanese curry. But after coming here, my whole curry experience has been revolutionized. The curry noodles and the coconut curry is really good.

Their Pad Thai is the worst Pad Thai I've ever had in my life. I don't even think you can even call it Pad Thai.  I don't know if the other yelpers here have tried Pad Thai before but it's supposed to be sweet and NOT spicy, salty, or SOUR! My husband and I were horrified to taste what they call pad Thai. It was like a Chinese version of sweet and sour spicy pad Thai. I don't even know if that description is correct because we could not figure out what we were tasting. 

Another concern is that the bathroom stinks. And you know what they say about how clean a restaurant's bathroom is, it's reflective of the kitchen cleanliness. Just something I thought about. 

But besides that.. Their curry is amazing. And we will be coming back just for it.

Looked at Yelp reviews and had high expectations . Presentation was good but taste was below average ...
The vegetarian curry was smelling like it may have had some fish sauce ... I reconfirmed with the waiter and he denied .. 

I would never go there again nor recommend to anyone ...

Pl. avoid and don't try !!!
Stopped for lunch, all 3 in the group had a different lunch special, everyone thought the food was very good. All agreed it was worth the drive, we'll be back.

I had a water leak in and drip system that was never really use at my families rental.  Epcor's records show that we went from being a family using about 9k gallons of water a month to 35k gallons a month.  Our property has no pool and Epcor says they have no way to detect such discrepancies.  Really!!  As a young family being busy and never paying for a water bill quite like this, it took us a few months to notice.  Know that this company does not care about their customer and their service is extremely poor.  They are not willing to help us out in any way.

This place is great. We eat here, probably once a week. The Phad Thai is fabulous--my favorite--but everything else is great too. 

The staff is from Thailand, and they are extremely nice. The decor is lovely. 

Also, they'll do many of their dishes with tofu if you're vegetarian.

We absolutely could not be more pleased with Jim's work.  Our "LG Mac" kitchen sink developed 'spider cracks' around the center drain - fortunately it was still under warranty. I called to inquire about replacing and Surface Savers was the designated company to replace.  Jim was here EXACTLY at 9am - and promptly went to work.  Four plus hours later, we have a totally new replacement sink. He was even able to save our 'bronze' drain sleeve (which I paid a large sum of money for).  Jim was courteous, professional and made certain everything in the vicinity was protected and totally cleaned up..  We would not hesitate to highly recommend his services!

Great customer service!  I have always received great service and I have been seen at The Core Institute for both knee injuries/surgery, and spinal surgery.  All staff have treated me with the utmost respect and the customer service is above reproach.  Compliments to Tiffany, check-in, Dr Thompson, who's the best ever, and my current surgeon, Dr Abrams.  I wouldn't use any other surgeons anywhere but Core.  I can't imagine anyone complaining about this place.  If you do, you don't know what great quality is.

Food were way too sweet. Starting from Thai tea to Pad Thai. I know some recipe call for peanut in Panang curry, but it was too sweet and the flavor was off. Pad Thai was too wet with tamarind sauce and too sweet even when I ordered it medium. Beef with oyster sauce was tasteless and filled with canned ingredients! And they tasted awful. I gave 2 stars because of the service was acceptable and we enjoyed our waitress. We won't be back, sorry.
Surprisingly the food was not too bad. However the service was quite slow.  This is always a great place to pop into if you need a quick pie for a  gathering

Come here for the baked goods, not the friendly service.  Some days you get a smile, most days you don't.  But if you ignore that and pay for your baked goods, you'll get a treat.  Rich, buttery cookies and cakes that look and taste homemade.  If you're lucky, the counterperson might let you stand there a while and admire the bread, if not take a look at their day old goods and refrigerated cakes.  Stop salivating and buy something!  I'll take a cheese danish :)

I don't care if the restaurant did smell like a hospice and the decor is like a cheesy buffet in Reno, Nevada, but I do care about the food. First off, I went in this place saying it's a Thai spot in Surprise but the white rice was undercooked...HOW DO YOU MESS UP ON JASMINE RICE. I'm done...
service was good , elderly  lady 6 am Friday.  Florentine omlet not  good, the egg crumbled apart as though it had been refrigerated and reheated.

This is the worst funeral home I've ever seen! I don't know where to start! After my mothers passing, her ashes were to be shipped to the family. After one week I called Palm funeral home and they said the ashes would be shipped out that day. Then one more week passed and nothing arrived so I called again and they assured me she's on her way.  Then another week and still nothing! The funeral home said they would call me back each time and never did.  It's been more then three weeks and we haven't received anything. I called again and they told me they would walk over to the POST OFFICE to check where she was. I couldn't believe they would put my mother through the post office! They charged me $200 for this mailing service which we thought was a fed ex. Now more then three weeks have past and still no phone calls or information of the whereabouts of my moms remains. I finally get through to them and I ask to talk to the owner who was very rude, I asked him is my mom on her way and he replied "I guess so" UNBELIEVABLE how insensitive and unprofessional these people are! Then I asked for the tracking number and he gave it to me. I then asked him what day was she mailed because it had been weeks. He then said there was no date on the receipt! Which we knew was a lie! After hanging up I tracked the number to find out she was mailed one hour before, during my phone calls. So I called back and told them I see you just mailed it today! She said to me "I'm done talking to you! If you don't like it I will go over and canceled the mailing and you can drive here and pick up the ashes". How insensitive of her after I just lost my mother! Now we don't even know if it's our mothers remains? This funeral home is not honest at all! It's now been 5 weeks and still no death certificate from them. Please don't let this happen to your family member!

Was really excited about Thai but the only thing I enjoyed was my Thai tea. I ordered something I didn't see any reviews for but it's such a typical Thai dish I figured it was going to be good. I ordered pad Thai and was hugely disappointed. Not the typical peanut recipe so I just couldn't enjoy it. So I did leave unsatisfied. It seemed like everyone else around me enjoyed their food and it was quick and clean.

This place is a counterfeit. Not even close to a New York bakery. Some times the cookies are stale. The bread is ok. The help have attitude problems. Forget about it! I like My daddy's bakery on Bell rd. Closer to a real Italian bakery from NY. Trust me. Much better. 4 to 5 stars, truly. You can eat there or take home sandwiches or pizza. A find for Sun City residents.

Super disappointing visit. No idea what's going on here. Flavor was totally lacking in all of our dishes. The green curry...was there even curry in it?  The heat was there, but from what? Not any ingredient I could figure out. And canned mushrooms! Yuck. I know they had fresh ones in the kitchen because they were in our soup.  Speaking of the soup, it was missing lemongrass and cilantro. The pad Thai was presented with one, sad string of cilantro and no lime or lemon. Even the rice was overcooked and flavorless, like the cheapest rice available. We all had enough left for another meal, but no one wanted to take it home. From now on, we will stick with Tom Yum and skip this one.
Good food, good service. Love the chairs on wheels. Recommend
I have been going their for over a year and have never been disappointed.   Pastry and Bake goods are as good as it gets.  Staff is excellent

Usually go here for some late night burritos :) Price and service is fair. 
No complaints here.

What to do for lunch on a Saturday whilst browsing realtors' open houses? Try Line Thai on Bell Road, of course.

Good selection, reasonable prices. Spring rolls were just $2 for two. I had the green curry with pork, and my girlfriend had special #29 - phad woon sen (silver noodles). Both were served with an enormous quantity of rice. We were both surprised at how juicy/wet each dish was; my green curry was served in a bowl and was more soup than curry. I didn't mind, as it was a different style than what I consider more traditional  Thai - like Siam Thai on 51st Ave & Northern who serve their entrees less saucy. But overall very satisfying with an appropriate spice, considering this is Sun City.

The one complaint would be one of the waitresses who spoke in more of a whisper than voice. I couldn't hear her, let alone understand her, and I'm far from being eligible to live in Sun City. I can't imagine what the blue hairs have to go through getting her to break with traditional demure vocalizations.

Definitely tasty enough to warrant a return visit to try the mee krob.

After work one night, I had a rediculous craving for some Thai Curry, so I remembered driving past this place and always seeing cars parked out front.  So, I thought, let's go there!  Glad I did!  I was a little freaked out when I pulled up @ 7PM, and there were no cars in the parking lot.  Then again, it is in Sun City, so their dinner rush ends @ 6, so it made sense.  I ordered the Yellow Curry with Rice and the Fish Patty with Cucumber Chili sauce as an appetizer.  Everything was so flavorful!  I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great Thai experience.  I did not give this a 5, only because I am still learning about Thai food.
Very clean inside and food is always good no matter what time of the day you come. Prefer it over other options any day
I've owned 4 houses in 4 different cities. Epcor by far has the worse customer service and is ripping everyone they service off..

We just bought a new home and we had several different contractors/service men in our home to address numerous things that are under our homeowners warranty. Of all the the contractors, 
Jim was by far the most professional and meticulous person that has come through our home. 

He did an excellent job repairing a scratch on our Quartz countertop and gave me great advice on how to care for our marble counters in our bathroom. Definitely adding his name to our contact list.

Towed my vehicle to a Firestone where they left it in the middle of the parking lot. Because they did not put it where it was easily visible overnight, like in a parking spot the vehicle was vandalized. Right driver's window was completely smashed out.

Stopped in for breakfast & ordered their French Toast what a mistake that was! It was terrible.
The cook didn't soak the bread in an egg mixture with sugar & vanilla. End result: tasteless. I couldn't believe anyone could screw up French Toast but they did. Their prices are too high for what they give you.

Our group of three arrived shortly after noon, and considering this is in a strip mall on busy Bell Road, I was a bit surprised that not only we didn't have a wait, but the lobby and dining areas seemed relatively empty. I hoped this wasn't a harbinger of things to come.

We were seated promptly after being asked our table/booth preference, and given menus and waters right away. After a few minutes of poring over the extensive menu, our waitress came by to take our order. There were too many items to choose from, so we needed help with our decision, which the waitress was helpful with. The guys ordered lunch specials ($6.95 each, served with soup, rice, and egg roll); one was a chicken/pineapple sweet dish, which the waitress said they couldn't do spicy, but she could bring out hot red pepper to sprinkle on, as well as what may have been homemade chili hot sauce in a dish. The other  was some sort of chicken dish ordered extra spicy, and he was a bit surprised (but not disappointed) it had *very* hot sliced hot peppers in it. I ordered off the regular menu, Phat Thai (pad thai) for $8.95 ordered extra "Thai" spicy, which was served with soup and it was delicious. There were several pieces of tender chicken but only two large shrimp in the noodle dish, which was probably enough to split in half and take home, but I didn't because it was too tasty. 

All in all the food and service were very good, the only reason for only four stars was it just didn't go that extra mile in ambiance, price, etc. that makes someone rave about a new favorite to recommend driving across the state for. Maybe just across the West Valley.

This has just become my new favorite bakery! If you are old school and grew up here in Phoenix and remember Karshs Bakery in Phoenix from back in the day, you will LOVE this place! Although I still miss the Webbies of old, their butter cookies are great! The variety they offer is like that of Karshs and are sold by the pound. They even have Kickle! I was really impressed with the variety of baked goods, breads, cakes, and other goodies that they offered. They were fast and attentive to their customers and I will definitely go back again!
All i can say is its awesome!! And i would recommend it to everyone! The pastries are out of this world!!
The food is decent but the facility has a smell about it that turns my stomach. Upon looking around the carpet is grossly dirty.

This experience has convinced me to never return to Subway. First problem was with a order on line. Showed up as the order said and the very "nice" associate explained that they were really rushed and that there was no way to have my food ready on time. Second time was we had a really big rush and we are all out. Last 2 experiences were with coupons we don't and will not except corporate coupons we don't have too. Just a really bad example of subway. There hurting the Subway image.

Aww, we discovered an oasis in the desert. An unassuming exterior. Once you step inside you feel the that this is the real deal. Just what we were looking for. In the lobby there are the most beautiful paintings of Thai traditions. The entrance has lush plants arranged just so. The restaurant has plenty of space. You won't ever feel crowed. The servers are so very nice. Respectful even. Reasonable prices. The food is the main thing right? We were so impressed. It has become our favorite Thai restaurant in the Surprise area. They deserve a great review!!

OMG. I just experienced the WORST service ever!!! When ordering the lunch special and asked the waitress for  the soup choices I had for my included soup her response "its chicken broth with noodles!" And let me point out with an attitude.  Only asked because it did not specify which soup was included with the lunch special and their menu did have a list of soups. 

Then After watching everyone arriving after us getting  their food before we did, I get my dish which was soooo bland I had to ask for soy sauce (by the time I was able to get her attention for service, my lunch date was already done with their lunch).  After dousing the chicken in soy sauce to make it eatable, i couldn't eat it. As she came to pick up our plates I mentioned I was not happy with my meal, before I could finish her response"its sautéed in oyster sauce and what you want !?! A fancy dish?!?"  AH! Really?!?! 

And please note 1) im NOT  a picky eater and 2) I am very well versed in Thai food. I come from Thailand raised in -laws.

I don't know what these negative reviews are on about, because I had a great experience. This place has many quality items and if you look around, you can definitely find a great deal. I got a perfect condition vintage coat with fur lining and some unworn Tommy Hilfiger shoes altogether for $13. (Always check the soles of thrift shop shoes.) I'll be back to treasure hunt!

this company are thieves! were out of our home for two months having work done on our flooring and had two toilets disconnected with no one living in our home. but miraculously  our bill remained the normal amount as if we were living there. then to top that, one month never received a paper or electronic bill and happened to realize that i should have and called to see why? was offered that they would adjust the small finance charge was told the little finance charge but they failed to mention that they treat your account like a credit card so if you don't make that payment in full rather it's correct or not you continue to accrue finance charges.  what kind of company are you??? you're not a bank. your customers already pay atrocious to begin with in fees (close to $90/month) just to have water. then you pay on top of that. i can live in another state and water my lawn to where it is green and still pay less than what i do here with desert landscaping. definitely don't recommend living anywhere that epcor is your only option for water. they'll take you to the gutters!!!

This bakery is the real deal. Being a New Yorker I consider myself to be a harsh judge of a good pastry. I've had the best and this place ranks top 5 in the U.S. My only complaint, it's 35 miles from where I live in the East Valley. With that said I visit at least once a month! I definitely would suggest you give them a try. I have no doubt you'll fall in love. Almost forgot......I love the way they package your items to go! All securely boxed and tied with string the old school way. No one does that anymore!

If you have not tried their italian desserts you are truly missing out.  I also love their breads.  They are always so soft and fresh.  Perfect for a nice sandwich or on their own.  Incredibly nice staff who are willing to go the extra mile. : )
I am very thankful for all the help Jeremy and his friendly staff have done for me and my family through this difficult time. I highly recommend!!
I have eaten here several times, and had really good meals, excellent lunch specials. The staff is super helpful and very friendly.

I have been here twice, first time I was ignored completely. Only one other customer and this customer and owner (?) employee were having a discussion that sounded more personal and friendly than a client inquiring about products. The second time, there was a sign on the door that they were closed on a specific day (may 5th) but the day I dropped by was the 3rd and it was a regular business day. I gave up. If i need something immediately, i go to sprouts otherwise, i order online from doterra or young living.

I moved to Fountain Hills and heard about Epcor. 
They charged me a fee to make a payment on the phone even through the automated telephone service was used.  The live person would not take a payment. 
They also charge you a fee if you don't set up automatic payment online. 
I am trying to see if I can make a complaint with the better business department.

Rude people. Especially the guy with the mullet. Starts demanding a tip after I get my haircut. A tip is not mandatory. Someone send these Commie Russians back to their own country please. Foreigners go home. #MAGA
Super friendly and knowledgeable! Took a ball in to be drilled and got lucky and they did it within a hour! I know where my bowling business will be from now on!

Wish I could rate this terrible company 0 if I could. They are corrupt. They charge 3X more for sewer than Peoria City! The reps sound like zombies working behind the corruption. We used 3 gallons of water last month at most not even at our old home and bil was 138 dollars! More than our new home using water! This company needs to be iced. Frankly the worst service I have ever experienced in my life

How can my bill for August and September be exactly the same along with their graph showing water usage EXACTLY the same... oh and those two months my bill DOUBLED!! Nothing changed from June or July, no leaks, nothing...just Epcor trying to scam people again, yes again!!!

I thought I was the only one who didn't care for The Core. We recently moved here and needed an ortho. We asked around and everyone spoke very highly of the place. After surgery I developed a staph infevtion; which just the luck of the draw.  What I object to is that the PA treated me by taking a photo of the infection, ran to show the doctor. When I go to a surgeon, I want the follow-up to be with him.

Got pad Thai and Panang curry 

The pad Thai was weird tasting. Tasted more like a sweet and sour dish than a pad Thai. 

The Panang curry was okay, certainly not what I would call Panang curry but not bad. 

Overall overpriced. and not great. Wouldn't go back.

I can't believe we've never eaten here and have lived in Surprise for almost 2 years! Started with the spring rolls which were delicious. There were 2 of us and we split the coconut curry soup and a curry, potato and chicken dish. All of it was delicious! Great service and even better food. and the bill only came to $24 bucks.
The food was great. We ordered the Pad Thai and it was great! The service was excellent, and the waitress was very polite and friendly.

I have stopped in two times to get treats and I will keep coming back.  I needed some gluten free treats for some family who can not have it, and they had three items that were the most delicious and enjoyable goodies!! The almond horn, coconut macaroons and pine nut cookies were gluten free.  They were soooooooooo yummy.  I also treated myself to the chocolate chip canoli in the car on the way to family dinner, ooohhhh my goodness it was soooooo good.  I am not a canoli expert at all, but if they are like this one than I am a FAN!! I have had the raspberry cookies before and they are very very good also.

Only things I would say kept it from being five star is the price, 20 bucks for 15 cookie sized treats.  I think about how many cookies or cupcakes I could bake for that cost and compare to the amount I was able to buy and I feel a little over charged.  At the same time, there is a lot of work put into everything and variety, and I couldn't make some of the things they did, so I can see it being ok cost wise... Also they are not rude at all, but there was tension or something odd about the customer service.  It felt like I walked into a family argument or something... They just aren't warm and I expect some friendliness in this kind of business, show me some of your joy and passion for what you are doing... I am dropping a 20!! :) :) :)

IT IS SOOOOOOOOO OBVIOUS that anyone who knocks the food here is absolutely clueless as to what authentic pastries / baked goods are supposed to be. Your ignorance is on full display. There is nothing but quality here. If your little wuss feelngs are hurt because the staff doesn't have time to tell you the ingredients in your grass fed gluten free wheat unsalted butter cut 9 ways organic BS cookie that was baked in the same oven as the lard based thing it is in the case with get the F*** out and go to crapbucks garbage laced (but lactose free) organic farro wheat muffin served by the idiot barista (LOL) from a powdered mix for 5 bucks because you will look cool with a starbucks cup in your hand.

New York Cheesecake is DA BOMB!

Ordered a 10" for a special occasion and it was a hit with my party! Not too sweet nor thick, super tasty, and just the right amount of 'fluff' (great texture/consistency). They decorated it beautifully - bright blue roses with green vines - and the cost was very reasonable considering the size and quality of ingredients.

Six large adults and several little ones later, I was left with more than 1/3 cheesecake to take home. 

We grabbed some other pastries too. The apple fritter was tasty but too sweet for my particular savor. The cinnamon buns were exceptional - very authentic, flaky, just the right amount of pecans. They have beautiful, hard-crust loaves of bread available. Have yet to tear into the rye loaf but it smells and looks delicious. And to my surprise, they had cinnamon crispies which - next to French palmieres - are my favorite baked good. Also a bit too sweet for my taste (I guess they're supposed to be) but a nice treat nonetheless.

I've been coming to this place for years and have never had a bad experience. Everything I've ordered from the menu has been excellent and is always a more than fair portion. My favorite thing about the place is the fantastic service though. All the servers there are very friendly and do a great job. After months of not going there upon walking in I've been greeted by long time no see and big smiles.
We are repeat customers here. Their service is always great and the food is very good.

Professional, kind, thorough.   I've never had a need for a funeral home until recently when my Mom passed away.  Rob, Leo and the whole staff were Amazing.   They went above and beyond and took care of everything with grace, professionalism and kindness.  Truly good people here.

$30 fee to transfer service. Seriously?? Epcor- you are guaranteed my business as long as I live in this town -there is no other company I can go through... is this really necessary to charge a transfer fee?! Just another example of ridiculous gouging from this company. I have lived here since 1999, they have been gouging since!Their excuse for this fee -we don't charge a deposit... oh ok- this so this fee will be refunded when i move again? NO - it will be CHARGED again!
Best Thai food I've eaten in the Phoenix area.

First time at this barber shop and these guys are great. They only charge $12 for a cut. The shop is nothing fancy, but I'm there for a good haircut. They use a straight razor and warm foam to clean your neck up. I've been to Master Phades and Straight Razor Barber Shop and I would say this place is the best. Will definitely be going back again!

The worst Thai food I've ever had! This place was recommended to us by another couple, and wow was I disappointed!

Everything was completely blase and tasteless, the only exception being the extreme spiciness of my fiance's entree(probably to make up for the lack of other spices)...

don't bother with this place.
We get carne asada burritos from here a couple times a month. I can live off them. I have noticed they have gotten smaller over the last year or so; that's the reason for 4 stars.

I would have given this restaurant 5 stars but I had to compare it to Tom Yum. Tom Yum had more flavor, and they are able to accommodate your spice level. The curry here was spicy even though we asked for no spice. Other than that. The flavor was good and good quantity and quality for the money. The only other complaint I would have is the water is sink water, and nobody likes that.

Went there today. Menu is all different and hard to read from your car.  Husband got tacos, (why is KFC selling tacos?)  There was almost an ounce of meat in each one, it was a pitiful thing.  Asked for extra gravy did not get, no butter for biscuit.  Biscuit smashed in the box and flat as a pancake.  It is just not the same as it used to be.

How in the world you can change the definition of Danish pastry for me??? 
You are making my life harder! 
Now I won't be happy with any random Danish pastry and you are TOO far! 
A sweet client of ours surprised us with three boxes delivered to our office. 
THE BEST we've ever had in our lives! 
You guys need to open a location in East Valley pls!
Excellent Thai food ! This is a favorite take out for my family. 4 stars because the restaurant definitely needs updating. The currys are wonderful and you are always greeted with a smile.

We love this place and vist at least once a month.  Never had a bad experience or had a long wait.  As far as the spiciness of the food, I always order everything medium hot.  Sometimes it's spicier than others, but it's always good.  Be aware, though, that some of the dishes aren't intended to be super spicy.  If you want spicy, you must ask.  Remember, this restaurant is in Sun City.  The retired set doesn't dig spice the way younger folks often do!  

As far as starters, I'm not crazy about the fried tofu.  It's cold and yes, kind of tasteless.  Go for soup #24, the Tom Kha Kai.  If you're vegetarian, just say so and they'll substitute other veggies for the chicken (still has fish sauce in the soup, though I personally make an exception for that since it's so great). Whatever leftover soup you take home goes well over rice.  The fried bananas are good, too.  Skip the deep fried egg rolls if you're wanting something spicy.  They're tasty, but rather generic as far as flavor goes.

The red curry tofu, Kaeng Dang Tofu (#81), is my favorite.  The green curry doesn't have quite the depth the red does.  Sadly, there isn't a yellow curry in a vegetarian version.  

Order the brown rice.  It's not that gummy, wad of newspaper-tasting stuff that some places want you to believe is brown rice.  This brown rice is chewy, but with a pleasant, nutty flavor.  I ate quite a bit of it plain and liked it very much.

Also, ask for mango sticky rice as your dessert.  It's not on the menu, but when they have it during Thai mango season, it is to die for.

I see this KFC/Taco Bell is already rated pretty low, which is no surprise to me after my last experiences there which span over years.  I am finally reviewing it and hopefully this will keep me away forever.
  
First I had promised myself that I would never go back, and yet I did yesterday.  This was after a few months ago when  I added a cake to my order that was suggested by the attendant taking my order at the drive-thru. I broke the cardinal rule of ordering via drive-through which is not to check your order before you drive off.  Yes, I arrived home and the cake was not in my order, a total waste of $5.  It's like just taking a 5 dollar bill and throwing it out the window.  Sure not enough to break the bank, but enough to severely piss you off.  At that time, a year ago, I promised myself I would never go back.  
  
Yet yesterday I had a hunger for some chicken strips, my son suggested this place.  I said any chicken fingers from any place would be fine but he wanted KFC so I gave in.  He spent $25 dollars on two chicken fingers meals!!!  If he had gone to Burger King or Jack in the Box, we maybe would have spend $14 instead of $25.  The problem is, KFC bundles their chicken meals (bone in or bone out) with piece orders with 2 sides AND NO DRINK IS PROVIDED WITH THESE MEALS!  So he orders 2 large drinks along with the meals which were 5 piece chicken finger meals, with cole slaw and home fries as sides that came with the meals.  I DID NOT WANT TO SPEND 25 DOLLARS ON TWO FREAKING CHICKEN FINGER MEALS!  
  
I am now going on a cruscade against this company and I will be writing them about this.  Plus here on YELP, I am reviewing every KFC within a 25 mile radius of where I live and they are getting one star (wish I could give 0 stars).

I have bought a cheese beef sandwich this afternoon about 5 PM. Hey I cheese was melted on the beef girl wrapped the sandwich up and set it on the counter. Another customer came in and before I could get cash out she's already start making sandwiches for the other person. I finally had to ask her to cash me out and the lady getting the sandwiches apologize and the girl said oh that's right that's what I'm supposed to do. Yeah the lady was not having any hot sandwiches but my beef and cheese sandwich set cooling off. Terrible service!

Also Taco Bell location. Ice machine no ice & flat soda. Told employees and they didn't bother let any customers know, who were taken food to good. Taco shell stale & besides paying extra for supreme taco, had to return yet again to get correct taco. Won't return to this location as it's second time I've had issues.

Very professional and very prompt I have them locked in my phone for the future I have only used the towing service so that's all I can speak on....took the time to be very careful and made sure the car was fully secure while lifting and uplifting my car

Rude staff. 
Fast service. 
Taco Bell is very greasy and just thrown together. For 2 menu items I did receive 23 (yes I counted them) packets of mild sauce. So I would say generous describes them as well. 
KFC has great food and well, you can't really mess that up can you.
Do not get seafood soup unless you like chewing squid, pongant fish and a sever that doesn't explain that the wood chip in the soup is not to be eaten..
Oh my gosh! The burritos are huge and delicious!!! So fresh and always super hot. Try the Carnitas Burrito. My favorite and so yummy!
Can't go wrong with this place, I love the Thai pork fried rice and beef satay as my default choices.
Stay far away from these slime balls. They hire musicians to play at funerals and refuse to pay!

I always go to Filiberto's for my breakfast burrito desires.  This place is quick and serves a delicious large burrito.  They are more than happy to customize a burrito for you if you want to be special and order something unique.  

Overall, these burritos are the perfect size - they fill you up but still allow you to work.  Great job and I look forward to many more burritos!  

Oh, they also serve all sorts of other food.  I am sure it is delicious... but I really like burritos.  :)
Worst drive thru ever. Sat in drive they for 23 minutes and there were only 4 cars. Incompetence at it's finest

Terrible customer service !!! twice the device had to been order because new representative did not know what she was doing when ordering my device. I called and got billing service they hung up on me when calling to return the device. The device was supposed be picked up the very next day, but four days later had to call again and got drop calls. finally I get someone to send out UPS to retrieve the device to send back. I hope my doctor never use them again In my opinion I hope my insurance never pays them a dime for their services. I would not recommend them to anyone but I gather there the only service in town what a shame.
The food was pretty good, and they were fairly quick. I'd eat here again if I was in the area and craving Thai food!

WONDERFUL !! The pastries are the best I have found in the area.  The counter help- not so much.  But because the items are soooooo good I will go back and put up with the person waiting on me being a crab !!
This is the best place, I love the crumb squares, and just picked up a pecan pie that is excellent

Being here from NYC we are very disappointed by a lot of bakeries out here. So I want to say THANK YOU SO MUCH for existing to New York West Bakery & Pastry Shop. We found you by chance and are grateful we did. Not much to look at from the outside and thats #1 indication something good is inside, excellent in this case. The baked items variety was wonderful including a selection of Sugar Free Items not a big selection but a good variety. My mom is diabetic and my dad is not so i always feel bad when i bring him something and not her and its hard to find non artificial tasting sweet baked items out there, so give theirs a try! Im glad I live across town from them and wont be able to go there daily but my weight thanks goodness for that! My suggestion...try one of each!
Finding hair in your pastry can really put a damper on your experience. Was not very impressed.

Absolutely, positively the worst food, Mexican or otherwise I have ever tried to eat.
Overpriced, flavorless and stale, the entire order should have been relegated to the dumpster, not served to a customer.
I ordered 2 beef tacos at $3.00 each. They do not come with any condiments (condiments are sold separate at a buck a piece!) such as taco sauce, sour cream or guacamole. They do give you a few tiny plastic containers each holding about 2 tablespoons of reddish colored water..mystery to me what they were as I was not brave enough to taste them. The taco filling consists of a tablespoon or so of stewed mystery meat which is flavorless, a few shreds of some limp partially melted process shredded cheese, and a few shreds of limp and browned lettuce all of which lie sadly in a tiny strip at the bottom of the overcooked taco shell. The shell itself was disgustingly flavored by the rancid cooking oil it was prepared with and was not only stale but overcooked...hard as a brick. My best guess is that the last time they changed the oil in their fryers, Texas was still part of Mexico.
No lie, my DOG turned his nose up at it when he sniffed at the trash...which is where my entire order ended up.

Next was a beef burrito served up in a stale, flavorless flour tortilla. The edges were hard as a rock and the middle was raw and doughy. 
The meat (again) is stewed and with absolutely no flavor at all, bland, bland, bland with a few sickly looking  strips of fried green pepper and onion mixed in. No beans, cheese, rice, lettuce, tomato or condiment...for $4.99 no less.

I lived in California among many Mexican families and am very familiar with authentic Mexican food which this restaurant is an insult to. My advice is to save your money and go to Taco Bell rather than visit this mexican dumpster. If I could give a negative star rating, I surely would!
They provided quick service and are very friendly.  We got Pad Thai.  It was good, but not the best that I've had.  I would return again to try other items on the menu.

The oxygen works, but their billing is constantly screwed up.  I use a credit card, get a receipt, but the charge never goes through.  They stopped them from accepting cash at least a year ago, so at least we have a credit card record.   Just be ready to waste some time getting the billing straightened out.

I truly do not understand the negative remarks about Epcor Water. Prior to closing on my house, March 8, 2018, in Corte Bella in Sun City West, I called to open an account. 

Mind you, I had heard some negative things about Epcor Water from folks in the neighborhood. I was expecting a bad experience. To the contrary, every person I interfaced with was kind, extremely helpful and answered all my questions. It was the smoothest opening of an account that I have ever had.

They told me with the systems that will be coming into play in the future in my community, my water bill will go down. They apologized that the system changeover could not be sooner. I have paid far more for water in other parts of the country. Every encounter with Epcor from phone contacts to turning in my auto-pay form at the office on Del Webb, has been extremely easy and their representatives are always kind and helpful.

If I could give them a negative star review I would. I have been trying to call this place to try and figure out why my CPAP supplies haven't been ordered and they never returned any of my messages this has been going on since the beginning of this year. I really hope this place goes out of business I will also be reporting these people to the BBB. It's the only place my Sleep Doctor uses to get my supplies so it's like I don't have a choice in that matter who I get my CPAP stuff from. I will be calling my doctor Monday to go through someone else. Save your the frustration and don't use this place.

Came here to see about macaroons and they had a different kind not exactly what I had in mind but overall I love that it's a family owned place and they had plenty of desserts but I end up buying the Mexican cookies they were pretty light and good till I got to the nuts they had a distinct taste no to my tasting

This is my favorite Thai place in the valley! Their flavors are so authentic and delicious.

They also have a great lunch menu to choose from. 

My friend and I ate lunch there one random day driving by. I ordered the red curry lunch special. She ordered their pad Thai. Both of which were amazing, full of flavor, and spicy because we had asked for it! I also ordered an entree togo for my boyfriend. He agreed that their food was fantastic! (Exactly his words)

They staff were extremely humble to us. I'm so glad I decided to stop by. Will definitely be back! Recommend to everyone looking for authentic Thai cuisine!

This place sucks!!! Not worth the money! The guy messed up my husbands hair didn't even try to fix it. They is hairs everywhere, the man still demanded a tip for this s**** haircut!! Save ur $17  & go somewhere else..

New York Meets Sun City, Az

Being a native New Yorker, I am always on a quest for Italian bakeries in Arizona.  However, authentic Italian Bakeries are not so easy to find in Arizona. So when I came across New York West Pastry and Bake Shop I knew I hit the lottery. I found my little taste of New York in Sun City, Arizona.

New York West has all the typical Italian pastries, Linzer tarts, napoleon,rainbow cookies, pignoli, pie pockets, devil dogs, salt sticks, and one of my favorites sfogliatelle.  

In addition to absolutely delicious pastries New York West is also a full service bakery. I mean, they carry rolls, breads, bagels, and even pizza dough.   The breads and rolls are flaky, buttery and perfectly delicious. New York West has it all.

The customer service is second to none at New York West. It is rare to walk into a bakery that you haven't been to for some time and the owner not only remembers you but recalls your favorite pastry's, now that's what I call great customer service. All the staff at New York West are friendly, accommodating, and patient.  After all,  it can take a while to decide exactly what you want to eat. 

If your ever in the area and want delicious pastry's, stop by New York West you won't be disappointed.

Delicious food!! Amazing service. We ordered the pad Thai and an appetizer that had a peanut sauce both were great. We ordered with medium spice and it was very spicy! So if you can't do spicy then order their less spicy option. If your up to trying something different then visit this spot. The menu is difficult to read but our waitress was very helpful.

Was visiting my Mom in the area and had a hankering for some Thai food (I am spoiled living in LA area with plethora of choices). We started with tum yum gai soup which was delicious.  Well balanced with spicy and flavor of lemongrass and chicken.  Also ordered fish cakes appetizer also wonderful!  Ordered Pad Thai and Gapow with beef as main dishes and all very authentic and delicious.  Service was quick and friendly while the inside environment is clean and nicely decorated.  I highly recommend this for some good, tasty authentic Thai food!

I'm not a fast food person but needed a quick bite before hitting a long commute. This was the only place I saw on the way to the freeway. Argh. 

The restaurant looked freshly updated. It was relatively clean for what appeared to be a busy day. My server was polite. 

I ordered the chicken little with mashed potatoes. Both were ok. I remember the original chicken littles years ago and those had much more flavor. No complaints other than its like a rock in my stomach - probably because I don't eat nuked fake food often. 

Oh - and they only have one container in the whole restaurant for iced tea. If they run out then it'll be at least 15 minutes before you can get a refill. Bad planning on managements part. They should have one out front and one brewing. I only drink iced tea or water so I paid for a 1/2 cup of iced tea.

Fresh, made daily, family owned for 18+ years.
Definitely try this little place out on Grand. It's awesome.

Needed a midpoint between Phoenix and Buckeye to meet up with my brother and his girlfriend.  We saw this one in the map, and we're hungry for Thai. I'm not super familiar with much on this side of town, so it's nice to know this is here. I frequent a lot of Thai places. This was definitely a pretty tasty one. We ordered the pad see ew, veggie Tom yum, tofu yellow curry, and red curry with shrimp. I was able to taste all but the shrimp curry. 

The pad see ew was yummy, the past three few thai experiences I've had, there was not enough flavor. This dish has maybe a little too much. It was a bit too drenched for me, but I'd rather have that than not enough. I wish they had listed that there was egg in the dish, but I should've known as most pad see ew dishes do. The yellow curry was good as well. Not much of a coconut flavor which I thought was a bit odd seeing that the shrimp curry looked much more coconuty. My bright ordered the Tom yum at a very spicy level. The flavor was good, but too spicy for my liking. If it were mild, it would've been perfect for me as they were quite liberal with the veggies. They also were very cool about swapping chicken broth with just water. 

The ambiance of the place is interesting. Doesn't feel quite like a thai restaurant and the furniture is definitely dated. There's a large amount of seating. Service was friendly and attentive.

Who knew?! This place reminded my friend and I of an old hotel lobby on the inside. It had an interesting entrance with a few main seating areas to the left and right of the lobby. They have lots of tables, which they keep really clean. 

If you like Thai food, eat here. The food was delicious! Great portions too! We ordered Phat Thai with veggies. It had the right amount of everything! We also ordered a veggie curry. If you are not a big eater, each dish has plenty to share. 

The service was friendly and attentive...even when we were the last ones there at the end of the night.

I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Phoenix!

My mom and I picked this place due to proximity to her house and low cost when my father passed. We went down, signed all the papers, paid them, and went home. In the timeframe they had mentioned, we got a call and I went to pick up the cremains. No problem. A month later (literally) my mom passed and I told the hospital to have her taken there. So, the next day I composed myself the best I could given my situation and drove over. I walked in and a guy comes out and looks at me and says "Oh My God...I knew it...I just couldn't believe it". He had seen the last name on the paperwork when she arrived. He sat in astonishment with me and comforted me and assured me that she would be taken care of in the same timeframe as my father. She was and sadly I went back to pick her up.

Never during any of either processes did they try to upsell me on a fancy urn or embellishments, in fact the girl we spoke to orgiinally said if you want something fancy - get on Amazon and buy it and we'll be happy to use that at no charge and save you some cash.

It's not 5 stars because the interior could definitely use a makeover, other than that...it was perfectly fine for my needs twice.

Pretty nice place! Alway drove by but never stopped till today! 
Very reasonable prices for a fancy place! Restroom is spotless which tells kitchen is clean too. 
Would definitely recommend this place.

First time here, will not be our last.  Our meals was delicious, I had the Pad Thai with chicken and shrimp mild.  The best I have ever eaten to date. My Husband had the Red Curry with beef, HOT, he loved it!  We were the first ones here when opened at 5 pm  The place quickly filled up. Service was excellent, cannot wait to try more dishes!

OMG!!!  Phat Thai (Pad Thai)  I ordered it super spicy and my wishes were fulfilled.  Whenever it's cold I like to warm the inside of my body, and WOW, my lips were flaming the whole drive home.  I also ordered an appetizer, the fried tofu with spicy sauce, that was very good as well.  So stoked on this place!!!!

Saw Line Thai on Check Please Arizona and thought we would give it a try. The experience was bad all around. Once seated, we waited a VERY long time to be greeted. Not being super savvy about Thai food, I was looking for some guidance that I did NOT receive from the staff. I did my best at picking a dish, as did my husband and mom. We also had our 5 year old daughter with us and they do not have much for kids. We arrived shortly after 5:00, assuming that we have plenty of time because my daughter did not have swim class until 7:00. It took so long to get our food that we had to get boxes after a few bites of food that left a lot to be desired. We will definitely not be returning.

I have driven by this restaurant for many years on a very busy section of Bell Rd. in Sun City and never stopped due to it's heavy traffic, but after seeing a review on "Check Please, Arizona", we made the trip.

Great food! Lots included in their lunch specials! For about 8 bucks, you can choose from about ten items that also include a delicious chicken broth cup, two wonton, a tasty egg roll, a decorative cup of rice and a large portion of the entree. I had a chicken dish with onions, basil, and tons of flavor! They will make it as spicy as you like. Try this place. It is a real value!

These people are the WORST!  Use anyone else if you can.

My wife was discharged from the hospital on Friday at 6:00 pm with instructions to call for an immediate oxygen delivery.  The office told us that since we had neglected to schedule the delivery in advance, we would have to wait until Monday.  They couldn't seem to understand that we were JUST TOLD to contact them for a delivery during the discharge process.  Now, they DO deliver at night and on weekends, but only if they feel you deserve it.

Each refill was also an experience.  My wife was struggling to breathe and was forced to argue every point with them until she gave up because she didn't have the strength to deal with them any longer.

We switched to another company just to reduce the stress on her and help her conserve her remaining strength for more important things like fighting cancer.

If I could give them zero stars, I would.

All been said in the other reviews GROSSLY over charges. Consolidation of district rates actually is suppose to make this balanced out, so I could image what customers have been dealing with in years pass.

I stumbled upon this gem while visiting some of my friends in Sun City. I was having a crappy day and needed some thrifting therapy and this place definitely gave me my fix. 
Their Black Friday deals were spectacular (50% off everything) and they had really cool unique pieces. I wish I could have stayed longer and explored more. 

I got a legit thermos, Mexican blanket, earrings, ceramic pots for my herbs all for 13$. So happy to have stopped by. 

Check them out especially for their big sales!

I have been trying for over 4 months to get this store to order me a scooter.  I have sent them every document they requested. My  Neurologist at Barrow in Phoenix has also sent them every record on me that has been requested.  They didn't  get it filed in time. They  had 45 days to file my request for the new scooter.  They didn;t do anything until I had called them 6 times and then called me and said they didn't get it in on time.  They now say it is my problem.  There customer service is terrible.  They never return phone calls for updates so I am responsible to call them.  When I do call I am never allowed to talk to the, DME person or the store Manager.  If they do eventually call back (3 times in 3 months) they are rude and condescending.  How does such a business that cares so little for the Disabled stay in business?  I hope my complaint to Medicare & The Better Business Bureau helps to Do. they understand how awful they treat their clients. Don.t use this company!!!

when I want tasty Mexican food at a affordable price and decent portion size, this is where I have my husband take me.. its all good!
I dont bother with mexican restaurants anymore..

Food was just OK. Steak burrito was kind of chewy, and my wife's taco salad was good but had barely any lettuce at all. They were nice about adding more. I'm not sure if the Air conditioning was broken, or if it is always too hot in there, but it was horribly muggy inside.

Oxygen Store is supposed to provide BRAND NEW equipment covered by Medicare then delivers equipment in open packaging that is missing important components and manuals required to operate equipment. Medicare pays the Oxygen Store for the BRAND NEW piece of equipment including all of the components required to run. Since the patient is missing parts needed to run life saving equipment, they call back Oxygen Store for missing parts which the Oxygen Store bills patient for. This endangers the lives of patients who are prescribed these machines and is also Medicare fraud. I plan on filing a complaint with Medicare and encourage anyone who reads this who has had a similar experience to do so also. Pitiful.

This is really a 0 STAR review. I wish I would have read reviews before signing with them. They are the worst company on the planet. I get empty oxygen tanks all the time ( fun when you think you have plenty and you put a new tank on and guess what it's empty !!!. and oh yes 40 miles from home. My regulator broke during the holidays and they wouldn't come out , finally a $20 tip did the trick. Now regulator is broken again and they won't come out till next Wednesday, meanwhile I have a Dr. Appt tomorrow but no regulator. Oh well I guess no doctor visit for me tomorrow. Did I say how much I loathe this company.
This is by far the best Italian Bakery in all of Arizona.  Haven't had anything this good since Sarno's in Hollywood, Ca. closed.  Absolutely wonderful!

I called the Oxygen Store about 4 x and left messages but no one ever returned my call. I finally got through today and actually spoke to a person only to learn that I need a new prescription in order to see if I would qualify for a newer CPAP machine. I understand there might be procedures for this but I really don't even want to go back there. I wasn't happy with the customer service in their phone call backs. Unfortunately, I don't think my insurance covers another medical supply store.

Horrible customer service.   They messed up a simple request for a new cpap mask and supplies more than once.  Never got a call back from Dexter the respiratory tech. They said I had 30 days to return the item but when I tried to return it was told I couldn't return it since I opened the box.  I was only checking they type of mask.  Never used it since they sent the same wrong mask type they sent previously.   Now I have to pay out of pocket so will look at better providers.  This is an ongoing problem with Rotech/Oxygen store.  I would give them 0 stars.
My granddaughter and her friend introduced me to this fine restaurant last night. She knows Thai food is my absolute favorite food so she wanted to give that to me for my birthday gift. What a
Overpriced junk that you could find at any thrift shop. And what's with writing "firm" on nearly every price sticker? Get over yourselves!

So I've always loved going here and go here probably every two weeks for about 2 years now.. so they have cool stuff and sometimes I find 20 things and sometimes I find nothing. That's not my complaint, if it stopped there I would give it 5 stars because that's a true thrift shop! My complaint is the owner and the lady that works there that has dark short hair.... so we showed them about 3 things that didn't have tags and we just wanted to know how much those things were ( keep in mind we already had about 10-15 things in the cubby we were for sure buying) so we ask the cost on those things and the owner makes a comment about how we hVe so many things coming back without tags on them.. implying we are taking tags off I can only assume. Go around your shop, there are way over 100 items without tags on that I wasn't interested in. Completely irresponsible and irrational to try and say your loyally customers are doing that. I would NEVER do such a thing!!!!! If you think that then go look at your "security cameras" that your 50 signs around the shop say you have and you'll find out I never once took a sticker off. That's crazy to think i did that when your store has 100+ EASILY items without stickers. The lady with the blonde bob is completely wonderful tho and even defended us. 
Just sucks that a place you've supported and spend your honest money at and the owner can be such a jerk!

Ordering Chicken Curry is the standard way to compare Thai restaurants.  Their curry is so good, I rarely order anything else!

Great Thai in Sun City area, and just a step away from Arrowhead Mall.

My father lives in Sun City West. He caught Epcor trying to double charge him. He is meticulous at keeping records and Epcor had cashed the check. They claimed they never received payment so he had to jump through hoops to provide the check to them. 
Now we have moved into Sun City and we keep getting multiple bill's and the same story we didn't pay X multiple mystery bill's. 
I especially believe they pray on the elderly because they can manipulate them and get away with it.
Let's face it people, We need to vote the current Corporation Commission OUT so there is real oversite. Meanwhile the CEO's are paying themselves ridiculously obscene bonuses. Then we have APS...
Lying seems to be very popular these days...

Had a water softening system and reverse osmosis system installed. Got a great deal on both systems and install.  Customer service was great for assisting me with the purchase and setting the install appointment.  Installers were on time with everything they needed. Installation was fast and clean. After install they showed me everything I needed to know about my system and answered all my questions. Very happy with the service and installation.
My absolute favorite! Try have the best cookies in Arizona. My family is from NY and they also say it tastes authentic! The florentine cookies are AMAZING!

Good Thai food here.  I always get the bananas with honey for dessert!  Try it!  As for the food they use just a little too much oil.  The service staff are so kind.  I will come here from time to time when I am in the Phoenix area.

A year ago I was in the hospital for 2 weeks in intensive care. My doctor prescribed a breathing machine for me. Two days before I was released, they contacted me endlessly on my cell phone about get my payment and delivering the machine. Someone came by the hospital to deliver the machine and to collect my payment.  I was under the impression that I was purchasing this with the help of my insurance company; however, they continue to this day to bill me a "rental" charge for a machine I used twice then gave away.

Yelpers, you didn't let me down! Everything was delicious! I wish I remembered the name of what I ordered. Anyway. If you like spicy, the medium here would be considered mild to Mexicans...lol...being that I am one. Great taste. I eat a lot so the lunch portion honestly didn't fill me up. For dessert I ordered the coconut ice cream. Omg! Delicious! My youngest had the sweet and sour shrimp and they were decent size! Definitely would make another visit. All the sauces for our entrees were on point. Not too salty. Not too sweet. Just right!

New to the area so could only rely on reviews to find a good Thai place, so we thought we'd try it out. We ordered pad Thai and chicken satay. The pad Thai noodles were coated in an unpalatable cheap chili paste. We tried to mask the flavor with the peanut sauce from the satay, but that didn't help. The satay had little flavor. 
Still in search of a good Thai place in the West Valley. 
I gave one star for the food, but the staff were all nice and attentive, so upped it to two stars.

We love this place, and come about once a week.  The curry and pad thai is always good.  The boyfriend loves hot food, and no matter how hot we ask for it, they always try to make it spicier than the first time.  The staff is always friendly and recognizes you when you come in, and usually knows what we are going to order.

Although it appears small, it is loaded with good finds! I love vintage, small evening bags and they had a ton along with a huge selection of shoes! My mother has bad knees and they even offered a walker for her to use while we shopped. Something unique also, they have cubbies that you can put your "treasures" in while you shop so you don't have to carry everything around. They were offering 25% off everything and we walked away with some steals! They have a little outlet area 3 doors down where all the clothes are only $1. I found an adorable vintage brass vanity seat for $15...The owner also donates to the Boys and Girls Club so l got to shop and know it was going to something good.. They also sell on Ebay so you can shop and support them there as well... Prices were super reasonable and the customer service was great!

Real nice bakery, great selection and prices are very fair.

Building stands alone by itself and its very inviting, I recommend stopping in for a thing or two and giving it a shot.

The devil dog was a must try for my first time and its delicious.

If there was a way to rate this store as a negative I would. Sleep apnea can be pretty serious and these people act like you are interrupting their life to make a nail appointment. Tried for weeks to get my cpap supplies from them - they wouldn't return phone calls, drove there in person- nobody knows what you are talking about- but they promise to have someone call- they don't. They were sure quick to bill my insurance for a full set up of supplies in the beginning- but when I get called in to actually receive the supplies- they are sorry they are missing some. So you have to limp through to your next supply hoping that you will get some of your order the next time. I can't think of any other way to label it other than fraud if they bill your insurance for items you don't actually ever receive.

Called to ask about getting cpap & o2 concentrator.
The store sends all phone calls to the general call center.
The call center said they would not sell the machines, only rent them as they make more money renting them.  
So they would rather pass up on making any money from you (with a sell) than make less money for less work (no billing each month)

After living in AZ for over three years I just ate (or tried to eat) the worst restaurant meal ever. At this Cocos restaurant.

Lousy food, lousy service!

It was Valentines Day and both my wife and I (and our friends)  had the Steak and Lobster Valentines Day special as recommended to us by the waitress (who by the way was the hostess who greeted and seated us, explaining that the normal waiter for our table was too busy).
When finally served (long wait) the fully loaded baked potatoes my wife and I ordered appeared to have been under a heat lamp for way too long. The cheese topping was not cheesy in texture, just dried out and almost hard. My wife's lobster tail although small seemed quite normal. As for mine when I pulled at the protruding meat expecting to get more from inside the tail it just fell off. There was no more meat in the tail beneath the scales/fins. The portion would fit in a tablespoon, Really!. It was about half of the size of the tail meat that my wife and our other two friends were served.

After over more than a minimum of five minutes of trying to get our waitresses or any wait helps attention and finding my tasteless steak getting cold I decided to start to eat the lobster before it met the same demise.

As I proceeded cutting my steak I found it to be overall very tough and without flavor. The only redeeming value food served were the vegetables and the bread. My wife and our lady friend only ate about a quarter of their steaks, my male friend a bit over half, and about a quarter for me with another quarter of the "attempted to cut -  but inedible portions" adorning my plate.
With the exception of one coffee refill for my wife there was no offer for refills of our water glasses, my ice tea, or our friends soft drinks. The hostess/waitress just kept flying by with packaged orders from the kitchen for take out folks without a glance in our direction.      
The next verbal communication with our waitress was when she approached offering / pitching pie and other desert items. When we declined she immediately gave us prepared checks and ask if we wanted boxes. Our female friend requested two for them, my wife one. When she ask me (I had noticed that she had looked at the uneaten mess on my plate which was directly below her gaze) I declined saying no thanks, and pointed with my fork to the steak on my plate and in a quiet manner stated to her that I was sorry but that I had found my steak to be extremely tough and not worth taking home. She just quickly said that she was sorry. I was going to tell her about my lobster tail issue but she did not give me a chance as she immediately walked away as I began to speak ignoring my verbalization attempt.

I thought that because of my complaint that she might have informed the manager or someone that might address my complaint. But no, she just delivered the ask for boxes at the corner of the table farthest from my position, not looking my direction whatsoever and again walked away.
Disgusted, I gave up. Paid our bill and left.

I am horrified that Menke is still in business.  They provided services for my Grandfather 15 years ago.  Our family was unfortunately in need of a funeral home again, and well, let's just say times have clearly changed at Menke.  They obviously don't keep accurate records and I'm not sure if they've heard of computers.  It has been 11 days and they can't even tell us where my Grandmother's remains are!!  A staffer told us multiple "stories" regarding paperwork, making it VERY clear they want to get you in the door quick to do an "upsell" and then forget about you.  Pathetic!!  It's not like it was inexpensive either, thousands of dollars!  Our dog was cremated by our veterinarian last year and I swear we had better, more efficient, kinder service.  Unfortunately, since they are in the heart of Sun City, most of the clientele won't see this review.  I'm seriously tempted to purchase a billboard on Grand Avenue urging folks to make other final arrangements.
I wasn't expecting a good Thai restaurant in Sun City but the service and food was great! I had a Chichen with drunken noodle and it's was the perfect spice! Will definitely be back!

We have been to this Co Co's several times over the past three yrs and each and everytime it seems to get worse. Our latest visit I had the 55 club country fried steak, not bad, mashed potatoes we so so but my wife ordered the ground beef steak. It was a cheap, really cheap, frozen hamburger thrown on the grill, nasty taste, may have been from freezer burn, but the burgers at any McDonalds, Hardees, or Burger King are one heck of a lot better quality meat. I doubt if we ever darken the door of this place again, I might be old but I still have my taste buds.

Okay, so while reading the reviews, many of y'all are most amusing.  You choose to live where you do and then complain about the cost of living there.  Yes, private Utilities cost more than city municipalities, this goes along with modern capitalism in which people selling good and services are expecting a return.  If the cost complainers were to do their due diligence on the rate of return, they would find that the ACC approves no more that a 10% profit margin.  While that may seem high to some, I'm sure if they examined other areas, they would find they are paying greater than 10%.  If a were a betting person, I'd wager a fair amount of money that the people complaining about the cost of water, willingly, even eagerly pay premium prices for bottled water and coffee.

As to the fact that the water can cost so much, they really need to look around and see that they live in an environment that is not really conducive to maintaining a large water wasteful society.  Water is a resource, a valuable one, a fact that many need to learn and will fail to do so until it too late.  

I've always had very positive results wen dealing with Epcor.
The food was okay, however the decor is quite outdated. I would have enjoyed it much more if the restaurant didn't smell dingy.

Yum!! The egg and spring rolls r delish! 
Red curry is a family favorite along with the pad tai.

Immediately upon entering, you're greeted by super friendly people.  We came here for lunch and there was a pretty good lunch crowd.  The place it decorated really cute.

They have lunch specials for $5.95 which include egg rolls and soup.  It's a steal!  The Pad Thai was pretty good and my husbands' Red Chicken Curry was delicious.

The presentations were nice and the portions were huge.  We will definitely be back!

First impressions of this restaurant or not good the Landscaping is a mess and there are visible signs of huge cracks along the building. the first thing that hit me was the smell. It smells like an old restaurant that has seen too many days and not enough cleaning days. The young man at the counter was very friendly and helpful but I couldn't wait to get out of the building. I think they should take one day and just give it a thorough cleaning. I did not stay to eat quite honestly because it was dirty and the smell

Came here for an engagement. The place is nice but the food was terrible. 

There's big doors entering and in the room there's windows with lots of light to see outside like the golf course. 

We had a salad and it was just lettuce, some cheese and alittle bit of dressing and croutons. Not very appetizing. They handed out the salad. Then it was buffet style so we went up and there was veggies that were pretty big and potatoes and chicken and some kind of beef but it was to red. Not my favorite meal. 

The cups were dirty and the pitcher of water too.

Waited more than 15 minutes in the drive through. Finally asked people to back up and let us out. This is completely unacceptable not one car moved in 15 minutes??   Next call is to report it to corporate 3 cars behind us also left

We have been going to Greenway Family Auto Service for several years.  We were there again today with a company vehicle, they finally pinpointed the issue that other mechanics could not find and made the repair at minimal cost.  They are always fair, reliable and dependable.  Would recommend them to anyone!  Thanks for your service!

This place has THE WORST customer service I've ever seen.  I've been trying to get equipment and supplies for my husbands bipap since July. YES July. I've been promised so many returned calls and never gotten one. Supposedly they're "working with my insurance " and will get back to me. Then we physically went into the store and were kept waiting 25 minutes to buy supplies out of pocket. We could hear several people talking and working in the back but no one helped us. Do not go here!  I hope everyone reads their reviews and sees the 1 star. Can I leave no stars???

I was excited when I entered and saw that the bakery was stocked with all my favorites, I saw budda cookies and black n whites I chose, small cheese cake cup, two eclairs one Napoleon, one carrot cake cup cake, and two Kiser rolls. 
SADLY the Neapolitan filling was way overwhelmingly thick and the filo was so soft and wet like Yuck!!! No crisp in the pasty shell layers at all SOGGY ! The eclair shells were fair the chocolate on top was good but the filling (again) unrecognizable as eclair filling. Odd!! The carrot cake was great!! The cheese cake had a weird taste to it, texture was a mix between NY and French silk cheesecake but it WAS NOT NY cheese cake. The Kiser's were good but didn't have the same taste as NY Kiser! I will buy the Kiser again because you cannot really find a hard roll anywhere in AZ. The service was blah! No NY in the service AT ALL!!!!! In fact it was BLAH like they were doing me a favor by getting the order filled no personality at all and absolutely NO NY CUSTOMER SERVICE AT ALL!!! Sad because I had lots and lot of dollars I wanted to spend there, sharing the NY Pastries with friends who haven't had the pleasure! Unfortunately they don't represent! 
My kid went to NYC this week bringing back som mozzarella and rainbow cookies!!!! Woo hoo!!!
Wonderful pastries and a very large variety. From the photos you can tell everyone made short work of the delights. Fave was the pecan kolache.

Yesterday I had dinner at Line Thai with a party of 16. The service and food were great. None of us had ever been there before, but we decided to go based on the rating and high number of reviews on Yelp. (Thanks everyone!) 

I made a reservation by phone the day before. When we arrived everything was set up and worked like clockwork. At the end they helped us divide the tab into equal parts and pay one-by-one or as couples. 

I've never been to Thailand, but the food seemed very authentic. For instance, the Pad Thai came on a plate with different ingredients by themselves, and you mixed them together in the way you like. Also, the dining area was full of Thai sculptures and paintings. 

Lastly, the restrooms were very clean and pleasantly lit.

This company is awful and crooked I get charged more than double my neighbor just because I have a different meter than them, their bill is $35ish mine is $80ish and we are connected to the same main line.

Went here last week after just moving to AZ. Glad to know its right across the street from one of my new jobs.

Have many nice cakes, cookies, desserts on display. Place isn't super fancy, but who cares about that anyway.

I ordered four cannolis with custard. Turned out to be good, different from what I'm used to, but good. Places on the east coast ask that you call ahead for special requests so thats what I did before going here to make sure they do custard inside the cannolis. The lady seemed uncertain on the phone about whether this can be done or not. When I got there, their pamphlet says they do custard, mousse, whipped cream, cheese...pretty much anything. If you have a pamphlet advertising this, why be so uncertain? Anyhow, shells were nice and crispy, filling was not bad. $9 for four cannolis. Will definitely go back to try other things. Glad to know its so close to my house.
Typical taco bell/KFC. Doesn't participate in dbacks taco promo.

Got stir fry shrimp with basil (#53). I like spicy and ordered it "hot" with a side of fish sauce. This was fantastic! The spice wasn't at all over the top. It came with a half dozen good-sized shrimp, and also bamboo shoots and onions. Recommended! 

Also, service was first-rate. The place wasn't full, but was moderately busy. Even so, my food was served within minutes of ordering. 

Last, the atmosphere was very nice, not cramped, nice decor, and (presumably) Thai music playing softly in the background. I wish I lived closer, because I'd like to visit more often!

This is the absolute worst oxygen delivery company in the valley. Go to Apria, don't even bother with these unprofessional morons. They were supposed to deliver my father's oxygen between 3-5 pm. They showed up at 7 pm!! They didn't even bother calling to notify they were going to be 2 hours late, I had to call them (after they still weren't there at 5:45) to find out they were still at least another hour out. Ridiculous. 
He was quickly running out of oxygen from the tank that was sent home with him from the hospital and started to panic that he wouldn't have enough. For someone that spent a week in the ICU on 15 liters of oxygen, that's a scary feeling and something he absolutely did not need to go through. He would have never been discharged had they known this was going to take place. I am still furious with the unprofessionalism and lack of understanding the importance of communication when it comes
to something as vitally important as oxygen.

Two words:  GO HERE!  If you live even remotely close to this place, go.  You will not find anything better in the area, rest assured.  

The owners, Pat and Hugh, are great.  I also love Chris!  Go, try everything, eat lots, and leave happy.  Get a box to go!  I would weigh 500 lbs if I lived in this vicinity.  I guess it's good that I live in Chicago.  Even then, I got stuff to go!
Good food, not the best, but the good lunch special prices make up for it.  Big lunch selection.  Been a few times, no regrets.

Too bad you cant do zero or negative stars.
Been paying them for last 12 years only since recent sale of company to a multinational has ripoffs started.
Rate increases 
Rounding up to next thousands of gallons
Cash unaccounted for.
No oversight from management
If not a monopoly would switch in an instant

If i could give zero or negative stars, I would.  My dr gave my cpap Rx to this place and I was reluctant after reading their terrible reviews.  They screwed up everything from my appt to my insurance coverage.  They "forgot" to get the cpap authorized by my insurance co, and were about to charge me over $400 because of their mistake, when this machine is 90% covered by my insurance.  I wonder how many senior citizens they scam this way?

When I told them i was going to go to a different company due to their incompetence, i didn't even get an apology.

STAY AWAY!

Some of the best Thai food we have ever had.  Good Phad Thai and Phad See Iiw.  Can't wait to get back!  The people here are the kindest we have ever met.  We came here for our wedding rehearsal dinner and they took good care of us.

I cannot believe this business gets anything less than 5 stars... I have Pulmonary Fibrosis which is a terminal condition with a 45 % lung capacity... along with my Primary Doctor these wonderful people were able to set me up with a complete oxygen system in less than 4 hours, something that Banner Lung Institute could not do in 2 weeks with another oxygen company... Cannot give enough praising to Dave, Steph, Margaret,and forgive my memory the 3 other wonderful people that helped me to receive my oxygen that I so desperately needed... You ALL are special to me!
