Having said all of this, I do enjoy this auction and the family feel is something that's getting lost in other auctions - but as a customer, I would appreciate being treated with some respect for both my time and my willingness to participate in the auction.

Im so happy I found this place. Such a gem. I brought my two dogs there for the works and was so happy.  In two hours they were both done and looking as good as ever. I love the personalized care here. Thank you we will be back!

Very unprofessional, we paid them in full and never got our documents. I called Penny several times, text her and also a letter. They kept the money and we never received any paperwork. This is FRAUD.

I was so impressed with this father-son team. Mario and Landon did a fabulous job. They go above and beyond, they cleaned out my tracks and sills and left my windows squeaky clean not to mention the sunscreens that sparkle and look brand-new. Thank you for the excellent service!

The food was very bland. The only good thing was the sushi...the service was horrible, waiter was not friendly at all, the other female waiters were on the other side at another booth table chopping vegetables up. Yes vegetables. With their bare hands. You are eating this food ppl. When i didnt tip because i can choose not to it is my right the waiter looked at the recipt as she was at our table and looked right back at us. It was one of the rudest things i have ever seen. All u did was bring us drinks. My first time here and will never go back. As we were leaving she said something in chinese and lets just say it was not positive. You have just lost a future customer
 Ruined my time there. If u want to be harassed by angry chinese women this is the place to go if u dont or cant tip unpleasant workers.

I had great service when I went to this store. The sales lady was so nice and helpful. We didn't know what we needed and she helped us understand the types of scooters that would help us at home and going shopping and going to Las Vegas a couple times a year. We decided the ones that collapse down to go on airplanes and in our van were great. We drove to Las Vegas over the summer and it was so nice to get around the casinos with them because they maneuver so easily.
We love the freedom they gave us to go where we want. We went here because they provide local service and they have been great for our neighbors who bought their scooters from there. They were given a loaner when they needed one for a trip until a part came in. I don't know if they always do that but that seemed very caring to me. We recommend them to anyone who wants a scooter and great local service. I saw the review about their service man on vacation and asked about it. He goes away once a year and I was told the owner goes out to help when needed.

I used to go to this barber when he was at 43rd and Olive years ago. Then a few months I was walking by and was ecstatic to see my old barber. 

Today I took my 6 year old son and decided I should write a review while I waited. 

Overall great cheap hair cut. Clean shop. Nice flat screen TV and a variety of magazine.

Terrible food, almost everything was tasteless. The crab legs were not only tasteless but also water logged. The one thing I enjoyed, slices of tuna, was never refilled. The meat was dry and tough, especially the ribs. Every shrimp I looked at had dirty veins in it. Too bad bc I live 3 minutes away.

We've been using Mitch with Bram Flooring for years and have referred him to family and friends who have all been very happy with him. We just finished another project (laminate wood floors throughout our downstairs) and this time was no different. He quickly responded to our calls/texts, was quick to start the project and was finished 3 days ahead of schedule. Carlos was the project leader for the install and he was amazing. He was very transparent with the process, took time to double check with me about prior decisions, recommended the best ways to maintain the floor and even moved our big piano back into place and put the wood protectors on its feet. The work was immaculate, high quality and quick. I can't recommend Bram flooring enough and that has been the case for many years now.

I have used this company several times. They have lots of items besides scooters and wheelchairs, etc to aid with living comfortably. 

Plus, they do repairs and order items when they do not have the size in stock that you need. 

Their prices are reasonable and their staff are pleasant to work with. They are a good source for mobility needs.

I wish I could give this zero stars.  Everything I tried was tasteless and questionable. There is no fresh sushi here..only imiatation crab / cream cheese type things.  The hot and sour soup LOOKED like it may be ok, but it was tasteless, even when adding a bunch of soy sauce.  The wontons I threw in for flavor were also flavorless and a very odd texture-like pork rinds or chiccarones? - they kind of dissolved in the soup. GROSS.  The ice cream was a scoop-it-yourself from old Baskin Robbins pails..I didn't try it, I was scared.  I was surprised I wasn't sick from this. Even the packaged fortune cookie at the end was disgusting. They still have decor from the old restaurant...photos of steak and baked potatoes. Very odd. The carpet is old and dirty. STAY AWAY!

Mrs. Ester is hands down the best tailor in Sun City or Arizona for that matter!  Her work is always excellent, she listens to the customer, but is not afraid to give her sage advice.  Mrs. Ester's is very quick and her prices are very reasonable as well.  I have ruined many suits and wasted thousands of dollars on mediocre so called tailors over the years. Not any more!  I love my tailor and I'm not afraid to say it!
Favorite Auction House when In Arizona! Most Reasonable Fee's in Nation!

PetSmart... 

Always a delight to come in here. Nothing better than an afternoon at a FREE ZOO! Wait, what's that noise, my kid crying for a pet! 

We came here 2 weeks ago and the employee who helped us was AMAZING. My sons first hamster and she made sure we purchased the right breed for his age. I didn't know that there was a difference. She rocked! 

We went again on the 25th for my daughters Birthday. That employee was a bi*ch! She was rude, mean to my daughter and just downright nasty. Pissed me off. I'm sorry if I asked you a question and it's your job to help us. So a star deducted for her attitude. 

It's all we have here in Surprise, so we will be back. if we had somewhere else to go, I would. Nobody makes Sierra cry. (but me! lol!)

My mother and I came into this location to look at scooters!  My mom ca't get around like she use to and getting a scooter for her would allow her to have a lot more freedom.  The person on staff Jennifer was amazing.  She took the time to go over everything with us ... she was not pushy like some other places we had visited. I would highly recommend this place and as an added bonus she called us a few weeks later to check on us to see how we were liking the new scooter.

Great place. Great people.  Almost all of the reviews have some truth to them, even the negative ones.  So it might not be everyone's cuppa tea.  

This is family run.  And no, they're not going to modernize.  They've been in business for a very long time.  It works.  Oh, and their buyer premium is 10%.  Try finding that at another auction house.  Their seller premium is lower than other auctions houses in the area, too.  They also pay- FAST. VERY, VERY fast.  Your check is normally ready in less than a week. 

This past year, they have been much more selective on estates they take because they already have quite a few they're already processing and more waiting.   

If you notice, there's no bad reviews from sellers or estate executors complaining.  

There is rhyme & reason to their selling.  I'll skip going over it, but, really, there is.  Yes, they do make up lots on the fly while the auction is going on.  That's one of their pluses for a seller and buyer- for the seller, everything is SOLD, no unsold lots donated or thrown out.  For the buyer, you can often get more items combined for a good price. 

You can get really good deals, as a reseller, I've found some pretty amazing stuff in the boxes "on the porch."  However, those are getting harder to find.  Stuff is selling for nice prices, but above what I want to pay for it, so not everything is being sold for pennies on the dollar.  But most of the time, crap does.   All houses have crap.  Including houses of estates they're tasked to sell everything... EVERYTHING.  

They post pictures throughout the week, but if you check Saturday afternoon, you should be able to see pictures of everything that's going to be sold.  Of everything in the boxes? No. But you can usually get a pretty good feel for stuff, but the items in the back building & main building are well shot.  If you want furniture or if you collect items they have in pictures, there's a good chance you'll get a good deal.  A great deal?  Maybe. A steal?  Possible.  But if you're there, check out the box lots.  Dig around a little bit.  You may find something. 

It CAN be an all-day thing, or a partial day... Go during the 1 hour preview and you should be able to figure it out.  Richie & Eric are VERY used to being asked what time they think the auction will be at the back building or main building.  Having done it for so long, they're pretty accurate on their estimates. 

Another issue some visitors have is that they run up the bid/bid on items themselves, etc.  Yes, they do bid on items. They have never hidden this fact.  There's many reasons why they do:  1. They want the item. Instead of just pulling it and appropiating it, they include themselves in the bidding. 2. They are not getting what they think is the fair bid for an item.  Both of these 2 examples are for the benefit of the consigner. And if they are the high bidder, well, they now own the item. It happens often.  3. They bid for other loyal/longtime sellers who aren't there. This is also for the benefit of the consigner but also to their benefit and to the benefit of their best customers.  I used to grumble about this until I heard Richie (not Ron, get your facts straight, folks) rattle off what 2 or 3 of their big buyers buy from them each year.  It's alot.  Yes, some auctioneers may make attempts to run up bids dishonestly, but I can assure you as a customer for 2-3 years, I wouldn't be going back if I felt being ripped off. I could easily give you an A-1 example of being ripped off at a local Phoenix auction.  If you're interested, lmk and I'll tell you. 

Oh. And don't move stuff from 1 box to another or 1 row to another.  And don't offer to buy something from a lot someone won, or to sell something from a lot you won.  It's their business, not yours.  Take it home and sell it.   

355
I love this place. The owners are super sweet and caring! They do an amazing job with my pups Bella and Izzy, my malteses!!

I've had numerous alterations done here and each time her pricing was less than competitors and the quality was just as good or better. I used to go to two other tailors but Ester is more patient and understanding. You can expect your item(s) to be done in a week. It'll cost you if you want it finished earlier.

My labradoodle was injured at the groomers. I received a call from Petsmart one hour after dropping him off asking that I call back ASAP. My dog was brought to the vet with a "sore" that was the size of a quarter that required sutures. My dog did not have an injury prior to being seen at the groomers. 

The groomers and the vet provided conflicting stories about what occured to my dog and I had to talk to the manager. The manager would not admit the injury occured at Petsmart but oddly enough he covered the vet bill and the grooming. My dog is now on antibiotics, prescribed pain pills, and is limping around the house. 

After calling the store the following day  and speaking to another manager, the groomer did admit the injury happened in the kennel. At this point I still feel that I am not getting an honest answer about what happened to my dog.

I want others to be aware of this injury. Please think twice before using this service!
This place is alright but the mark up on their stuff is ridic. I only stop in here for some dog food and that's it. Anything else and you're getting robbed. Sometimes the lines can get jammed up too.

Ummm.  What is the hype?

Over expensive for the quality.  Wanted so much to like the German food...

Pluses:  the solo music man!  The hits kept coming.

First time at this local restaurant drawn by a newspaper coupon. It was 12:30 pm lunch on a Thursday returning from estate sale hunting in the area. My first concern was the few cars in the lot in this busy area. No matter decided to give it a try.

We were seated quickly by a pleasant young Chinese guy near the first row of the buffets. Interior is old but clean and functional. Kitchen staff were mostly busy young Hispanic males.

Being a sushi guy went right to the cold bar. Here sushi is California rolls. Also peeled shrimp squid and jellyfish. Wasabi and ginger cocktail sauce was all quite cold and pretty good.

My lady went for hot food. The hot dishes looked very cool. Lo mein and other noodles were completely flavorless and all the hot food although visually appealing had virtually none of any detectable Asian spices.

The hot and sour soup was inedible and is one of my favorites in this cuisine. Many hot foods were too sweet and salty.

Fried items like crab puffs egg rolls died a painful death long ago and were then resurrected .

I ate some greenbeans about half of which should have been served.

And I really wanted a good Kung pao and soup today. Save your money go somewhere else. Ming and gee is a San Francisco china town populare compared to this place. The tab 20 bucks. Worth ??

And one of the employees apologized for the food being "awful"

I came in with a Groupon for a cleaning & a take home teeth whitening. There's a reason I needed a Groupon-no dental insurance. I didn't get a real cleaning & afterwards, the dentist just kept trying to talk me into spending more money on more several other services. She said I had a small cavity & that was the reason she wasn't going to even give me my teeth whitening trays-she was holding that until I came back in to HER for my filling. Uh, since when is it her choice where I go? I finally just said well I'll call at a certain time to think about my finances because she was so insistent about everything she was "selling". I didn't even get a real cleaning, just a polish & a regular floss & I know my teeth are nice but I'm sure I had some tartar that needed attention. I was also talked into a fluoride varnish, which I said as soon as it was put on that it didn't feel too good & I kept trying to get it off my lips. I kept asking if it was really ok to swallow & the girl said it was totally fine. I did everything she told me to do & didn't brush or eat for the time it needed to set & the longer I had it on the worse my mouth felt. My tongue & lips got swollen, tongue had some bumps on it the next day, almost like a burn! I could barely talk & really hard time eating! I finally got in touch with the office (after Groupon) & it took a while for the doctor to even care enough to get back to me...waking me up, so she finally said she would call me back, which she didn't. Just today I decided to call back to find out why they even bothered calling me if they didn't care & I told them I was never coming back. I told them from my experience & what happened I think they need to refund my money. They wanted me to make another appointment & see her first again to TALK about a possible refund!?!? Now that doesn't make any sense! I've NEVER been to a dentist on a Groupon & felt like I was in a sales office & then to be told I have to come back, spend the time & money when I was NEVER coming back to talk about a refund....sorry, NO! How about some compassion & at the very least don't pressure your patients when they are coming in for one thing-fulfill that first & talk about IF they want to come back for anything else later

The owners are so amazing!!! They really care about your pet and customer services is above and beyond. Forget Pets Mart and all the rest they do not compare. Prices and specials are great. Family owned stop in.

This is only place I get my dogs food. Forget  the rest. If you love your pet then should buy only the best for your loved pet. They have the best cause they care! The service is great. Allen knows what he is talking about.

My review is based from the viewpoint of "seller/consigner" rather than buyer. I spoke to their scheduler and sent her pictures of all the furniture.  She asked what my estimate was for the goods, and didn't indicate that there was anything out of line.  In fact she gave me an "ok". Then the representative (someone authorized at the highest level to make decisions on behalf of Brunk's) came out.  He was shown all the items, and made a detailed list of the goods.  I asked him if he had any questions, and he said "no". Then he said that the scheduler/coordinator (same person I spoke with earlier) would call me back the next day WITH A QUOTE.  Yeah, I got a call the next day to tell me Brunk's wasn't interested in any of my household items.  I invested a lot of effort based on the information received from Brunk's.  They were incredibly misleading and could have easily told me based on just the photos if there was no need for the goods.  The whole experience was awful.  My furniture is mostly higher end goods and some antiques.  Certainly sellable, so that wasn't the reason. Thanks for nothing, Brunk's, for the buggy ride and a giant waste of my time.  My advise to readers: if you have better things to sell, avoid Brunk's.

Oh my goodness - forget the negative reviews - nonsense. We had the shrimp cocktail - good, and the nachos - best ever. Homemade nacho chips were incredible. The person who said "bland" and "no taste" must have dead tastebuds. The food was great and the service as good. Highly recommended!

This is a review for the Starbucks in Safeway just down the street, however they do not populate on Yelp so I'm placing it here as the next closest location. Went into the Starbucks located in this Safeway. Young skinny hispanic guy with a name tag that said "Sky" on it. Probably the poorest service I've ever gotten at a Starbucks, and I'm in one probably 3-4 times a week. Had to wait while he made (and then had to remake) a couples drinks. Was waiting at the register for about 5 minutes. Never once did he say, "hello", "I'll be with in just a minute", "sorry for the wait". He came to the register and just looked at me. never said, "what would you like to order".  He was seriously a joke. I'm in management, I would have termed him then. Embarrassing! I don't want any contact in return, just thought you should know because I would want to. I'll be posting this on my Yelp page as well. Thank you.

We had filled in our sunken living room and had intended to use the carpet that was down before we raised the floor.  When the carpet stretchers came to put the carpet back down, they found the carpet was 3 inches short all the way around.  This was three days before I was having a Holiday Party at my home.  I was put in touch with Mitch Taylor at Bram Flooring, he saved the day.  His crew was out the next day. I bought this carpet sight unseen. Mitch was able to match my decor with a the questions he asked over the phone.  I also referred Mitch Taylor and Bram Flooring out to my friend, she and her husband are thrilled with their tile.  Call Mitch Taylor today if you need carpet or tile.

I called the day before coming in to make an appointment because I have not used the grooming services here before.  I live about an hour away and wanted to make sure things would go smoothly.  The next day I drove the hour into the store and I arrived for my 11am appointment slightly early, ready to go and was told that I needed to present my dogs vaccination history in order for him to receive grooming.  Of course I don't carry this with me and was never told on the phone the day before that this would be necessary.  My dog has a valid license and rabies tag but that is apparently not enough.  IF IT WASN'T ENOUGH, WHY IN THE HELL DIDN'T YOU TELL ME SO THE DAY BEFORE WHEN I CALLED TO SCHEDULE THE APPOINTMENT YOU IDIOTS!!!  You have wasted my entire day now and I have to turn around and drive back home because I can't take my dog with me to the other places I had planned on going while he was being groomed.  This store needs to hire some qualified help because the people I've dealt with are simply morons.

I am a huge fan of Chinese buffets.  After a graduation ceremony last night for my oldest son we decided to give this spot a try.  Never again.  NEVER.  Food was luke warm at best - NONE of it was to temperature.  Stuffed mushrooms were like little hockey pucks,  Chinese ribs were tough as horse meat, sushi was subpar and unimaginative, they were leaving pans until the last scrap was gone instead of refreshing them thus making what was left to choose from dry and tough - the place was pretty empty and after being seated we were pretty much ignored on drinks.  I am be generous here when I say their food tasted like all of the other buffets dropped off their day old food here to serve so it would not go to waste.  Way to many options around to ever waste money here again.  Very VERY disappointing!

I am left thinking that the people who left 5 star reviews for this place are either financially vested in this place or offered some MAJOR discounts to write them.
We had them come in and do our windows and screens. They did an excellent job . They were professional , courteous. on time and friendly. Will definitely use them again

This place is a gem! I found this store and visited for the first time yesterday and I'm sad that I haven't known about it for the year I've been in the area. I'm truly passionate about pet nutrition and feeding them beyond kibble that is deemed "all-inclusive" and "healthy". It is difficult to find a pet store that has true, trustworthy, and wholesome products that I want to feed my 4 rescue pups. This store has it all and the employees are so knowledgeable! I will definitely be returning and highly recommend to anyone who is looking for better nutrition for their pets. Even if you just have questions or don't know where to start in your transition, this is the place to go. They won't steer you wrong!! Shop local and support a store that has the best in mind for your companion!
Reasonable priced . There were no cart girls. The greens were very inconsistent.  . They were hard as a rock.  Greens would not hold. . Drinks were also reasonable.

Just like to give a special thank to dr Brannon crew in making my wife happy with the procedure she's having done so far and a very special person's that's putting up with my crap and handling it very professionally thank you Stephanie and Megan you guys are awesome later on I will be posting more as a procedures are being done on my wife thank you all ladies

Love this location. So clean and the girls all fuss over my Doggie. They make her feel so welcome and loved. She is always squeaky clean and smells so good. They do a greAt job on her nails and gets s treat at registers.

Just another below average Chinese buffet in the West Valley.  It's a shame that no one on this side of town can get it right.  I have to travel about 40 mins from my home (in Peoria) to get a GOOD Chinese buffet.  
To put it bluntly, China Olive is just alright.  It's nothing to write home about.  What it IS is over-priced from what they offer.  
The first time I went (yes, I've been there more than once) was their 2nd day of operation and it showed some potential.  Everyone was nice, the food was warm, the place was clean......everything was fine.
I returned about 2 weeks later.  It was still good.  Although the food was starting to get old under the heat lamps, and there wasn't much sushi out but it was OK.  Service was good, the servers were pleasant. 
I returned about 3-4 weeks later and what a transformation.  It's like the whole place went to pot.  The interior of the place looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a while.  The hostess barely said anything (kinda acted as if we were disturbing her) and the food had obviously been sitting under the lamps for too long.  I hate to assume but it was probably let over from lunch.  Everything was hard and tasteless.  Like someone said before, everyone can have a bad day.  I'm still deciding on whether or not I'll return.  If they don't turn it around soon, I don't think this place will last a year.  What started out very promising has done a complete 180.  Oh well........I guess I'll still have to drive 40 mins to get a good Chinese buffet.

We have been going here for about 15 years.  Our original optometrist there decided to go part time before retiring.  We were concerned when Dr. Toland joined the group.  He seemed so much younger & we were not sure if he had the experience needed.  We decided to give him a try.  Wow, we received the most thorough eye exam that we ever had!  Dr. Toland also explained the results of the test to us & provided us with information to better protect our eyes.  He keeps up to date on the latest eye health care & procedures.  Twice, my new glasses seemed too strong.  It was my fault because I looked at the boldest print on the images, not what looked the best to me.  My eyes were tired & my allergies were bothering them.  Dr. Toland retested me & changed the prescription on my glasses at no charge.  He never made me feel bad about what happened.  He know that it takes more time with me & never makes me feel rushed.  He just wants me to have the correct prescription. I highly recommend Northwest Valley Eyecare!
As to the former review of one star. This was a harsh review. It seems like it was a miscommunication.

I'll start off by saying PetSmart is a great one-stop shop for your furry little family member.  I shop at the Surprise location quite often, have taken a couple training classes and used the grooming services a few times. 

This review is for the grooming services.  I have taken my puppy to the PetSmart groomers three times which was three times too many. 

First time: bad haircut.

Second time: foot long scratch down the side of his stomach and bad haircut again.

Third time: Gave specific haircut directions and still got the same bad haircut.

My biggest concern is how the groomers treat the animals.  I should have known better, the second and third time I took my puppy to the groomer he hung onto me for dear life. Don't get me wrong, he loves going to PetSmart but the minute we walk into the grooming section he turns into this freakishly scared little puppy which is completely out of character.

Three tries and $200 later - never again!
safeway does not price match and i even called the district office. crap attitude at this store. don't have any expectations while going to this expensive store.

Oh what a joke. Sushi looked like store bought california rolls (and tasted like them). The food was bland, and not very hot. We visited on my birthday on a whim, and everything from the dumplings, to the soup (which had zero flavor for hot and sour!), to the main dishes (oily mushroom chicken--ew) were just so disappointing. 

The service didn't even seem to be at all interested in being there, but I don't blame them, and won't be returning.

In April, 2018 my elderly mother experienced extensive water damage involving both of her bathrooms and toilets and much of the carpeting in her house.  The entire restoration process took several weeks.  BRAM Flooring was a great company to work with on the selection and installation of new carpeting once the structural work had been completed. Just looking at all the choices and selecting material, weave, and color can be overwhelming, but everyone in the showroom was very knowledgeable and helped my mother make an excellent choice.  Steve and Ben, who did the actual installation, were punctual, professional, and meticulous in their work.  We greatly appreciate BRAM Flooring and highly recommend them.

I have done business with these people before. They installed a lift for my 1st scooter. 

I just purchased a new scooter from them and they couldn't have been nicer or more professional. They gave me a good trade-in on my old scooter and I know if anything goes wrong with the new one, I can get back with them and they will take care of it.

Thank you, Jeff and Justin!

I went to this store looking for a ve ry specific toy and they had it! Very reasonaby priced compared to that large box store ( if you know what I mean). While I was the there, I compared the price of an organic dog food that I buy and it was a few dollars less the that large box store. I am very impressed by their service. No high pressure. Will ask if you need help and give good advise if you need it. Then  will leave you to browse if you so desire. They are a 5 star in my book! Give them a try, you'll be glad you did! Why drive down Bell Rd if you can just drive around the corner?

Safeway is like my second home, I've been shopping there since i was born. It has food and drinks and more food(its a grocery store). Anyways i love safeway and its underappreciated so i felt the need to write them a nice review. Safeway if you're reading this.. youre great and i love you;)

My first visit to Omaima S.Samain,DDS was great
Yesterday.  She and her staff were extremely nice and friendly.  They made my visit worth while
Dr spent extra time with me and explained everything to me. She made me feel appreciated and she cared about my problems and concerns 
I highly recommend Dr. Samain. My thanks to you all 
Glenda Turner
Jen is the best groomer. My sweet girl was so afraid and nervous and Jen was super sweet and made my girl feel so welcome. When she was done she smelled so sweet and looked adorable.  # happy dog Mom

I have been going to Dr. Helvig for several years and have been very pleased with the results.  He has helped me tremendously when I have been in pain.  He is very professional, yet very personable.  His staff is very gracious and caring.  It is always a very positive experience.  I would highly recommend him.

I went into 1st Classical Dental with a groupon coupon for X-rays, cleaning and exam.  The clean was done wonderfully by Dr. Samain and my exam came out very well.  The whole office was very professional and made sure I was comfortable in every way.  Because of the great service I got, I decided to have Dr Samain replace three of my crowns.

New to the area, I chose Ester Tailoring based on Yelp reviews.  To say I was disappointed is to put it mildly.  I usually do my own alterations.  I had 2 new denim skirts (part of  2 piece ensembles) and limited time so I thought I should try a professional.  Big mistake.  Both skirt were very simple gored skirts with buttons down the front.  One had 8 gores the other 4.  Ester charged $24.00 to shorten each skirt which I thought was a lot but not the big problem.  When I got the skirts back there was a difference of 6 inches between the front  and back of the 8 gored skirt and of course a big dip on the sides.  The 4 gore skirt also had a dig of 3 inches.  When I brought the one skirt back to Ester (I was afraid to let her touch the 4 gore skirt) she argued with me saying that's the way my body was.  I kept my cool and finally she agreed to even it out.  Of course there is still a large difference between the front and back with dips on both sides but it would not have been possible to shorten the skirt any higher.  I consider that outfit ruined.  Would I go to Ester again.  No Way.

We visited this newly relocated to a Sun City address (from Surprise) business, looking for someone to repair my 12 year old Amigo.  The owner was friendly, but told us his repairman was on vacation until April 4th.  We called the store on April 4th, and left a message that we would like a repair appointment.  We called again on April 6th, leaving another message with essentially the same contact.  We never got a call back.

So, Mr. Highsmith, here's our two cents of advice:  Be honest with us.  Tell us you: 1) don't have a repair person, or 2) your repair person hasn't yet returned, or 3) your repair person is too busy to schedule any more work, or 4) your repair person is on staff solely to refurbish trade-ins from people who have bought new scooters/chairs.  Honesty is SO much better than just ignoring our calls.
Very professional and efficient staff, has helped our family on multiple occasions and will continue to seek their courteous services.

With the dentures I received, I can finally smile with confidence , thanks to Dr. Samain . I could never thank you enough. The staff was very kind and comforting. Any question I had, was answered. Very nice environment

My neighborhood coffee shop. I can sit and read my book or what have you. The staff knows what I order. That is cool!  The manager has an exceptional attitude. The staff all good and friendly. And where else can you hear a recent version of Neil Young sing Old Man?
Worst buffet ever. Food was horrible. Dishes were dirty service sucked. Waist of time and money.  Shut it down.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! I was in town and needed some dental work - ASAP! This amazing place took me in with very short notice, accepted my insurance, and gave me the best dental care I've ever had ( and im not a kid ) - Thank you Dr!
I'm back for a fantastic cut. I miss this place, best haircuts in phoenix since I moved here. I'll drive distance

After about a half an hour, finally got photo taken...so unorganized!!
They were supposed to be emailing it to us well it never came 
Had to call the store 3 times, manager couldn't even return our call, got the runaround every time we called.

We were told a different story every time we called.
Finally found out, they lost it ....

Wish we would have went to a different event now TOTAL WATSE OF TIME !!!!
UNPLEASANT.AND UNCARING STAFF.

Just said come back tomorrow and redo.
NO THANKS!!!!
Its alot of effort to go through all that and wait again in a long line

Grade F for service and understanding

Visiting family and needed a cut. Great job, I will return as I visit the area frequently. We travel a great deal and finding a barber is always an adventure and this time I picked a good one. If we lived here this would be my go to place.

Had to go in to see Dr. Toland today on an emergency basis due to a chemical burn I got in my eye. They fit me right in and took great care of me without making me feel stupid for causing this problem in the first place. Everyone was empathetic, kind, and even helped entertain my 2 year old to make sure that Dr. Toland could give me the best care possible. It is very rare to find such kind, empathetic people who treat you like a valued friend. If you are looking for quality service, excellent care at great prices...go see Dr. Toland and his staff at NW Valley EyeCare. Tell them I sent you! :)

This place is the best! I call last minute and they get Tucker in! My dog actually looks forward to going here. He loves the attention he gets from the staff. Everyone is so friendly and they all have a great positive energy! They provide excellent grooming services with tender loving care. Thank you to everyone for providing such a great atmosphere for grooming mans best friend. Tucker loves all of you!

Glamour did a great job on my Morkie who was way overdue for grooming.  They were on time with the appointment and complete less than 2 hours later which I am pretty sure my nervous dog Max and I appreciated.  No assembly line here such as other places which often keep your dogs 4 hours or more. Cut was exactly what I asked for.   Will be back with my other dog as well.

Love this doggie salon, the groomers are all experienced and well trained. They always suggest the best for my dog and I am always happy with how cute she looks at pick up. Deanna is the best she loves on my baby and makes her smell so sweet and clean. The shop is always clean and the groomers are so friendly !!!
great old school barber shop, excellent cut, and good pricing.

This is my favorite window cleaning service. They are fast, accurate and polite. Mario stays in touch via text from the moment you schedule a service. They have been on time every time. You won't be disappointed in this company.

This is a pretty standard Chinese buffet. Not great, but good food and the price is reasonable. I have not had the problem of the food being cold which I have seen from other reviewers. Overall I like it and would return.

The dentures cam out nice. The only problem is the scheduling of appointments. I was scheduled for a 9 am adjustment. I got here at 830 in the morning to be early. I was taken back to the room and sat in the chair for an hour. I. The future I will go elsewhere...

This company was referred to me by Home Advisor app. Mario called immediately and came out the same day. Very friendly and helpful. We had a car oil spill in our garage and driveway that he said he could take of. Did a nice job and finished in just over an hour.

I think we have found our family dentist. We will see how it goes...  checking in and paper work was a breeze.....comfy office. They seem to be great with referrals and thank yous.  Sending my husband in first as I wait to see. He was Smiling
My turn!!! 
Small bite but they were so patient. Hygienist very careful to explain the process. Gentle but thorough. I will be seeing the Doctor. I met Dr. Samain, wonderful and thorough. An exam and discussion of treatment plans gave me confidence.   I am in the right place!!!!

I have used Bram Flooring on both of my homes. One with tile and the other with hardwood floors.

They did an amazing job and came in on budget and time frame.

Mitch is great.

Mario and son are terrific. Very quick, professional and great work ethics's. Highly recommend Mario. Called a few other places and some did not clean window sills etc others were 2 months out. Mario was most accommodating and here on time. You can't go wrong with Mario you won't be sorry.

The auction runs quite quickly. Leave a cash deposit get a number and wait for your item to come up. Make sure you stand close by the auctioneer so he sees that you are still bidding. It is fun when you win they will tag you item. You do not have a long time to pick it up but they will help you load it into your pickup truck.

A pretty decent starbucks to come in and get some work done if you're in the area. There are a few others nearby that don't honor gold cards and card rewards, so be sure to stop by this one if you're planning to pay with your starbuck cards and earn rewards! It's been pretty full every time I stopped by, the staff has always been accommodating and friendly despite how busy they are.

There are also plenty of outlets around the place and the bathrooms are pretty nice. Stop by for some coffee and get some work done!

I took our 6 mth old golden doodle puppy here last week to get a shorter cut for the hot Arizona summer and he looks absolutely adorable! The staff was very warm and welcoming. Before coming here, I took him to pets mart to be groomed and it was a horrible experience, so I was very nervous having him groomed again. The staff put my fears at ease and did a fantastic job! I will be coming back!

Mario and son are terrific. Very quick, professional and great work ethics's. Highly recommend Mario. Called a few other places and some did not clean window sills etc others were 2 months out. Mario was most accommodating and here on time. You can't go wrong with Mario you won't be sorry.

We shop here on a regular basis for food and treats. I appreciate that they sell Fromm, which is our preferred brand. The staff is friendly. I wish they were opened later, but I know how small businesses go.

Simple review, if you want an unprofessional butcher as a dentist then by all means go to this place! Dr Brannon will be so preoccupied with his time he might forget what he was doing on you so be extremely careful, make sure you know what you are having done before he works on you so you can catch him up to speed!
Look forward to loud music playing by your bed, he doesn't care if you like it or not!

Since he will be working on multiple patients at once, look forward to him speeding up your appointment with no care on how much discomfort you are experiencing!

Be warned on his harassment to his staff, he's a very sexual guy, he has an all women workforce for a reason! It's sickening that he still has his medical license!

I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone even if it is "affordable"!

Great company! Very responsive when I requested a quote and answered all my questions. Easy to schedule and worked very fast and did an excellent job! I would highly recommend them. Great price and great service!

Yesterday, Thursday, February 22, 2018 1st Classic Dental accommodated me by getting me in on short notice by me for a New Patient Appointment because I badly needed a cleaning.  As a new patient they proficiently performed an exam, x-rays, and a cleaning all for the new patient special of $29.  They handled my concerns with professionalism, care, and excellent customer service.  The cleaning was performed with excellent care with no discomfort.  Dr. Omaima Samain, D.D.S. discussed my dental condition with me, made me feel at ease, and thoroughly answered all my questions.  I would recommend 1st Classic Dental to anyone needing dental work done.  Thank you 1st Classic Dental!  Happy Customer Bill 2/22/18

Found this little Gem by looking at a map on Yelp.  Was looking for a new Barber since my regular is always packed.  Total old school barber shop.   I had Boris as my barber today and asked him to give me a fade and trim.  He did not disappoint.  Probably or of the best I've ever had.  Then after the cut and old school shoulder massage with the back rubber device.  Prices were very reasonable.   Will definitely be back!

I have only been once, this past Sunday, but left after nearly three hours. It was as if Sanford & Son had taken over an auction house. I kept waiting for TLC to show up with a camera crew; it was such utter chaos.

There must have been 600 lots up for auction, ranging from nice Victorian-era furniture to very cheap trinkets you might encounter at Goodwill. Auction lots were hand labeled/numbered with tape, but this soon seemed meaningless as there was no rhyme, reason or order to what lot was auctioned next. Mr. Brunk, the owner, would wander the room picking up pots and pans for the next item, or another painting, while the previous item was being auctioned. And there was no printout or listing. If you came for one specific item, or items, listed on their website, you were liable to be stuck there the entire day waiting, hopeful, that luck would be on your side and your item would be randomly picked next from the dusty hoard.

Mind you, just because your item(s) were listed on the website for that day doesn't seem to mean they were going to be actually auctioned off that day. We drove 42 miles from Chandler across the valley to Sun City for this "auction" only to be informed in Mr. Brunk's opening monologue (he should do standup) that they hadn't bothered to unpack or sort all the boxes this week. In short, for us, the items we had planned to bid on but couldn't find on the floor, were apparently still in boxes and would likely (no guarantee) be up for bid next Sunday.

Speaking of standing, we arrived to find a large building with easily 100+ seats inside, but most, if not all, were marked with tape, reserving them for "regulars" of the auction. We could understand this practice if, indeed, the regulars would bid on things, but from what we could tell, many of the regulars came for the bar-b-que sandwiches (pretty good), the cameraderie (fine, whatever), and the fun of a day out of the house in dusty, windswept Sun City, AZ. Within minutes of the auction starting, we counted at least six "regulars" already fast asleep in chairs that might have gone to actual bidders who were left standing around the room's edges.

After nearly three hours, we'd had enough. Mind you, these folks were pro's at getting people to pay $50 for chipped glass boxes you can get for $5 at the swap meet, which is probably where they found them.

If you're looking for "Honey Boo Boo & Family Go to the Auction", you'll find no better place... and the BBQ was decent.

Wow, I'm blown away! Dr Omaima Samain is amazing. Having so many bad dental experiences I was so amazed at how kind, thoughtful this dentist is. Dr made me feel at home right away explained everything and when I was a little hesitant she had me come in  her office to say she doesn't want me to be afraid or scared or nervous. Even money she advised about. You want a great dentist here she is! Love her!

Absolutely the best eye professional I've ever been to. His expertise in eye care along with his outstanding professional and caring nature created a positive experience for me. 

I suffered from a serious abrasion and mass on my eye casting me to completely lose my vision. He did not promise me that my vision would completely return but was encouraged about the potential. 

With his dedication and medical expertise, I am regaining my vision. 

He gave excellent follow-care instructions. 


He had two locations. One in downtown and one in Surprise. 


The office staff are welcoming and here to help. Thank you Team Walman.

I understand that sometimes restaurants have bad or off days.  They are run by people, and from time to time it happens.  Tonight however was a disaster!  

First off if you have a young child like my family does, you may have to have them sit in your lap.  As you see, they have only three highchairs!  The staff also seemed to initially care less, as the lady who sat us instantly went back to stand at her station and never even mentioned they had no chairs, or that it might be a while.

The food was also not even up to par to earn a three yelp star.  I tried a little bit of a wide verity, and found a common theme.  Nothing was hot, and at best warm.  If you are a fan of certain Chineese buffett staples, you may be disappointed.  General Tsao chicken for example can not be found here.  Lastly the ice cream tasted as if it were left over from the old Furrs days.

I wished this place invested in the resources to have a chance, but I just can't see them lasting past summer.  If the health inspector don't shut them down, the low quality food certainly will!

Went to P.S. to pick up some dog food....very big mistake....there were so many dogs (with owners) in the store and several pit bulls were very aggressive making customers feel very uncomfortable!!!! Will find another dog food vendor!

My parents had made their funeral arrangements with Sunland several years ago. My brother and I live out of state and, when my mother passed away recently, everyone at Sunland was very helpful and very professional. All the original paperwork was in order, and everything was handled as my parents had wished. Thank you to an outstanding staff.

Horrible! This is my second time trying this place out! The First time I came the food must have been sitting down for the longest time ever . The wings and chow mien where crusty! The fish had no flavor and the chicken smelled funny. . . Should've took the fact the parking lot was empty for a reason!

Dr. Samain was the worst dentist I have ever had. After botching my implants, it was impossible to get ahold of her or her staff. So unprofessional. I switched doctors and now I'm way happier. She has low integrity and doesn't truly care for her patients. Never again. If there was a zero star rating, I'd use that. You've been warned.

The other 5 star reviews for this place seem fake to me. Not one critical comment. This doctor is a joke.

I have been using Ester Tailoring for almost 5 yrs and find her to be very reliable and does Excellent work at very reasonable prices. I have referred a number of families I know who have had either Bridal parties or Proms. Everyone I've sent to Ester were not only quite please but they too have become regular customers.

If you want food poisoning, this is the place to go! The sushi rolls were hard which means they were sitting there for quite awhile. Most of the food that was left in the bins were noticeably old, but never changed. Even the desert was hard as a rock (brownies, cakes, etc). One bite of the cantaloupe was enough to make me gag. Looking at the rest of the food that could be "prepared" for you was ghastly. The raw meat had been sitting so long it was dried out. I'm really not sure why this place is open because it's clearly got enough code violations to shut it down.

I went to 1st Classic dental with an ad from the Sun City news paper. I found her to be very rough and careless! Dr. Samain, told me I needed crowns in the lower right due to my "cracked" teeth. I made an appointment after my shoddy cleaning and the fee was $160. I went back in and a 2nd set of  X-rays were taken. I had 7 shots to numb me and it never numbed. Doc came in and told me to go outside and walk the parking lot for 15min as it would help the nova-cane "disperse" it was 115 that day and I did as instructed!!! When I got back my mouth still wasn't numb so she gave me at least 3 more shots and the pain was excoriating , she started the drill and I wasn't numb. I kept jumping and eventually went into a panic mode. My heart beat was so high I started cry & shake as the pain was incredible they put oxogen on me!
Dr. Samain came back and finished her work after I settled down a bit! After she was done with me she put the temporary on and never checked my bite and it was high. This was the beginning of my long horrible journey!! 

I went back to get my actual crown, I had paid the money and felt I needed to go back for the finished product.  When I went back she attempted to put the crown in and the bite was off, and crown to large for my space. Dr. Samain worked on me for 1.5 hours to no avail, she proceeded to cement the crown in place. So, she proceeded to adjust my upper crowns in attempt to correct her mistake! I left in such pain as I knew the work was very poor quality and my mouth was in such pain!! The office manager called the next day to check on me and I told her about my mouth, I was too fearful to go back I was in such pain!! I waited a few days to see if my mouth would settle down, then went to another dentist and she said I would need the work corrected and 4 new crowns & 2 root canals. For now my mouth still hurts but I am confident this other dentist will fix the wrong and I will move forward never to return to Dr. Samain. 

Judith Wares

Sun City Mechanical. Very happy with this company. They installed my air conditioner and heater about six years ago. I am on their service contract for both plumbing and AC, heater check yearly. I just had new faucets put in my bathroom - beautiful job they did.

Pros: The service is fast, food is tasty, and cheap. The salad bar has fresh veggies, several pasta salads and four soups to pick from. My hubby had the Ruben sandwich, he thoroughly enjoyed it. He reports the male bathrooms were clean, I never checked out the ladies.

Con: the dishwasher needs to be fired! The salad plates, mugs and utensils were dirty. The soup spoon utensil bucket at the salad bar had crumbs and food stuck in the bottom. The least they could do was put the handles to the bottom and not where I put my mouth into. Eeewwww!

I'm surprised they got as many good reviews as they have. That was not my experience. He did shoddy work on a plumbing project of mine. I had an experienced contractor look at his work and he said it wasn't even up to code. We made him fix his mistakes and then when we weren't looking he sabotaged the conduit going from my AC unit to the breaker. Every coupling had been deliberately snapped and if it had rained the water would have gone straight to the breaker and likely started a fire. Luckily we found what he did and fixed it.

This guy is a snake. Do not trust him.

This use to be a decent place.  But new ownership took over an it has slowly gone down hill.  I still dealt with the decline up until recently when my niece found a piece of suran wrap in her burger.  When we notified our waitress she came back and said the manager took half off the price of the plate.  HALF OFF!?  Believing this to be unacceptable, I asked to speak to the manager.  After explaining the situation he stated that she still ate half the sandwich and I quote, "It was only suran wrap that the meat was wrapped in."  That is literally what he said.  Needless to say I will never return to this establishment.

This is a cattle call. This is a surgery center for several eye docs in the west valley. There are 3 OR's. My father in law was told to arrive at 1 PM, and his procedure would be at 2:30. We arrive slightly early, and sign in. We wait. and continue to wait. 
Finally, at 3:30 they begin his paperwork- and then he waits some more. Finally, they take him back... and we wait. At 4:45 the tech comes out to tell us (we assume he is finally done) that he is NEXT. She states the doc is finishing up the procedure and he would be in next. FInally at 5:00 PM another tech comes and tells us that he just went in.  We have been there for 4 hrs and this is the only updates that we have received from them. And when we dare to ask why, the attitude starts as if we should just sit and be quiet.  Now... there are others in the waiting room, and they are waiting for a patient by a different doc, but we ask, how long have you been here? Same story.  Another man, also waiting, same story.  This place heards the patients in, and just let them wait. They are preying on the elderly, knowing that they will just sit and wait. Simply outragous and if I am ever asked to refer anyone to this facility, I certainly would not.  

 As a side note, the reason I am so upset is that I have worked in opthalmolgy before, and know that this IS standard practice to run late because of overbooking, HOWEVER, we also called patients and told them to come in later rather than having them sit in the lobby for hours. Let the patient make an informed decision. Not to mention the family members that take time off of work,to take them, and they too are left waiting for hours on end.

He is the BEST pain specialist in the world and one of the most caring individuals I have EVER met!! Top rate personality and the BEST bedside manner you will ever see. I have been seeing him for 8 years and have seen so much improvement in my pain  that I'm able to do ordinary things I took for granted while I was in Chronic Pain!! 

Thank you and your staff for all you have done for me,

Charles E. McIntosh. E.M.T. Orthopedic. P.A. Author: Casting procedures Illustrated.

Dean, of Jan and Deans Estate sales sold me a used GE  Refrigerator. He promised me that if it did not work he would pick it  up and refund my money. Quote" If it doesn't work I'll give you your money back, it's only money"  It worked for about 14 days then started to heat up and would not cool so I tried to contact Dean to resolve the issue. The refrigerator had a burned out heater element which I replaced but did not solve the problem. I have tried for 3 weeks to have him call me but no response. Obviously its ALL  about the moneyII I would like to get my  money back as he sold me a defective unit but he will not contact me nor will his secretary give me his phone number. I call his office every day but now no one , even the secretary will answer the call. I am very disappointed that a business man like Dean would compromise his ethics and reputation over a few  hundred dollars. But I guess it is shame on me for trusting that this man's word was good.

Moore Audiology and Hearing Aid Center is a wonderful caring office. The doctors and staff are a pleasure to work with, they are well educated in all areas of hearing health care. They were very compassionate about my hearing and explained how the loss of hearing could affect my life.  They were able to give me useful information as well as options to improve my hearing.  I am a grandma and watch my grandchildren during the day, I was having trouble hearing and understanding what they were saying.  Moore Audiology gave me the gift of joy, hearing!  I cannot say enough nice things about their offices.

This is tucked away in a non descript strip mall and is nothing to look at. Don't bother if ambiance is what you are after. If, though, you just want a decent gyro, then check the joint out. It seemed as though they weren't selling a lot a gyros based on the slight crispiness on the edges of the meat, but it is tasty, plenty of tatziki sauce and crispy fires. All at a very reasonable price. I will stop by again when we are in the area.

This is a wonderful diner to get those comfort foods you want all tasting homemade. I had the Monte Cristo sandwich which was wonderful and not greasy. French fries were to die for!!! Crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. I am looking forward to going back next time in town to check out breakfast. Their menu is very diverse for every  type of person kids included. I will definitely go there again. Prices were great and affordable.

Found the truck I purchased on autotrader.com through Easy Street. I'm Ver skeptical of dealerships, even small ones. I was ready to negotiate the dealer fees on the truck and was praying that I wouldn't spend half a day here. Good news is I had cash for the purchase and apparently there is no city sales tax in Sun City so the price came lower than I expected with ZERO fees. The whole transaction took 45 minutes and that's because I had to run to the bank for cashier check. I also noticed most all used cars here had low mileage because the ppl that trade in here are retired folks that hardly drive. I highly recommend checking this place out in your next need for a vehicle. It's a small place do not much inventory but the main guy Perry was very helpful.

Service was so-so. Our server was very much in her own little world it seemed. The restaurant was clean and good came out fast but it wasn't anything to write home about. Standard cafe fare, maybe a little freshness would liven it up.

So I'm sitting in this waiting room surrounded by Seniors (over 50 club). A good sign that this place is every bit what the reviews say it is. 
I spoke up and asked "Ok guys I'm new here can I trust taking my car here"?  I've learned that when older people have good things to say about something, they are anxious to talk about it. They all said for the most part they wouldn't take there car anywhere else. 
Now that's the kind of response you wanna hear from a mechanic shop. I have to say they are right. 
They advertise reasonable service prices in the paper. They have an open waiting area that's not surrounded by walls. I can practically see my vehicle getting worked on while I wait. Who does that you ask? Shops that have nothing to hide. I'll be back with my other vehicles as well.

This is a city bock of thrift stores. i always find something to add to my folk art and desert pots for my garden, as well as other treasures. whenever I travel thru Phoenix I make time to browse. A real find

grace

Dr. Nez and his staff are very knowledgeable and offer excellent service.   He was very good at explaining our daughter's diagnosis and the steps needed to correct her vision.  We definitely recommend Dr. Nez as he's a great optometrist.
Love this place great bud and amazing staff good quality of products. And they are also opened until 10pm which is Perfect if you get off later

I have a lady friend of mine who has been going here since APR11 for tires. She told me she needed two tires and wondered if I could take a look. I looked at all of her past paperwork & found some VERY interesting information. In 5 years she has had 3 alignments, one was a 4 wheel alignment. The tires they have been recommending don't come with a mileage warranty & cost $109 - $129 per tire for passenger rated tires that only last around 11,000 - 13,000 miles!  The will cover road hazard & workmanship issues, but for $11.50 - $14.50 extra per tire! 
The tires are not installed for that price either! Oh no - an extra charge amounting to $40.00 or so. A lot of extra fees are added to EVERY ticket. 

When I looked at her tickets and then her truck holistically, I found something else extremely interesting! She had a couple of tires replaced a year & a half ago, one under warranty. Last summer she had another two tires replaced. Magically, the two tires, which were not worn out yet, were removed and the new tires installed. The tires that were on the rear & had over 20,000 miles were left on the truck. BTW, her spare tire has NEVER been touched, looked at, inspected for ANY issues since APR11. This is supposed to be a professional shop! All in all - the work they do appears to be safe, don't get me wrong. I have been a professional mechanic specializing in tires & emergency road service for over 30 years. The job of taking care of the entire truck and hence the customer, has been pushed to the background and replaced by the need to generate revenue!

I asked for and dealt directly with a Bruce Ogilvie, who was reportedly the manager, and got my issues resolved for my friend. I would still not recommend going to this shop unless you are qualified to understand & observe the work they want to perform!

A great family owned place that has good service and good prices. I took my vehicle here for the first time and it is so much more convenient than using the dealership.

They were honest and didn't try and sell me on things I didn't need. Great prices on the service I asked for.

Will use them for all my auto service needs in the future.

I've been going to Automotive for a good eight years. I found them after experiencing sticker shock at my dealer for simple oil changes and filters. 
When a friend of mine was given an $1,100 quote by her dealer for some work on her Toyota Sienna, I suggested she get another quote from Automotive Dynamics. They did the work for her for $800. 
Their shop is clean and well lit and their lobby is a comfortable, pleasant place. Their workers are loyal long term employees and the business is an honest friendly local establishment. I carry AAA and as an AAA shop, I enjoy a discount. For anything longer than an oil change, they provide free transportation back to my home, and pick me up when the work is done. 
I recently had a problem with my dashboard media center lights. Together we worked it out that my recently purchased (online) Dashmat didn't come with a hole punched in it for the daylight automatic light sensor--which I couldn't see from inside the car. Eureka! I just punched a hole where it was needed and all is well. 
They take the time, have the equipment and experience, and charge fair prices as well.

Nice people...bad food. We went for breakfast and got some things to share. Bacon, eggs and pancakes were way overcooked. Our 3 year old had biscuits and gravy which was pretty bland, even she dumped salt and ketchup all over it. Definitely did not hit the spot which sucks cause we were really in a b-fast mood and starving.

I was not aware of Fix Auto in Sun City before this past week.  I had simply asked my insurance company to find an auto body shop closest to my home.  Lucky me, they came up with Fix Auto.  From the moment I walked in the door I got the feeling that this was more of a family business, and not a franchise.  Grant did my estimate, was friendly and courteous and prompt in running the numbers and firming up the estimate.  We then arranged for a prearranged date for me to bring my drivable but damaged Honda van in to get the work done.  They then drove me home and sent me a text message to begin the process.  One note...a small one...I received no further updates during the week and had to call on Thursday morning, just to see how repair was progressing.  I was told the car would be ready Friday,today, before 4 o'clock.  So this morning I got a call to pick up the car.  They sent a shuttle to pick me up and when I arrived at the repair facility the bill was ready, I was given details on warranty matters, provided a coupon for a free oil change.  I paid, received my info and receipt packet, then walked out to my car.  I was floored when I saw that not only had Fix Auto repaired my Honda Van, but had detailed it, cleaning it both inside and outside, even shampooing my rather dirty carpets!  No where have I ever received that level of service.  In the future, if I am ever unlucky enough to have an accident, it will be Fix Auto I will demand to do the repairs.  Always love when a business exceeds expectations!

4/18 took my dog in gave specifics on phone and in person. picked my dog up and the cut looked horrible! i payed 45.00 for this service...!
the anas is still swollen its been 5 days!
they had a white dog shivering as this groomer was shaving him roughly! 
hair from multiple dogs everywhere!
never go here!

Awful.  I brought my car in for a flat tire.  They told me it could not be fixed and that I needed a new tire.  They put a new tire on and I drove away.  After three days that tire was flat.  I took it to my regular mechanic and he said I had a bad valve and that I never needed a new tire, they were just trying to make money off me.  My mom brought her car into Big O for an oil change and they overfilled her and she had blue smoke and leaking all over the driveway.  We will never go back.  Be careful.

HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE 

Was told I couldn't cash a check because the bank doesn't hold enough money... then asked if I wanted to open an account there. 
Nope.

Supervisor Celeste was extremely rude and no help whatsoever. 

If your bills can wait and your life can be put on hold until US Bank has money, join them!

This company is a complete scam!!!

Beware their goal is to rip you off. 

As others have said, Josh Sneed will come to your house and claim that you need a new part. He'll say that the part is hard to find but he has a local distributor so he can get one right away. 

He then takes your money and disappears. 

I wish I would have come to Yelp before I called Josh.

Maybe we can all get together and sue this guy because he is a con-man and a thief preying on people who are in a vulnerable state.

Found the truck I purchased on autotrader.com through Easy Street. I'm Ver skeptical of dealerships, even small ones. I was ready to negotiate the dealer fees on the truck and was praying that I wouldn't spend half a day here. Good news is I had cash for the purchase and apparently there is no city sales tax in Sun City so the price came lower than I expected with ZERO fees. The whole transaction took 45 minutes and that's because I had to run to the bank for cashier check. I also noticed most all used cars here had low mileage because the ppl that trade in here are retired folks that hardly drive. I highly recommend checking this place out in your next need for a vehicle. It's a small place do not much inventory but the main guy Perry was very helpful.

This restaurant is the star of Sun City! Not only is the food out of this world, (Check out the chicken noodle soup, the noodles are homemade! When is the last time you have seen that!) the employees are friendly, helpful, and make you feel like part of the family. The owners are out and about checking on tables and making sure the place is running smoothly, and the servers are quick to make sure you get everything you could ever need as well as providing friendly conversation. This place is a testament to having good management, good staff, good food, and an environment where everyone genuinely cares about one another. I keep coming back to this restaurant for a variety of reasons, and the stellar food is just a bonus! 

The salad bar is fresh, clean and well stocked, everything is perfectly chilled and well maintained. The soups as mentioned are fantastic, and every thing that we have ordered off the menu has come expertly prepared.

Amazing place, people and food. The trifecta that is very rarely found anymore.

There are many diner type restaurants here in Sun City. I have commented on a few. I was greeted immediately. The server asked me if I wanted a small table or a booth which I thought was very nice. I opted for the small table as I was dining solo. I ordered a patty melt with cheddar cheese instead of Swiss and fries. She asked me how I wanted it cooked, which you hardly get asked that anymore. I ordered it medium which is exactly as it came. Marbled rye and lots of juicy sautéed onions. The patty melt was perfectly grilled on both sides! Thank you! And thanks for the extra napkins. And the offer to give me a to go cup for my soda. I will be back to try different menu items!

I was very disappointed with this course.  I got there early to warm up but didn't have a chance.  They were pushing the groups out 15 minutes early.  Our one buddy was running late,  so he showed up right at the designated tee time. The clubhouse was irritated,  so they berated him over the PA system.  We didn't see the beverage cart until the 9th hole,  then not again until the 18th green. They don't accept credit cards at the restaurant and they don't serve breakfast.  The course, itself, was in decent shape.  Some tee boxes were spotty or uneven. Just below standards that I would expect from a country club.

I met Dr Justo and his wonderful staff four years ago and I have never been disappointed. Dr Justo and his staff are always upbeat and willing to go the extra mile for me.  

I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE my eyes since I had my eyelid surgery.  Before the surgery everyone would always ask me if I was tired because my eyes were so droopy...not anymore!!  

All I can say is Thank you Dr Justo for your many years of professionalism, expertise and of course your experience!
Ok place for Sun City folks. Too small place, we had to leave once as no chairs. Expect to see super drank people.

The epitome of the neighborhood bar!!
Cheap drinks and friendly folks!! Great people!
Great food, breakfast is superb. Family owned restaurant where you are greeted from first minute. Food portion is huge and food is super tasty and the price is amazing. Recommended!

Really great food at a very reasonable price.  Their home made soups are the best I have ever had, and I love their gyro and falafels as well.  Their side greed salad in unreliable, large and full of great things.  I have been several times, and never have been even slightly disappointed.  The place is very comfortable and nicely done.

I love the fact that this place is supporting all local 
We had awesome service from Ben at the bar, super informative about the menu , about his libations and the whole experience. We had just wondered in for a drink , ordered drinks and the best fries !
We have to give all Kudos to Ben !

This is my husband's second trip in for cataract surgery. Both eyes are now done. The scheduling here is a nightmare. First time, we were rescheduled because the laser needed cleaning. The procedure involved 4 hours waiting in the reception area and finally surgery. Second trip in, 4 hours waiting again! It's difficult to wait in a reception area with a roomful of angry people. All I can say is that I am glad he only has 2 eyes. There has to be a more civilized way to do business.
They close early at 4:00 PM and they let you know it! They sweep the aisles for customers that dare lurk a minute past the time they close. Come early if you want to shop here.

Located in the corner of a small strip mall. This Thrift Store has expanded space and is now a bit bigger with more stuff. Good thrift store prices and the old dears that work there are friendly. There is an additional cashier located in the Xmas section, plus they have kids stuff too!

I don't know if there is a restroom (sometimes this is good to know).

Evan was our waiter and he was very attentive and the food was great.  The Spanish omelette was delicious and my husband enjoyed the cakes and eggs and meat.  The cafe has a great "old" vibe, the food was good and Evan was awesome.  We will definitely be going back!
Terrible service cancelled an appointment they scheduled without calling . Will not come back here staff is very unprofessional

The Mr. and I stopped by for breakfast after craving some good ol' diner pancakes and eggs. We each had the Bobbie's Breakfast Special - $3.99 for 2 eggs, golden home fries and 2 slices of bacon. The food was pretty good, but the service wasn't the best. The waitress was attentive - if not overly attentive! Everytime she kept coming back to check on us she would stop and stare at us watching us eat for I swear what felt like a whole minute - not saying anything, just staring! My husband ordered a side of pancakes to go with his breakfast special and she made a comment about how much food we ordered. Who wants to go out to eat and be judged by how much food you order? Please just do your job, take our order, bring our meal and refill our coffee. No need to judge or stare! But where else can you get a full breakfast for under $5 though? Will definitely be back if we're on this side of town...as long as we don't get the judgemental waitress with the staring problem!

Stumbled upon this great thrift shop with my friend in Peoria! Very clean and organized! Found some great throwbacks videos and some really great articles of clothing. Friendly workers at the register! Can't wait to check back in and see what else they get in.

I have downgraded my opinion of this dispensary recently. (Since the end of July) New lady budtender does not like selling  superb strains for economy prices. 3 weeks ago the shelves were stocked with super tasty og's like XXX, Fire, True and Headband. GDP, Emerald Jack and more. What a turnaround! (Negative) I give 3 stars for what they were because what we have now is a 1-2 stars in an inconvenient location. Please bring back old business model

Restaurant moved location about two years ago, and the menu was changed a bit.  Still a diner atmosphere, and on our recent visits the food was only fair.  Service was very slow and they may have been understaffed.  It's OK as far as restaurants go, but there are several nearby that we prefer.  Meals are not too pricy, but the food is mediocre at best.

We have been going to this restaurant since 1989.  The food is great, the servers are attentive, and the price is reasonable.  Up until the current owners took over, we felt like just another patron with no personalized interaction.  We continued going there for the food and the price, not to mention the tradition established.  Now we've become acquainted with the owners and servers, and they make it a pleasurable experience every time.  We just recently learned that customers they had at their restaurant in Canada and who snowbird here, travel from various parts of the valley to eat at the restaurant and to visit with them.  I'd say that is quite a testament!

Amazing stock and staff! Everyone was so friendly and polite; even the other customers. So much to see and look at! Wide selection of books and a polite gentleman that can recommend books! Whenever I'm around, I always stop in!

WM has rlly good flower, delicious edibles, and great deals every day. Tasty Tuesday n Free Gram Friday are my favs :-)

On top of good product, the staff here is so kind and helpful!! I couldn't ask for a more well-rounded consumer experience. I end up going a few times a week bc white mountain takes such good care of their customers

IF YOU HAVE HEARING NEEDS, DO NOT GO TO THIS BUSINESS!! As a customer of the zounds in Sun City, AZ from 2/2015 to 3/2016, my hearing aids have broke or fallen apart numerous times. Even with an appointment, I usually have to wait and wait. There's always interruptions when being helped. Instead of being part of the service experience, I always am left waiting and waiting for answers. During my last visit of 3/2016, again I brought my aids to be repaired. When I questioned the tech/dr about the aids breaking so often, he too offense with me. Of course I was irritated but in control after paying thousands of dollars for a broken down product. The offended employee even followed me outside just to rudely accuse me of calling him "a half wit". I was so shocked that he eves dropped on my conversation and accused me of something i did not say, all I could do is correct him on the lie he accused me of. This schoolyard bullying that I experienced only shows how rude and unprofessional this company and employees are to their customers. Whatever happened to "the customer is ALWAYS RIGHT?" AGAIN, IF YOU HAVE HEARING NEEDS, DO NOT GO TO THIS BUSINESS.

Deep fried battered fish and fries from some frozen food distributor, and not even of the Gorton's fisherman quality--air space between batter and fish and ends of pieces were devoid of fish. Portion sizes were okay, with the fries especially generous and 3 average pieces of fish. No lemon sliver and no malt vinegar (my fault for not asking for the latter, so maybe they did have it, but visits from the server were few and far between since we were seated outside and Karaoke going on inside, which also meant that we had to walk in front of performers to get to the bar to get to a server to tell her we were outside--a logistically poor and embarrassing layout for those of us not wishing to inadvertently find ourselves the center of attention.). Tartar sauce and coleslaw (okay, but why just a couple spoonfuls? Cabbage is cheap) served in little plastic containers with caps--why? It wasn't a to-go meal, so why serve my meal with throwaways esp. when the world is overrun with necessary plastic? 
I went with a coupon for $5.99 fish dinner and showed it to server upon arrival and asked if it was still good and she said yes. When I got home and put my glasses on, I found I had been charged $7.50 with the description saying "Fish fry with coupon special." Guess they had upped the price since my clipped ad which didn't have a date on it, but why wasn't I told when I asked? Why was it just slipped in without an explanation? And why did it take so long for us to get our check?--I really didn't want to go back inside and walk across a performer again....
At least they had something other than Bud-light on tap, so had Amber Bock, at a small pitcher price of $4.50--good deal even though it wasn't Happy Hour, and boy could I use it!

My husband and I were invited by our friends to the newly owned Union Hills Country Club.
We had the best experience with a couple of events. 
The first night was Italian buffet. I have to say I was blown away. I heard about their new chef joining the team.
 The second occasion was Oktober Fest buffet. My husband is German, we really loved the authenticity of the food, it reminded him of home.
We will definitely be back and tell our friends

I had a bunch of work done on my 97 Jeep Grand Cherokee Laredo and I dealt with the manager named Mitch. He was great!! He went over with me everything I asked for and gave me the price. The nice thing was the price never went up 6 hours later like many repair shops try to do.
