Worst HOSPITAL Ever. NO CARE For Patients Well Being at ALL. The Dr.s Here are 3 world at best. What has our Health Care System Come to? I have seen first hand that they sent a family member home that is physically unable to care for themselves and they didn't even help to arrange for Physical Therapy or in home health care. How in the Hell can you be rated top 100 when you provide CRAP care like this.

What a great "Americana" restaurant! This place brings back so many memories of what used to be very popular restaurant's back in the day ~  the buffet/cafeteria's.  This Furr's is conveniently located just west of the 101 Hwy on Grand and Sun City.  You can tell this Furr's has been around since the fifties based on their sign and building but they have done a very nice job maintaining everything inside and out.  

I had a very enjoyable lunch last with some fellow Yelper's; Rand H., Mike C. and Scott W..  This Furr's is a cafeteria however once you go through the line once, you can go back as many times as you like to, all for the same price of $7.39.  I really liked this concept because your not picking through what other the prior people have handled ~ you know what I mean!  You choose what you want and they serve it to you.  

They have most of the traditional "Americana" food options to choose from.  I recommend when you first go through the line asking for smaller portions and trying more varieties of things.  This way you can refill on what you really like without over stuffing yourself.  Everything was very tasty and fresh.  I'm looking forward to going back to this Furr's so hopefully I will see you there.

First time to this restaurant. Not terribly impressed. 

Start with cleanliness. There were flies in the restaurant. The bathroom had not been cleaned. The rest of it looked okay for a small taco shop. There is only fast food restaurant type seating.

Service was good. The woman behind the counter was very good at explaining the food and give me some recommendations. She was courteous and nice.

The food is okay. Price to quantity was pretty good. But I would rather have less quantity and more quality. It was relatively bland food. The salsas were okay but they all kind of taste the same. I spent $13 on chips and two large flower tacos with beans and rice. 

This restaurant was just under okay.

You know you're in a great place when it's located in the middle of retirementville and it's still hoppin' after 11pm.

And I'm not the youngest one there.

This place is one chic little bistro that is family owned.  The owners are the sweetest people ever, and they were more than accommodating for our party of 7.  The atmosphere of the entire place is one of joy and good humor, and mingles smoothly between contemporary and rat pack era.  And I don't mean the kind of rat pack era that makes me feel like I'm still a fetus.

Ever been to a restaurant you didn't want to leave?  This is one of those places.

But what's atmosphere without good food?  Dominic's doesn't disappoint.  The menu is pretty simple, but everything looks delicious!  I had the chicken parm, which was a perfectly cooked moist piece of buck-buck I've ever had.  The marinara is perfectly herbed.

Most everyone else had the eggplant parm, which I tried a bit of, and found a new love.  I already know what my next meal there is going to be!

I also recommend the house dressing on the salad - it tastes almost like a tomato viniagrette.  The fried ravioli were also drool-worthy.

Okay so now I have to start a new paragraph just for the dessert, which was the Cassata Cake, hand made by the daughter.  The first thing you think of is, 'this is my future wedding cake'.  It was moist, and had just the perfect sweetness in the frosting without being too cloyingly sweet.  And as if it needed any improvements, the occasional chocolate chip that wandered into my mouth made it just that much better.

The house band was excellent all night, and if you feel like the cake is expanding your waistline, just hop up onto the dance floor and shake your money makers.  Every 15 minutes of dancing allows you to eat another slice of Cassata Cake.  No Lie!

This place is large party friendly, good for all ages, and only parties into the night on Fridays and Saturdays.  Get there early, or miss out on seating!

The Burritos are really what you want to get here. They are top notch, incredibly delicious, especially the Surf & Turf which has shrimp, a white sauce and steak. 

They USED to have very good prices, 5 bucks got you the burrito a-la-carte but now it's $7.95. Most of the people who work here are very friendly but there was one girl who worked here for awhile who definitely was not. She gave me the wrong change one time and when I asked for the correct change she threw a fit and literally tossed my coins at me. After that each time I would go in she'd give me a strange attitude, including one time when I was watching something on the TV (I was the only one in there) and she purposely changed the channel then looked at me and smirked. Not cool!

I've been to the one in Scottsdale, it's MUCH better in my opinion. Either way, I can't deny how delicious their food is...

Not as special this time. Eggplant parm. sandwich was not generous. Roll was just average. Same for the service. Wedding soup was good and coffee too. 
Decor  of Movie memorabilia is interesting.
An old lady threw up all over the table tonight.
Was not a big fan of how they make their meals. And beef tastes like it was over cooked and was still saturated in grease.
First time here, surprising legit! I ordered a carne Assad taco and rolled beef tacos. Well prepared Calif style and goodsurprised me! I will be back!

I have placed orders for delivery from this particular Domino's on quite a few occasions. They are my "go to" pizza place! I have always been very satisfied with their pizzas and I am also a fan of their brownies and cinnamon bread twists with the icing. Delivery has always been very fast and the food arrives hot and the drivers have been professional. I love ordering online because you can get a free pizza after so many orders... when you do redeem for the free pizza, just make sure you check your final order to make sure it was marked as no cost. 
I have been impressed with how the quality of Domino's pizzas have improved compared to the many, many years ago that we used to order them in college (they certainly were not as tasty as they are these days).
I have also done carryout at this particular Domino's and the place has always been clean and staff were friendly enough.
I guess if I had to offer any suggestions to corporate Domino's, it would be to offer a garlic dipping sauce that actually had butter in it... this stuff is just oil and the sweet icing dip is not much better nutritionally. But other than that, the food has been good.

This place is amazing!  Good food great service!  The spaghettini w meatballs is so delicious and they give you fresh hot bread, and a choice of salad or soup!  Salad w Italian Dressing is very yummy!

Went to redeem my two massages and complimentary drink. The drink was a kiwi strawberry water. The reception area had stained seats. No smells of aroma therapy or soothing music. Asked to use the ladies room .. the rugs look like they had never seen a washer. 
The voucher was for two people and the appointment was for two of us. When we arrived they only had one operator and he would have to take turns. HUH???
We excused ourselves and left ... no way I was taking off anything or laying on anything in there.

I was really surprised with this place. We stopped to give it a shot since we pass it everyday. The food was delicious. The señor taco burro was HUGE and I don't mean chipotle huge I mean 2 chipotle burritos huge. The flavors were perfect. I can't believe I didn't eat here before now.
Awesome shrimp burrito! I get nothing else even though I try too. It's filled with big shrimp and the sauce with it is so good. When family comes out I always recommend going there.

The food at this little place was great. Had the rolled tacos with beef tamale and the food tasted fresh. The prices was also fantastic. Lunch for 2  was  cheap and it was a good amount of food as well.

I found inVision by chance, after a silent auction landed a gift certificate in my hands.  That was about a year ago and I've been going back to see Khana ever since.  I never fail to book my next massage before I leave.  Khana is an amazing massage therapist!  She will listen to you and customize your massage to help heal what hurts.  I always feel so much better after my visits.  Khana genuinely cares about your health and wellbeing; and she is great at communicating with her clients.  She has even called me to follow up on how I was feeling after she worked on particularly sore and problem areas.  inVision has awesome specials... so you can try them out without breaking the bank.  Make an appointment with Khana and you will become a client for life!

It's a 3 star joint. They get a 1 star for friendliness. The cashier never smiled once. There was no one else in line at the time, so it isn't that she was buried with customers. I watched as others came in and ordered and she never smiled once. I didn't see any of the staff in the back smiling either except once when they were joking around with one of their own staff leaving. 

Their namesake is where its all at here. The tacos have a great shell and the perfect crunch. The beaf was cooked to perfection. 

The quesadilla is loaded with a lot of cheese, but if you are ordering one, I'm guessing you know that and expect it.

The enchiladas have a different sauce than most places. It was pretty good, but if your counting on the standard red sauce you get anyplace else, then this is not for you.

The beans and rice are excellent.

Chips: I got 2 chips on my plate with my meal. If you want chips to eat with your meal, they only have a large bag for $3.99 ($4). We would never eat all those. It would be nice if they offered half the bag for half the price.
The chips taste like the taco shells, which means they are great. You will love them.

The joint was very clean and well kept after when people left.

They have daily specials that give a bit of help for those on a budget ($5-$6). On average, meals will run you around $8-$10 if you don't eat off the specials.

Wish they had a little better selection when it came to combo's. They didn't have any combo's that include a burrito besides one with a shrimp burrito and it was over the $ price guide given by Yelp for the Taco Shop.

Overall, I still think 3 stars is about it for this location. If the Staff was more friendly and actually acted like they were glad you walked in, then I think this would get 4 stars.
Love this place. Breakfast burrito is very large and tasty. The crunchy burrito has good flavor. For dinner I love the Chipotle chicken burrito.

I had the pleasure of being introduced to this place this past Saturday. The food was good, the service was very good, and the music was fun. The decor was dated, but, if you're like me (who will take good food and service over ritz any day) this was a great place. The menu is simple, but between the five in our party, everything was great. The service was given with a smile and the sangria was good. I liked that the entrees were offered at lunch 'size'. The music kicked in and the dance floor was hopping. The live music was from two fellas, a keyboard and bongos. However that may sound, it was fabulous. Great voices. Musically skilled. It is in the heart of Sun City, so if you're afraid that age is catching or if you're looking for the price tag of your outfit to be noticed, this is not the place for you. However, if you're looking for friendly company, good food, and a fun time, go. Maybe I'll see you there, because I'll be going back!

Khana is awesome and does great massages! I have rheumatoid arthritis and am a hairstylist so constantly being on my feet takes a beating on my body but  she keeps me feeling good and loosens me up so I feel good at work. She very knowledgeable about many techniques and really informs you on what's good for your body. I highly recommend her to any one that wants a great massage and wants to feel good

Best Carne Asada burros on this side of town by far. Decided to give this place a try after an older Mexican co-worker told me they had good Mexican food and he liked Senor Taco a lot. I wasn't disappointed. The frijoles and tostadas lack flavor compared to some traditional places but the carne asada and pollo asado burritos are great. I haven't been able to find a good burrito since my years living in Westside Phoenix, and this place reminds me of one of the very few things I miss from that part of town, great Mexican food. If you think Taco Bell is great (like my wife from Michigan) this place isn't for you. I however, will be back soon.

First things first, don't order from here. The service is just as bad as the food. Okay, maaaybe a little bit worse. 

Im not sure if they still have the same crew working there or not but Daisia, the girl who answered the phone, should work somewhere else or go to a Customer Service class. I called and she answered with "Can I put you on hold?" then didnt wait, just put me on hold. A couple minutes later she took my order like she has waaay better things to do and completely disregarded my request to get a phone call when the delivery man was outside my door instead of a knock. Of course the delivery man came to my door and knocked loud enough to wake everyone up and get my dogs to bark up a storm. He said he wasn't told to call and then slammed my screen door. So I called the store again and miss Daisia answered with her 'hold' greeting and when I asked to speak to a supervisor, he apologized and said there was "nothing he could do". I hung up and proceeded to just eat my food and put it all behind me. But the bread was still VERY doughy and the pasta was so hard, it was crunchy. I threw that crap away. I made sure to get my refund but wow, you guys suck!

I tried giving them a second chance but the food came out just the same and the daytime manager was rude enough for me to write my first bad review on here. Apparently all the breadbowls come out doughy unless you call to let them know you want it cooked all the way through. Maybe if I order wings they'll deliver a dead chicken and tell me I shouldve called to have it cooked instead.

I've only been here once but am determine to go again when we get back to AZ.  The think I really like is that they have a huge petite selection with some great brands.  The sales people are helpful but not pushy.  I forgot my coupon but they had a spare one they let me use which was huge to me.  

They are a little pricey but with the coupon they are reasonable.
Went here with my dad today, we were very pleased with Sebastian and Eric they were super helpful same with the manager on duty. Didn't catch her name but super friendly staff.

Went to dinner last Sunday and it is The Best Italian Food in town hands down! One of the few places that every dish from the fresh baked bread to the main entree has flavor. I had Chicken Parmesan, other family members had Lasagna and NO ONE left hungry or disappointed.

I always get the shrimp burrito! The best shrimp burrito I've ever had! You get big plump shrimp in every bite! I have yet to try anything else because I love that burrito so much I have to get it every time lol. But the chips and green salsa they have is also delicious. I will definitely try other things on the menu when I get a chance :)

This is an outstanding place!  Spotlessly clean.  Welcoming.  Friendly, happy staff.  But the very best part is the communications!!!  I am 73 years old, so I have dealt with a LOT of doctors and dentists in my life.  In all those years, only one other doctor ever equaled Dr. Cho in being able to explain and communicate medical issues to a layperson like me.  To communicate at this level requires complete mastery of one's field of expertise.  I have dealt with plenty of perfectly competent journeyman doctors who could do their jobs, but could not effectively explain what they were doing.  Dr. Cho is at that master's level.  We are so happy to have found this dentist!

Honest, friendly, knowledgeable, fair, and polite. I get a little nervous when someone else works on my vehicle. They allowed me to watch the whole process. When their original diagnosis was wrong they went to option b and didn't charge me for the unneeded replacement. They usually very busy, but we'll worth any wait.
Great staff and very knowledgeable! Tony and his crew helped get my truck back on the road. Highly recommended with quality work. Thanks everyone!

I can't say enough good things about Dan and the guys at King Automotive Repair.  I had just moved to Arizona, and bought a car with a very tight budget (low mileage 1992 Toyota Camry).  It needed a new AC and a couple of other things done to it, engine, ac and some body work.  Basically, I needed a functional, reliable car without putting a lot of money into it.  I also didn't need it back in a huge hurry as I was getting settled in my new house.  Well, the guys at king worked with me to keep things at a reasonable price point.  Granted, I could have had it done faster (with them if I had wanted to or with someone else), but it was more important to me to save some money, take some more time, and still have things work well at the end of the process.  Well, the guys worked with me, and I now have a fully functioning car and I probably paid about 50-70% of what I would have paid anywhere else.  Everyone was nice and professional, and in the end, I got my car back running great in a reasonable amount of time (when you considering ordering old parts from far away places to save some $$$).  They even named my car Betsy for me, which somehow fits.  Anyway, I would for sure come back to see them again with any of my car needs.
Omg this place is so amazing!!!food is on point. Best pastor tacos I've ever had..The cleaness of this place is great. The customer service is very friendly love the atmosphere.

Honestly, the place was clean, service was amazing, hence the 3 star. everyone was on time. i received a crown- and had to get it shaved down from the sensitivity couple weeks later... now its still hurting been couple months.. was told it might be a root canal now. still cant chew on this side so ill have to go back again. maybe get a 2nd opinion just in case 

Update: after writing this review the manager contacted me and took me in right away to analyze what was going on. Dr clearly explained everything to me and compared my two x-rays. I appreciated that it was all shown and explained to me. I need a root canal due to my old filling being very deep and causing nerve sensitivity. Dr explained that once I received root canal he will redo and fix my crown at no charge. thank you!

Two stars but only because of location! Most sale items are gone right away. Can be a busy location. Today's cashier was rude to customer in front of me. Cashier didn't greet the customer or make eye contact at all. Customer politely said, "Smile (insert name of cashier), it can't be that bad!". The cashier responded curtly, "I am smiling!". 

She wasn't. 

Love being a rewards member and the deals, but see ya, CVS. I'm going back to Walgreen's or Walmart.

What a precious gem of a restaurant!   It's a little hard to find but so worth looking for. Their lunch specials are perfectly proportioned and scrumptious.  The waitress was super friendly and helpful about the food preparation and menu.  We'll be back!!!
three rolled tacos with rice and beans. Rolled tacos were okay, beans so-so, rice awful, like Uncle Bens with almost no flavor. Red sauce was horrible, tasted like it came from a can.

I am writing this as a former employee. I cant tell you how many times I heard hospitalists, nurses, cnas, and PAs talk crap about their patients in the ER, definitely discouraged me from ever visiting not only their ER but any Banner ER. The bathrooms around the hospital dont even look like they're cleaned regularly and definitely doesn't smell like they have in sometime. Nurses on the floors are rude, and have bad attitudes. The department I worked in was horrible, bad training, excessive call outs without repercussions, my direct manager was horrible and two faced. When I was hired she kept saying she wants everyone to be successful in this department etc but she waits until things become giant issues to even address it. You never saw her,  and shes completely unapproachable when you did see her I had to go over her head to get my log ins to do my job because after 5 weeks after my hire date I found out she never requested them in the first place and I was supposed to go live the next day. Other coworkers in my department had bad attitudes, the lazy ones are rewarded while the hard working ones get more stuff piled on and treated like crap. They made inappropriate racial jokes and if they didn't like you they'd act like you dont even exist they have no sense of professionalism.  I am sure a few of them were high when coming into work everyday. My direct manager is clicky with certain co workers, obvious favoritism. If one of those said co-workers didnt like another co worker they'd spread lies to the manager who then wouldnt even listen to your side of anything. You're guilty until proven innocent and even then in their minds you're guilty. When I was hired there I was warned about the high turn over rate and I can see why, it's truely one of the worse places I've worked. If I could give this place 0 stars I would.

Completely over priced for the quality and quantity.  Decor was kitchy.  Music from the 40's...would have been more OK if one was in a piano bar mood I think.

Waitress was nice and on point, so no fault there.  Problem was the upsale...my bad as I should have asked the price difference between chicken and veal.
4 tiny pieces of veal with less then 2 cups of spaghetti  $18.

House made cake was yummy for $5.  House brand wine was undrinkable.  Mini meatball soup came with dinner was good but barely 1 cup full (literal cup).

Dude at bar hacking up his guts was a real turn off.  I say keep that at home and not in an eatery.  Common sense.

So, not sure on this place.  Willing to try pizza next time or lunch at the more reasonable prices.

This was a good find, good food, great prices and friendly people.i would recommend it to everyone. Small plain little place but worth the stop to try it.The ingredients were fresh and tasty and plenty of food for the money.They have specials after five which are the first five dinners on their menu for $5.00

I went in with my boyfriend, and it seemed the service was less than friendly.

I had the misfortune of going on a Saturday night, and having to bear witness to the "entertainment" of what I assume to be one of the proprietors.  Yikes.  The elderly people seemed to enjoy themselves, but this place just wasn't for me.  The food was by no means terrible, but I found it bland and forgettable; I  wouldn't call it any better than 'average'.
What a pleasant surprise, we shared the new chicken Cesar salad and the pork carnitas plate. Wow, both were generous and excellent. A great value and we will be back!

Went here for lunch with fellow Yelpers Mike C, Rand H, and Arlin B.  I got real excited about the fact they offered liver and onions the day were going and even though I like mine a little on the well done side that particular dish was a real disappointment.  Most of the other dishes were acceptable and better.  While nothing really stood out as great the overall value of the place is very good.  There was enough variety of dishes should keep almost anybody happy.  Being in Sun City most of the clientele is older but there was plenty of working folks there too.

Very, very surprised! Been driving by this place for a while now. Have been hesitant to try it. So on our way back from our foster kids therapy. We decided to stop by on our way home. I had the carne asada soft tacos. First they are large, and very good. I also had a bite of Natalies chile verde burrito. I liked it because it also had beans in it. All five kids really enjoyed their dinner. Wife had the cheese enchiladas, and said it was worth coming back for. 
The only down side at this place is their decor is worn and dated. Needs to be updated. But this place is well worth it. Glad we tried it, and will continue to come back.
Great food! Can't believe it's fast food. Been a long time since I've had great fish tacos like they are in cali.

I went to one of the temporary ones to get our 2010 and 2011 taxes done (had issues using Turbo Tax to file last year).  So after being quoted "around $200" to do each return, I decided, OK let's try.  My husband usually does it himself with Turbo Tax, but since it had issues with the first-time homebuyer credit last year and kept returning the forms, we decided to try a live person, and we figured $400 wouldn't be too bad. 

 Well, after spending hours there because the guy was so slow typing everything in- he kept making mistakes that my husband and I corrected- we ended up with a $579 bill.  Not sure how it happened- he said because we itemized, etc.  I don't know why we weren't quoted at a higher rate.  I left there feeling upset, cheated, and like a fool.  He tried to give us a $25 coupon, like that would really make a difference.  He seemed to understand that it was a lot of money, he said it should be free since I'm a teacher...blah blah who cares, I still had to pay almost $600 right there that I was not expecting to pay. 

We will NEVER use a tax service again.  I don't care how desperate I am to get my taxes done.  I will trust my husband to do Turbo Tax or whatever, and if we miss out on something, fine.  At last I know I didn't pay some guy more than $100 an hour to type numbers into a computer.  What a waste.

Looking for Cool Pepto Bismol tablets. Didn't have any bet can't fault them, nobody in this area seems to have them. 
Market  opportunity  missed. 
Seems like stores don't keep an adequate supply of things that move quickly. Go figure.

Our first time here, pleasantly surprised by Senor Taco.  Outside looks like a fast food place, but we were told it had good food.

Husband had combo plate with chicken and beef soft tacos, beans, rice, horchata, and guacamole. Very good. I had three rolled beef tacos with guacamole. Also very good. 

Clean restaurant. Pretty busy at lunch time. We will be back

Had to go there for a Kidney Stone that wouldn't pass. My Doctor works out of that Hospital. I started in emergency and the staff was wonderful and attentive. They made sure I was comfortable and got me into a room quickly. I had surgery the next morning. All of the staff were wonderful. Always making sure I was comfortable and understood everything. I will not go anywhere else!

First when I was making the appointment for a passport I was given the address to a different post office. When I made it to the correct location I was 10 minutes late they had they nerve to give me a hard time after they game me the wrong location. Now to top it off after I left 5 hours ago they are demanding that I come back in before they close because they screwed up my paperwork. I can't wait until the postal service collapses and all these incompetent burdens on the tax payers have to go find a real job.
I would recommend this clinic. The staff are great to work with and nice. Dr Patel took the time to listen and answer all our questions.

They took care of my PapPap for the last few days of his life. Most of the nurse staff was wonderful to us and took good care of him. I wish the outcome had been better but he seemed comfortable and they were all pretty nice to our family and let us stay with him outside visiting hours which was really wonderful to be by his side.
I absolutely love this facility. My wife and i go to the dining hall everyday. I enjoy seeing the smile on my wifes face.
Khana is great! I went with the 90 min massage! It was one of those massage that are so good the time goes by way too fast. Guess I will be going back for another! Thank you!
Wonderful place. Good food,great service, along with fair pricing. Plan on going back a lot

If you can get past the fact that this store is in Sun City and it's teamed with elderly customers, it's a very nice store that is well laid out with pleasant employees. Here are some tips for a successful visit to this store:

1) Be on high alert when you come into the parking lot. The elderly are always FIRST, no matter if you were there or not, and they will walk in front of you as though your car isn't even there or back out as though their car was on fire. They drive too fast or they brake very late so don't let your guard down.

2) If the elderly are first in the parking lot, they are still first at any station in fry's where there is a line too. Even if you were there first, they will cut right in front of you at deli, bakery, meat, floral...it doesn't matter. Fortunately, the staff is very good about politely reminding people about the order of operation and the order of the line. 

3) Go early in the morning or after dark when possible and there is less of a crowd. This store is VERY busy so keep this in mind.

4) Because this store is across from Boswell, it has a lovely floral department and a nicer selection of cards. Keep this in mind and avoid the high priced gift shop at Boswell if you can. 

If you are patient, this store can be a good visit if you keep the above tips in mind.

Starbucks inside is a pro HOWEVER they are always either slow or backed up. Regardless you'll probably be waiting a while. 

The actual fry's is clean and plenty on the shelves. 

Please remember where this location is, mostly seniors working and shopping there.
I've seen many restaurants come and go in this location over the years, I like this one best. Service is always nice. Food cooked quickly. Tastes delicious and fresh hope this place sticks around.

This is by far, the best car washing experience I have ever had!! From the cleanliness of the site itself to its extremely friendly staff, I will be a lifelong customer! 
Instead of feeling like getting a car wash is another check mark on the list of things to do - I will look forward to coming back to such friendly family business vibe. Strongest vacuums too!!! Thanks clean freak!!

I like Domino's.  Their prices are fair and you can custom build an order right online.  Every time I've done this, the pizza has been prepared perfectly.  I usually pick it up and the staff has always been polite and professional.  Today for a little something special, I ordered the CHOCOLATE LAVA CRUNCH CAKES - OMG, so yummy but I'm sure I'll have a sugar crash later.  That's ok, it was worth it.  Thank you for a job well done!

I went here right before thanksgiving for eyelash extensions by Joanna. They told me to arrive a bit early so I did and no one was there and the doors were locked. Half an hour later they finally opened. The eyelashes took about an hour. The room was a bit darker so when I looked in the mirror everything looked fine. That afternoon I was getting ready to go to my family's house for thanksgiving. I went to put mascara on my lower lashes and that's when I realized Joanna had CUT OFF my lower lashes! I was devastated. I called her and the spa no one answered so I left a message almost in tears. I called them after thanksgiving no answer. After about five different calls and no one even answering the phone I just felt like going up. I called one last time and the owner picked up. He said he was shocked and would figure out what they were going to do for me to make up for it. I have yet to hear from him or Joanna. I went to have eyelashes put on, not have my own cut off by some unprofessional idiot. I do not recommend this spa for anything. They are the most unprofessional group I've met.
I really like their food, it's really good. I just wish the inside of the restaurant was nicer and didn't smell like disinfectant.

Has a fast food atmosphere and moderate prices but has the best tasting authentic Mexican. As good as any sit down high end restaurant. Fresh hot homemade tortillas, great rice. Try the Carnita it a platter, fantastic!

This place is fantastic! We were going to get our food to eat, but for some reason we stayed and ate there instead. The atmosphere is alright, kind of weird but pretty cool at the same time. As usual, as a creature of habit, I got the Fettuccine Alfredo and it was great! When I say great, I mean it! It was creamy, delicious, yummy, goodness! The bread was delicious too, I could have eaten a whole loaf. 

We met the owner and maybe his daughter (?) and he was such a nice guy, he was friendly and really great to talk to. He was so welcoming and he was honestly happy to talk to us and we just chatted about Denver and about our vacation. 

We ended up getting a couple of desserts too, and the Cassata cake was pretty freaking amazing. 

If you are looking for a place to go, eat here! I can't wait to come back to AZ just to eat here!

I have taken my car here a few times for routine things and been very happy. Last week my car started over heating so I stopped in here (Wed) in a panic! It was later in the day so I just assumed they wouldn't be able to look at it until the following morning. Within about 30 minutes they were able to tell me what was wrong with it. Unfortunately it needed a fairly expensive Kia (hybrid) part that had to be ordered, then Kia called back and said it was on back order. Ugh! Oh well, what can you do? Anyway they said the part would be in Sat at the earliest, more likely Mon. I got a call on Fri saying the part came in early and it would be done Sat. They called me Sat AM saying it would be ready by noon and it was! I was able to turn in the rental car I had 2-3 days early! Amazing! These guys are great! Honest! No upselling!

gonna try again, but i was embarrased when i didn't have my lunch money and they had me sit in front of the money takers to see if I could have lunch there.felt like everyone was staring and it shamed me. I have not returned, i did go to other centers where the donation was recomended but not required..don't like to be embarassed cause i was broke due to my medical bills.. lady said I could not get items from the pantry if I did not have lunch, no money , so I went home  with nothing.
The Dr that attend me was so sweet and very straight forward I appreciate that in a Dr the staff kind very professional I definitely recommend them.
Love this place! Everyone is awesome:front desk, hygienists, assistants, and Dr. C!  Would highly recommend to anyone looking for people who care and do a great job.

Outside will make u want to move on, don't this is excellent Mexican. On par with anything in the valley. Great portions fresh awesome salsa. Don't go out of your way but if you stuck in bell 101 traffic grab a burrito

Great Mexican! We got this delivered through Uber eats. We tried the Diablo shrimp burrito, shrimp enchiladas, shrimp tacos and carnitas tacos all were great! If you want some quick Mexican this is definitely worth it.

Cute store with a lot of AZ knick knack stuff to purchase. My issue came when i went to buy stamps. They charged $10.00 for a book of stamps. When I asked why so much was told that because they now  take credit cards the price has gone up. I explained I was paying cash and the gal just said, "we'll that's what management told me to say."

This location is new.  They are giving away free car washes right now, so today I got one.  I was impressed.  The two gentlemen who helped me were great and my vehicle is reasonably clean.  Considering the last time I washed it before today, it would be fair to call the results spectacular.  I think this location is going to do well because of its um, location and because for a fee, you can come back as many times as you like in a given time period.  I would give all 5 stars, but I like touchless car washes the best.

I would like to start off by saying OMG "The Bread" it's hands down the best warm crusty Italian bread I have ever had! I felt like I was jetted back in time with theRat Pack style decor and music. Which is a good thing. When did people stop dancing and smiling and having fun? Well not at Dominics. Everyone if they were not dancing were obviously enjoying the music. Oops did I forget to say Live music. The service was amazing and friendly. We never had to ask for anything. And being married to an Italian for 30 years we both give the food a very strong thumbs up. Go and support this locally  family owned and operated Sun City business and tell them Susan sent ya! We will be regulars. After 10 years in Arizona we have found our place for Italian. Oh and lets not forget the Cassada cake. Moist and delicious. The perfect end to a perfect meal and perfect evening!

Things I love about this Fry's:

The cute, slow little old people.
The huge parking lot with the temptation of a Taco Bell within.
The great selection of spendy La Brea Bakery Bread.
Wednesday's.
The vast inside with everything but the kitchen sink. Fresh lobster?!
The cute, slow little old people. 

Things I hate about this Fry's:

The cute, slow little old people.
The huge parking lot with the temptation of a Taco Bell within.
The great selection of spendy La Brea Bakery Bread.
Wednesday's.
The vast inside with everything but the kitchen sink. Fresh lobster?!
The cute, slow little old people.

I felt compelled to write about the Budget car rental service located just inside the entrance to Frys. It is conveinent, their cars are just at the edge of the building by the gas station, and their staff is friendly and efficient. On the downside, they are not open beyond bankers hours. But if you need a car for Sun City errands, they are fairly reasonable. Why they aren't listed as a Budget car rental separately on Yelp, I don't know, as they have been there at least a couple of years.

As for the supermarket, they are a large store, seem to have lots of choices, friendly staff, easy checkout. If you are getting forgetful, they are accommodating, as they cater to the seniors of Sun City. Prices are great, compared to where I come from, Hawaii, and where I used to live, California.

This may be a new or newer business, I'm not sure. They were great at getting me in with almost no notice for a face wax. They offered me water the moment I entered the door, and had complimentary cookies and fruit out to snack on. The two men working the counter were very professional and courteous. The intake form all places seem to make you fill out asked the typical invasive questions, some of which I left blank as I didn't feel was there business and unlike many places I have been to they didn't try to pry it out of me when I turned it in. A huge positive in their favor, and I was really liking the place for that. 

The appointment didn't start on time, but the reception made the wait easy and they had free wifi available. The lady who treated me was very nice, she stated that she uses something called "sugar wax" and was preparing it. She  described that it was safer and gentler than other waxes and the same area can be reapplied with it more than once without worrying about the skin getting burned like with other waxes.  Compared to other waxes she was correct about it being gentler, and didn't irritate my sensitive skin. However, it takes longer for them to do. Typically I am use to being in and out in about 15-20 minutes; this appointment took closer to an hour. Also, she seemed to be doing the same areas multiple times and had to tweeze a lot by hand. Also (red flag), at the end of the appointment she didn't offer a mirror so that I could verify that all was ok. At the time I wasn't overly worried about it, paid and left. 

Then I met up with a friend to do some quick shopping before heading home. My friend noticed my face was pink in some areas and I explained where I'd been. She grabbed me by the chin and checked it out and said she was surprised I was alright with it.... ok, now I'm getting a bit nervous as I tell her that I didn't actually check over the work, just paid and left. She heads me over to a display counter for me to check out the job. While not horrible, my face had strays and wasn't the normal smooth look I received at other places. If I went into full details it would make it sound like I had a full girly beard and mustache, so to save my dignity (some), I'll not go into all the details. She did a good job with the eyebrows, but as far as a full face I was disappointed. However due to the reception and courtesy shown upped my star rating from a 2 to a 3.

Like this CVS, located conveniently off of Bell Rd. in Sun City.

This store is large, roomy and usually. It overly packed. They receive some good cosmetics at this location and the staff are very friendly.

They have a nice parking lot with enough parking to keep you close to the door.
Also conveniently located in the same lot as Safeway and several other stores.
Awesome place good food well worth the money my wife got enchiladas and I got the señor burrito and its huge and chicken nachos for our daughter service was really good fast and accurate

The BEST local, one-stop, no-wait postal/shipping service in the west valley!  I use this place for my business box, bring my shredding in and call on them when I have questions about how to get my packages out best and they are consistently helpful!  Yes, sometimes they can seem short or a little direct but this place is a busy little shop that goes the extra mile to get it done RIGHT.

Ordered on line. Spicy sauce was tangy, it had enough sausage, gr pepper, salami, mushrooms, onions and olives. Crust was chewy and good. No complaints. Especially when I didn't want to cook and no one wanted to leave the house. Thank goodness for delivery... We would have starved... Or so everyone thought!

wish it was possible to give zero stars! the customer service here is ridiculous! the employees act like the customer is bothering them when you ask for help and there is always at least one overcharge on every receipt. pass it by.
A little slow on getting the order ready but definitely worth it. Their Carne asada fries beat any Federicos and Humbertos.

This place just shot up to my favorite taco shop in all of Phoenix!  The carne asada is the best this state has to offer. Deliciosa!!  The salsas, though not as hot as I'd like, fantastic flavor. 

I'll be back!!

Bruce did a fantastic job servicing the west valley until he closed his doors. Power Window Repair is proud to take care of his customers and continue to service the west valley area! Thank you for all your years of service Bruce!

I heart this office. It's really nice inside and everyone there is so friendly. My hygienist is Jeneen and she's always making me and my family laugh. ask for her, you'll like her. Dr. Guzman is cool too. he's not all judgy when you don't floss :)

A less than  average hospital stay!  Staff- some great, others lack competency and professionalism.  Nursing units not particularly quiet day or night and suspect this is r/t layout of nursing units?  Failed to receive help with bathing and hygiene at times and call lights not always answered promptly!

Dr. Anthony de Beus is great.  He took the time to explain the issue and provided a solution, along with talking about future care needs, if needed.  Very knowledgeable, friendly and patient. Referred me to another specialist for a potential cornea issue...just in case.  Better safe than sorry is my kind of doctor. I would recommend him.
I had the California Surf Burrito, arguably the best burrito I have ever had. The restaurant was clean, the workers were friendly. We will definitely be coming back.

Holy crap, how have I been in Arizona for 5 years and never been here?! Finally tried this place tonight and it was awesome. Just around the corner from our house. The burritos are amazing and huge for the price. I had the burrito with the shrimp and carne asada and the secret sauce is like a flavor explosion. Husband loved his carne asada burrito. The guacamole is perfect and not filled with a bunch of crap like onions and tomatoes. Definitely will be coming back here again.
Got right in to my appointment. Dr. Patel was thorough in the exam and answered all my questions. Very pleasant. Staff was helpful and friendly.

My mom just left from Boswell to rehab. We chose Boswell because I believe they treat and take care of elderly better than Banner Estrella.  Of course my mom doesn't want to say anything while she's there because she's still there.  Thank God her experience was not as bad as it was at Estrella last year. I realize nurses and cnas are really busy doing their job but if patients don't check in what job are you left to do?  Her only thing was they almost transported her without cleaning her up after she asked several times as she needs 2 people  assistance going to the bathroom.  I'm glad this time she was fully aware of her surroundings and could articulate what she needed.  Imagine if quiet like some elderly/sick? Anyways I still choose Boswell but I will spend the night on random nights anywhere my mom is admitted.  Thank you

The food is amazing here!!! The service is top notch as well as the food quality! I have been to plenty of Mexican food places, but I have to say that this has got to be the best place I have been too in a long long time. I definitely recommend anyone to come here and eat!
Very clean, neat and well assorted.  Produce are super fresh and always great specials.  Employees are super polite and very knowledgeable about there products.   I really enjoy shopping here.
Sara Evans PA-C is rude and is the very reason I won't come to your ER. The rest of the staff I encountered all the way down to the cleaning staff have been nothing but nice.

Update:  sent private message with mothers contact information.  No response back. My mother has checked out. When she checked out left to go to car realized she left her phone charger my stepfather went back up within 10 minutes time it was already gone.  And not turned into lost and found.

Great place to dine with great entertainment.  We especially enjoyed the antipasto salad with amazing dressing.  They serve delicious Italian dishes and the service was friendly and personal.  We danced for the first time in 3 months.

Highly recommend this place.

This is a nice, big location loaded with stuff. There are some brands I recognize and some that are new to me. I like the nice range of sizes.

My favorite items are the hand-painted purses. Some are made in the USA and some are from India.  They are in the $250-and-up range and feature a variety of colorful images. I can see the daughters and granddaughters of the typical retirement-age customer walking out with these.  

The shoe section was kinda blah -- I think they should add some ballet flats to their collection. Flats can and should be pretty.

Hurry up and wait! Very clean facility and the volunteers that work here are phenomenal and very accomodating.
The associates and doctor were very kind, gentle and informative. I felt very comfortable with them and the facility.

Pretty good! Came here several times already. Prices are VERY good... and food is very decent with big portions! I love their beef rolled tacos with gauc (~$3-$4). Sometimes I crave it when I want something lighter. My husband is in love with their chicken enchiladas and gets the same thing every time. The tacos and quesadillas are decent, but not my favorite on the menu. I also tried the Surfin Burrito. My friend thinks its 'to die for,' but I personally think its decent but not my favorite. My favorite is the rolled tacos with gauc!! :) We will be regularly going back here. 

On tuesdays, combos are $5. Everyday after a certain hour.. I think after 5 or 6pm... combos are also $5. That's cheaper than McDonalds!

Well I can start off by saying that the staff is so rude at this dominoes I have to order from this dominoes because it's the closest to my house and they messed up my order twice I call in and I talk to somebody and they tell me they're going to give me a credit to receive another pizza and every time I call to receive my free pizza they tell me I didn't call and the manager is very rude and will not do nothing for me I will not be ordering from the Domino's anymore i'll just go at Pizza Hut

I had checked out a couple Frys and other grocery stores in the area and found they were not at the level I was used to.
I went to this one when I was close by and I was nicely surprised.

They are a bigger store, with a decent organic/natural section.
Their deli is bigger, they have sushi in the store (typical grocery store sushi).
They had a decent selection of produce.

Banner Boswell Medical Center is a great hospital.  I just completed an stay there a few days ago.  I was having chest pains and finally decided to go in because my intuition kept telling me to go.

Nonetheless, I arrived and was seen by the triage nurse promptly and was in a room and seeing a doctor within 15 minutes of arrival.  Now granted I was having chest pains which probably explains why I was seen promptly.  However, my wife had to visit the ER at Boswell twice this year and she was seen and in a room promptly as well and she didn't have chest pains.

My stay at Boswell was very pleasant and I felt confident that the doctors and the entire staff were doing everything possible such  tests and labs accordingly to determine the cause of my chest pains.  I felt safe and comfortable the entire time.

The CNA's, Nurses & Doctors and everyone involved in my care were awesome !

I would like to personally thank should they ever see this post RN Mary, Britney and Bethany and the CNA's under your supervision at the time and Dr. Fala and the other doctors for being so nice, friendly and professional.

Banner Boswell is our favorite hospital !

We always choose Boswell over Thunderbird and we live like 2 minutes from Thunderbird hospital.

So, the hours on yelp are slightly incorrect. I just went in today (Saturday--they're open from 9 to 3) to pick up a pair of climbing shoes I had stretched out. 

I received really excellent, super fast service and the price was reasonable. I don't know what John's problem was (which, by the way, racist much, bro?), but the woman helping me showed me exactly how much she was going to stretch them out before I left 4 days ago (I came to pick them up a little late) and gave me an idea of what to expect for half leather/half rubber shoes.

Honestly, I hate having to put my feet through tons of pain for a couple months before they fit me right, and this was worth every penny. I'm sending routes harder without needing to take my shoes off in between.

This Non-Profit Senior Center is one of the best.  They offer a smorgasbord of services for seniors, including having (1) a social worker on staff to help seniors get the most of their retirement, (2) a dining hall that offers  nutritious meals, a visually-impaired support group,  a meal-delivery program, a pantry that supports a food bank, OAP (Operation American Patriot) to serve and assist Veterans and activities/events to promote good health both physical & mental to members.  There is no cost to members.   I highly recommend this facility.
Awesome breakfast burritos!  I recommend the crunchy breakfast chipotle burrito!!   Always helpful staff and great prices for what you get

I went to Grand Ave Leather and Shoe repair to have my brand new leather boat shoes stretched maybe a 1/4" for I bought them one size smaller for didn't want to wear socks with these shoes.  I took them in and the lady put a stretcher in one of then while I was there.  I came back 5 days later to pick them up, I tried them on and they are now too big, I told her she stretched them too much and her comment was "You should have told me not to stretch them so much" in her broken Asia dialect and then walked away.

Would I go back?  Questionable.

We first came here to the emergency room for my wife.  Today she had an outpatient surgical procedure.  We are very pleased with this hospital.  The staff is excellent and caring.  We are glad to have such a good facility close to home

I was so surprised by all the quality goods stored in this Dollar Tree! It literally has everything! It has so much that other stores lack and the qualities are reasonable. I think I have found a Dollar Tree to shop at when I need or want a variety of things.

Great  ER experience this week taking my father-in-law.  Although the hospital was at capacity (which is odd for summer in Phoenix), he was treated very quickly.   We only waited minutes before he was seen by a nurse.  The nurses and doctors were very nice and every seemed to be in such a good mood!  I was in the hallway when I asked a gentlemen (Donald) walking by with a portable xray machine if there was a vending machine close by - not only did he show me where the cafeteria was, he waited for me and carried the food tray back to the ER room.

Volunteers that greeted me were nice. There were snacks. I only drove my roommate for her procedure, so the day was relatively OK for me. If I had a knife going through me in this building, I don't know if my experience would have been as pleasant.

I had a long wait but they were very busy with ambulance's. I was treated so well by everyone . I just really want everyone to know how great this place is. The young lady that takes you to x-ray her name is Chanel was so sweet. She made me.feel like she was truely there because she cared. All the stuff was like that !! Maria on the fifth floor wow!! She is amazing ! I feel alot better after going and I was in some of the worst pain of my life. Thankyou banner

A great find to say the least. We were greeted by a very friendly hostess and seated immediately. It's a loyal local's restaurant. Our waitress Patti was better than super. Was most helpful in assisting with our order. She was friendly and very efficient but still made us feel as friends. The dinner salad was typical but was very very fresh. Husband and I both had different chicken dishes-- very tasty. We stuffed ourselves with a delicious cake dessert which was wonderful. Patti told us they have a band on Friday and Saturday nights. It was nice to have a nice quiet uninterrupted dinner. Put this on your must to try.

I am one of the many who missed this awesome place during my time in the West Valley and recently discovered it to be one of my favorite Italian restaurants in Arizona.  

I've been here a few times and I found that Everything on the menu is really good.  The sauce is just right, it's not too sweet and just perfect.  Out of the few things that I've tried, just a simple bowl of baked penne was my favorite.  

I would like for the restaurant to have a meatless lasagna but, this is personal preference only because the sauce is really yummy and I like those flavors combined.

They seem to forget about the rewards. If you order so many pizzas online you get your sixth one free. Their Internet is so screwed up the manager at this place will not give me my free pizza. She says it's a third-party. Totally lost this customer forever. Dominoes if you're watching this it was at 3:50 PM on a Sunday. I would fire the manager in charge today. No customer service road and I will never do business with you guys again

Came with an open mind and left with a full stomach. Prices high for what you get, Beans are canned and since I ordered a #4 Combo I got them on a Tostado and as a side, it was a let down.  Taco was fair, shell crispy but the filling was lacking. I am used to getting tacos full of shredded  beef but this was a small patch in the center with a large glob of cheese, sort of melted. I was greeted and my order taken promptly by a friendly attendant. This is a Sun City establishment. Small salsa bar with no chips and no napkins, only what are given with your order. I got there just in time for the 5 PM specials and an empty parking lot. AT 5 it began to fill up. While in line it was "specials all around with water for a beverage."

The food was wholesome and served in a timely manner and the price for the special was reasonable and the portion more than I could eat.  But I was never the less disappointed. 

Many better places to choose from, I won't be going back.
Keep coming back for those shrimp tacos ! Yum Yum , to bad I am only here for half a yr.

Let me start by saying that I am a very very picky customer. That may be a good thing or a bad thing. Good for me but bad for the specialist I suppose lol. I like things done right and well if I could do it myself, I would but of course that isn't realistic. So once I find someone that does something right I stick to them like glue. Anyways, when I moved out here 4 years ago I was looking for someone to tattoo my eyebrows. I like to retouch them at least once a year. When I first moved out here I got them done with someone, and well I wasn't happy to say the least. Now 3 years ago I found Joanna. I saw her work and I was really impressed. I booked an appt with her and I came to find out that she didn't do the tattoos with a normal tattoo gun like I was used to. She used a pen with a needle (not sure what it's called). It was all done free hand (TALENT). When it was finally done, I looked in the mirror and my eyebrows looked AMAZING! I was so happy :D and now every time I need a touch up she's the only one I will go to. Her work is really incredible. I refer everyone to her that's looking to have any permanent make up done. She listens and does my eyebrows perfectly how I like them. Like I said I'm very picky, but she's always very nice and patient with me and I couldn't be happier. Her staff is also amazing, always very polite and courteous and they make me feel welcomed as soon as I walk through the door. I'm very happy with Delight Day Spa and I will definitely recommend this spa to everyone. Thank you Joanna and staff! :D

Great atmosphere, great entertainment, wonderful service, and Great Italian food all six of us were very pleased with everything. Would highly recommend this restaurant to all! But most important great place to spend with your friends!

Just shopped at this location, I did not enjoy my store visit. May i suggest that on Senior Discount Day, you ensure ALL self scans are functioning. Also, when the self scans are backed up, have a sign up directing customers to stand. I was chastised by another customer for standing in a line for the scanners to the right. She was in a line to the left. She then felt the need to tattle tail to the selfcheck cashier. The cashier rudely told my husband and I that we had to moved to to the end of another line which would have put us behind several people that had just got in line. Another customer jumped to our defense. I told the cashier they should put up a sign indicating where to line up. She retorted, this doesnt happen that often. I pointed out there was a out of service selfscan and she ignored me. No apology for the inconvenience. Just scolded for their error.

Ive had epilepsy since birth. Was brought in by ambulance w/seizures, after another banner dr gave me a quick dose of a drug that's contraindicated for patients w/seizures. Banner prides themselves on having all your records in their system, so any dr can quickly access them. This is B.S.  When I arrived at the ER, I couldn't speak and my husband wasn't there yet. The nurse and dr did not bother to look at my records or call my neuro or husband. Since I was seizing and thin at the time, they assumed I must be on drugs and accused me of being on cocaine. Since this was their assumption, it was okay for them to yell at me as I lay defenseless in a bed with no way to communicate. When I started seizing again, they had 3 others pin me down, while one sat on top my lower body. I'm 5ft, 100 pounds. As my blood pressure and oxygen dropped to a dangerous level, the nurse and dr yelled at me to breath. When this didn't work, they finally put an oxygen mask on me. They were certain about their cocaine assumption until my husband showed up and told them my condition and to look at my records. Then, they were quiet. My husband quickly had me discharged and upon leaving, the idiot nurse gave me educational pamphlets on epilepsy. Really?!  Shouldn't she and all others involved be reading these?  I seized for the next 24 hours at home from the drugs they gave me.  The place is a death trap. I hope everyone who works there, has a similar personal experience someday.  They are all uneducated, careless and worthless.  It hurts me to think about those patients who go in there alone, without anyone by their side.
Just good food. The half size carne asada fries is so good and can feed a large individual.

This place was ok, I would give it 2.5 stars. I bought a living social deal for this place. I liked how their system was all computer based and they emailed me reminders and I could change it online. The living social deal seemed like a good deal but I don't think I got very much of a treatment out of it. The people were all very nice and friendly. I enjoyed talking with the girl who did my facial.

Now why the 2 stars? Well, the place itself is a little long in the tooth but I don't really care too much about that if the service is good. I wish that I had read the review before about the eye brow wax. The same thing happened to me. She spent a ton of time doing my brows, and I thought these have to be good. She also did provide a mirror at the end, so when I got in my car I was shocked. My eyebrows were sooo thin, and there was a part that was so thin, it was pretty much bald. So now I am having to fill my eyebrows in everyday. It is very frustrating. They are starting to grow back, but it isnt pretty since I have to let it all fill in. Another part that irked me was that the facial did not include extractions, so she said it was an additional charge. The charge was 15 dollars, that just seems like way too much money for extractions, so with that, the deal really wasnt that great. 

If you do like this place or want to go, they will still give you the same price for a living social deal even if you do not have a deal, you just need to ask. 

So all in all, I have just experienced better places with better results so I will not be going back.

Clean, friendly service, food is awesome.  This location opened a few weeks ago and has been packed ever since.  Food has a lot of flavor and everyone I know who has eaten here loves it and comes back for more.
If you want a quick car wash this is ideal but my idea if you really wanted to really stand out and do it yourself
Great food!!! Had some really delicious chilaquiles that taste just like home : ) definitely coming back as often as I can. Great staff as well!

Customer service sucks.  I ordered a to-go create-your own burrito.  When I got home, I found out the cashier rang up my order incorrectly.  I went back and tried to have my burrito replaced but the cashier accused me of putting in the wrong order instead of offering to rectify the situation.  I do not recommend this place.

This is by far the worst car wash experience I've ever had. They staff doesn't seem to know what they are doing. I understand it's the opening week, but I've been to multiple car wash openings for the free car washes and this place is just EXTREMELY slow. The first time around the machine did even wash my car so they had me go back in line and wait another 10 minutes. Now the machine didn't even wash my car all that well at all. I still had lots of stains on my car. The dryers also didn't work all that well to even dry it in this 100 plus degree weather. I'm comparing this car wash to the multiple other places I've been too and this is the bottom of the totem pole. I would not recommend this place at all!

Went on a Saturday night. I'm originally from an area where there's an authentic Italian restaurant everywhere, so I have high expectations, I guess. The place was totally packed--standing room only. 

People were really dressed up with panty hose, heels, dresses, leisure suits, etc. I later realized it was because they were there to dance.

The food was good, but not great. I liked the flavors but my eggplant Parmesan was a little crispy on the inside and a soft on the outside (breading). :( It' s not an easy dish to cook.  My husband didn't really like his meal--can't remember what he ordered.

Our white wine was warm. The cassata cake was delicious, and I may sneak back sometime for a quick slice.

There was a talented local band that played country-western music. (I think that's the genre--I have never heard any of those songs before so I may be wrong.) It seemed like the place was packed with seniors waiting for the band to start, because they pounced on the dance floor the second the music started. The dance floor was packed. They were ballroom dancing to this country-western music--no matter what the song or speed, they had a ballroom dance for it. I have personally never seen anything like that before--I come from a generation that didn't do much partner dancing, and I have never seen people dance to this particular music. It was cute and they seemed to be really, really enjoying themselves. (However, not the NY Italian experience I was hoping for.)

Husband wanted to try out, it was oh so good! We both had the Diablo Shrimp Burrito, and let me say it will not disappoint you! Has a nice little salsa bar, free refills, and a cozy small lobby! Can't wait to be back!

I had a very difficult time with Money Gram which is located in the pharmacy.  It took 2 days to complete a transaction. 
Rueben was amazing. He helped me through the complicated process which unfortunately involved people from Money Gram who were very difficult to understand because of their language barrier. He stayed calm and was very supportive throughout the process. He is the shift manager and is excellent in customer service and patience.
Mark, who also is an employee at that store, gave Rueben the assistance and patience to assist me, the customer, who was very frustrated with the Money Gram process.
Thank you to Rueben and Mark.

This place has some of the best beef Taco's I've ever had. The inside is always clean, the staff is very friendly. For the most part the food is served pretty quickly which is okay since you want to make sure it is cooked all the way. We go here at least once or twice a week. If you haven't been you should try it.

Not a bad store. Get here early or go late! You'll be amazed at how many walkers and canes occupy the aisles of this place, watch your toes when a electric cart comes down too, they're ruthless!!! Meat counter has no ticket dispenser so if it's crowded you'll be all thrown off. Nice selection of beer and liquor here as well, beer is my main beverage of choice so I know that aisle well

Brother in Outpatient, surgery delayed by an hour and did not give people waiting the news that it was delayed.  Left a phone number to be called and never was notified that he would not be coming out of his anesthesia right away, but hours later.  No doctor or nurse came out until I called several times and finally someone came out and told my husband (who had been waiting for 4 hours) that there was a problem and they needed to get the doctor back to do something.

I scheduled 2 facials and 2 massages a week in advance as I was having company and we were going to have a ladies day out.  We arrived 15 min early for our 1000 appts, no one was there when we arrived.  I called but wasn't impressed with the response.  I felt bad when one gal showed up at 1005 to learn we had appointments, she said she hadn't been told.  We ended up restructuring the rest of our day hoping to still have our services.  We exchanged a few calls as she said she would try to find someone. We did not get our services and I will not go back nor recommend anyone else go there.

Best ER that I've ever been to. They were quick, friendly and thorough. Larry my nurse was so nice, made jokes and was always there to answer my questions and keep me informed. Stephen my Ultrasound Tech was awesome too.

Minus 1 star because when I called back to get my test results (which I was told by the dr. to do) the lady was extremely rude. I had to wait to get my medical records to find out my results. Please don't work with sick people if you lack compassion!

Furrs buffet is kind of a weird buffet because you walk along a cafeteria line and they serve you along the way ,The food they serve you is really good and changes daily the desserts are self serve and amazingly good I love pecan pie and theirs was the best i have ever had.I am going to put Furrs on my top ten list, 9 or 10 but but they will be there.

My husband son and myself loves senor taco and we come pretty far to get it but the website information is not accurate my husband went there last night at 9 arrived around 9:30 because we thought we still had time to get food but it was closed I don't know if that's because of the holiday or what but their website says 10:00 closing time. It's just a little disappointing because we love this place but it be nice to have accurate information.

Love using and supporting local family-owned businesses... King Automotive Repair
has a friendly and courteous atmosphere, they treat you like family and not like the redheaded step child other shops make you feel like. Dan and Doug operate the most honest and sincere shop you'll find and its the only place I take my vehicle. I always recommend King Automotive Repair when someone is looking for an auto repair shop or any work to be done on their vehicle.

We have been very disappointed private  we have been very disappointed with this company. We were told we would be able to exchange steaks that were well below par with a new product. Even though he promised he would  call us back he never has.   We have left repeated messages with absolutely no response. I would never recommend him to anyone.   Janice and Jerry Oeswein

Clean store with friendly employees. I've had several pizza's from here & all have been very good. Their delivery service is excellent as well. They use quality ingredients on my pizza's which is very important to me. The fantastic prices I can order a pizza & not break the bank.
I always go grocery shopping with my girlfriends at this store. Produce is fresh and prices are great. Plus, I get Fuel Points for gas. Every cashier I have gone to seemed to be in a good mood.

Please drain the meat before it goes into the flour shell bowl. I had to go home and pour a lot of water-like juice out of it and the bowl was very very soggy. 
Giving you 4 stars because everything else is good.

I've been going to Dan and Doug for years and followed them to King Automotive Repair.  It is very hard to find an auto shop that one can trust and I definitely found that with Dan and Doug.  I would recommend King Automotive Repair to anyone looking for a reliable, honest auto repair shop.

I had a carne asada burrito and kid had carne asada with red chile and wet burro style. Meat tasted good but burro was little skinny on meat content and lots of tortilla bites. $17 for just two burro and waters bit too pricey. It wasn't all that different than any other burro joints.
Best ever! the most honest auto repair shop I have ever been too. I would trust them over anyone else.

I like this place.   Clean.  Affordable.  Good fast food.   If I was giving a suggestion for improvement I'd add something cool, light, sweet and soothing as a desert for after the spicy Mexican food:  either soft serve ice cream or yogurt.   The deserts they have seem heavy.    But apart from that this is a good place.

Went to this place by myself. about 7:30 on a Wednesday night. Stood at the lectern that says "wait to be seated" for about 10 minutes. No help whatsoever, even the owner walked by without acknowledging me. Finally took a seat at the bar and asked another patron what the deal was to get seated. He said that the lady that does that has the night off. Okay. I finally got the bartenders attention and asked for a table. She was of no use so I just ordered carry out from the bar. I had the chicken marsala and it was horrible right down to the canned mushrooms on it. Could have used an axe to cut the chicken it was so tough. Needless to say I have had way, way better chicken marsala.
Not one of my better restaurant experiences.

I ordered a burrito with chorizo, potatoes, cheese and with no egg! I was very specific when I made this order. Being Hispanic I ordered it in Spanish. They still got my order wrong. The burrito came with egg and potatoes only. 

The upsetting part was the ticket was correct. The cook in the back doesn't give a dam about what you want in the food. 

The funny part is that you can add language barrier, but when the orders are made with perfect Spanish there is no excuses. 

Fist and last time I will purchase any food from this place.

My wife took me to the ER here early this morning. I was in horrible pain due to muscle cramping of my chest, stomach and especially back. I could not even stand up straight at the check in, where there was no chair to sit nor any concern by the staff that I was in pain at all. I was checked in with no privacy as the area is just a few feet from the waiting area. This is unacceptable.
The nurse, Jessica, that helped me was really good, but the PA, Sarah, that eventually saw me was rude, uncaring, and didn't even go through the motions of doing any kind of physical exam. She just simply said that the blood work had come back normal and made me feel badly for even coming to the ER rather than go my PCP. My Dr is not available on Saturday that's why I came HERE. I was given a Valium and sent home.  I am still in the same amount of pain as when I got up this morning but am $100 poorer though, since that was my co-pay for this joke called an ER.

I had surgery here (8/31)which went well; OR staff was great. Then went to room 341 where it went down hill fast.  Nobody checked on me, I kept asking for water and did not get it. I was just back to my room, had an IV in each arm, oxygen on and a catheter; barely awake. A woman came into my room to say that they had miscalculated my out of pocket and she needed to collect $2602. (I had paid the amount the ask prior to my admission)... I told her that I had no money or even a wallet I just came from surgery.  When I was more a wake, I thought "this woman was trying to get my credit card knowing I was still sedated."  I told the nurse which went nowhere.  I am an RN. I have worked post surgery. These people never came in the room. I was put on an automatic B/P machine and they left. I could  hear them talking and laughing but could not get water!  Finally after about an hour some women came in with a Styrofoam coffee cup with water. I said "finally my mouth is so dry." She responded "don't grip. I am just doing a favor." Whatever that meant!  They never checked my abdominal dressing or did an assessment. Respiratory came in and set a piece of equipment down (incentive spirometer) and just said "use this when you are more awake." I never saw her again.  I thought to myself, "what about those who did not know what this was." She did not know I was a nurse and did not care if I knew how to use it.  Finally at 4 PM, this nurse came in and sat down. I was upset and told her that I could not believe nobody checked on fresh post op patients. She replied, "I looked in at you but you were sleeping." Not true! I was miserable! I was so thirsty and had had nothing for pain!  Later in the day I was told by this nurse, "you might want to order something. I sent your dinner order down late and I do not know if they will send anything." I have to have a special diet so it is difficult to just order something. They finally sent a piece of boiled chicken and a spoonful of rice. disgusting!  My daughter brought me food and bottled water in a cooler.   That night, I again was having bad pain. I was told that I could not have an injection (I had had abdominal surgery less than 12 hours before)  because I was to go home the next day. I was given one pain pill. Had a horrible, painful, sleepless night. Lab came in to draw blood at 3:42 AM... at 6 AM, I finally was given one more pill for pain. I hurt so bad but when the day nurse finally came in a 9:10 AM, he said that it was too soon to have anything else.  Horrible place and experience. I went here because my surgeon is used to working here. Next time, I will just say "'sorry I am going somewhere else". Even if it means finding another doctor.

CARNE ASADA fries. Amazing!  I hope this place lasts. Horrible Del Webb sign blocks the entire location as you are heading west on Bell road. The sign has been an eye sore forever. 
Every taco place that opens here doesn't survive.   I hope this one does.
I LOVE the play on words "senor" taco in Sun City. Hehe and to pull up and see a row of gold carts...just makes me giggle.  My mum loves this place. So I am sure I will be picking up for her again.

I came inside to order. As this was my first time here, I decided to go in so any questions I may have could be answered. I asked "what is the size difference between a small or large order of the carne asada fries?" Gesturing with my hands so I could visualize how large an order would be---to determine how much food each would include. The worker replied, "the difference is one's small and the other is large". No kidding. I guess I can't expect people working here to be geniuses, but this guy wasn't all there and was rude and not helpful. 

I just went with a large size and it was nearly 12 dollars. Way too much food and too expensive for one person. He could have said that the small is enough food for one person vs the large is enough for 20 people!!!!! I also came at 11 when no one was in line or inside. It took my one item 20+ minutes because they served the drive thru first. Wasted my money. Don't recommend

What a great group of guys!!  My AC stopped working in June (ugh!) and they had me fixed up in no time and for a great price.  Very knowledgeable and honest, took the time to explain everything and gave me my options.  I won't take my car anywhere else.

Here is my opinion of this hospital:  The only reason I even gave this hospital 2 stars is that it would be a great place for someone that wants to be tested for every ailment possible.  Also, if you for sure want to have surgery it's the perfect place. They especially love to find any way possible to remove your gallbladder. I know all the tests they do are a cover for possible lawsuits but it makes them seem like they are just digging for surgery gold.  The doctors are probably competent and the nurses are nice but, there is nothing that would change my mind about this hospital and I would not let a loved one go there.

This is my store for drugs. Sometimes there is a line and sometimes not, after all this is Sun City .Some one always calls out Hello! when you come in and it is good to be acknowledged. I try not to shop around too much, but darn it all, they have some pretty neat stuff.
