This was the worst pizza I've ever had. It was barely worm. Like an idiot I gave the driver a good tip. The cinnamon twists were delicious. So it wasn't all bad.
I like this CVS. It's big, clean and everyone is very friendly. Watch out for oldies!

where do i start well first off we had reservations and when we showed up the hostess wanted to make sure that we were out by 8 since they had live music and i guess they weren't much of a fan at the idea of kids being there. 
i decided to order the spaghetti with sweet italian sausage or so i thought. the sausage was so over cooked it looked almost like slim jim beef sticks in my pasta. the wine selection was very lacking i decided to get their most expensive bottle of wine which came in at 21 dollars and tasted watered down.

Went to this CVS specially to but passport photos. The gentlemen who took the photos was extremely nice and great to deal with. From that point on dealing with a women cashier and the lady manager was a nightmare to work with.
I pulled up the information for CVS passport photos it stated that purchasing 2 passport photos the cost was 10.99 and if you had their 2.00 coupon it would make the photos 8.99. Read them the information from phone and then  showed the manager the information but that was not good enough for her , so I said forget don't need to purchase from here. Felt like I was being treated like a thief . Will not shop  from this CVS and maybe not at any other CVS.  
Will spread the word of treatment received

They were doing well, but this pizza I got today was like Dominos used to be, ordered large sausage and pepperoni with extra cheese. It had less cheese, there were pockets in Pizza with no cheese,two of them. Extremely dissatisfied, it will be a cold day in hell before l come back! Should of actually rated it a minus Star!  ED

I'm a picky eater with almost all my foods, I just wanted a bean beef and cheese burrito. My girlfriend asked if there's onions and peppers in it the girl at the register assured us that there was not. My burrito was ordered and my girlfriend had ordered a carne asada burrito and we left. 

After arriving home I open the box and there's a few soggy chips in there, I take a bite and it's riddled with peppers and onions. After a 4 hour drive home, and stopping for a quick food pickup on my way the last thing I wanted to do was get in my car and go back so I tried picking it all out, I soon gave up. My girlfriend was far from impressed by her burrito too.  

So I think with this being a $16 waste of money that makes us one time customers. Unfortunately.

Love this place! Found about about this shop through one of my buddies and stopped in when I had problems with my ac and had them check it. They got my ac working again quick and blowing ice cold. Had another problem with the car vibrating while driving, took it to them to diagnose it and found it only needed some hub rings, I'm really pleased at how quickly this place works and is actually one of few shops I've ever been to that are honest and don't twist your arm for cash or give ridiculous prices. This is my go to place from here on out.

I will have to give this dentist a 1 star because I had a filling fall out three times.  This is excessive and incompetent.  Also, they try to cover up their incompetencies by making excuses for themselves.  They said that they were trying to save me money.  Hah!  I was hurt and this is another issue.

Really put off by them! Standing in line behind a very elderly couple that had a gift card with only $.96  left on it. They wanted a candy bar that was $1.99. The cashier tried to tell them that they owed $1.03. They couldn't hear or understand. No sympathy there! I said I would pay for it,but cashier the cashier saidshe'd already voided it and turned them away. I picked it up and followed them and gave it to them, then went back and paid for it. I know they can't buy stuff for everyone, but how often does that happen? Come on. Have a little empathy for others.

I went about a week ago.  I enjoyed a very pleasant evening.  I have a service dog and she is small breed so sometimes I get some unpleasantries when I go out with her.   Dominics was fantastic.  I don't remember my servers name but she was a young blonde girl.  She was friendly but not over the top.  Her service was very efficient, and I would be happy to have her again.

I ordered the tom moz appetizer.  It was excellent.  Often I think the sauce is too sweet on these meals.  This one however was perfect.

My chicken Alfredo was very good.  However, re-heated the next day it was out of this world.  Next time I go I might order one for carryout for the purpose of eating it the next day.  

I got the highly reviewed Cassada cake.  It was good and I might order it again but the  dinner food was outstanding and made it dull a bit by comparison.  

A few people from a large group slow danced on the dance floor, which was very cute.  

I only recommendation would be to offer a few more wines, given that this is an italian restaurant.  I understand wanting to keep it fresh but even if they were available only by the bottle a better selection would be welcome.  On the flip side I did love they have spirt offerings as well.  This made up for my disappointment over the wine.

I received a note that I could email the guy responding to my review. I also received a survey in the meantime which I pasted the same comments.  I then received an email from .Hugo M.
Patient Relations Representative Banner Corporate Center Mesa.. as follow: " Our goal is to provide an exceptional patient experience, and I am disappointed to hear that your visit to our Surgical Department at Banner Boswell Medical Center was not a positive one. We value the comments and would like to learn more about what happened and how we can address. If you would like to call me to discuss your comments further, I may be reached at 623-832-6657.  Our office hours are Monday through Friday, 7:30am - 4:30 pm. "

I wasn't going to call but then decided that if speaking with him prevented somebody else from getting the lack of care I received; it would be worth the call. I called the next day. A woman answered who knew nothing about me or my survey, ask numerous irrelevant questions and then told me that Hugo M.  "is in a meeting."  I ask to leave my name and number letting her know that he emailed me about my survey responses. She took my info saying "he will return your call."  That was a week ago.  I am assuming he really did not care to "learn more about what happened."
This store is a mile away from where I live good place to go to when I need to get something in case of emergency.The store is clean and organized and the sales associate is friendly.

It might just be a pharmacy chain, but I am 1500 miles from the Rite - Aid I go to. My RX needed refilled on a Friday night (about 730-800) & I came here.
At 1st the woman in the pharmacy department said she didn't know if they could get it transferred,  it would probably take 24 hours.  
Umm no good, I needed it that evening.  She consulted the older man in the back, busy on a computer.  Not only did he call the Washington store, he got it transferred and filled it...within about 30 minutes. .. While my little girl and I were at the store.  
I appreciate him going the extra mile to get the job done, on a Friday night.

I had a package delivered to the wrong house on the wrong street. The Sheriff Deputy was doing a vacant summer house  inspection and noticed the package and that  it was addressed tome on a different street. He said if he had not seen it it would have stayed until September..
today I get 6 pieces of mail addressed to someone else and with a different address than mine. .  What  is going on? What incompetence!

When I took my truck to Midas Tony listen to my problem and reissued me that he would check everything out. Tony informed me on each step of the way. Tony took the initiative to double check his work and he explained to me what needed to be repaired and the cost. The work was completed as he promised. Tony and his staff are very friendly and professional. They all made me feel as part of the staff. Highly recommend Midas for all Auto repair. I will be taking my wife car there for her repairs.  Midas is forever garage.

I've went to this place originally to get my brakes done since I've used midas in the past and have the lifetime brakes, worst decision ever! While there I asked the owner Tony about getting my ac repaired, he said they can fix it. I had them look at it to tell me what was wrong and he said it would be around $140 to get the ac fixed, the ac worked for about a month! After taking my car to this place 3 or 4 times and then trying to charge me for something new each time, I just parked the car and let it sit. 

Eventually I ended taking the car to the midas in Peoria, the ran the tests on the ac and showed me exactly where it was leaking from! The funny thing is the leak was at the very top of the engine, in plain site when you open the hood. The Peoria midas fixed the ac free of charge because of what this midas didn't do. Now about the brakes, while driving if I hit the brakes (I know, crazy idea to use your brakes while driving) the steering wheel would shake violently. This is after Tony and his con men "repaired" the brakes! 

The midas in Peoria took my tire off and I could see as clear as day a spot on the rotor that was darker than the rest of the rotor, he explained it was a high spot and that's what was causing the shaking. Since I paid Tony and his henchmen to fix my brakes (they should be able to at least do brakes, right?) and the receipt clearly shows I was charged for "turning the rotors" I didn't expect for them to not even repair the brakes either! After spending a few hundred dollars and time wasted, they did nothing to fix my car! 

They even tried to change the labor fee to make me pay for bringing my car back to fix what should've been done the very first time I took my car to this place! They only took my money, they didn't do any actual work to fix any of the issues that they were paid to fix! I will be contacting the corporate office next...

it's hit or miss. I expect the food to be good every time not every other visit. sometimes it's nice and hot other times it's cold. never consistent. We gave up on their food. the star is mistake. I give it no star

This drive through is better then most, they make the beans with lard and it tastes...feels authentic-ish. I'm told it's not by Mexican food snobs who have sweet little Mexican grandmothers "who make it better".
Great dental office. They accept care credit which allows you to make payments. Got me in same day and did treatment :)  friendly staff and open late on Tuesdays with 2 great locations.

This was the last night of my six day birthday celebration!  I could not have been more happy to spend an evening here with such good friends!  We couldn't have asked for a better venue and the food was soooo good!  Two of my four dining companians had the sausage and peppers and both of them raved about it.  They both like some heat so I assume there was heat for the taking.

The other two of us  of ordered Chicken Marsala and Chicken Piccata.  I know we both scraped our plates clean!!  Plus the bread is so good!

The wait staff was really good too.  And they took about 8 pictures of us to get one that we all looked good in.  

The music started at about 8:15  That's when the great people watching starts, which I love.   

What can I say?  The food us really 4 stars.- the waitstaff it incredible and  if you dance or not - it's fun to stay for the dance-floor show!!
Excellent care at SW Eye in Sun City.  Dr. Patel is thorough and explains everything.

This place is one my new favorites. Diamond in the rough! My husband and I visit here often. There is a great special we get every time. Three rolled tacos and quesadilla for $5. Such a great deal! The three rolled tacos come with a huge pile of guacamole on top! And the quesadilla is giant! Great deal and tastes excellent. Last time we went we got the tostada and taco combo. Rice and beans were so authentic and yummy! The chicken in the taco had great seasoning and flavor. I can't wait to go there again! The staff was so friendly. The food was ready fast! Restaurant was very clean! It's a must try! You'll go back for sure!

Good fresh Mexican food. Not at all like Taco Bell. Real cheese, fresh guacamole, great salsa. I had lunch here three times and really enjoyed it. The service is quick and pleasant. They answered all my questions and helped me choose my items. The rolled tacos are my favorite. They even have a drive through window!

While visiting my dad over the holiday weekend, I became very ill with extreme vomiting and diarrhea.  My partner called a few urgent cares, but none of them administered IV's. After 6 hours of feeling miserable, we came upon this hospital which was only a couple of miles away. From the moment we walked in we were taken care of. The registration person was kind, as was the triage nurse. Twenty minutes later I was taken to my exam room and James, my nurse was personable, kind and got my labs and IV catheter in immediately. Lori, the PA was also warm, professional and caring. Heck even the registration gal Yolonda was nice. I think the only issue that I had was when I saw that they'd done a pregnancy test without asking(not at all necessary in my case) and it would've been nice to know what labs were being ran and why.

I will say with over 20 years in healthcare, the people I encountered on that night were professional, compassionate and extremely good at what they do.

My husband son and myself loves senor taco and we come pretty far to get it but the website information is not accurate my husband went there last night at 9 arrived around 9:30 because we thought we still had time to get food but it was closed I don't know if that's because of the holiday or what but their website says 10:00 closing time. It's just a little disappointing because we love this place but it be nice to have accurate information.

Purchased a Groupon for a facial, hydrating mask and 20 minute massage. At first appearance, the place didn't look that great. Upon entering, it was clear that the outside appearance wasn't in deceit. There was some pop radio station playing with not so appropriate music and the front desk girl didn't seem enthusiastic or friendly at all. The front desk girl left and locked the door behind her, since the only employee left in the building would be doing my facial. The girl that did my facial wasn't friendly or pleasant either. The room for facials didn't look very clean and I was glad the lights were dimmed in order for me not to notice anything more than I already had. During the facial the girl put on some relaxing tunes, but there was a ticking clock on the wall and I could still hear the music coming from the front desk area. Then, some new employees must've entered because I heard a lot of loud banging. The facial was relaxing for the most part, but I was confused because I never received a 20 minute massage. I did get a face massage, but it was only for like 5 mins. After I was done, I decided to take a peek at the products and I was disappointed to see things I could buy at Wal-Mart and Sally's. When I went to use the restroom, it was in an area that seemed to still be under construction. I wouldn't recommend this place and I won't be going back. Needs better staff, a makeover and quality products for a start. Good parking, though. ;-)

The staff here is so patient and also very courteous! The service they provided to me and my partner was excellent! I felt very comfortable being at the dentist and the service was very through along with gentle! Dr. Cho explained everything in clear language that I understood! I've had bad luck with finding a good fit with dental offices and this one is it! I scheduled an appointment within days from my initial call and the hours of operation whe and are convenient! 
Your office is Awesome! Thank you!!!

Great food, wonderful people, live music is soo fun even if you are just people watching.  Love the decor, my grandfather was a huge Sinatra fan so looove all the Sinatra pics! The bread is fabulous!! Pizza and wings are amazing!! Best bleu cheese ive ever had!
Nice enough and clean enough store. However, went in for shoelaces, to make my 3 year old a practice board. Bought her a juice, get to car and see it expired in May :( yuk.

Employee safety
As I was checking out, a female employee walked up to a manager who was on the register directly behind me checking customers out. The employee was obviously upset and tried to tell the manager that there was a customer at the customer support desk harassing her and following her and would not leave her alone. The manager immediately got frustrated and annoyed that the employee was interrupting him. With a stressed and unpleasant voice he told her that he was on a register right now and dismissed her. TAKE CARE OF YOUR EMPLOYEES!!! This woman was upset and scared. Do something! Get on a radio and call someone to help her or better yet, man up, get someone to cover your register and go take care of the problem. Thankfully, one of the female managers who seemed to be more of a man and manager than the he was took care of the problem. I will not shop at a store where a manager refuses to take care of an employee's safety.

This store is a hidden gem! It's jam packed with so much stuff. I work close by and my manager recommended it, because she had used to to get last minute party stuff for a anniversary party we had. There is like six isles of party stuff and the walls are covered. Not to mention like three isles of decent teacher stuff. I didn't look for anything else I was trying to stay focused. But the only thing I will say is that it is in Sun City territory so it's dead quiet and the other customers might be ancient. If your not impatient you will enjoy your shopping there.

Someone needs to seriously rethink this post office. Went in late one night to drop off about 15 parcels. It was 10 minutes out of my way but the usual post office I went to had a full parcel drop off. Got here and while they have two letter boxes hey have no after hours parcel drop off. Let's think about this. It's a small office. They could probably do away with one of the letter boxes in favor of a parcel one. Seriously... whoever runs this place could use some common sense.

I have been here so many times I don't know if I should be embarrassed or proud, this place is definitely one of my guilty pleasures. They have amazing afternoon prices, I believe after 3pm and if you work at one of the near by dealerships they give you a discount. You have to try their spicy oil on basically anything you order, it's a staple!

This place is absolute shit. Came in with a positive mindset and happy to get some pizza and looks like this location hired a bunch of people with bad attitudes. Wouldn't recommend this location to anyone, in fact I'll probably never go to Domino's again. Worst experience ever.

Love it's tadtw and practical price. Then original Coke is great with  Mex food.
The kuds plate was more than enough .. Do we always have to write a long review?
Tip: Try the the california surfing. Service is great and at affordable prices.

Potential new employees!  Watch out!!!!  This hospital has awful upper management and they embellish, lie, twist the truth and make false fabrications on their employees whom they want to terminate.  Loyal employees of 8 years, 15 years, 21 years, 37 years have all become victoms and pushed out!!!  No one is immune.  Watch out for Diane Jennings Medical / Surgical Director, she smiles in your face, stabs you in the back and directs Senior Managers who to write up and what to say!!!

Tony the manager of Midas auto repair Sun City went above and beyond the call of duty. Not only did he backup is warranty at no charge to us ,an employee's wife delivered parts over 150 miles to Flagstaff. Although we had not planned on Tuesdays stay in Flagstaff we enjoyed the scene in Sedona very much . thank you so much Tony for your wonderful service. signed ,the Larsons
I was contacted by the owner.. Nice touch that included a gift card! Woohoo! The owner understands the value of customers .. We pay the bills!!

If you value your life, don't go to Banner Boswell.  My husband was told to go to the ER by his doctor's office.  He arrived at Boswell around 10 a.m.  He is diabetic and has heart and high blood pressure problems.  When I arrived at 2 in the afternoon, his blood pressure was 177/87, and he had not been offered anything to eat. I told the staff that he needed his afternoon blood pressure meds.  They said I had to wait for the doctor.  The doctor came and examined him and ordered a nitroglycerine patch and left.  An hour later, he had still not received blood pressure medication and his blood pressure was still alarmingly elevated.  I talked to the nurse who told me that the doctor hadn't ordered any medication as he was afraid that with the nitro it would lower his blood pressure too low.  I had to leave at 4 p.m. for a doctor's appointment.  My husband called me at 6:45 p.m. to say that he had been given a room.  His blood pressure was still sky high; he had still not been offered food or blood pressure lowering meds.  I talked to him several more times trying to calm him down.  At 9:30 p.m. he still hadn't received medication or food.   The next morning when I went to visit, they had him on a sodium chloride drip.  I don't understand why they would be giving sodium when his blood pressure often shoots up to over 200.  He could have been given water to drink if he was dehydrated.    We will never go to this hospital again

For over 20 years I had avoided a dentists office! That is until I had unbearable tooth pain and was referred to Dr. Gerard by a coworker. After I had explained my fear/concerns, Dr. Gerard made me feel so at ease that I was able to have 3 teeth pulled without being put under!That was a HUGE accomplishment to get to for me! Now two years later, I am seeing him and his staff on a regular basis for cleanings, replacing old broken fillings, and even completing a much needed crown or two! Everyone in is office is so warm and welcoming that now I actually look forward to my dental appointments ! Big thanks to everyone at Arizona Dental (both offices) for being the BEST !!!!!

Look'in to get my little Camero SS cleaned up.  Stop here.  Free vacs.  Work'in on my vehicle and along comes Antione.  "You want this to look brand new?  Let me show you what we do here".  Antione shows me the menu, prices, and recommends the best, of course, and guarantees I'll be happy.  OMG!  Was Antione ever right.  I love this fine establishment, and Antione too!

What a delightful find! Not only was the environment welcoming and super friendly, but the food was out of this world! Debbie, the manager / owner made a point of coming to the table and introducing herself and giving us a little background on the history of the restaurant. I enjoyed the manicotti, while my boyfriend enjoyed the meatball sandwich. He's Italian, so when and Italian man says the food reminds him of his mother's cooking, you know it's good! Will definitely be going back to sample other items on the menu. Thank you Debbie, and all the staff for a great dining experience!

*UPDATE: I got sick from the tacos and it was a crappy experience all last light - literally. :( I feel like my body was hit by a freight train, and still does this morning. Had to call out of work, and I had chills in my body all night including pain. Wow. Never going there again. They need to step up their game.

So I really love Senor Taco, but this location was a miss for this first visit. I've been to two other more popular and busy locations across Phoenix that open till 2 am and the food there was much more noticeably fresher than this location, including the salsa bars. I don't blame them, from what I understand this location tends to be slower, and it was towards the end of their night shift - 10 pm. I was super excited to share my favorite "taco" place, but was disappointed by the fish being dry, along with the corn tortillas. The salsa bar here I could tell by the end of the night had been sitting there for a long while, being dry along the edges. Nonetheless, it was still "good". Just not the killer good I am used to at the other locations. I feel bad for this location, as it has potential. I also learned a bad taco place used to be here before they took ownership, so maybe that affected the business - from others who remember the old place and prefer not to give this new place a try? I don't know. I look forward to eating at the other locations in which I had always been blown away by each and every time. I was hoping tonight would have been one of those times. Not sure if I will try this location again. It was rather small compared to the other ones I've been to also. Portions seemed the same by the way. Just not as noticeably fresh. For such a great price, I suppose I can't complain.

Not sure I am a fan, but it was nice to have food delivered so I did not have to venture out into the 114 degree heat here in Sun City, AZ.  

Ours was a small order as eating a low-sodium diet is our challenge right now.  It was hard to find items low in sodium, but it all worked out for this time.  Would love to see "broiled or broasted chicken" placed on the menu at some point.  

Was impressed by the timely delivery.  Cost was reasonable except the $2.79 for a 2-liter bottle of Sprite -- that was a bit high.  But, again, I didn't have to venture out into the heat, so I won't complain.  After all, I could have elected not to order it.  

The thin crust, gluten-free, with veggies was at 380mg sodium for a 1/8 section of a medium sized pizza.  The gluten-free crust is made with Water, Modified Rice Starch, Rice Flour, Brown Rice Flour, Potato Starch, Olive Oil, Potato Flour, Evaporated Cane Sugar, Fresh Yeast, Honey, Avicel, Salt, Calcium Propionate. There was no way to leave out the salt in the crust, so a 1/8 section was all that could be consumed, which is okay because we had prepared a nice home salad and raw pasta cooked in water flavored with extra virgin olive oil.  

Made for an okay meal.  

I do, however, plan to visit the shop on 99th Avenue in person, before I order again.  I want to speak with the manager and see if there are any suggestions for getting the sodium level even lower on our next home delivery order.  Also like to see what type of environment our food is coming from.  

Hope this review is helpful to others that are having special diet concerns, but don't care to venture out into the extreme heat in the Phoenix area.

I stopped by for a quick lunch today, but I am NEVER going back there!!! I ordered the two soft tacos pictured on their menu (one fish and one carnitas). Halfway through the fish taco I bit into something hard...and big and long!!! (I think the smaller, hard stringy thing in the first part of the taco that I ate around was connected to it.) I HAVE NO IDEA WHAT THIS WAS! It wasn't like a kitchen utensil, it was more like a flat piece of backbone from a chicken. Before they gave me my money back, they poked around on it with a plastic fork and decided they didn't know what it was.

I'm glad I didn't have to eat the carnitas, they looked stringy and HARD and weird.

The best fish tacos I've ever had were at Baja (fresh fast food) in the Los Angeles area of California: these tasted awful and were literally oozing mayonnaise. I know what great tacos taste like, btw--the best I've ever had were next to the bull ring in Tijuana from a little vendor on the side of the road there in the 1980's.

I can't believe I didn't vomit after that horrible thing that was in the fish taco. I'm just crossing my fingers that I don't go through a bout of food poisoning tonight.

UGGHHH.
Good location for me but there is a seriously grumpy cashier there. Walk over to Safeway instead.

Yummy, fresh and delicious food! 
Nothing tastes greasy, old or bland. 
Large portions.

It seems as if every time I stop in briefly for one item, I find 20. There is always a fun clearance sale or a new two fer with vitamins. A lovely cashier who is so helpful with photo books, thank you Trish. I seem to live at this store!   It's a second home! I appreciate you CVS... Donna H

On Feb 4th, 2015, part of our family dined here. We were in town for my second oldest daughters wedding. The food was delicious, the atmoshere great, and our treatment unforgettable!! Doni, our waitress was so attentive to our requests.  We returned again early the next week and enjoyed ourselves as much as the first time.  If I'm Peoria again, I'll be back.  Thanks for the memories!!

Wow wow wow!!!! I was highly impressed with the food and service that I received here today!

Let me tell you, I live right across the street from this Señor Taco and I was also more than hesitant to try their food due to my experience with the restaurant that was in the location before.

After passing by it everyday for the last month or so, and with my mom's reassurance that it has since been cleaned, remodeled and is now under new ownership, I gathered my courage and stopped in for a bite to eat. Like I said before, I was more than impressed!!!

I ordered the Chile Relleno Burrito and it was the most delicious Chile Relleno Burrito that I've ever had. I also got a side of both the red sauce and the green sauce and although they both had great flavors, the green was just amazing!

I enjoyed my experience here so much that I even gave them a phone call to commend them for their great work. I'm so happy to know that there is a delicious and safe place to eat right next to my place. I will be returning, and I recommend that you try it out too!

Great food, friendly service for lunch!
Loved my eggplant parm. sandwich, tasty sauce, freshly prepared on crusty toasted roll. Served with a nice salad with delicious dressing. Very good coffee. Neat looking decor with record artist memorabilia. Music performances some evenings.
It's where all the best Seniors are eating these days. Definitely a see and be seen scene.

STAY AWAY been going for several years and the staff and office have been going down hill . My daughter has had to go back 3 times for crown they put in that keeps falling out and is now causing pain. My other Daughter let them know she had no job no money but talked her into a mouth guard they said insurance will cover just to find out they don't. Now we r stick with the bill. One of my daughter's went to a new dentist just to find out her cleanings have not been up to par because even though she goes every six months they had to do a deep cleaning on her!!!! I can't wait to see what the new dentist tells me! When I left a voice mail, their message hasn't been updated since April.

Good grocery selection, poor service by deli, cashier, and bagger.

Great service at bakery.

We cannot say enough good statements regarding the pharmacists at this CVS.
We are from Ohio on vacation in AZ. Somewhere between Florida and AZ we lost a bag containing all of our prescriptions,  vitamins, aspiring etc. After searching for hours we resolved they were gone.
After explaining the situation to the pharmacists he filled what he could, those that were due and gave us a weeks supply of the others.
No charge for all of this.
A wonderful store, company and individual. 
He saved our trip. Simply wonderful for two total strangers.
Not enough thank you are available in this phone.
Thank you

Honestly, the place was clean, service was amazing, hence the 2 star. everyone was on time. i received a crown- and had to get it shaved down from the sensitivity couple weeks later... now its still hurting been couple months.. was told it might be a root canal now. still cant chew on this side so ill have to go back again. maybe get a 2nd opinion just in case

I'm giving it one star 'cause I can't give ZERO.
Some incompetent lady at the passport office scheduled an appointment for me. The supervisor DON RAMEIRO comes out to me after 40 days of waiting saying that there is no appointment scheduled. 
And guess what - myself, my wife and my son we all took days off to be present there, according to the regulations.
They don't provide a confirmation for the appointment and afterwards have the guts to say that I did not make that appointment. 
If you make an appointment at this PO ask for a confirmation or tape the conversation.  
What a bunch on INCOMPETENTS!! For these people customer service is fairy tales. 
Do you hear that post master Troy Eber?

We had the wedding soup which was awesome! The fettuccine Alfredo with shrimp, was probably some of the best I've ever eaten. The lasagna was good and the fresh bread was wonderful. I would absolutely suggest this restaurant.

There were so many things wrong with my appointment.

-My "master tax advisor", with supposedly 13 years of experience, took almost 2 hours preparing my taxes with 1W-2, claiming head of household, education expenses and 2 children for Earned Income Taxes but only 1 for other taxes.

-My bill was over $300.  They charge  $8 to file as head of household.  They nickle and dime you over every thing.

-I didn't pay the $40 peace of mind guarantee, and the "tax expert" messed up.  He claimed both children instead of just one.  This mistake is causing me to have to file an amendment and risk getting audited, which won't be covered without the guarantee.

-I didn't receive an actual apology from the "tax expert".  He stared at me, said people make mistakes, that he is human and he couldn't do anything.

-While I was there, the CPA told the receptionist to misquote a price to someone shopping around for taxes (told her to quote $500-$600, which is way more than they actually charge for that service) because "we never make money off of shoppers."

-When explaining to corporate why I was upset, they said the location had double screens, so why didn't I follow along?  (Blame the customer much?)

This location is unscrupulously run with tax advisors that probably only work during tax season and then do nothing to keep up on their knowledge.

Come here if you want to overpay, possibly get your taxes done wrong, which will increase your risk of audit (better opt for that $40 peace of mind), and be blinked at for being upset about it.  Me?  After at least 10 years of being a customer, I'll be taking my business elsewhere.  Screw me once...
Bomb bomb bomb filibertos is finished! If you are close to this place hit it up! Definitely worth the wait!

Señor Taco is delicious!!  I love love love their red chile carne asada burrito. It might be a little on the spicy side for some, but it's amazing...beans, red chile, and carne...yum!!!  My kiddos always get some type of breakfast burrito and my husband switches between their carnitas and regular carne asada. So far everything's been amazing!!!

If you are 70 and love American Italian food this is your place! Came in on a Saturday and there's older women dressed up ready to dance the night away.  I'm not big on Americanized Italian food but my party was all elderly besides myself and my husband and they all loved every bite.  Cute family owned place.

Khana, is by far the best massage therapist I have ever met.  She has a very good touch and is extremely intuitive.  Khana just seems to know where your ailments are. I have been going to InVision for over a year  I  can't see myself going any where else.  GIVE HER A TRY!

The store us wonderful. Nice selection in all departments. However, the parking lot is horrendous. I prefer Fry's but I will go to Safeway because it's easier to get in and out. 

I know a few people that have gotten into minor collisions in the Fry's lot. Not worth the hassle. Sad, cuz I'm not a fan of Safeway.

When you first opened I was thrilled, clean good food.  I told many friends about Senor Taco.  The last few months friends have told me that they no longer go there because of the bad food.
Last night I went there myself.  Ordered two beef cheese and bean tacos with extra bean to go.  There were little to no  beans, which I was charged extra for, no cheese at all,and so much grease from the meat that it did nit drip, it ran out every where.
As I was waiting for my horrible order, I noticed the filth around the sides of the salsa bar.   No this was not spills, this was dried built up food. I was leaning on the counter with my hands under the edge.  There was so much debris left from other dirty hands could not wait to go wash.  There was a brown liquid on the floor by the office door.
When I got out of the car to go inside, it smelled like sewage.
Needless to say I will not be going back, and will call the health department.  Will go back to Joses for my next Mexican food

My GF and I went here a couple of nights ago and it was pretty empty. I think we beat the Sun City rush.. lol  We were trying to find somewhere "New" that was good and we stumbled upon this place because of all the Google+ positive reviews on Google Maps. We had the chicken Marsala (OK) and Parmesan (Good). Personally, I like Elephant Bar's and Carrabba's Chicken Marsala better. The Chicken Parmesan and Marsala was better the next day as left overs. Their bread was Excellent. It melted in your mouth and they kept it coming. Lastly, the service and staff were extremely friendly. 

Overall, the food wasn't bad, but it just didn't catch either of our fancy's enough to come back to give it another try. Maybe we got the wrong items.

As soon as my husband (patient) and I walked into the ED  at midnight we noticed unorganized staff and dirty floors, dirty restroom with blood. Which I was going to use as soon as I walked in but did not because it was disgusting. I came out and he was yet to be signed in and when he did the lady took her time getting his information like as he wasn't in any pain or sick. I then asked her for a warm blanket because he was shaking and was very cold and she refused to give him one and said he will get one in the back once seen. After he was sent to the back and laid in the room #4 that was not only filthy but smelled like eggs the Nursing Assistant Chris who works NOC also denied him a warm blanket because he needed to get the blood work taken care of and add the IV but yet my husband was shaking and shivering and I had to be firm and say something in order for him to get 1 warm blanket just 1 this really upset me. They didn't hand him his remote once arrived did not check on him did not show any concern the staff here crap!

If you've been to one post office, you've been to them all. But this one, well, it's situated in Sun City. I love the aging population, God knows I do. Everything, including parking, is on a much slower scale.  It's imperative that you have an abundance patience. :-)
This was a good find, good food, great prices and friendly people.i would recommend it to everyone. Small plain little place but worth the stop to try it.

Andrew was awesome. My wife asked about mothers day specials and although there were none available, he said he would do his best. The pizza arrived promptly. When I opened the box, " Happy Mothers Day" was written. He also threw in a garlic dip because my wife asked if it was as good as a compeditors' . You know, such a seemingly small thing can boost your business SO MUCH!  Customer service and a personal touch do not cost much but this gesture will ensure repeated business from my family. By the way, we normally order delivery about 4 times a year. This was the 1st time we ever ordered from this store. It will not be the last. Great job Andrew!

This HOA management company is unusual in that it operates with honesty, ethics and integrity, which by all accounts, is severely lacking in this industry.

All members of the HOAs managed by PRM have a direct line of communication 24 hours a day, seven days a week to assist with problems that can arise unexpectedly as they so often can.

Life can throw a curve ball when you least expect it.  Money comes and goes but there are always bills to pay.  Sue is always more than willing to assist an homeowner whose account is in arrears by setting up a payment agreement plan and offering the chance to the person(s) to catch up on dues instead of simply turning the account over to a collection agency.

FIVE stars all the way!
Service was excellent everyone was friendly and the food was amazing be sure to try the Casatta cake

Where do I start about this place?! It was dark, dirty, and really disappointing in appearances alone. I arrived on time, but I received my services late. Facial and Massage. In my experience Day Spas are generally quiet, but you could hear everything going on in the lobby from the treatment room I was in. 

From the moment I set foot in this establishment the employees looks tired and were rushing around. It gave the impression that they were very disorganized. No one was ready for me and I had to watch and wait while they cleaned and set the new room up for me. The only bright side was that I could see everything thing they were taking into the room. Everything looked clean to me. 

As for my services, the massage was great. Unfortunately, I could tell the therapist was worn out. I probably should have made an appointment for earlier int he day. The esthetician looked tired and frustrated, but she gave a decent service. 

I voiced my concerns at the front desk after my services, and from what I got in response it sounded like the ladies that work there were over booked, and it wasn't the first time. I asked to speak with the owners, but was told they were not in at the moment, and that didn't know when they would be in again. 

Personally, I was not impressed with this business. The ladies that did my services were very nice, but the ware on them was quite visible. I don't think the owners know what they are doing, and the products for the facial weren't even professional grade. I paid good money for a professional service with professional products and feel like I received the Walmart special. 

Save yourself the money and don't go here. It isn't worth your time or money. I just feel sorry or the ladies that work there.

I purchased a Living Social coupon for this business several months ago. When calling to make an appointment it took almost a month before someone called me back. Once the appointment was made (several weeks out was the 1st available), it was cancelled. I made another appointment, again, several weeks out. Again, the appointment was cancelled due to some "plumbing issues." So, I gave them a final chance...made another appointment, several weeks out. Got a call the NEXT day stating they were under new ownership and no longer accept Living Social coupons. DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE DUE TO THEIR BUSINESS PRACTICES.

This is our spot we come here atleast once a week they have $1.39 tacos . My favorite's are Al pastor, carne asada it's so delish as always. The service is quick we come here for lunch with our co-workers it's always a pleasure.... 
They have a selection of salsas they are all good my favorite is the green. I definitely recommend coming here. They have a special on Tuesday a taco rice, beans and enchilada for five bucks !!! That's a deal.

If there was a zero star this is what they would get. My nephew died at this hospital. If you care for your life or your families lives do not bring them here! Find another hospital. All these bad reviews are true. It's so sad that my nephew a 20 year old young man died due to this hospital's incompetence.

Do not eat the fish tacos unless you want to get really sick. Two days later my stomach is very bloated and I'm still feeling very sick, I have the chills. Not to mention that, the fish taco was very dry and not very good at all. I will never ever ever eat at this place ever again. I knew it always looked sketchy to begin with.

First time eating at the restaurant Saturday night March 12th. My wife had the penne pasta and meatballs, she enjoyed it, but not the best. I had a pizza, pep and sausage. It was ok, nothing I would go back for. The hostess however ruined our first experience. Susan, very unprofessional and snotty. Live music was good. Enjoyed that.

Nothing special, just average.  The food was served hot, but had minimal flavor.  It appeared few spices were used.  The server was very friendly, but not real attentive.  Spent most of her time with a customer looking at a laptop.  The bread was good.  I have had more flavor at Olive Garden.

We have been to a lot of other Mexican restaurants, best shredded chicken ever. We loved the  marinade they use. Lots of shrimp dishes I love shrimp. I got the shrimp quesadilla. So amazing. Staff is wonderful. Best Mexican food place I've been in a hot min.

I was just at this Dollar Tree and they need to hire more cashiers. I wanted a Fathers' Day card, and then I remembered I needed another one.  So I picked out the first one and after a while had to give up on the second.  I am impressed they even had a new dad card, but not all new dads have newborns; sometimes people marry others with children, not babies.  
However.  I took my card to the front and whoa!  There were five, maybe six people in line and just one cashier.  No.  I'll try again later.  Preferably at a Dollar Tree that has enough cashiers.

I had cataracts removed from both eyes. They said my copay would be $250 each eye. They were wrong turned out to be $400 a eye. I assumed they knew their job as they do this all the time. They say it's a estimate but the lady didn't say it was a estimate when she quoted me $250 each eye. Now they want the rest because of their mistake. BAD BUSINESS PRACTICES  THEY ARE NOT TO BE TRUSTED

We ordered for a 2nd time using UberEats and was very pleased.  Food arrived in a timely manner and still nice and warm.  

I had the Bean Tostada and it was perfect!  My husband had a Chili Rellenos Combo Plate and he was pleased with his serving size and the taste. 

We will use UberEats to deliver Senor Taco meals to us at home again soon!

My husband took his car here and after leaving noticed a shattered glass appearance on both sides of his car on the molding between the windows. He noticed the machine was very forceful when going through the wash as it slammed his mirror into the car.  He returned and filed a report and they denied responsibility for the damage saying they don't think their equipment could do that.  STAY AWAY!!

There have been several other taco shops in this location over the past few years. None have fared well, obviously. We were happy to see that a Senor Taco was now in place and decided to give it a shot. We ordered a couple Diablo shrimp burritos, a quesadilla and a bean burrito. All were very good but the shrimp burritos are very obviously Senor Taco's claim to fame. Worth the trip.
Great food , family style resturant dancing untill 12:00 PM owners pleasant nice people.x

I've never had a problem with any associate worker or manager anybody in the store ; in 14 years living in Sun City but standing at the showcase-  the meats and fish - I could see the gentleman in the back ! I had to get the Baker to go get him so I could be serviced !  
Tony came out in a very upsetting attitude !  Now I have to  laugh,  after waiting 20 minutes for service ALL  I needed was 4  bacon . 
so piss on you Tony  !!!
he was so rude

The staff was so helpful and informative, I knew exactly what was going on at all times. The technology they use there is state of the art. I did not feel like I was at just any regular dentist office. From enjoying their freshly brewed coffee  to doing X-rays this place is amazing

Keep up the great work!!!
What a pleasing experience from the first call to the cleaning and treatment. They maximized my insurance benefits and I heard they even offer a discount plan for people who don't have any.

I'm a huge fan of CVS Pharmacy.  I'll start by saying this convenient location is right off Thunderbird & 99th in the heart of Sun City.  Very convenient, easy parking lot access and plenty of ample parking.

This store location is extremely clean as are the restrooms.  People often joke about this location being overrun with seniors partly due to its location, but during the toasty summer months (like today), I was in and out of there in no time.  Everything is well-marked, laid out quite well and very easy to find.

I will say that CVS Pharmacy can be pricey.  There's absolutely no doubt about that so I would recommend checking the weekly sales advertisement AND make sure you sign up for their e-mail solicitation.  I know.  I know you probably already subscribe to thousands of other newsletters, but the CVS subscription via e-mail makes it worthwhile.  In fact, the ONLY reason why I came here today is because I needed more essentials like toothpaste, body wash and shampoo.  BUT to make this trip even better was the fact that I got a coupon for 50% off one regular priced item which I used on my shampoo.  The toothpaste and body wash I usually buy were all part of the weekly sales ad this week which means for $10 and some change, I walked out of there with my three essentials in a matter of minutes.  As far as I'm concerned, that beats the hassle of fighting your way through a Wal-Mart parking lot.  In fact, I was in and out of CVS in the amount of time I would have taken me to get a parking spot and walk to the entrance of a Wal-Mart.  

Convenience, time-savings and weekly savings are the reasons why I opt to use CVS for my essentials.
love the food and entertainment..nice to have a place in sun city here you can dance and relax. i have met a lot of nice people there. great staff!!!!

My favorite Frys! I like to stop by here and shop if I can when I come out to visit my nana.

Seriously the cleanest store with the biggest selection.

This place was delicious. With little joints like this, it always seems hit or miss. 

But color me impressed!

I got the two shredded beef tacos (#5) with rice and beans. 

The tacos were crunchy and meat savory. The beans were NOT dry like some other places. The rice was soft and fluffy. And the tomatillo salsa tasted fresh. 

A perfect lunch. Good job, señor!

Same day surgery 9/13/16 for Green Light Laser prostate procedure. (Dr. Sivarajan under the watchful eye of, I believe, Dr.Patel) Mostly all went very well. Hospital called the day before to make sure that I had good travel instructions. The parking lot is convenient from the street and signage is good from the lot into the hospital. Registration went smoothly. Medical personnel were proficient and friendly. As far as I can tell at this early date, all went as expected. But... In pre-op, the installation of the venous access catheter went awry. Someone please observe and correct "Amber". The puncture entry, I believe should go north south, not east west. When the ulnar nerve gets tapped, it is a painful shock. When a patient is in pain from a simple puncture something is wrong. Anyway, in the O.R., the intravenous anesthesia would not flow. She missed the vein and the catheter had to be redone on the other arm; an unnecessary and painful delay. Just an awful way to start. Boswell, please pay closer attention to your newbies.

I miss this place so much! So Good! Growing up here in California this was the first cafeteria i ever went to. I remember my friend Alex's brother worked there. I tried it cause we went to visit him. They had a location in Claremont CA walking distance from my house. They serve good ole American comfort food and healthy portions of it. Sadly they closed that location and can now only be found in 7 states AZ,TX,NM,CO,KS,AR and OK. We re discovered Furr's when unfortunately my father was hospitalized in Sun City AZ while visiting family. Across from the hospital was Furr's and we would go there before heading back to CA every weekend (My pops could not leave the hospital for many weeks) Furr's was a nice place to sit and enjoys some happy food and clear your head it was easier with all the great staff that would get you refills and more food. Service was good food was great but it did get packed Sundays after church so get there early. Furr's please come back to So Cal I miss you're tasty fried chicken and fresh pies. It was like Thanksgiving everytime I went.

We have wanted to try this place for awhile. Yuk I can't even say it was american Mexican sad to say we would have been better with Taco Bell. The service was poor and the enchilada sauce tasted like cheap canned sauce. We love a good taco shop this is not it. My fiancé says they should be arrested for pretending to be a authentic Mexican place lol. The shredded beef chimichanga woah they fried the lettuce in the burrito. Never again

I recently moved to the area and my doctor had to call in a prescription.  I told him to call CVS as it was right down the street.  My prescription was for a Z-pac.  Since I was new to the area my insurance was new also.  When I went to the pharmacy, I was told they didn't accept my insurance (BCBS).  I had to start my medication and said to just ring it up - they did to the tune of $34.84.  I paid and left.  Today I went back to the doctor and needed another Z-pac.  I had him call it into Frys.  They took my insurance, no problem, and the charge was $4.94.  Insurance or not, a $30.00 difference on the same item is highway robbery.  This is not the first bad experience I've had with CVS overcharging, but this is the straw that let me know never to return to CVS and to make good use of social media to report my encounter.  They also make it a habit of never asking their customers if they have a CVS card, thereby not having to give the discount. If you value your money - stay out of CVS.  There are too many other drug stores around to give away your money.

I know it hasn't gotten great reviews, but I really like this Fry's.  Say what you will about the senior citizens that have taken over Sun City, but at least they aren't trashing the place.

The parking lot is clean with plenty of ample parking.  Sure, you're going to run into your fair share of golf carts, but I have no idea why that would possibly dictate your review of the business itself.  The senior citizens drive golf carts.  They live in Sun City.  The business is located in Sun City.  How exactly would you like them to combat the golf cart driving senior citizens?   Ban them from the establish?   ...it's silly.

So after you've dodged the crazed old people in their turbo-charged golf carts and make your way to the front of the store, you'll be pleasantly surprised to see it's super clean!  The produce is fresh, the aisles are clean and clear (unlike your acne) and the shelves are always fully stocked!  You'll be well aware you're not in Kansas anymore with the old time 50's and 60's music playing over the Muzak system.  

The registers at the check out are busy, but the front end managers do a good job in monitoring the activity.  I've been there when it is really busy and they do not hesitate to call in reinforcements to open more checkout lanes.  Now.  Do not go apeshit if/when you come here at dinner time on a Monday evening and are floored if you have to wait a couple of minutes.  You aren't honestly that naive, are you?  You can't possibly be.  You're not the only one on Planet Earth nor Sun City for that matter.  It's a busy time at any grocery store.  Employees aren't standing by idly at your beck & call waiting for you to be done with your shopping so they can check out instantaneously.  Be realistic and be courteous.  Everyone is busy.  Everyone has things to do.  Everyone wants to be home after a hard day at work.  Be conscientious and mindful of this.  

I honestly wouldn't hesitate at all to recommend this location to my family and friends.  It is clean, the employees are friendly, the shelves are stocked, the prices are low and the customer service is above average.  It is our new go-to grocery store in a convenient location that borders Sun City / Peoria.
We just bought beef,chicken, bacon, and seafood.  The gaulity is great. The taste and texture is a wonderful experience compare to that bought in the store. We will be buying more in the near future.

I love the convenience of being able to walk here, when visiting my mum. Only 1.5 miles (when it isn't 100+ of course) & usually I go around sun set. I utilize the self service kiosk.  
I shipped a package to my aunt for her a special little someones 7th birthday.  (The age when it is still fun to get mail, since it isn't bills) My 2 yr old and my 50# pit came with me for the walk...other perk to after hours. ..is puppy can come in and enjoy the air conditioning. I paid for 7 day with tracking.  It does Piss me off that the dang USPS wants to nickel and dime you. What the heck, you want me to pay extra for tracking, delivery confirmation, insurance etc.... No other industry gets away with that. (Not the local workers faults tho) 
I emailed my aunt about 5 days later, she didn't get it. It was delivered to some Po - dunk town in Kansas not Michigan.  Whaaaaat. I call the 800# and ZERO help from them. Since I didn't purchase the insurance.  What the heck. Your people delivered it to the wrong address.  I have very legible handwriting & it made me type in the address to the kiosk. ..so no way it was labeled wrong. 
I went into this location next day, woman at counter was super nice and verified in their computer it showed it indeed was to be delivered to Michigan.  Her "manager" wasn't ultra excited to help. He did verify it should have been sent to my aunt no Po - dunk Kansas.  
Took my name/number and said he would research it for me and promised to call me next day. Would give me print out of it's wonky trail from Sun City to Kansas.  Said it was internal only. Hmmm 
Never called me with any information/update. I spent another full day contacting numerous numbers,  & finally was told it was rerouted and arriving in Michigan.  Still never heard from "Don" ...He is why no 5 stars.

This building used to be a Big Burrito, which had terrible food. We were hesitant to try Senor Taco, since it sounded like your run of the mill fast Mexican food. I am so glad we took the chance!

They have a huge menu, and everything we have tried so far is delicious! We had the Diablo Shrimp Burrito which was phenomenal; we also tried the Chipotle Chicken Burrito - amazing! They even give you a side of chips with your burrito. The rice and beans were awesome - and the beef tacos were just as good! 

The customer service is a lot better than what you would find at Filibertos or the like, and the prices aren't bad either. We have officially found our new drive through Mexican joint!

It was my first visit. Warm, supportive, welcoming are just a few of the descriptors that I felt from The Banner Center. I was surrounded by neighbors having lunch together in an atmosphere of care and understanding. It was such a positive for me. 

     Its a wonderful world.

     I loved it. Thank you.

I'm a longtime customer at this store, back even before it was a Fry's. I'm usually relatively happy with this store. Tonight I had a different experience: we stopped to buy Powerball tickets for the drawing tomorrow. The staff person at the sales desk was selling lottery tickets to a woman, and I went to stand in line. Long story short, when I asked where to stand to buy tickets, I was told that she closed at 9 and that she had to do reports. ?? It wasn't 9pm, but 8:55pm. So, if you close at 9, close at 9, not five minutes to 9. We went to another store to buy our Powerball tickets, and I'm not sure I'll continue to patronize this store on a regular basis. I will shop here again based simply on convenience and the gas station, but it was a really negative experience. I was told by a floor customer service person to buy our tickets from the ticket machine kiosk...I responded I wanted to buy mine from a real person, and was told that 'I'll put your money in the machine for you.' Yeah, thanks - I wasn't amused then and I'm still not now. We went in feeling very upbeat, pooling our money to try to win the big prize, then having to get back in the car and drive to another store to buy the tickets. Big 'boo' to you, Fry's, for a rotten end to what had been a fun evening.

Tyler was fantastic. The design was exactly as it was shown in the images he sent over a preview. Installation was done in a timely and professional manner, and he was even unhappy with one of the portions of the sign (which honestly looked fine) and redid it due to his own sense of perfection and professionalism. You can tell he cares about his craft. We'll definitely be using these guys again.

Great carnitas tacos. A lot of food though so next time I'll try the smaller street tacos. Sides were very good too. They were very nice and friendly, the place was nice and clean. We'll go back often.

This place definitely deserves the 5 stars. When I write a review, I take everything into honest consideration. Starting with the customer service, everyone is super friendly. I'm a very picky eater and don't trust many places but I knew right away this was a good place to eat when I saw how clean everything was, the salsa bar, the counters, soda machines, everything! That gave me a huge relief and built my trust immediately. They have a huge menu to chose from, the food is delicious and very affordable!! . I've liked everything I've tried so far and particularly LOVE their California surfing Burrito it is amazinggg! Unlike many other fast food places that may serve the food cold, the multiple times that I've visited Senor Taco my food has always been really warm and that's something I always look out for. This location has only been open for about a month and every time I go eat there, there are always lots of customers which that alone speaks for itself. I am a very satisfied, this place not only met but EXCEEDED my expectations and I definitely recommend anyone to eat here, you won't regret it. Two thumbs up!! :)
Terrible customer service, mean workers, doesn't even deserve the one star I'm required to give.

Zinnia B., Your facts are wrong.  I called your office about the behavior of Dr. Cho and your dental assistant; not me apologizing for my behavior as you are falsely claiming.  I have a right to complain to higher ups when something like this happens to a patient. The work was shoddy because it kept falling out--three times are excessive.  What about the bruise on my arm?  No apologies have I received there either.  I never requested to fit my budget, Dr. Cho.  Like I said before, I WILL NEVER COME BACK TO YOUR DENTAL OFFICE.  Really read and comprehend the previous emails where I didn't state I was apologizing.  You are trying to cover up and look innocent.  

Comment from Jae C. of Wildflower Dental 
Business Owner 7/23/2018  Hi Susan, as we discussed on the phone (when you called back to apologize for your behavior in the office) you need more extensive treatment on the tooth than you were prepared to do. The last 2 times we preformed the treatment you requested to fit your budget, we didn't charge you an additional fee for it. You also agreed that you understood you would need more permanent treatment on that tooth in the future. Yesterday I let you know that even though you haven't paid for anything on that tooth since 2016, if you do decide to have the recommended treatment done, I will still apply what you paid in 2016 to the new treatment. I hope you have a great day Susan- Zinnia

I have been going to Package Plus for the 3 years I've lived in Sun City, for everything from packing and shipping large amounts of gifts all over the country, to notary and copying services.    They also faxed 50 pages for me when I was buying my home.   Everyone is nice and the service is great.  I believe in supporting small local business whenever possible.   This is a great one for our town.

If it weren't for these people, I think my brother would be close to death! We ran him into this hospital from another hospital that treated him so poorly, I was horrified. They ran out  grabbed him, and in a few days time, he is able to feed himself and he is talking again! They are always courteous and professional tom e.

This place is the best for fast, delicious, Mexican food! I have yet to get a bad meal here.  Everything is always so flavorful! I usually go with the 2 tacos meal which comes with beans and rice for like 5 bucks (if you go in the evening)!

 I prefer the shredded beef, it is packed with the most delectable goodness. Be prepared to wait just a little bit longer than your usual fast food joint. It's totally worth it! I've been told the shrimp burrito is outstanding as well. 

You can drive thru or eat in. If you choose to eat in you can help yourself to the small salsa bar as well.

Up until the other day the only problem I had with the pharmacy is that they kept leaving my meds in the manufacturers container even though it's on my record to place them in the clear see-through containers.  However, Saturday was a huge issue.  I always check my meds when I get home.... is my prescription name on the container and do the pills look just like the ones I am using.  Saturday some #$%^&$  gave me 
someone elses meds.  For someone who isn't as diligent as I am that might have been dangerous.  So, folks be sure to check your meds before taking.

Just ordered take out for lunch from here.Came for dinner months ago and had great fettechini alfredo. I tried to order that for lunch. But alot of menu is not served at lunch time. So I Went with lasangna with meat sauce. Im so so dissapointed. The size was a joke. extremey tiny ( sample size actually) not even  half the size of a regular size piece. Not good when your sides are bigger than your main dish. It came with  a  side house salad and a mini loaf of bread. ( bread lovers might appreciate) but I didnt order bread.. But bread was very good.Anyways. Lasangna was really good  too but it was literally a tease even a nice salad and loaf  of bread do not compensate  for sample size lasangna portions. Notice size was not much bigger than plastic fork in background
Keep coming back for those shrimp tacos ! Yum Yum , to bad I am only here for half a yr.

Worst place for a pizza. I rather drive out and get better quality and better customer service. If there is something wrong they don't listen, they always straighten out the problem by saying it's your fault and not dominoes.  Sad!

This place nestled in the heart of Sun City (Senior City) was everything you would expect from an American Style Cafeteria. It was reminiscent of one of my old grade school lunch room cafeterias. Late 70's early 80's LOL everything I chose was good and I left full and happy. While I was there I got into a couple of conversations (like I often do wherever I go) with some old folks that were fun and cool. An easy four stars for this blast to the past that is still ALIVE in Sun City. Rand H, Mike C and I ate and were FULL earlier on the day we were to enjoy the festivities of the Yelp Event " Science Fair" I will write about next!! =) JH
Excellent service, food and atmosphere. Serendipity brought us here, and it was a pleasant surprise. We will definitely be back!

I had to go to the ER. I was expecting an hours wait but was I ever so wrong. I waited about it 10 minutes and was immediately brought back to a room. The entire staff was friendly and attentive to my needs. Hopefully I never have to come back to the ER, but if I do, I know I will be in good hands

We have used this hospital several times over the past few years and have always been happy with them. I like the fact that they are smaller. Seems like you get a little more personalized attention. I also appreciate the many volunteers they have that are always willing to assist you.

Nasty. This place was dirty inside from the tables, floor to the area they were making the food. The girl at the register was coughing up a lung and had to walk away so someone else could take over. She just walked back to the food prep area coughing as she went. Gross. The salsa station was dirty and the salsa looked old. I got chicken tacos and the chicken was raw and pink inside. I didn't eat one bite. My husband took 1 bite of his egg and chorizo burrito and said he wasn't hungry. A total waste of 13.00, but at least it was only 13.00.

I met my Wife here yesterday for lunch at noon. Since I had no breakfast, I am sure I got sick here. I had one of their shrimp dishes and started feeling sick before I even left the restaurant. I was in our bathroom most of the night, and could not sleep all night. I have never felt so bad. I will never go here again.

If you need something from the pharmacy forget it..... I wanted a flu shot and CVS says come in anytime before 8pm but this one stops when they want to.... I was watching the tech give out 2 shots and pushed them to do one more and then clerk/pharmacist did not know how to enter the voucher code in her own system when it clearly shows the directions on the voucher..... The clerk told me she hadn't eaten all day so she's cranky..... Still doesn't give her the right to talk to the customers like that.....

Great service with no bull or up selling 
I brought two cars in for oil changes and it was fast and efficient 
Very good coffee while I waited

ER staff doesn't listen to patients needs and they left her alone sitting on gurney after she stated she felt light headed. Still worried about her care here but her doctor is here today on call. Would rather be at Arrowhead Hospital.

Horrible, I mean, horrible service. Doctors and nurses were so very rude. Went to urgent care after and they were much sweeter. I never felt more disrespected. They didn't take care of my needs and didn't resolve the problem.

While the fashions at Sunburst are great and the customer service reps in the front of the store were friendly, the reps in the shoe section of the store (in the back) were horrible. Customer service is obviously not a priority for them. And unfortunately, that's where I was shopping that day. Not sure if I'd go back because I'm not big on spending my hard-earned money where I'm not welcomed. I hope those ladies (in the back) get it together.

We LOVE Dominic's and have been in twice in the last few weeks. We are new to the area. Today was our second time in and the waitress remembered where we like to sit and even what we ordered after one visit. They have great lunch specials, yummy food, and excellent customer service!
Quick in-and-out to get holes added to my shoe strap after a nearby appointment. Bonus: they were open early!

Today we used UberEats for the first time and ate a meal from Senor Taco for the first time.  We were pleased with both!

It was great to have Mexican food delivered to our house.  Both our meals were still hot and tasty.  Plus, it didn't take very long.  

Really pleased and will give UberEats another try soon -- from Senor Taco!

Banner Boswell Hospital is terrible, I entered the building around noon or so.It took quite awhile to get in, I am a diabetic and on dialysis.First they came to get vitals,Keep in mind that vitals were 208/83 Orderly said they will get you upstairs soon, Advised him I am not staying overnight. He never put in an order for B/P after another small wait I was called to the little room area for Weight & Temp as well as B/P. My blood pressure was still high.Again no medication for the B. pressure and I advised her that I am not staying over,The Nurse said she would get me a form to sign when I got into the room.We went back out to waiting again.Then they came and got me.First thing this nurse says is we will get you upstairs soon ,Again I had to advise her That is Not Happening. You would think someone would write it down as 3 more Nurses had to be told that same thing.( I am not staying here at all) From 1 or so to 4,20 They gave me nothing for B/P at all.They did give me a med for some nausea I asked for a sandwich at 2.40 pm (I am diabetic) and needed 2 eat, at 3.10 Nothing had come yet, My Mom went and got me what I asked for which was just a sandwich and nothing more, At 4pm or so the nurse asked if the food arrived.Of course it had not and never did, She said all they had was peanut butter and jelly, Dialysis patients are not allowed any p. butter at 4.15 pm or so The moron Dr came in and said you need dialysis now I,told him not a chance in hell I am here for blood pressure,(All hospitals under Banner have mandatory 3 day stay) when they do dialysis to you there at the hospital. He never said a word about that hospital policy Told him enough is enough.Take out the IV or I am walking out of here connected or not, All of a sudden they are doing an e.k g,They had not done anything but a blood test after four hours or so had gone by and still no B/P pills,No sandwich had ever arrived.(I could have died there with an insulin reaction and no care or food). It was close to insulin time,now ( Mind u my previous stay in Nov was completely useless).They did not to give me my insulin until 8.30 pm and that was not a complete dosage..I Did not get my next dose till a half hour later, I was 329 at 1.30 am I did not get insulin until 2 hours later after that..When I questioned why they said it,s hospital protocol as we must ask doctor first. I replied are you kidding No doctor is needed when any diabetic is that high in their blood sugar count, You could have killed me as my organs could have shut down I replied get the insulin or I call my Atty,My Mom showed back up because I had called her at 2;20 am and she brought (my personal insulin)This was a frigging joke and a half as all involved should have been reprimanded,Back to ER visit and the lying staff. All of a sudden they wanted to take care of me after being there for 4 hours.I said You could not even get me a sandwich.The doctor asked at least 2 more times for me to stay there,I replied that is not happening as I do not need to.They were simply trying to siphon money off my SSI,I asked again for the 3rd time where is letter that I have been promised and asking for that the lady who checked me in said they would get to me.The Doctor had no response again and then I,told him that is why I do not trust you or this garbage dump.Then out of the blue a nurse came in with another machine.One more stall tactic on their part. I asked why wasn't this done in the beginning like all the other patients
 had done in the waiting room.In the end I never got my Sandwich from the hospital staff losers.No,Medicines or anything but grief came from the absolute lying and extremely slow and incompetent staff is what I experienced.I never got my letter that I was asking for. I will never return, to this pig pen of sh** place I will never go there again, I am going to put in complaints where ever I can. 
Sincerely
A Concerned Dialysis Patient
Have only been once, had steak and egg burrito and it was excellent.  The fact that you can get a grilled pepper to go with it is a bonus.  Salsa could be better, but the food was great.
Overall they do a good job to help in your rehab to get back into the world. They have plenty of people on staff. Great nurses and good food. Pop machine and Internet for guest.

Arrived early for my 10:10 appointment for my annual diabetic eye exam. Finally seen around 10:40. Exam was quick, friendly, and efficient. This is the place approved by my insurance so I will be back next year.
This place is an awesome find, amazing carne asada quesadilla! Definitely on the top of my list when talking about quick mexican food.
It's been tuff being here, but I highly recommend this hospital.. The staff works super hard to be taking care of each patient.. The Cardiac ICU unit has an amazing staff of Doctors & Nurses..

Pretty good food. Out of all the Mexican places I've been, they have the best carne asada fries by far. It has big chunks of steak, good fries, good salsa, cheese, guacamole, sour cream, and beans. Very fast service too.

My friend was taken by ambulance to the ER after a bad car accident. First, two female nurses called her a "hooker" based on the way she was dressed. Things went downhill from here. I've never seen a staff treat a patient more disrespectfully with rude comments and sarcasm throughout the hours we were there. Everything from claiming she wasn't in a car accident (mind you she was picked up by their ambulance) to not offering any type of pain medication or meds to help with her swelling. Random nurses and staff kept walking in the room without knocking to grab random medical supplies. They were acting as if they were barging into a supply room rather than a patient's room. Walking through the halls proved to show a very dirty and unkept facility. At one point, I observed numerous medical gloves scattered across the floors in one room. To top the entire night off, while I was driving to drop my friend off, the nurse gave my fiend a "courtesy call" to let her know they forgot to take out her IV. Yes, my friend had to take the IV out herself at home.

Thanks for being honest and straightforward, guys! They actually recommended that I call the dealership to find out if a repair would be covered under the transmission warranty, before agreeing to go ahead with the repairs. Turns out it's covered, and they saved me couple hundred bucks. :):) Can't beat that service!!

You want honesty and fair pricing with excellent workmanship? You found it here at Grand Avenue Leather & Shoe Repair in Sun City. 
Over the years I have gone to a great many places to have shoes and boots resoled. I started the hunt after the last shop told me "$100.00 because you can afford it".... thankfully I found Grand Avenue Leather & Shoe Repair. The price was $60.00 cheaper than the last place I went to and the quality of the work.... in a word... excellent. Their attention to detail and customer care is superb. 
Why pay higher prices when you have quality and excellence at a fair price!
awesome place to go! My teenager was scared of the dentist and they were amazing!!! We are DEFINITELY going back

AMAZING!! This was our second visit. First visit we had a sit down dinner in the dining area. The steak and side dishes were DELICIOUS and service even better. Our second visit was specifically for happy hour which offered generous pours of wine and an exceptional offering of food. We had the steak & fries and calamari. You can't beat the $10 price for happy hour food especially when you're served with healthy portions filled with an enormous amount of flavor!!
The pizza from here has always been good. Wings too. Make sure you call because they sometimes have specials just at this location.

Everyone here has been so awsome ! While my wife was at work I had a dental emergency.  Forced to bring my 4 and 2 year old in with me and they have been so kind and awsome . They have been Willing to help with my children in this time of need . Everyone from the ladies up front , to the nurse and Dr.  They have been excellent !!! Please bring you and your family here for all your dental needs !!

This restaurant is geared toward the older generation, however the food is old school and done right.  Try the Tomato and Mozzarella salad, so good!  They have open mic night and dancing on the weekends.
