The person in charge (Tina?) lied to me when I showed up (& was there early as requested!) for my massage appt. First, hrs of operation are on door (Sat 10-4) but No-one was there! I called TWICE. First time no-one answered so I left a msg. Called back 15 min later as I'm waiting outside & Tina told me her esthetician quit on her LATE at Night Before my appt. She didn't bother to call me then or this a.m. before I drove Forty minutes out of my way. I then asked her if the esthetician does the massage as well or is it a masseuse because my appointment was for a massage not a facial. She said, " oh my masseuse didn't show up this morning, its been a rough day. so I can give you a free facial or you can call Groupon and get your money back. " I told her I would just call Groupon. I use Groupon all the time, this is my first horrible experience with one of its vendors. I will never go back to this place nor do I recommend it obviously.

Was at frys getting groceries for trip out of town.  The store was dead at customer service.  I had already bought my groceries and just wanted to get another card .  so I had two linked together.  Went over to customer service and the clerk behind counter Danielle was the rudest associate I have ever encountered in this whole store as long as I have been coming here about 20 years.  You would have thought that I had asked her to do my grocerie shopping, load my car, drive me home and put away grocieries.  Not even  a smile or how was I doing,  could she help me nothing ..She sure got the super bitchy attitude right.  My complaint?  (I can handle her I deal with bitchy women all day.) If she treated me like that then she treats the elderly like that and thats what sucks.  The guy infront of me she treated the same way.   I will now shop at other store and make sure everybody else shops other storea too.  Because Im su re this is not her first complaint she has received.

Don't know if all Frys Stores do this or not, but there's certainly no such thing as brand loyalty.  I've used a product (Spic n Span) for over 50 years and now the store doesn't carry it.  The other brands are too expensive & seem to aggravate asthma.   Second,  I raised an 18 year old cat on Aristocrats Cat Food.  When he passed away, I started my new kittens on the same regimen.  Four years later, Fry's doesn't carry it.  My spoiled kitties won't eat anything else.  Third, Beneful dog food is .20 per container higher and the dry food is $1.00 higher than PetSmart .  Fourth, when I go to find my favorite brand of coffee, the store has chosen to stock a multitude of Starbucks products instead.   And all of these brands are more expensive than what I used.  Fifth, I hope they don't remove the Bailey's creamer.  The quantity stocked has dwindled.  This store is located in a retirement area and it's customers are primarily seniors on fixed incomes.  They choose to gouge prices of new products and remove the cheaper brand of older products.  Sixth, I usually pick up my prescriptions there.  The last prescription I received (refills) were not the right amount of mgs.  I'd have to take 4 of these pills to get the same dosage as I was taking.  I feel a Pharmacist should have caught that mistake.  That has caused me problems with my insurance, as well.  Seventh, Fry's issued coupons for their products which should make me happy.  However, some of the coupons are for products that Fry's doesn't carry.  Should someone doing the printing know this?   This unhappy customer is shopping for a new grocery store.  Any suggestions?  Sick and Tired of being Taken for Granted!

Just came home from dinner at Dominic's. Got a few recommendations to try it so tonight we did. I am very pleasantly surprised. everything was fresh, tasty, high quality and service was perfect for a family owned Italian restaurant. Décor is semi authentic kitschy old Italian. Food was good/ very good. Definitely will be back.

My mother lives in Sun City, and I live in Florida. I've taken to Package Plus, at four different times, 2 original oil paintings that require special expertise in wrapping for shipment, 2 albums with precious photos, and a large fine china tea set from Germany plus several crystal glasses with gold rims to be specially wrapped and shipped to me in Florida. Every time they have been properly and expertly wrapped with special care and received by me in perfect condition at fair, commercially competitive prices. I would travel anywhere within the Phoenix and surrounding areas for expert shipping services; I choose this Package Plus for all of my shipping of expensive, irreplaceable items.

DO NOT USE THIS PHARMACY IF YOU CAN AVOID IT. Prescriptions are often not ready when promised. Recently I had to wait 24 hours for a prescription to be filled (this in a major metropolitan area). To top it off, they just shorted me on a prescription for Prednisone, which is risky with a drug that requires specific dosages over a specific number of days. It is not unreasonable to expect a pharmacist to be able to count to 12.

I live in Washington.  So happy to come visit my mum this tasty place. Portions sizes are huge. Ingredients are yummy. I hope the place survives.  
The ugly ass Del Webb sign blocks the entire location.

The best part about this place was the price.  The lunch deal is a good deal but it's not the highest of quality.  I think it is strange that they only give you a tiny cup of ketchup and mustard when you need the bottle. 
 
I would probably return simply because of the price of the food but they could definitely improve the quality of their lettuce and flavors.  The lettuce was limp and the hamburger was bland and could use some seasonings. 

The service wasn't great as I was in a small group of three during lunch but it was difficult trying to get the attention of the waitresses even though there was only one other table in the entire restaurant.

I liked the look of the restaurant but I think they could really improve their business if they just improved the quality of the ingredients and flavors.

I purchased the entertainment deal for a hour massage and an hour facial. I got there late which was my fault so they took it off the massage. The lady that did the massage was decent. After I went into another room for the facial. The facial was not the greatest facial, and it was only 30 mins. I purchased it for an hour. The shop was a hole in the wall. The restroom the hot water was not working and also in the massage room there was drywall on the floor. I would not recommend this shop to anyone. Thankfully I had the deal so I did not have to pay full price. I am really disappointed. I was really looking forward to getting a nice relaxing massage and facial. Do not spend your money here. Next time I will spend a little bit more money and go to a better spa.

Sunday after church, we would head for Furr's.  I remember grabbing a tray and utensils, moving down the line making my own choices for food.  My mom watching but not interfering.  This was when I learned that I could try new things. 

Today, the line is just not the same, the food choices are smaller, and hit or miss on quality.  It's changed up to AYCE which makes sense, they did charge per item selected.  So when my husband and I are heading out of town and we come across a Furr's we still like to give it a try.

I order from here the other day and the food was great, my girlfriend and I decided to order again tonite and we did not get any salsa, the food tasted old and my "quesadilla" had no cheese....so I got a fancy folded up tortilla.....

I came there for a consultation and was quoted 2500 for our of pocket costs for an implant. The customer service rep up front said that would include everything. I then told them I had insurance, boy bad mistake. 

After the X-rays the price went up to 5100 lol. I went to Alpha Dental and the staff was way better in cleanliness, equipment and service. What did they charge?? 1300!! Because they were honest!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME HERE!!!!

Lookin' for a GREAT lunch at an awesome price... When in or near Sun City, look no further than Dominics Bistro.  So, for $7, yes that's SEVEN dollars, you get Fresh Baked Italian Bread, a fresh green salad, an entree and a drink. I love the Lasagna lunch special. Its great!  Did I mention all that for $7 bucks... Of course the service staff is great too. Tiffany never lets my tea get empty, and always offers more bread to dip in olive oil.  I have taken my business co-workers as well as friends here. And, although they don't YELP, they all shared my big TWO THUMBS UP, or rather 5-star review. So, for less than a fast food place would charge, and with fresh tasty entrees and a salad, come to Dominics... maybe I'll even see you there.

My dad took my mom to the ER and was admitted last week  which is scary in itself. Luckily everything turned out great and she's "fit as a fiddle" as she keeps telling people. 
Although, we certainly didn't know that when she arrived but every nurse, doctor, lab guy along the way treated my mom like she was the only patient in the building and treated her like she was part of their family. 
I could not have asked for a better staff to entrust with my mom!

No one likes going to the hospital, but the next time I need one, I might consider the extra drive getting to Boswell based on how my mom was treated!

Cannot believe there are no more Furr's Cafeterias out here in Phoenix anymore.   I grew up on Furr's in New Mexico.   My mom would always take me and my sister.  We would always get the chicken fried steak with mashed potatoes and brown gravy, green beans, a
Dinner roll, millionaire pie for desert and iced tea.  Or sometimes their baked cod and tartar sauce or their cheese enchiladas with pinto beans.   What were they thinking to go away?  Guess I will have to go to New Mexico and eat at a Furr's there, except I heard it is more like Country Buffet; not at all like how it used to be.   Why do good restaurants have to go away?  I know a lot of people loved Furr's Cafeterias!!!   Please come back!!!!
I've seen many restaurants come and go in this location over the years, I like this one best. Service is always nice. Food cooked quickly. Tastes delicious and fresh hope this place sticks around.

If I could give this store no stars, I would. Hours state opens at 7am. Ah. No. That's when the staff shows up. Once they get in, expect to sit and wait for them to open up. Another 15 mins. Very enthusiastic bunch.

Just had my last visit to Dominos on Grand & 101 loop. You buy a pizza and expect it to be the usual especially Dominos but when I got home it was a joke to sell such a poorly made pizza to your customers! It's Dominos same company everyone has been going to from the mid 80's for me. I bought 2 pizza one was suppose to have been sausage and ham. There was literally a few pieces of sausage on this pizza. It look like a ham pizza with not that much ham and a close up look to see any sausage because there wasn't even a piece on ever slice. My 5 year old daughter could have done a better job! Dominos you suck!!!

Usually a great location. We order from here a lot and I guess we have been spoiled in the past with super fast delivery. Today we are still waiting for the delivery. 60 to 70 minutes is not acceptable. Hopefully this is a fluke.

I made an appointment for my husband for a cataract exam and they were able to get me in the next day.  When we arrived around 9am, there were only 2 people in the waiting room. We were greeted and asked to sign in. The waiting room was your typical waiting room, spacious and comfortable. We were called up soon after we got there and then called back 5 minutes after.  The technician performed several eye tests and was very friendly and helpful in explaining as she went along. It turned out my husband did not have cataracts. We waited to see Dr. Patel. She was very polite and professional. My only complaint is that she seemed rushed- we did wait about 15 minutes to see her once the initial exams were done & I'm sure there were other patients waiting for her as well. 
Overall our experience with all of the staff was positive; they all were friendly and professional.  The office and exam rooms were clean, and so was the restroom. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because of the wait time to see the doctor and the feeling she was rushed once she finished her exam.

I stopped by with my hubby and a business friend for lunch today. Very cute little place with lots of fun Sinatra memorabilia. It took about 10 minutes to get our drinks but we were sitting around talking when she came by the first time. After we got our drinks, it took another 15 minutes or so for them to get our order. Once our order was in, our food came out in just a few minutes. Server was very polite, and all the staff was talkative and friendly. Food tasted great, sandwiches were fresh and the wedge fries were hot and tasty. What a great atmosphere, and especially if you want to go for a little music entertainment in the evenings. I would recommend.

Portions are huge! Some orders can feed up 3 people easily, and the servings are worth the money. Try the agua fresca, as all the flavors are good and not too sweet.  
Wish they brought back ceviche on the menu, as they recently removed it.

These guys are great. I was getting a pizza during take out and you wouldnt believe all of the cranky old people that treat all the dominos employees like shit. These guys work their butts off and people of all ages mad about waiting 15 min. It's crazy how things are these days. It's funny because all of the people that were mad and complaining all looked like they could be a good candidate for a Jerry springer episode. Thank you dominos for working so hard and staying calm cool and collected even when your getting yelled at.

I'm here at least twice a week! Love this Fry's! The Starbucks is awesome and the lines at checkout are rarely long. Plus, all the old folks are always commenting on my 11month old, since she was born on how cute she is hahaha she's like a mini superstar when we go! Love it! Thank you Fry's!

Starbucks inside this store SUCKS! 
First, I was so happy to know there is a Starbucks in the store that I don't need to drive to a Starbucks to buy my drink however; what I got is very big disappointment. 
There are 2 Barista working however; service is very slow & not friendly at all. I ordered my one & only ultimate favorite frap & they messed up my order. I over heard the barista asking the other barista who took my order; what is this? And replied; she just want 2 pumps of roast. When i got my order it looks like she had made my drink regular with 4pumps. I asked her if she only had put 2pump as my drink was very strong. She rudely replied; yes! I was like, i know my drink & this is not right. She then turned her back & ignored me. I'm so upset that all i want is my frap but all i got was disappointment. Threw it & walked away with no drink & paid for it. I will never buy starbucks there again!!

STAY Away!!!! I went to the car wash and an hour later I had a flat tire and the next day my tire popped!!Unbelievable!!I knew that the damage had occurred there because I felt my whole car shake  as it was being washed plus when I got my tire changed they informed me the tire had been damaged and irreplaceable . I spoke to a manager named Keaton and he basically did not believe me and offered me a gift card ...NO WAY I will NEVER GO there AGAIN!! I paid $160 for a New tire because of this!

Tag Team did a FANTASTIC job on our doors and window. The price was reasonable and the wait time for install was not bad. We are actually having them redo a sign for us and the price is 1/5 of the cost we spent the first time. Will DEFINITELY recommend to people.
This is a fun place to have fun ..!! Any anniversary birthday engagement wedding and divorce Parties are so much fun to celebrate with good n live  music  to dance  I lol give 5 stars plus 5 more..!!

One fine day My girlfriend and I stumbled into Dominic's by chance and had lunch on a weekday. She had cheese raviolis and I had the lasagna . We enjoyed our delicious meals and great service very much. So much so we returned several times .If you can go on the weekend when they play music you will have a great time dancing and having an amazing meal in a warm friendly atmosphere.

I wish there was a zero star option do not be seen by Randell Davis went in with a heart rate of 140 just sitting there and had trouble berthing I donated my kidney at banner good Sam it was great this time sucked he asked me first off if I was high on meth wtf I came in because the transplant team told me to do not go here the nurse told me to go to a different hospital if I want to be taken seriously

It was all pretty disappointing. A few friends and I came for facials. We waited 30 min past our appointment time  before any of us could get in. One of the estheticians had a family emergency and couldn't make it. They were nice enough to still take all 4 of us (2 at a time)  but it took a very long time - about 3 hours total, which you wouldn't expect for the services we got. The quality of the facial was questionable. There was no pore-opening steam and I don't know what products she used. The most unfortunate part of our visit though was the quality of service. The esthetician seemed very unenthusiastic about her job and unhappy to be there working with us. Unfortunate for her I realize, but it really dampened the experience for my friends and me. This was my treat for my gals and I was embarrassed to have taken them there. We won't be coming back.

PRM has taken over management of our Condominium Units and have really done a great job. This place was such a dumpy place to live before they took over. Our HOA Board is pathetic but at least we have PRM making great changes.

David

First time. We walk in. Wait to be seated. Asked if we want booth or table. We say booth.  Then told sorry they are reserved. We sit, then in walks two gals, no reservation. They start to seat themselves, we inform them you have to wait to  be seated. Waitress or hostess ask them how many and  they are directed straight to a booth supposedly reserved. We walked out. Will never go again.

Went in for a quick lunch, quick and friendly service and good prices. I had the Italiano sandwich which was delicious, and my girlfriend had the cheese ravioli with mushrooms which she said was 'bomb'!

This store is only a hop with no skip and jump away from me. You would think I'd be a grateful  person living so close to a market, but no! The parking lot is a disaster. I saw a woman right in front of me break her hip trying to walk to her car, and fell on the cement parking block. Paint those things would ya? The grocery carts are probably my biggest complaint. Why can't you have the small two tiered ones that they have at Walmart and Competitors? The answer I got when talking to a store manager was: because people steal them! No kidding! That's called a business loss and a tax write off. Or do what other stores have done in places like Las Vegas, put monitors on them where the wheels lock when rolled off the property. I live in Sun City, and yes we have lots of Great Grandmas and Dads so get over it! The aisles are not big enough for the giant carts, scooters, walkers, and canes. It would be so less wasteful if produce would pre cut half a cauliflower, squash, and other bigger veggies and fruits. The employees in the front of the house are very nice, but the deli and pharmacy is atrocious. They are not the pharmacy gods or the deli princesses, they are Kroger employees and should honor their policies.

We went to Dominic's Bistro in Sun City, Az last night with some friends and it was GREAT !! 
Our first time there and so glad our friends invited us. The food was great  it has a frienly atmosphere and the owners were very welcoming.  I am looking forward to going back soon.
The music was fun and  we highly reccomend Dominic's Bistro.

so my family usually gets food from here but for some reason today when i went with my mom they were closed! and i have been there earlier than the time we went so i know i wasn't just early. it even said they were open when i checked online. i love their food and service it's great but this was just a little weird to me. another taco shop was doing the same thing so i don't know what's going on with that.

Cafeteria type buffet. Which is great for me since I'm a slight germ a phobe! 
Excellent food and staff. 
Low price. 
Great location.

Sonia the manager could care less that there were 12-15 people in line with one cashier. The cashier called for help over the intercom twice. People cut lines and everyone was irritated. This on a Saturday morning at 10am. ONE star for customer service!

I was extremely disappointed with Banner /Boswell on 104& thunderbird; I felt like I had  been misdiagnosed in the beginning by a PA. Not aware that any second opinion was made to determine meningitis. Put me through a crap load of test which all turned out negative. Turns out I was having an allergic reaction to a medication given to me by Banners urgent care not a fault "somehow I created a reaction to z- pack first time. Ever ". And made I sure they were fully aware  I was there that same day.  I had just started taking new medication. But because They seen a rash that automatically jump to "meningitis "the most extensive testing that they could. Then when it came out negative getting information out of them ; about what's really going on with me was impossible. Notified them that I was extremely allergic to penicillin and penicillin family. So evidently they thought it was OK to add it to my IV bag. Which during my hospital stay I had another allergic reaction to the medication that they provided me. Had to have a infectious disease guy there to figure out that the rash was based off of a allergic reaction. Just seems really amazing that if these people didn't know what the rash was then they probably should've put me through that testing until they found that part out. I'm extremely upset with this hospital They sent me home on Friday and told me that I was supposed  to have cultures testing completed by Saturday never got a response . it's now Monday so I have no idea what was in those cultures or if there are positive or negative. I'm assuming negative but I still feel like crap so something is wrong with me.  And I've had a headache for over four days cause the spinal tap they gave me.  . And hindsight should've got some prednisones and an IV bag.

I have a parent in this hospital right now. Three doctors were in his room arguing with my elderly parent and threatening them with sending them home in a cab and my parent was telling them there's nobody home to take care of them. While I suspect my parent was being a pain in the butt, there is no excuse for doctors to behave in this manner. I am 4 hours away and cannot drop my job to come to their aide and now I have to worry about what they are doing to my parent. I have been unable to speak with a Case Manager despite my several requests as I am trying to get my parent transferred to a rehab facility for a week or so. Nothing. No call back, no way to get them on the phone, I've been completely shut out. I even have 2 non-Banner rehab centers willing to accept him. To get a return call from a nurse for a status is nearly impossible and they are now looking to discharge my parent on their own recognizance when there is nobody at home to help. They can barely walk and not strong enough to take care of themselves like cooking, etc. So worried and very frustrated. I'd also like to add that this is the 2nd time they've been in the hospital from this operation. Banner Rehab released them to go home too early and two days later, they're back in the hospital. The RN that visited my parent at home was shocked that they released my parent in that condition. I'm very upset with the care my parent is getting in this hospital.  Beware!
This is not a good place to dine!!! Small portions and the food is. Mediocre at best!!  Closes at the late hour of 8 pm.
Horrible. Burrito rice & beans, couldn't even eat half. The pork was dry and chewy with terrible flavor and their salsa tastes like ketchup. Don't waste your money.

The pharmacy sucks I do not know if it is due to the new laws, but, my Doctor called me in a rx last week and all I heard from the pharmacist was that it was to soon to be filled. I had to call my Doctor back for over 5 days to get this situation straight then the pharmacy told me that the Doctor changed my dosage which was wrong so I had to wait till after 3pm to get my pain medication. They texted me around 12:10pm and said it was ready same dosage I have always taken and my Doctor called this in last week. Not only that same doctor has been doing this for over 4 months now. I wonder if there is anything I can do about this. I get 9-10 rx filled there from Blood Pressure medication to Diabetes Pancreatic just to name a few. If anyone else has had a problem report them.

This is a very friendly hospital, you are greeted at the door and from then on everyone  you come in contact with has a smile and a greeting. The volunteers take you right up to the desk where you need to be, not just drop you off at the doorway . The hospital is clean, neat and does not have that hospital smell like some do the minute you walk in the door .

I was recommended to King Automotive from a friend and I am so happy they recommended me to this AMAZING group of guys! They are a no bullshit and are completely honest when it comes to repairs! I have enjoyed this expierence and they just gained a life customer! I won't go anywhere else now! Keep it up Doug and Dan. Thank you for everything!

Very clean fast food restaurant. Salsa bar is full and great choices. I got the California Surfin Burrito with shrimp, potatoes, carne Asada  and some sauce that is excellent to bring it all together.
They are friendly here and have a drive thru If you don't feel like dining in. 
Give it a shot if your in the area!

I've been using this Midas shop for over 3 years without a problem.   They  always been up front with me explaining whats wrong and fixing whatever problem quickly and reliably.  
Over the summer I had my car towed to the shop with engine problems.   It took them four days to diagnose, and told me I needed new spark plugs.  They had my car for 5 days just to replace the plugs and get my the engine codes to clear so my check engine light would stay off.
Easy fix I thought.   Two days after the fix the car was still having issues, so I replaced the coil packs and plug wires myself.   This seemed to fixed my problem with only an occasional engine hiccup which I was comfortable with owning a high mileage older vehicle.
I brought my car in for emission testing and it showed an engine code failure. The technician thought it was strange since my check engine light wasn't on so he ran the test again and told me that the bulb was probably burned out. Once again older car, I can see that happening.
Decided to bring my car to another shop on recommendation to fix the problem, and upon removing the instrument cluster to change the engine light bulb, THERE WAS NO BULB.    The Tech at Midas REMOVED the check engine light bulb so I it would seem like my car was fixed.
They just lost all my business.    Sorry Tony.

My mother is currently on the Observation floor and has been since Wednesday.  Was admitted but not moved due to no space available.  The care in observation has been horrible.  Medication has been neglected and so have meals.  Meals have been hit or miss.  They have not brought her breakfast in the last several days.  Today no dinner, I am in another state. So my 78 year old stepfather has had to bring her food which has been difficult.  My mother called nurse in tonight to tell her about dinner. Nurse got snippy and said well everything is closed there's nothing I can do.  To add to all this the lack of cleanliness at this facility is substandard. My mother has requested several times that the bathroom be cleaned as it had not been when she was taken to the room. Finally this morning they had someone come in to clean after multiple complaints. She was barely in there for 3-4 minutes cleaning. It's bad enough for my mother who is trying to heal to have to be on them to do their job and then still ignored or put off at times.  Had her request a patient advocate but none are there on the weekend. I don't know if this is how the whole hospital is or just Observation floor.  But this level of care is unacceptable. Hoping to speak to advocate tomorrow.  Other patients have been complaining as well. My mother was told that another patient had to clean his food tray because it was filthy and sticky.

Hands down my favorite Italian restaurant! The lunch menu is priced not to break the bank and the food is fantastic, the High-Standards music they play and all the "Rat Pack" era memoribilia is great.
If you like home styled Mom & Pop italian food look no further.

What a great little place! I went with the parents for dinner this evening and I am impressed. I had the Chicken Picatta, mom had Chicken Parmigiano and dad had Lasagna. All of us enjoyed our dinner and were happy with the portion size. We had dessert as well and that just topped everything off. The Cassata cake was one of the best I have ever had and Dad had homemade peanut butter and chocolate chunk gelato. We will be back! I can't  wait  to  take my husband here.

my father was there for a triple bypass and just wanted to  thank a nurse on the dayshift named ryan on 5 B.  What an exceptional nurse and thankyou so much ryan for simply doing your job to its best.  Ryan is one of the most through nurses i have ever met.  Everyone would be so lucky to have him PJ

This place is pretty delectable for a fast food joint. I grew up eating delicious authentic Mexican food regularly, so when I find a place like Señor Taco I get pretty amped. My boyfriend and I came here on a whim for lunch and were pleasantly surprised by the portions, prices and quality. The cashier was very kind and patient as we scoped out the menu to decide what to try. I ended up ordering the #6 daily special that came with 3 rolled tacos smothered in guacamole, a quesadilla and a 20 oz drink for $8.49. My boyfriend opted for the señor burrito which was $9.99. Before we payed the cashier asked us if we knew how big the burrito would be. We said we didn't and she said it was pretty big (the length of a tray). My boyfriend decided to get it anyway with the idea of taking the rest home for dinner if there was any leftover.

My goodness. The cashier was not exaggerating the size of the señor burrito. Not only was it massive in length, but it was stuffed with flavorful ingredients. My boyfriend barely finished half of the burrito and that was an impressive feat in itself. My plate was also a generous size and after eating the rolled tacos I was pretty full. 

In short we are both full, satisfied and happy with our meal and experience. We'll definitely be back and eager to try out their other options.

I love this place - authentic, fresh Mexican food. I went there for the first time with my sister and was amazed at the good quality of the food and the service and the cleanliness of the place.  I just had a meal there with my dad.  We have found our new favorite Mexican restaurant!

Great service! We called Bruce the night my window broke and he met me at my office the next day to repair the rear window of my BMW..they already had the parts! Very nice people and great value. We will definitely be working with them again!
We order at least once a week and it always come really hot.  Drivers have always been great too.  Only thing is sometimes the dough isn't as crisp as I would like for it to be.

I cannot express how grateful I am for the level of service I receive every time I visit Midas. I've been going there for about 10 years and won't go anywhere else. Tony and his staff care about not only my vehicle but me as a person. They are honest, caring and trustworthy. If your vehicle needs work, don't go anywhere else.

Love their taco salad!
Not the best atmosphere for eating inside but great place to pick up a to go order.
This place sucks. They stop answering their phone and won't deliver 30 minutes before they close.

Dr Gerard and his staff are AWESOME! Best dental experience! They accept many different insurances and also have many options for cash paying patients. I love that they offer same day treatment, limiting your visits and time off of work.

This place is so sad. I do like their food but their customer service is the worst I have ever seen. The employees are rude and their are several items on the menu that they don't want to prepare. This is honestly the first 1 star review I have given but trust me it was well deserved.

I was incredibly impressed with how well Automotive Power Window Repair did in fixing the window on my Jeep Liberty. When I called a received a quote it was $165 for a job the dealership previously did a year ago for around $600! I then called the next day to make an appointment and they even were able to fit me in their schedule that very day. The man arrived early and finished the job within 30 minutes, for exactly the amount of the quote I was given. If any other of my power windows break I will definitely be using Automotive Power Window Repair again. I could not be more pleased with my experience with them.

I can't say enough good things about this Midas and Tony the owner. You can take his word as Gospel. There is not a more trustworthy person in the automobile industry let alone in life. Tony is someone I trust implicitly and unequivocally, and someone who I am happy to also call a friend. If you need any work done to your vehicle, no matter what what it is, Tony has you covered.

We went to Dominic's last night for dinner. I found the food to be just ok. Nothing special. I had Chicken Marsala with a side of spaghetti. The best thing about it was the bread and side salad that came with it. The spaghetti sauce was very watery and didn't have much taste. The sauce on my chicken was also very thin - I've had Chicken Marsala before at other restaurants and the sauce was thick and flavorful. Another friend had spaghetti and found the sauce to be tasteless and thin. i wouldn't recommend this restaurant when there are so many others out there that have really good food.

BEWARE, BEWARE, BEWARE  BANNER BOSWELL E.R.
Last Sunday I visited my mother and found her to be very lethargic, not alert, and generally out of it.  Her caretaker said that her feet had become very swollen, and they had not been when I saw her two weeks before.  The caretaker also said she is barely eating, and is stopped walking from her chair to the bathroom and release herself in protective panties.  She only walks in the morning from her bed in the bedroom, to chair the front room, and back again at night.

This is absolutely abnormal for my mother who usually can walk fairly rapidly throughout the house.  That she was not eating, not reading the newspaper or doing crossword puzzles which she always did.  I was very concerned and called her doctor, who responded to my call the next day, and came out to see my mother on Tuesday, performed an evaluation, and drew many vials of blood for testing.  Results came back on Friday.  The doctor, Susan Ward, called me, saying she was quite concerned because two of the blood tests came back with highly abnormal readings.  This coupled with her behavioral change and lack of eating, indicated to her, and urgent need to go to an emergency room.

Paramedics took my mom to the Banner Boswell ER on Thunderbird in Sun City.  Before any tests were taken, the doctor walked in the room after my mother had her vitals taken by a nurse, very chipper and happy with a loud voice saying you look fine.  I explained the situation and her behaviors, and he asked if she was back to normal now?  I said no, my mother did not even understand that she was in the hospital, which is totally abnormal for her.  The doctor appeared very unconcerned and says well will find out what is wrong and get her back to normal in no time.

After several vials of blood were taken and 500 mL of fluids are given, and urine obtain from a bedpan, we waited.

Now my mother has atrial fibrillation, but refuses to see a cardiologist, she has stage III chronic kidney disease, which is normal for someone 99 years old, and she did make plans to see a nephrologist.  Her heart is weak because she so inactive, due to the pain in her legs which was recently compounded by the urinary infection which was causing aches and pains and lethargy, as well as her sleepiness.

The ER doctor (Jones) came in, and said she appears to be fine, and that they were going to release her.  I strongly objected, stating my mother is not normal.  She was confused as to where she was.  She did not know what time it was.  She kept sleeping the entire time she was in the bed except when attended to by a nurse or a doctor, which is highly abnormal for her, as usually she is quite alert and talkative.

A bit thereafter a nurse came in with orders to see if my mother was mobile enough to go home, as the doctor stated that in her condition would probably be dangerous for her to go home with only a caretaker for eight hours.

Well, the mobility test consists of walking from her ER bed to the ER but room entrance which was about 7 feet, and then walking back again.  It took my mother all of four to five minutes to walk 14 feet and yet they wanted to release her.

I told the nurse how can they possibly release my mother in her condition, she is not normal.  She is confused, she cannot walk more than 14 feet with somebody helping her and with a walker, she could never make it to 50 feet to bed from her living room chair where she spends most of the day.  I emphasize that this was an entirely new condition, that until a week ago she had not had that much of a problem ambulating, eating, concentrating, reading and doing crossword puzzles.

The nurse said he would convey this information to the doctor.  The doctor never came in, instead a social worker came in, and was quite rude.

Basically she said, your mother should never have been brought to this emergency room.  There is nothing acutely wrong with her that can be treated.  She went on to say, what you should do is either putter on full hospice care, or get her the medical care she requires.

Get this, her regular doctor, Susan Ward, is the one that stated that she should be taken to the emergency room.  It was not a decision my mother made, nor that I made.  That social worker stated the options were to make her comfortable until she died, or give her the care she needs, but she cannot have both.  And she is being discharged now.  She asked whether I could stay with my mom, to which I responded that I was having hip replacement surgery in three days.  She responded "well, the doctor said she is going to be discharged even if it is only to her home with a caretaker there eight hours a day.

They absolutely refused to admit my mother and treat her for any of the conditions that she was suffering from.  My mother has a doctor that takes care of her at home, that comes to her home every three months and more often if needed, such as when she came out to draw my mother's blood and ascertained that my mo

I am really, really impressed. For the 400 dollar job @ the dealership, this place did it for 300. Thanks for the hundred bucks guys, I'm buying school supplies this week! I desperately needed my power window fixed and these guys sent out a super nice guy who got here PROMPTLY when he said he would. Oh yeah, and he CAME TO MY HOUSE... wow. I really do credit these guys with making my life easier. Thanks a bunch, will definitely pass along the good word :)
The food here is awesome.  I really loved the atmosphere, the friendly staff. It reminds me of my Italian family.

I've been to this hospital twice this past year. The first time after breaking my ankle in June, I went to this hospital because it was 5 minutes from my house. The 2nd time was recently when I had severe stomach pains, because I knew I would be treated well and quickly here. I don't know if it's because the snowbirds haven't come back yet or what, but I feel like this hospital is the west valley's best kept secret. It never seems to be too busy.  Both times I visited the ER, I was checked in and in a room within 30-45 minutes. I received compassionate care from capable and friendly staff. For both emergency surgeries (yes, 2! What a year....) I was pretty much the only patient both in pre op and post op (once on a Saturday night and once on a Tuesday...maybe because it was at night?) Both my osteo surgeon, Dr. Benoit and internal surgeon, Dr. Huang were fantastic. The PA's and nurses were so wonderful. Nothing but love for this place!

I don't know what happened, but this place has  gone downhill over the last 6-8 months. Brown guacamole 2 weeks ago and this time all my tacos were undercooked.  I usually have to ask for salsa in the drive thru and they have a combo that they sell on the window for $6, but if you order it off the menu with a drink it's  $8.99. Yep, $3 for a drink. It often comes down to whomever is working the front. It's sad because I used to love this place for the food and value, but now it's not good for either.
The team at Midas Sun City are some of the best I've met. Honest, caring and reliable. Always willing to go the extra mile and make things right.
Rude, slacking in customer service, food was horrible and taste like it was sitting all day. Salas were mostly empty and very dirty all around.

Terrible terrible customer courtesy. The tall grey haired man who runs shop front desk is rude and obnoxious. He does not exhibit an ounce of common courtesy or personality. Rude mean and terrible service

This company is an example of how customer service should be done! Always answer the phones in person. Quick responses to emails. As a board member of a challenging condo association, it means the world to me when I can randomly call my management company and access one if the owners!!! If you ever find yourself in a position to hire PRM....do it! They are well above the normal standard in Arizona.

What an incredibly vibrant and fun place. Went on a Friday night and everything about this place screams a great time. A band who actually sang in Italian, patrons who danced, homemade food and great decor. I had the stuffed manicotti which was so good i just kept eating even after I was full. For dessert we had the pumpkin cannoli which melted in our mouths. The service was perfect. We will definitely be making more visits here.

Dad was here today in the radiation department for a surgical procedure.  The surgery was delayed almost three hours due to the anesthesiologist not being present and two nurses who were not in.  Once they got him into recovery, the staff there was more concerned with gossiping and eating than attending to dad.  If I had not been there to sit with him he would have gotten up out of his bed and fallen.  No one checked on him even though an alarm was going off due to him trying to get up.  Dad was in extreme pain and no one would give him anything for it because no doctor was available.    Extremely unorganized and poor patient care all around.   I'm not happy at all and would not recommend this place.  Terrible experience.

Just pulled into Surprise for a month long stay and found Dominic's for a late night dinner. Wow!!! The service, the atmosphere and the food are all crazy good. Dominic himself is singing classic lounge music and the dance floor is packed. Then it turns to current pop! This is truly the definition of a family restaurant - the owners are on the floor with all the customers and everyone seems to know them. I will definitely come back - maybe every Saturday while I'm in town! Food: chicken Picatta - they had me at extra capers. Chicken Parm - tender and the breading was delish. Cannoli - yum! ... and the best salted caramel gelato I have ever had. My hat's off to this gem of a place!!!

I love this Frys, not only do they have a Starbucks inside but they have a sushi and salad bar.  The sushi is made daily, and it taste amazing.  As far as the rest of the grocery store, they have the biggest selection of items I have seen at a Frys, including 2 full aisles of organic items!

I have lived in AZ for 11 years now and I have had a hard time finding a dentist I like and trust. That was until I came to this office!!!  They are friendly and professional.   So friendly they share there DOUGHNUTS with me!  Dr. Gerard always makes sure his clients are happy and keeps his office ethical.   There are not many doctors like that around anymore.  Thank you Doc!!!!!

Decided to try Dominic's last night and were we glad we did! Very friendly and attentive wait staff...our water glasses were kept full which I like. All 3 of us tried something different-chicken parmigiana, chicken Marsala & baked penne and throughly enjoyed our meal. The bread is great, homemade chicken soup was tasty and had to try the cassada cake which was very good. We enjoyed the musician playing the keyboard & singing and there were quite a few couples dancing. We will definitely return!!

I drove twice the time in the opposite direction from the SC west PO location today (because they are terrible) and I was thinking as I was driving holy cow this is twice as long just to get here - but I walked in with 3 people ahead of me in line - and I was the next person with in 60 seconds, in and out within 2 minutes with a "here you go your all set, have a nice day!" Granted - no snowbirds this time of year - being new to the area I was coming to this post office before I found the sun city west location and it gets crowded in the fall and winter (what PO doesn't that time of year?!) But with my small business I frequent post offices everywhere I go - and this one has always moved fast when I go in and they have always been very accommodating and helpful..... I don't mind driving twice as far, at all.
Tony and Mary are the best!  They have a life-long customer. In all my years I have never met a more honest and caring company.
Stopped in for a burrito and Horchata. The Senor burrito was huge! Enough for lunch and dinner or can easily feed two people.
Great food! We ordered delivery and the pizza and wings were very warm when they arrived.

Came in on a Friday night to pick up some items with coupons. The minute the cashier saw coupons in my hand, she gave me the death stare. I picked up 8 packs of dryer sheets and 8 bottles of triaminic. She looked at me and said, "Did you even leave any for us?" Why helloooo to you too, wench. As a matter of fact, I was going to give this woman some coupons for the medicine since I would be getting the item for free with coupon. I was planning on donating the most of it anyway because I only have one child. I offered some to her anyway and still, rude. I have to say I'm new to couponing at dollar tree and don't know what the policy is. Turns out my $2/1 triaminic product would be reduced down to $1 and there is a limit of 4 identical coupons per transactions.  All she had to do was explain that to me. I certainly did not deserve the disrespect she gave me. I politely asked if I could void 4 out of the 8 triaminics since no coupons would be qapplied to it. The manager told her that when she voids the products, she will need to rescan all of my coupons as well. She did not hide that fact that she was just plain annoyed of me and gave out a long sigh and mumbled something under her breath. I can't see what I've done wrong here. I tried to follow their coupon policy and nothing I am doing is shady or illegal. Why take coupons if your employees are treating customers this way?
We bought the beef box last year. Just bought beef and chicken. Haven't had an issue, makes dinner planning easier and cuts my cost on half for meat. Will buy in the future

So all of the guys at work were raving about this place so I finally decided to give it a try. And let me tell you I was pleasantly surprised! It has such a quaint interior with some pretty high tech registers and it is really clean. The food is fresh and was delicious. You definitely have to try their salsa verde. It's KILLER. ;) I would definitely recommend giving this place a try if you've been skeptical. It's definitely worth your while.

I was a little worried when I got there and the doors were locked- I was early and I guess they were with another client. My fears increased when I went in the building-it left a lot to be desired-bare bones and no frills. Now with all that said the massage was "great" and really what else matters- since I spent the next 90 minutes with my eyes closed. I went for a 90 minute massage and got a 90 minute massage for a "great" price-I had a"groupon".

Wow! These guys were amazing!  Tyler was super easy to work with and very patient with me and my project. I priced MANY other places all over the Phoenix area, and not only was Tag Team faster, but less expensive and they seemed to want my business, unlike several other sign shops. Huge thanks to Tag Team for a job well done and and for your friendly staff!
Cheers!
Dr Patel was easy to talk to & knowledgeable, she took care of my concern & requested a follow up to make sure my eye was healed. That staff was nice & friendly

Tried the carnitas burrito with red Chile. Excellent! Very flavorful and filling. If you really like spicy, try it with the diablo salsa. 

Definitely going to sample other items on their menu when I get the chance.
Ordered a sign very well done in a timely manner very helpful staff and friendly. Will definitely recommend and use over and over again!!!good job guys!!!

If you have never been to a dollar tree ,you don't know what you are missing . This is a place you can buy just about anything you can think of. Candy galore and much cheaper than the movie theatre. House cleaning or decorating supplies. Pet supplies, handy little household tools and if your hungry you can find frozen foods, lunch supplies and dessert. Cards for all occasions, books and toys. Take a break and stroll thru a dollar store sometime, you might be amazed.

I work in Peoria and recently discovered a real gem here!  Their customer service is awesome. And better yet, the food is amazing. The quantities and quality are the best!  I've already been back once this week and will be back more, that's for sure!!!  Thanks Senor Taco

Fast. Easy. Convenient. 
They got me in for an appointment same day and I was out in 30 minutes. 
AMAZING service!

Have shopped here for over a decade.  
I've had major issues twice, most recently the lack of stock/replenish overall, but more troubling, on 1st Wednesdays.  The past year has become more noticable decline.  My list must be adjusted, amended, abandoned as there is no product available after 12 noon.  This includes their flyer-featured SALES items.  Once inventory is depleted, it stays that way for the rest of the day-nite, sometimes for days.

Spending MY valuable time running down 'floor' workers to 'check in the back', several times a visit is the definition of insanity. The manager reports that 'everyone who shops there is happy!'  Corporate was ameliorative but the result of that contact is yet to be experienced.  Store management is in constant flux, as if Sun City is a 'waystation' to better things.

As to the "most dangerous place on earth", the PARKING LOT, where painted lines, aisles, and lanes are apparently 'conceptual' to many shoppers.... I bought a dash cam and stay out of the central core.  Bad driving habits are one thing; incivility and anger issues are prevalent. 

It seems as some seniors are not aware of the ubiquitness of cameras, in & out of the store; a feature I pointed out to the lady that jammed her 'scooter chair' in reverse, onto my foot and left it there while snarlng "How you like THAT?"  She had been yelling at a cashier after checking out, I HAD checked out behind her, yet she continued.  I asked to get around her to go home.   She attempted to 'engage' me with her unhappiness.  Um, no; behave yourself.
I did have a word with mgmt on the way out, as I don't like bullies and the cashier was graceful under assault.

Best Italian food I have had in a long time. The atmosphere is great and the employees are very friendly. I had the chicken parmigiana and was it was delicious and had great flavors. Also my favorite part was the cannoli that I had for dessert!!! Excellent food and service and hot and fresh food comes out.

Best carne fries I've ever had... That says a lot because I order them all the time from various Mexican food locations around Phoenix and Tucson.
I only have 4 stars because the place doesn't seem very clean and the service isn't always friendly.
I've had the enchiladas meal which is pretty good.  The sauce is a little to tomato-y for me though.  I've also had many of their burritos which are always good.  The fish tacos are hit or miss ( I've had good ones there and very gross ones).  I never order the fish tacos anymore because of two bad experiences I had where I'm pretty sure the fish was no good.
Awesome beef taco. Not in love with enchiladas (too tomatoe). But also enjoy shrimp burrito ----best Mexico food on area --wish they were open later

I love this Fry's! Sure, it's right in the center of the senior capitol of Arizona, but you just need to figure out when to go (any time after 5pm - any day of the week).

The store is HUGE! They have an awesome sushi bar with fresh made sushi, their produce is some of the best I have seen at a grocery store, and the customer service is great! Also, their overall selection of products is second to none.

Recently, I have been going to WinCo for the slightly lower prices, but I may just start going back to Fry's.

I order the same pizza all the time online. The last two pizzas delivered were wrong. I talked to the manager and he said he would fix it and send it right back out. He did and he put the same toppings on, from the wrong pizza. Today I ordered again and they got it wrong again. How hard it it to order sliced sausage and mushroom on a thin crust. Instead they put tiny sausage and mushroom on a regular pizza. When your kids thinks it rat poop and won't eat it. I don't want your free pizza i just want you to get it right... Hello pizza hut

I can't say it enough, this place is so dang yummy.  Portions are very good for the price.  Dishes are incredibly flavorful.  I try to get something different every time. The Diablo is crazy spicy. I had the shrimp burrito tonight and it was so goooood! I will be so mad if my next trip out here to see my mum...they close. And I will blame that hideous, god awful sign of Del Webb.  It is an eyesore & blocks it's visibility when heading west on Bell road.

I just can't come here anymore. Nancy, one cashier in particular, is so rude, and has been for years. I'm done. No one 'wants' to work at Dollar Tree, I'm sure, but no one has a gun to your head either Nancy. 
The store itself is fine, but I've just had one too many huffs, eye rolls and groans from her sour puss, so I'll find another Dollar Store. 
There are many- shop an another friends.

Trusting someone with your eyesight has to be one of the most important decisions that an individual can make. I trusted Southwestern Eye Center and at first, I thought I may regret it...

What you have to understand is that I had very poor eyesight, with stigmatisms in both eyes. Not too far from not being able to get the procedure. I had PRK, which is a longer recovery period, but more stable of a surgery.

I'm 8 months post opp and for the first time in 35 years, I can completely operate without glasses or contacts.

My eyesight is 20/20 in my right eye and 20/25 in my left.

I would highly recommend Southwestern Eye Center to anyone!

Excellent. Freshly baked bread. Good portions for the prices. Good sauces. Everything was cooked fresh. Mother ordered shrimp scampi. Said it was excellent. I had the Chicken Parm with fettuccine Alfredo. Very good. Not too noisy. Owners are from New York so you know you will get fresh authentic Italian food. Will definately return.

Excellent food. Had cheese enchilada and beef taco, better or good as any sit down Mexican restaurant.  Nice people. I'd skip the nachos, like Taco Bell nachos but bigger. But everything else is great.

I read the two good reviews here on Yelp, so I was looking forward to a good Italian dinner.  Unfortunately, it must have been an off night.  The waitress didn't want to be bothered and the meatballs and the tomato sauce on the spaghetti didn't have much flavor.  That's the test of a good Italian restaurant for me.  If the sauce is good, they usually get thumbs up.  This sauce wasn't "bad," but it was bland and watery.  Even the bowl of spaghetti wasn't drained properly so there was a dripping, runny mess at the bottom of the paltry bowl of pasta.  This place is right around the corner from my house and Dominic is my brother's name!  So I was really disappointed.

When I first moved into my community, we were managed by another company. I use the word 'managed' very loosely. We have people hoarding on their patios. Abilkion cats. Cracked sidewalks and buildings. Furniture suites left at dumpsters. 4" year old trees that haven't been trimmed or watered for at least 5 years. At least we HAD trees, lost about half of them this past storm season. I personally asked for 2 lights to be fixed about 5x and never once got an answer from those people. 
Then PRM was hired and it was like the lifeboat had been launched. Lights fixed immediately. Lawn maintenance began that same week. We got a laundry room update that brought us into the 21st century. Notices about water outages due to repairs, pest control, even managed to get some trees trimmed. I think our board gave them about 6 months it seemed, to fix everything wrong with this property, that took a decade of neglect to fall onto such disrepair. Apparently PRM was not quick enough for the board. We now have the prior management company. And I don't have lights again, water shut off for 3 days without any notice, AC turned off for winter without any notification, board meeting schedule changed and guess what - no notice so nobody went. Best part, rather than take time and invest a little bit of our astronomical fees back into the property and landscaping, ie plant some grass seed (and WATER it) - we're getting a bunch of rocks where there was grass, I'm sure more trees will just fall over, it's scary to walk at night with all the lights missing, buildings look like they're falling apart. I was actually told we can't afford lightbulbs...????   And we won't get minutes from meetings, notices of construction, told you need a permit before you get towed from your own spot, a phone call answered or a message returned... I knew it was bad before, but after having a real company for a short time, I'm ready to try to sell and get out. Before the rocks are dumped... .  
Didn't mean to complain too much but I tell ya, I desperately miss PRM already. Hire them. You'll get results. Even when they have to fight the board every inch of the way. :(
YUM!!! They season their food unlike a lot of Mexican restaurants I've been to. Their portions are huge and they are delicious!! Enough said.

I had an individual Pan Pizza and it was very good.  Next time I forgot to say "pan" and found the flat pizza to be hard and sub par.  Service varies from good to fair.  Atmosphere is Italian, with lots of Rat Pack pictures all over the walls.  It says they take reservations, but I heard someone say to the hostess that they had been told that they did not take reservations.  So, I guess a reservation is a maybe yes and maybe no, depending on the day.  All in all, it was a good restaurant.  Worth a try.

For the reviewer who found the crowd to be older, well, this is in Sun City.

The employees here are quick getting everyone through the line. I have to drive a bit out of my way for this location, but it's worth it with the time I save. Usually government workers are known as inefficient, but not this group! I am always impressed!

As a home owner, and now a several years running board member of our small, but active, HOA here in Phoenix I can tell you first hand two things- 1.) You want to be professionally managed. 2.) Give PRM a worthwhile chance, they have been fantastic for us for over 10 years!  

Hiring a management company is very much like forming a relationship.  Each party needs time "to adjust. Time to see what has been done to the community, what needs to be done in the community, and most importantly what the community will need to protect itself. Paul & Sue, and their competent staff, are very professional, and most of all has integrity. They have been a HUGE asset to my time as a board member and our property values now reflect that.

PRM can help you learn the ropes on keeping your community accountable, infiltrating new procedures that will help keep up property values, stay in line with HOA laws, and basically how to address certain issues so the community can overcome them and everyone can benefit. 

But, it does take & need actual home owners, who live in the community, to step up and volunteer their time!  A management company cannot run a community all by itself, from afar, it needs a few individuals to be accountable, be involved, communicate with them,  and most of all be willing to see the 'end result'.

Remember, you are only as strong as your weakest link in your community. In my personal opinion these poor & harshly negative reviews on this site could potentially be from holders of delinquent accounts. No one likes the 'bill collector' but when an HOA doesn't get paid the WHOLE community suffers! HOA's and communities fall apart from lack of community involvement, home owners not paying their dues, and/or poorly elected board members that make decision that are not in the best interest of the community then PRM is "forced" to act on their directions..... not the other way around.

PRM can be a big help to keep your community progressing IF you are willing to form the relationship and be active in your community..... give PRM a try, we have been professionally managed by them for over 10 years and been VERY HAPPY with their service, you won't regret it.

We had a wonderful family lunch at Dominic's today and I highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys excellent Italian food and a friendly atmosphere. The Sesame Bread is made fresh daily and it was fabulous. I ordered the fettuccine alfredo with chicken and it was excellent. The service was very friendly, Dominic came out and greeted us and talked to the kids. The ambience was very old Hollywood I would highly recommend this place, it is very friendly, very local, and we will be returning.
Great experience. Wonderful staff! Dr. Gerard is the best in the business! Zero pain!

I ordered dinner for my family from this location, the order NEVER came, i then received a phone call 5 hours later at MIDNIGHT stating he rang the door bell and there was no answer, which never happened.  My card had already been charged.  Then I call to talk to a manager today, in an attempt to replace the order for pickup, INSTEAD I get the manager, KIM, on the line who was EXTREMELY RUDE to me, and basically told me I should have called the night when it was placed to have the matter resolved, and this was MY fault.   I will NEVER do Buisness with dominos EVER again. I highly suggest looking elsewhere for your pizza needs.

Quaint and lively Italian bistro! Great atmosphere and energy!!  Refreshing to see such vitality in Sun City!   Enjoy fresh baked bread,  authentic lasagna and traditional Italian cassata cake!  My personal fave is the Chicken Piccata..tender chicken topped with light fresh lemon butter and capers compliments the pasta and homemade tomato sauce.  You can then dance the night away to live entertainment Wednesday,  Fridays and Saturdays!  Friendly and welcoming locals and a great house band.

This hospital is close to my grandma's house so we had no choice but to take her here since it was an emergency. We arrived about 9:30 at night and waited in the lobby. There were stains on the arm rests so we had to wipe it down with some disinfectant wipes. We were across from a poor crying toddler and we knew he was uncomfortable. He and his mom must have been there a while and no one from the check in window came out to reassure the mom that they are doing their best to find him a room. 

We were told that my grandma would be in a room within 20 mins. Waited for 45 mins and I had to go up and ask and remind them we have been waiting. Finally got in. The doc seemed to think he knew more about my grandma's symptoms and interrupted us every time we explained her symptoms . He didn't want to hear anything. We couldn't find the nurse that was assigned to us yet, there were 5 to 6 nurses at the station just shooting the s***. The tech guy who drew the blood talked about weird stuff and when a patient was screaming, he made a smart a** comment that I won't repeat.

The night staff lacked the quality of care and service. They were arrogant and dismissive. The only reason why I'm giving them 2 stars is because,  the daytime nurse and doc that my grandma had was excellent. They listened and helped us understand the discharge summary and meds. Very disappointed with the night crew. Most of your patients are seniors and they should not be made fun of or talked down to. That also goes for the families that are there. Show some respect and compassion with your patients.
They are bankrupt now so please be careful i would never say these things if i hadn't had such a bad experience with this shop after five years dealing with them but now they are broke and bankrupt
This place has the best carne asada fries! Great size portions, prices aren't bad, and I just can't say enough how much I love the carne fries. I go here weekly.

King auto is the worst place to take your car because it has bootlegged mechanic and they are bankrupt so they are over charging people for everything so please don't take your car to them because they are rude and they get angry when they can't rip you off any more.I have been going to them for five years until they ripped off my warranty co and his partner Doug wanted to talk to me like he had no since,that man is crazy and i think it has a lot to due with the fact that they are bankrupt and broke

Please please don't ever take your car to this place for any major repair because they will mess up your car and tomorrow i will report them to my warranty co because they changed the warranty co 1200.00 dollars to fix my fuel pump and it is not fixed so they will get sued for doing a crappie job so i can get my car fixed right

I said l would not leave a negative review, however l have to tell the truth about my experience at King Auto. Dan is a really nice person, but l initially brought my Audi in for a check engine light. I was told later many times that my car was fixed. I did have a second opinion confirming a blown head gasket. King Auto reassured me the car was fixed, However it ran worst then before an in fact blew a head gasket on the freeway. Seven months, yes seven months later my car is complete. The roof is ruined due to leaving it outside, as well as the gas door broken. I can only imagine the gas was siphoned. There was also exspensive an personal items missing from my vehicle..of which none of were accounted for. I was very disappointed by the lack of professionalism as well as effort. They did pay towing charges as well as an uber fee. l did pay the fee asked, yet to no avail the very next week the  check engine light came back on again. Without a doubt the worst experience. Do your homework.

I saw the last mexican restaurent go under at this location because they were selling illegal drugs in addition to the lousy food. Im really contemplating the same with these owners. My little Italian grandmother often said: soap and water is cheap. So why do so many taco shops have so much difficulty with cleanliness?  Its simply because they dont care. So being a rational 50 year old man, if the bathroom is dirty is the the kitchen clean? You fill in the blanks. 

Food is way over priced for what you get. I have been around in the food industry and mexican is the least expensive. Taste is so so. The staff is not so friendly. The list goes on. If I want to visit a dirty over priced taco shop with mediocre food with crappy service ,I can go to Tijuana and it least get it cheaper. Sorry owners, go to a corporate restaurant business and copy there business model and you will have more people than you can serve.

Adios Senior Taco...........
Great Italian food, best lasagna I've had in the valley, the bread with sesame seeds is amazing/
Kings automotive is an amazing place to get your vehicle taken care of...Dan really cares about what he's doing, they are truthful and hard working! They always communicate.

Tonight I ordered the medium pizza deal with a soda, parmesan bites, and cinnamon bites. I ordered one of the pizzas with alfredo sauce and when it was delivered, it came with some sort of garlic sauce. Not a big deal! I had my little sister call back to see if we could get the correct order and was put on hold. After several minutes, we received an apology and was told that the correct pizza would be delivered within a half hour. An hour and a half later, after no delivery, I personally called and spoke to a girl who gave me a little more than attitude when I told her the dilemma and asked me to hold. I then spoke to "J.D." who quite rudely told me that he had taken my order and I did not in fact order alfredo sauce on my pizza and that when we were put on hold, I was to speak to him and hung up on him. Although completely untrue, I still apologized. J.D. continued to be rude to me. They told me that they'd deliver the correct pizza, which they did. I would have been more than happy to pay for it, however, the immense amount of "sass" I received from J.D., whom I assume is the manager, was extremely uncalled for and unappreciated.

Finding a good and HONEST mechanic (or shop) is like striking gold.  I first met Dan (owner) when he was the owner and manager of the Big O Tire shop in Surprise.  I took my wife's car to that particular Big O shop for a tire repair due to the fact that his shop had such great reviews (if it is still on here, check out the reviews for his former shop - the Big O Tire at Bell & Grand in Surprise) .  I was immediately impressed with Dan's personal-level customer service. I noticed that most of the people coming into the shop were on a first-name-basis with Dan and the employees, which told me that he had a lot of repeat business (which means satisfied customers).  I became one of those satisfied customers myself.

A couple of years ago, the Big O tire shop closed, but fortunately for me Dan opened a much smaller auto repair shop in Sun City... King Automotive Repair.  I have had all three of our cars in his shop for various work ranging from routine oil changes, to brakes, coolant, suspension etc.  As a repeat customer, I've been VERY impressed each and every time I visit his shop. Typically I meet other customers who are as trilled with their service as I am.  On many occasions I've seen them pass on opportunities to make "easy money" in favor of giving the vehicle's owner the type of honest advice they would give their own family members.   For me, this morning was just one such day - as I suspected that I possibly had a coolant leak in my wife's Saab 9-3 convertible.  After pressure checking the coolant lines, no leaks were found or detected and everything looks solid.  When I asked when I owed for the diagnostic work, Dan explained "Nah I'm not going to charge for something like that - the great news is there's nothing wrong with the car!"  So I was out the door for the price of a handshake.  This shop continually impresses me, which compelled me to write this review.

I think Dan (and the guys) realize that a business can be run successfully by following the golden rule.  People as smart as these guys realize that when they treat you honestly and with respect when you come in for a $30 service job, you will remember them and bring your car to them when you need the more serious work done.  I am always excited to refer friends over to King Automotive Repair.

If I could give six stars, I would.  Like I said - finding a good and honest mechanic is like finding gold.  I struck gold with King Automotive Repair.

- Cory, El Mirage, AZ

Fantastic food at super prices. Combos drop in price to $5.00 after 5:00. It's a great deal with such delicious food. The employee were friendly and gave super recommendations. We'll definitely be back and make it our go to restaurant when in west Phoenix. Make sure to give it a try!
Great food I ordered the all you can fish wow, it was good I would recommend this to anyone who looking for something to eat

Excellent service! I was not able to make changes to my pc because of some setting problems I couldn't fix. Thankfully he knew how to fix it, Great Job! Definitely returning if I have any further problems with my pc!

We just returned from another fun shopping 'trip' to Al's Meat Market. Loaded up on several fresh cut meats and delicious sausages at fair market prices. Everything is always so fresh and nutritious; no preservatives. The owner Al is always there is answer our many questions and provide excellent recommendations on selection and preparation. We know what we're getting here vice a big box grocery store. The shop is easy to get to and has plenty of free store-front parking. We'll be back again and again. Sincerely, Art & Karen Huseonica, Sun City, AZ

Please don't go here. My truck got towed here after it stopped on me. The new owner Ray Sanchez said they would diagnose it for free. So they called me the next day and told me they need to replace the throttle body and the crank pos sensor my husband was going to take care of the throttle body. He said diagnostic would $120 and if they fix it they would deduct that of the total. Well I had them go ahead and replace the sensor and it was going to be $138.12 part and $144 labor plus $10 shop fee and $8.98 taxes. So I told him out the door is what? I calculated $181.10 and he put me on hold and came back also with that price. I got there the next day to pay and it was $301.82 I told him that is not what we discussed over the phone and he started yelling and raised his voice where I had to get a little loud just so I can say anything. He didn't even take into consideration that's that my 8 year old  son right next to me. So we went thru the numbers and he said no he didn't say that and said he can take it out if I didn't want to pay so I told him to take it out and he charged me the $120 diagnostic fee +$10 shop fee. I payed it and they took part off and brought my truck back. My husband and I heard the same thing and he said he didn't say that price. He yelled in front of other customers and as a new owner he should have stuck to what he said. Well my husband just fixed the truck and guess what nothing by the sensor looks disturbed. Usually when someone works on a vehicle its clean or surrounding area is disturbed also. Plus some bolts didn't even get tooken out and you need to to get that part. So imagine if I payed for the whole thing and they didn't do nothing. Please take it from me they are scam artist and I feel bad for all the older people that take there vehicles in. Please don't take your vehicle here.

I've been living on this side of town for over 4 years and have driven by the "Iowa beef" sign almost daily when I finally wised up and stopped in this amazing place. Why oh why did it take me so long!? 

Al's is a small butcher shop but they carry everything you could ever dream of in regards to meat.  Chicken, beef, pork, they even have homemade sauce and meatballs!  It's a carnivores fantasy. 

They grind their own beef right there and it's out of this world! 85/15 and just the most delicious flavor (you can request the fat ratio you'd prefer if this isn't to your liking). The beef is antibiotic free and hormone free too! Chicken is free range, they have lamb and veal upon request too! Not to mention deli selection,  and trays too! Whoa, overload here. 

If you're looking for a great butcher and shop and want to know where your meat is coming from this is the place for you.  Believe me, you won't be disappointed.  Mmm Mmm mmmmmmmm.

I broke my arm and have been to this facility many times, for treatment and physical therapy.  The doctors at the Core Institute are top notch.  The physical therapists are good but I noticed a high turnover rate in the physical therapy dept.  Just as I would get comfortable with a therapist, that person would quit (4 therapists in 2 months). Still, not that big of a deal. What is a big deal to me is  the people in the front area.  They are indifferent and borderline on being rude.  They give the impression that they have more important things to do besides checking you in.  Once you are checked in, plan on waiting at least an hour to see your doctor.  Also, plan on holding a minimum of 15 min when calling to make an appt.  In a nutshell, the doctors are very good, everything else - not so much.
Update 8/22/17: Thank you Allison from the Core Institute for your reply.   However, I do not see why I would involve your 'dedicated Patient Advocate', as I do not have any 'questions or concerns'.  I feel Yelp is the appropriate place to let others know of my experience with the Core Institute and looking at reviews left by others, I'm not the only person who feels this way.

Snuggled into the corner of a strip mall in Sun City West, the Ghostlight Theatre hosts some of the West Valley's most special gems in the acting world. The theater seats about 50 people and has a stage that's just the right size for smaller ensembles. We enjoyed Nunsense recently and the cast was well-rehearsed and flawless. The lights and sounds were comparable to a full size theater. We were able to purchase our tickets online and our seats were assigned. 
We were very impressed and look forward to going back!

I highly recommend Gasser Dental.  Nothing short of amazing was my experience.  From the moment I walked in for a consultation I was blown away by the professional, honest and caring way I was treated.  I always felt a certain way about going to the dentist but this experience has changed my perception.  Do yourself a favor if your looking for a Dentist and see for yourself.  You won't be sorry.

It is always scary and/or nerve wracking to have a situation that you need to see a lawyer for.  I have to say that Moore Law Firm is wonderful to work with.  I spoke with Bob who listened and the time he spent with me was very valuable.  I can't say enough about this firm and their ability to be sensitive to the needs of a client.  Bob was extremely through and was able to answer all of my questions.
Change there shipping based on unknown criteria. Just tried to ship the same package to the same place price was doubled. Take it to the terminal . Bad business
