Well we showed up for our 12 pm apt and the lady at the front desk told me the doctor was 40 minutes late. I asked ypu didn't call to let us know? The receptionist was rude and said oh well we dont do that.
Great place!! Fresh meat!! Al is very personable...love this place...won't go anywhere else!! Thank you!!! #gem
Service and kind faces are wonderful here!  A breakfast service that is not worthy of the Amazing pancake!   Mamma Americanna

Sometimes people leave harsh reviews especially when there's bad news about their vehicle and especially when somebody has tinkered with it before they take it to a professional.
I have had nothing but a good relationship with my mechanic.
To the gang at Pete Nelson's thanks for looking out for the Customer.

This company is fantastic. They went out of there way to accommodate us and get our home cooled back down in the middle of a hot humid rain storm.  The new unit they installed is so quiet we do not even know when it is running.
We highly recommend Bob Brown and his team, fast, honest and economical.

I wish I read the Yelp reviews first. What a horrible experience! I waited over 2hrs to see the MD for 5min of humiliation . He was extremely rude and unkind, suggesting that I was wasting his time (while he was fully compensated for the mere minutes he spent being awfully rude.)  he did not examine me. I was desperately looking for help, I am suffering from terrible back and neck pain for a long long time. I left his office shocked and stunned. As I was walking out into the bright sunlight, I bumped into a total stranger who flashed me a sweet smile for free. I was reminded of how beautiful kindness is. I will not drive by that place, let alone enter it. I walked away inspired to be more kind and gentle. I pray that this brute of a human being will never be in my situation, but if it happened, I pray that he will be treated with kindness and gentleness. His office called back a few days later to tell me I have a prescription for physical therapy. I cringed and declined picking it up. I will never go there ever again. May he find peace.

For starters, this review is written by a mechanic. I have never seen such poor service, incompetence, and lack of willingness to fix a problem until coming to this shop. Horrid communication between staff and customers. They fixed my original issue but in doing so they created a new one which was no less serious and took them months NOT to fix. Instead, we bypassed the problem which considerably decreased the value on my vehicle and even that solution was carried through incorrectly. I literally spent thousands of dollars for them to do nothing. To add insult to injury, they were incredibly disrespectful throughout the process. Do NOT bring your vehicle here. Had I been any less knowledgeable about vehicles I would have paid them considerably more and still be left with a non functioning vehicle. At the very least, I should have been completely refunded and again, this is coming from a mechanic. I gave them ample opportunity to remedy their mistakes and time and time again they failed to do so. They are an absolute disgrace to the industry. Had there been an option, I would have given zero stars.

I am so grateful to John from Surv pro.  I woke at 4 am to a flood in my laundry room, garage, breakfast room and part of my dinning room.  I called at 4 am and John was at my house by 5;15 AM vacuuming up the water from a burst hot water heater. John was professional and quick. he returned    to check on the drying fans  for 2 days after.  I would recommend 'JOHN"  for any water, restoration problems in the west Valley.  Excellent customer service.

i had give them a star in order to say anything. my mother took her car to ger her oil and ac charged. $800 later and her ac worked 4days. they charged her for a brand new ac compressor that didn't look new. she took it back and they couldn't fix it. i took it to a different shop and they fixed it and told us that they have heard many bad things about them and the manager joe. people stay away fron them.go any other place but here.

I see Dr Gorman here but not anymore. His staff is horrible. I had an appt in July but they decided to close for a meeting and forgot to tell me! I showed up to a closed, dark office. I called to ask what was up & the lady was like, "oh, you are right, you do have an appt but we forgot to call you and change it, oops!" And she giggled! Unacceptable! And u can't get an appt here for months out! 
I finally called and got one recently - December! I was told I could be put on a cancellation list, if one came sooner they'd bump me up. Well, one did. Gormans asst Diana called me and said they'd see me next day. We had a lengthy conversation about it and I even repeated the time and day back to her, had her repeat it back to me! But when I went the next day, she denied our call even took place! She was not only rude, but tried to say it must've been one of my other docs. I tried to show her in my phone but she refused to look. She could have at least apologize but no - just very rude and unprofessional. No care for the patient at ALL. Diana is awful! Don't go here!

Convenient location ! Very friendly and helpful staff. The store has had a change of ownership it seems and the new owners are doing a great job. They now have better pricing and improved range of services.

I have been attending Master Stephanie's class for a couple of months now, and have really noticed a difference in my energy! I am in the Air Force, and started going to the classes to get in shape. I recently had a fitness assessment, and got a 90, the highest scored I've ever received! If you are on the fence about trying Tai Chi, try a class, I promise you won't be disappointed!

Wonderful little cafe! Found it on Yelp, was not disappointed. I've had Cuban sandwiches all over the country, this one was the best. Great, friendly service, good prices, great value! Do yourself a favor, SAVE ROOM FOR DESSERT! All delicious.

The first time I came here I had a cup of New England clam chowder. The soup was the best clam chowder I've ever had. Creamy,savory,clammy,hot. This soup was neither bland or grainy. So go on Friday. I like this little place. Very clean and neat. And everybody is very friendly, smiling and seem to enjoy their jobs. The second time I had a California chicken club. That was tasty. The French fries are the wedge kind and beware they are served piping hot. So don't burn your tongue. Thanks Betty, see you on Friday!

Noreen was the rudest person I've met in a LONG time. 1. She ignored us. 2. She treated a coworker with complete contempt and 3. She couldn't ship our chairs (I know, we were stupid to purchase chairs here but they're perfect) for the same price the UPS store down the street could. I'm not saying they were close, it was a $500 difference. Not only was this pooh poohed by her she kept using the phrase, "We're a franchise. We do it our way." Well, UPS this should be an eye opener for you and have a little more control over the stupidity of one 'franchise' employee disparaging the UPS brand. We have friends that own a franchise in Minnesota and we know that this would NOT be tolerated. Needless to say, it's likely this franchise will go out of business very soon. By the way it is store number 5360.

DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY IF YOU ARE ELDERLY OR DISABLED.

BOB BROWN EXPERTS 
HEATING & AIR CONDITIONING
Address: 10020 W Santa Fe Dr, Sun City, AZ 85351
Hours: * Open 24 hours
Phone 623-243-4517

I am 70 years old. My daughter is 49 and physically disabled, confined to wheelchair. On Friday August 26, at 9 pm, we awoke and noticed the house was hot. 89 degrees.  The air-conditioning had stopped working. I called Bob Brown Experts at 9:30 pm after I Googled them and saw the "Open 24hr" advertisement. I spoke to Ariana, explained our serious situation and she gave me pricing w/coupon and said tech named Tim would call me within a couple of hours with an ETA. No call. I called again at 12:40 am and spoke to Cindy. She said she would call manager and leave message of urgency. Again, Tim was the tech on call and would call soon with an ETA. No call. House is now up to 92 degrees. I called again at at 2:50 am. Again, the person I spoke to said they would call the manager "again" and tell them this was a priority call. NO CALL BACK! At 5:30 am, now feeling sick, I called and spoke to Becky. She told me the "OPEN 24 HOURS" only meant they take messages for the company for 24 hours. She would put this as a priority for them when the office opened at 8 am. Well guess what....they never did call us back.  Not even to this day. This company strung us along all night long...otherwise we would have gone to a hotel had they been honest in the above advertisement. My daughter is totally physically disabled and we both have hypertension and became nauseous. My daughter can't move about and really got overheated. 
A company representative returned my complaint call today, Tuesday August 29, and apologized.

Don't trust them! (Now an Exxon, dba Sun City Union, Complete Auto Service) I took my vehicle in and they said I needed a bunch of work done (over $1,000 worth). They looked at things I didn't ask them to look at. Then when I refused the work they said I needed, the owner (Ray Sanchez) got mad, charged me for the labor anyway, and wouldn't give me my vehicle back until I paid every penny. Including a "shop supply" fee that he never mentioned up front. The next day I took my vehicle elsewhere and was told that almost all of the work this shop suggested didn't need to be done and that this shop had over tightened my brakes so I was "riding" my brakes all the way from one shop to the next (17 miles). This wouldn't cause me to crash, but would cause my brand new brakes to wear down too fast, not to mention kill my gas mileage and over work my engine and transmission. I wonder how many senior citizens in this community get ripped off by this place.

The owners, Al and Trudy and their staff don't just sell the meat, they're knowledgeable about all the cooking techniques as well. Their customer service is exceptional and the meat is very high quality. We really enjoy the rib eye and the porterhouse. Though everything is quite good. They also have hard to find food items from Itsly. Shop here, you won't regret it.
Jonathan was a real help in setting up our mailbox. We had to do it long distance and this was not an issue for him. He was polite and very efficient.

If I could give no stars, I would. DO NOT TAKE YOUR CAR HERE!!!! For starters, my husband is a mechanic and had all the parts they needed, but they wouldn't take them (even though they were brand new). Charged $100 over the actual price of the parts plus $96 in labor. THEN, they "fixed" the problem for $400 and not even a week later the car took a shit again. I called to have them tow it back and Ray said that we would have to pay (which I'm not going to pay for - since this problem should've been fixed in the first place.) They overcharge and they are a horrible horrible business. Please, do NOT take your car here!

I wish I had taken photos of my food before I ate it!  I had the Reuben & an extra side of pasta salad. Both were amazing.  The deserts are fresh baked. I couldn't decide between the 5 choices...  the pies looked amazing.  The service was quick and friendly. I thought the prices for a good lunch were low.  I am stuffed and I will be back again!!

The battery died on my car and after I got a ride home - with the keys - Ford had Mike's tow the car.
As I had the key, the driver made a special "out of the way" trip to my house to get my keys.  I could not be more pleased with the professional, friendly and courteous attitude of the driver and the people.
I highly recommend them.

91st ave and union hills fredericos location , the food is always good and the store is always clean , but this past sunday something strange happened , i walked in like i always do (drive thru speaker noise is bad) , the young lady took my order (familily of 4) , after 15min of wait time she asked me if i have casj to pay for my food and i said no only my credit card , she told me that their cc machine is down and with a rude tone told me to go to an ATM (wow) , now im not expecting anything free but why should i drive 5miles back to my house to grab the debit card for atm then to the bank to take money out and back to the store to pay for my food ,  we were eating from there 2 sometime 3 times a week (like i said they have food) , i will never step foot in that or any other fredericos because of this small incident , she should've said take the food pay next time ( she knows me i go there a lot )or your meal is on us tonight , and thats customer service for me , sending your customer to an atm its not very profesional ..and thats that

My 8 year-old "fatboy" PS3 contracted the YLOD. Matt replaced the GPU and it seems to run cooler and better since. This is my go-to shop from now on. You'll notice how organized the work area is and Matt's competence and professionalism.

I've been to and purchased many products from Al's Meat Market and believe them to be the best in the valley. The top quality, corn fed, Iowa meats are fantastic!  I have purchased bone-in prime rib roast, bone-in rib eye steaks, porterhouse steaks, beef short ribs and so much more from them and it has all been fantastic. Just this morning I made their breakfast sausage links; just amazing. 

The service is also the best in the valley. If they don't carry what you need, just ask and they will have it for you in no time!

I highly recommend Al's Meat Market!
We love Al and Trudy..The only place we buy our meats.excellent quality Belinda and Tony

This is the most unprofessional office I have ever been to.   I got an email and a call requesting I be 15 minutes early.   I had made my appointment a month in advance to be first seen.  Upon check in I confirmed yes I would be first seen.   However another patient was called I inquired they said sorry mix up.   I have m ow waited 2 hours and still have not been seen.  DO NOT COME HERE!!!!

I was referred here due to a bad lower back with a pinched nerve. I first saw Jessica from her to Kareem, from him to Dr. Abrams. I've had 2 injections with no results. A prescription that doesn't help (so I stopped taking it).I still feel my nerve pinching when I bend, or do any activities. I've gained muscle weakness! They've not once gave or offered another prescription to deal with pain! I've lost my job & the end result was.. Let's do physical therapy/ tense unit "can't do anything else, Good luck & take care of yourself"... Really I want answers and not some half way response!? My total time during my visit with a PA OR DOC was 10-15 mins? I'm so frustrated right now! These guys are a waste of money, time! You spend more time waiting to be seen than with the PA OR DOC. If you truly are worried about your health and in need of help/ answers please look elsewhere!
Great service and food was delicious.  I had the fish and wife had soup and sandwich.  Price was better than average. We definitely will be back.

This place is a joke. The staff is extremely unprofessional, the PA at this location (Michelle) and at the 25th Ave location (Whitney) have terrible bedside manner and probably need to go back to school (you only need a C average to graduate college).  I came in with a clear issue (herniated disc between L4 and L5). I had all the classic symptoms and not once did I ask for drugs because they don't help.  After plainly asking why they wouldn't help me they had terrible reasons. "You are too young", "I don't think the surgeon will know how to help you", "We can only give you more injections", and "The doctor says there is nothing wrong and he won't see you." Well I am now 10 weeks post-op from surgery with my second opinion and I have my life back; I competed in a triathlon 9 weeks post-op.  Do not go to Core, they are the worst practice I have ever dealt with.

UPDATE!!!!!! What an even bigger joke.  So I spoke to the Patient Care Advocate and he basically just wanted to make sure that I knew he was going to talk to the staff about my experience, yeah right.  He did ask if he could do anything for me, I told him he could waive the $19 bill they were trying to charge me.  He told me to just pay it and that the billing department would start calling me until I paid it.  I didn't realize they would start calling right after we hung up and that they would call me almost every day since we talked. $19 people, not $50, not $500, but $19.  What a petty, unprofessional company.  If you want to be mistreated this is the place to go.  Also, I will not stop posting negative comments, like I was asked to by the company.

The workers here were really nice and helpful.  I went in to make copies and the worker set up the copy machine for me and got all the copies made.  

We also asked if we could have a fax sent to them and they obliged.  He said he would call us when the FAX came in so we could come down to pick it up.

We drive older vehicles and as a result have frequent repairs.  Pete Nelson's has fixed everything right the first time.  If we didn't have someone like them to rely on, we would have to buy new cars which would certainly cost more than repairs.  They do a great job.

jim and his staff are way overworked and underpaid for their talent. they bend over backwards for customers and do everything humanly possible to keep you riding in your car reliably and safely. i've used their service for many years now to keep all my vehicles driving. i have put them through hell and back on my old bronco alone. everytime my truck broke down from another old part failing...they managed to still find the parts for it and repair it to new working condition. i eventually had the whole truck rebuilt from new engine to new transmission to new a/c system installed. they did it all. no complaining. no fussing. they just got her done. i never once felt in danger of breaking down out in the middle of the desert, 50 miles in back country while i owned it. the a/c system blew colder in the middle of summer here in phoenix,better than some new cars today. now i have them maintain my wife's sonata and my suburban. i also have them maintain my moms crv as well. i trust jim and his crew to the fullest extent with my vehicles and family. i  know that the repairs they did in the past, and to the future repairs i will have them do...will always be the best that can be done,while knowing at the same time i will not be stranded for faulty work. i don't use any one else. may god have mercy on my sole, should this shop ever; for any reason close down. i will be lost. you cannot find better tradesman in the market than what jim and his mechanics at united car care offer. thank you jim for the years of service you have provided me, and the family.

It's the only Walgreen's I know of that doesn't have a driveup window and there's no parking next to the store.  And with the pharmacy located way in the back of the store, it's a real trek to get medications. Not having a driveup is a serious problem in a retirement community where lots of folks have difficulty getting around.  The pharmacy manager is helpful and very nice but talks so loudly to the customer next to me that I can't hear the tech.  And in the store they're stocking Walgreen's Nice! brand.  All but one of the Nice! products I tried was awful!  I always liked Walgreen's but after 4 years of dealing with the one on 99th I finally decided to drive a little further and use their competitor.

had my ps3 fixed there had the red light of death, took about 4 to 5 days to get it fixed, 
got a year warranty in that year i took back to him 2 other times for the same problem. the year is up and same problem happened again. paid about 140. i should of just bought a new one.....

During an insurance company referred tow, I was treated rudely by the station manager.  I would never use this tow service again.  They showed up an hour and a half after their scheduled time.  The manager kept yelling at me like it was my fault the driver couldn't find us.  No stars for this company due to their ignorant shop manager.

Dr. Gasser's Dental practice is completely professional, from the staff at the front desk area, the excellent dental hygenist, to Dr. Gasser himself. I would highly recommend Dr. Gasser, and have to
many people.
Wow!  The customer service here is the best!  They fill prescriptions so fast and answer every question you could ever ask.  I will never fill my meds anywhere else!

Came to Betty's Rooste because of the good reviews.  If you are a regular or a senior....this is the place for you.  I, on the other hand, am not and had a less than good experience.  Service was not good and food was ok.  I was overlooked more than once.

A tiny meat market on Union Hills and 100 something in Sun City.

Als offers a pretty decent variety of fresh meats.  I haven't had a lot but the beer brats are very good.  They also have a small selection of rubs, sauces, and pasta shells.

The prices were on par for a mom and pop meat shop and the workers were pleasant.  Worth checking out for your next bbq to impress your guests.

My 14yr old was referred by his pediatrician. I walked in & there was a line of about 10 people,  not to mention the 30+ people in the waiting room. I was given 20 pages of paperwork and a pager! You would think that these would be mailed in advance. As i finally done with the forms, the pager went off. I handed in the paperwork and shortly after called back. 

The young lady/medical asst wasnt very friendly. As she pulled up his info in the room, she asked "did you already have an xray done today? I responded "was my son supposed to? She didn't respond! She walked out, and the Dr walked in. He was very pleasant. We were there all of 5 mins. Mind you, my son's condition is mild. Anyway as we left i asked another young lady for my son's dr's card, seemed little annoyed that she had to go grab one off a different desk. Needless to say, we wont be returning.

This place has re-opened.  
If you are 85+years old you might enjoy this place.  Had dinner tonight with my in-laws and was stunned by how bad the food was.  My wife and mother -in -law both had salmon that was dried out AND whitish-grey.  Sent wife's back and was replaced by a less cooked but still inedible small piece of fish...definitely not salmon on either plate.  Vegetables were good, however.  Salad bar is tired looking with cheap ingrediants; the lowest quality of everything.  Soups were old and looked like they were sitting out for hours.  Garlic bread with NO garlic.  Very nice waitress named Rachel.
NEVER AGAIN!!!

I cannot say anything but good (great actually) about Dr. Gasser and his staff ... My case had many unforeseen problems and they were taken care of right away if not sooner to be honest ... Dr.Gasser had to make more than one trip back to his office to attend to a problem that was actually caused by the people in my Cardiologists office (Coumadin Clinic) which prompted and was the cause of excessive bleeding on two different occasions ... Dr Gasser worked late into the night to get the bleeding stopped and put several extra stitches in to keep there from being any more problems ... I took my time and did a lot of research before making the leap into the all on 4 procedure, am glad I did ...  Dr Gasser to this day still does follow ups to make sure everything is as it should be ...  If I could  give 10 Stars I would do it without hesitation ...

Al's was completely surprisingly in a delightful way. All of the people I encountered were helpful, knowledgable and treated me like family. The meat was spectacular. I purchased a filet mignon, meatballs, hamburger patties and meatloaf. I haven't tried the meatballs, but the rest were far superior to anything I've had from any other butcher in this area. Check it out. You won't be disappointed.

New owner!! Give them a chance. Previous guy had chip on his shoulder. Will update once my vacuum gets repaired.   
Ok they fixed and I had to pay despite the fact that they refused to honor the warranty I had with previous owner. But it works fine and for $90 easier than buying a new one.

Thanks. We enjoyed everything a Great place to eat. Steak and blue salad the bomb , the Cuban sandwich delicious, the shrimp salad great. Clam chowder we love. Italian cake mmm good. We ll be back . Chow XO Petunia

Just went to a farmers market at this nursery near my home.  I didn't even know that this nursery was here and wow was it nice.  I see that they have a great selection of plants and trees for sale.  The farmers market was great with food, jams, homemade deserts, Santa was onsite, the people were nice and the atmosphere was clean.  The market is the second Saturday of each month.

Food is in the mediocre to good range, nothing crazy special. They have a nice variety. It gets the 4 star bump for dessert. You know what is badder than a bangle tiger? The peanut butter tiger cookie from here!
For some reason I was unable to find the other reviews on this store through my iPhone. There are two others. Yelp, they're the same store. Could you merge the reviews?

Appointment wait times are usually 1-2  HOURS and then you talk to the doctor for about 5 minutes.  I found a new pain management doctor.  

My CORE Institute doctor seems to only push procedures and doesn't have time for questions about anything else.  I feel they did 2 extra Medial Branch Block procedures when they weren't needed.  That left me with a MONTH of extra pain and recovery each time. After the 3rd one he told me it was 'just for insurance purposes'.  WEREN'T THE OTHER 2 TIMES ENOUGH FOR THE SAME INSURANCE COMPANY?

On procedure day you'll feel like an Indy 500 car at a pit stop.  Multiple people rushing and all doing their prep so they can get the next customer in the bed.  If you just want procedures without any other support, this is the place.  If you want a Dr. that will partner with you and offer more than the one thing they specialize in, go somewhere else.

The store itself is a good average Walgreens store, and has liquor to boot. 

The pharmacy staff are helpful but the pharmacy opening hours are bad for anything with a job, guess thats because its Sun City.

5 stars are not enough for Jm and his staff.    By far the very best mechanics  I've ever used.  Honest, reliable, pleasant  and they don't take advantage of little old ladies or anyone else for that matter.   I highly  recommend them unconditionally.
Not a good experience. They are nice and do want to help. But when I left they said something really uncalled for.

Tiny. A deli case and a meat case. Both filled with quality products. Staff is quick, on-the-ball and friendly. Come with an idea, not a plan. Buy what looks best, or what you can afford. 

It's not cheap - quality never is. 

There are a few dry good items like pasta - but if you are looking for that kind of stuff, head to Romanelli's...don't come here. Come here for the meat. They specialize in corn-fed Iowa beef. If you are looking for grass-fed...I don't think these are the droids you are looking for, but they might be able to order it? 

What I DO know: is that the ribeye I had from here yesterday was AWESOME (so well marbled). Melted in my mouth. The hot dogs and sausages looked mighty tasty - but that's for another day...

Bob Brown Service Experts have been servicing my roof-top unit for years.  When the compressor finally went out they had a new unit ready the next day.  The installers were courteous and cleaned the area before they left.  I couldn't be more pleased.

It's always good when a mechanic starts the conversation with "you got lucky."  My car's AC stopped working.  Fortunately, it quit in March, not July.   Took it in for a diagnosis fearing the worst.  Just got my tax refund and I could see it evaporating as I arrived at Mike's.  Even though the parking areas were full, they checked me in right away.  After a quick look, the car was moved outside a service bay to have test equipment connected.  All of the Freon was gone.  After half an hour, the mechanic let me know a valve had failed allowing the gas to leak out.  Cost for the new valve - $1.  New Freon - $100 (thanks EPA).  Add an hour labor charge and I was on the road with a working AC in less than two hours.   Fast, friendly, expert and did I mention fast?  Way beyond expectations.  I hope to not visit often, but will definitely visit again the next time repair is needed.

I moved here from a small town to be able to get "more options for my conditions. After coming here I am realizing that was the worst mistake ever,  and all the progress I have made I am now going backwards. They dropped medication 40% on my first visit with no other alternatives. My doctor assigns tests that he doesn't tell me what results I have,  so I don't know if I am progressing or getting worse. The wait time is long and when you get in I only have 3 minutes to talk while at the same time the doctor is on the computer. The nurse and office staff are nice and professional in my experience.  Now my doctor has ordered a "electrical response"  test and I have a pacemaker. I am now scared if I get hurt. I am going to see if I can go somewhere else, I just wish I was meet halfway. Sad to hear that I am not the only one who is having problems.

Apparently if you're not associated w/ DPS they treat you like dirt! My car was not a priority to them & took the over a week to tell me that they couldn't fix my car. I had a bent "I beam" on a Ford pick-up & they claimed they couldn't find the part. Luckily there are places like Chastain auto in Downtown Glendale that still know how to treat customers. To ad insult to an already disappointing experience, they charged my wife $65 (rack time) before they'd give her the truck. I'm sure if I'd worked for DPS they'd have figured out how to fix my truck.

Matt was great, professional and knowledgeable. Would definitely 
Recommend! Had issues w ABSVulcan
FX380 shutting down, also squealing sounds. Disk mode improperly set at factory, a reset should optimize performance for gaming.

The customer service I received here was horrific. I dealt with one of their employees both on the phone and in the store and he was rude, short, and unprofessional. I dropped my vacuum off at their store on a Friday and was told that I would be called back Monday with a quote for the repair. I called on Wednesday because I hadn't heard from them and when I asked for the quote he seemed irritated and told me that I should already know what it is. He gave me the quote and told me it would be ready Friday. I called again Friday afternoon because I still hadn't heard anything and found out that it still wasn't ready. I was finally able to pick it up that evening. It took a week for a repair that I was told would take a few days. 

The vacuum was successfully repaired but I will not be going back because of the blatantly rude and disrespectful employee.
This is only the 2nd time we have been here.  The breakfast bar is pretty good and they do have a good variety.  There was no wait at all for our menu order either and our granddaughter liked it

I was referred to this location for physical therapy from my dr. For 6 weeks of treatment for lower lumbar which radiated to my leg. 

* Ray and Zack seem like good guys! They helped me with my recovery!
* The staff really appear to enjoy their work and are always friendly.
* I found the other patents also felt like it was a very comfortable environment.
* they will challenge you to get better!

Thanks for what you do and I am glad to have used your facility and the opportunity to meet and work with your staff on my recovery.

Don't lock the door at 3 when you close at 4, also I called with a message they are helping someone else but no one in the store. I also see the workers personal items inside so I know they are in there. Complete garbage.

In my relentless quest for the perfect Mexican food, I stumbled upon Federico's. First impression, I encounter a locked door with a women inside that glimpses over at me trying to get in and looking the other way while wiping down a table. I guess that was my cue to try the drive-thru. 

A near-indecipherable wave of static noise blew towards my eardrums once I drove through. Keeping it simple, I ordered the two carne asada tacos with beans and rice. Once I got home, the first thing I noticed was the generous portions of the taco. To the contrary, the tacos only had one unheated tortilla each. I already knew this massive filling was not going to be supported properly by one flimsy corn tortilla. This held true, the structural integrity of the taco collapsed beyond despair within one bite attempt. Secondly, the taste was profoundly underwhelming. The beans and rice were also on the same page, lacklustering in the flavor depot and so goes the salsa and carrots. 

I can't help but to think every cylinder of this establishment was off-beat and beyond repair. Though my regular visits to Ramiro's and Poliberto's are consistently memorable, my search goes on for that perfect taco.

I was referred to the core Institute Peoria by my pcp for a vascular issue in my pelvis. I was told the provider wanted X-rays, which was confusing to me since I came with imaging on CD, and the X-rays don't evaluate vascular complications. Additionally, all my imaging reports were faxed to thIs physician. I was told by the tech the dr wouldn't see me without the X-rays. I was seen by the provider and he was pleasant. He told me that he wasn't the specialist I needed and referred me to a vascular surgeon, and that there wouldn't be a charge for the visit. But that wasn't the case.

I was required to pay $40 copay and also required to pay for imaging that was not necessary. Pretty shady

My mom won't buy meat from anywhere else. And I'm thankful for that. Everything that she buys there is fresh and yummy. The folks there are always delightful and willing to help you with recipes. I would highly recommend Al's for your meat.

This place is far better than you can imagine. 
You will enjoy every bite. Best food in Sun City.
We went for breakfast. Normal breakfast fare at reasonable prices. Service was good, and food came hot and fresh. Will probably give lunch a try at some point.

This is a super nice place. They even have a farmers market on the second Saturday of every month. The family and I stopped in to check out the farmers market just before Christmas. They have a beautiful piece of property with very friendly staff. The vendors were better than I had expected. Good variety of food and artists. Will be back to check out tree and plant prices.

I started attending the Sun City - Body & Brain Yoga - Tai Chi Center in November 2015.  Since that time I have seen significant improvement in my overall health.  I have osteoarthritis in my knee and through the exercise programs offered at the center my knee has become so much stronger and I don't have the pain I once did.   Through the meditation and breathing exercises I have become more relaxed and at peace.  Both my flexibility and balance have improved considerably.  The center is very welcoming and offers a variety of programs.  Stephanie, the Center Manager, is great.  She really cares about the members and works with each person to ensure their individual needs are addressed and met.  I highly recommend this Center and encourage anyone who wants to improve their health to give it a try.  I feel so much better after each and every class and I am so glad I joined the center.

This place is great.  It's hard to find a honest repair shop.  The best part is they do the service and they find other things wrong with your car....they call you and let you know what's wrong and provide prices.  They don't make you feel horrible when you tell them that you don't want the additional items replaced. The owner Bill is very knowledgeable and friendly.
The owners are the kindest you'll find, who will actually look out for you. Prices are inexpensive for the quality of work/service you receive. I highly recommend this place!

I should of written an update long ago about my past experience with Bob Brown. I received a call from the customer service manager after a very positive conversation, my tenants received a full refund!
Went to see the " You got hate mail.". I haven't laughed that much in ages. Talented cast and just a fun night.

Drove all the way to sun city to find out this "business" is out of a garage?  And they warranty ?  Like how do I know you will be here in a year?  Needless to say did I not do business there wish I would have known as a waste of a drive!  Are the other reviews really true or written by owner you decide.

I'm so impressed and satisfied with the work and service of Jim and his staff that if I ever got stuck, I would rather pay got the towing service back to Jim's shop than let another person lay hands on my truck. Always personable and honest! 3 generations of our family are faithful to United because they are just that good!!

Matt is an awesome tech. His response time, service and pricing are great. Yes, he works out of his home but do not let that deter you. I have been using computers since the late 80s (which means I have needed help and/or repairs since then) and he is better than any retail location I have ever used. He may not be in the center of town (Sun City) but he is well worth the 5-10 mile drive.

This place is out of a garage but his work is impeccable.
He repaired my PS3 with the red light of death and warrantied it for a year. It did have the same problem 11 months later and he fixed it without any hassle what so ever. That was two years ago and my PS3 is still going strong.
I have referred a few friends there and they loved his work and his prices. 
OH and Stephanie, I'm not the owner. Lol!

Every time I get on the west side I always make a point to stop and eat at Betty's Rooste. They have two west side locations that are easy to access and provide a spotless dinning experience along with awesome food and service.  I would encourage you to enjoy their friendly service and food.  Forget the chains and eat by a local owner who takes personal pride in her business.

Great customer service. Very prompt expert knowledge by David the tech. Go to car service. Car broke down they towed me there for free and quickly  and efficiently solved my issue. Would refer 10/10 service. Jeremy and Lance both fantastic customer service and really care about the clients.

They fix up cars and sell them. That should be your first warning.  

I have a long, juicy story about my experience here but here is the summary: They quoted $1600 for a repair then turned around and offered to buy the car from me for $150. 

I would not recommend them for towing, repairs, or anything else. Stay away.
well, its  Walgreen in Sun City, always a wait at the cash registrar....but no city sales tax...so I put up with it....

Please ppl, listen when I tell you not to trust your car with these ppl. My battery died and my insurance company used this company to tow my car. The driver was extremely nice and offered their repair shop for a new battery and I agreed. After we got there I was told I needed a new alternator. When they told me over $600 close to $700 for everything. I called my dad and told him and when I told him the name, he quickly told me to get the hell out of there. He said this place will try and burn you. So I left. The next morning I called another tow company to take my car to Liberty Buick. I get a call back from them because they were making them wait a ridiculous amount of time to release my car. The guy at mikes called and was quite upset that I decided not to let them fix my car even though the day before they said they would work with me paying them. I think they knew that was a ridiculous amount of money. However, after a 2nd attempt, the tow company got my car and took it to Liberty Buick. Two days later, Liberty called and told me all I needed was a new battery. I didn't pay over $150 for that. Mikes was going to take me for my money. Do not trust your car to these ppl please.

The times I have been here, they have been quick in helping with my transaction and pleasant to deal with.  I was a bit surprised to see such low rating. I will continue to consider this store for shipping needs.

My husband was seen by a PA for an injury to his elbow. The PA was fine, he sat about 4 feet across the room from him and watched as he displayed range of motion, ability to bend extend, lift, etc

The physician assistant at no time physically touched him, but to shake his hand on his way in and out of the room.

We have received a bill for $226 for closed treatment without manipulation in addition to his copay. We have contacted their billing department on 4 separate occasions and received multiple conflicting reasons for this bill.

We have left 3 messages with the billing manager and have not been contacted once. We will absolutely be reporting this to our insurance, Medicare, and the better business bureau. I have worked in the medical field since 2007 and this is fraudulent billing. It is clear that they are unashamed of this enough to disregard the courtesy of a phone call to even pretend otherwise.

You will be better off absolutely anywhere else.

Al is awesome. Friendly, great convo, educated me on some cooking techniques. And then there is the meat. Phenomenal meats. 
I like to smoke a nice pork shoulder. He's got some extremely tasty pig in there!

My husband, daughter (11) and I went to see "Woman in Black" (that we purchased through a Groupon). The show was done as a two man show, a play within a play. Both actors were very good. Their place is very small, 501C, so don't expect a fancy theater, but get past the hard seats, and very small entrance, and a whole world opens. The actors were fabulous. Only complaint is that there a few grumpy old souls in the audience who complained a lot, and loudly, the first 10 minutes as the lights are on (as part of the show) and pointing at the crowd, so just be patient, they go down, and save your complaining for something that really matters. Maybe the theater should announce that they are doing it on purpose to save some heartache. Honestly it wasn't even bad, no different than walking through Frys. Lastly, I also wish the actors had comes out for a bow so we could give them a standing "O" but they stayed backstage. They deserved it!

We found this place on Yelp since I was meeting some folks right in the building were Betty's is located.  Despite the great reviews, we didn't know what to expect.  It looks like a luncheonette in the first floor lobby of a medical office building.  Not an auspicious first impression.  Our opinion changed as soon as we walked in the front!  Everybody was super friendly.  The owner waited on us and made some suggestions as to what we should order.  I had a breakfast platter and my wife had one of the daily specials.  Everything, including the baked goods, are made fresh.  They source the bread for their toast from a special local bakery.  These are just little touches you don't expect in such a modest location.  When we asked for the check, I had to look twice to make sure everything was included, it was that inexpensive for what we got.

Highly recommended!

My wife's Saturn decided to stop running on the way to work.   AAA dispatched road service that turned out to be from Mike's Sun City Union.  This is a gas station with multiple service bays for repairs.  They diagnosed the problem as a seized water pump.  Unfortunately, my wife was more interested in getting to work on time and badly overheated the engine.   After the water pump was replaced, they found a leak due to a split tube that connects the coolant reservoir to the engine. Of course, this cheap plastic tube was molded into the air manifold.  It took a couple of days to get the additional part.  When completed, they explained what the problem was and showed me the old parts without being prompted.  Cost was more than I had hoped, but reasonable for the added repair needed.  They gave me the AAA repair discount.  Overall, they fixed the problem that turned out to be a little more complicated than first expected.  Good communication eased my concerns when dealing with a new service company.   Affiliation with AAA and multiple service awards also helped.  Thanks for a good save.

My car wouldn't start so we replaced the battery since it tested bad and it still wouldn't start. So I called Geico to have it towed to Midas, a shop my family has always used. However, the tow truck company called me back and recommended I have it towed to their shop as they would not charge me a diagnostics fee. So I went ahead with their recommendation. It turned out that I needed a new starter. They quoted me $515! Feeling as though I was about to be ripped off, I called the original shop I was recommended to. Their quote was $390. I then called the tow truck's shop back and explained to them how frustrated I was. Long story short, I ended up haggling enough to get them down to $450. Still cost me $60 more by taking their so called advice. I am shocked that Geico is contracted with a company with such low values that takes advantage of people such as myself. They also called me to tell me my car was done and so I got a ride over to the shop, when we got there they said "I'm not sure why they called you it won't be done for another hour". So we went home again and then waited about another 2 hours before getting another call saying it was done. Thankfully, it was actually done that time and we were on our way, never to cross paths with this shop again!

I STOPPED shopping at Safeway about eight months ago because I constantly found EXPIRED FOOD I don't mean expired by a day or two BUT YEARS!!! That happens at the Safeway on Waddle in Surprise AZ and the one on grand Ave in Surprise AZ. I took this concern to managers and all of them told me how sorry they were. I thought I was speaking to a robot! "Were so sorry" blah, blah, blah. I contacted corporate they contacted me back, and NOTHING!! So today I thought let's try again, it's been eight months.....well two things I hadn't mentioned which were concerns at the Safeways I shopped at in Surprise, and which I DID also write corporate about, were, the rice paper THIN plastic bags!! AND the BAD APP AND ABSENTS OF INTERNET!! That's right!!! Today I stopped at the Safeway on Bell road and 108 Ave in Sun City AZ....NO INTERNET OR WI FI CONNECTION FOR THE APP and I continually had a pop up screen tell me "try again" no connection, well I turned my wifi off on the phone so that I can use data, same thing same pop up, and I then remembered this is the same thing that happened in Surprise store too!! I had gone many times to the service Desk for help and ......you guessed it, "we are so sorry!!" NO ONE KNEW WHAT TO DO!! No app no coupons no savings GET IT? Now who saves money? Not us!! Okay, so I went to the service desk again...this time after ten minutes of fable attempts they called a guy up who DID know how to fix it!! Go into settings, go to Safeway app, turn on data! (Because you can't use Internet, there is none) but you do have to enable data separately on the Safeway app. Whala! Okay, so the bags so thin all my stuff fell out all over the floor!!! IM DONE WITH SAFEWAY unless management reads this and would like to help me out.....and please, I don't want to hear how sorry you are!

Horrible everything. 
They over charged for simple repairs. It takes them 3 times as long as they say, just to look at your vehicle, then they don't fix what you ask them to.  Not impressed with any aspect of this shop. I went in for an oil change, tranny drain and fill, a/c inspection and a tire sensor reset. This ended up being $700 and 3 visits to get completed. 
If I ran my business like this, I would be broke.

Hi - this is a wonderful, old-fashioned meat market.  Great food.  the Yelp posting, is, however not correct in regards to the store hours.  The store is only open Wednesday through Saturday, and their own web site has it right.  I was just there and can verify they are NOT open Tuesdays...

So, Yelp for once is not correct!

Best meat market EVER!!!!  Al and Trudy are friendly and most helpful - never had  less than an excellent piece of meat.   They appreciate their customers and always remember who you are.  If you want great meat - shop here!!!!

Jan Davies, Anne Williams, Pat Ormond
Dr Kutz knows exactly what to do to relieve pain. Everyone in the office is very patient and efficient.

SUITE 200: you will be waiting forever and doctors are all very rude and it takes about an hour and a half to be called back. Than having to wait to be seen by the doctor is another 30 minutes. do not come here

This community theatre is located in the corner of a strip plaza with Safeway.  I had the opportunity to see a performance there last night (Almost, Maine) and I thoroughly enjoyed it.  The theatre is small and nothing fancy, but the experience was nice and there are no bad seats.  Now that I know that this place is here, I would definitely return to see other shows in the future.  I am interested in seeing "The Woman in Black" next month.  I enjoyed the movie and would like to see how this will translate to a live stage.
Feldman sucks, very judgmental. Don't go to him. Hates people with husband/wife/so in prison-thinks the pain meds are to sneak into prison. He's a real jerk. Worst doctor ever!!!

You definitely don't get the small-town doctors office feeling in this office however every doctor that I have dealt with there is absolutely amazing and very sincere and caring about my needs. They always get me in on time and when I called last minute they get me in the same day. I have nothing negative to say about them whatsoever. I attended Sun City location.

I have never been more unimpressed with a store or an individual.  Their so-called vacuum expert is rude, self-important, and offensive.  The worst customer service experience of all time.

I called prior to visiting this location as I have an old model Dyson with a belt that needed replacing. The man on the phone barely let me talk, interrupting me to say "yes, we have the belt." "yes, I know what you're talking about" "yes, I have that part".  I repeated several times that the vacuum was the old model, and tried to say it was my understanding that the part in question was rare as it had been updated. He didn't even listen. I even tried to read the part number to him, but he just kept interrupting to tell me it was in stock and he absolutely had it and hurried me off the phone.

Upon arriving at the store to pick up the part, the "expert" told me he didn't have it.  "But, I called ahead and was assured you did," I tried to say, whilst he interrupted me to say it wasn't possible. There was no apology, no trying to find out who I might have talked with, nothing to empathize with the wasted trip due to the erroneous info that THEY supplied.  Mr. Expert was aggressive in his continued interruptions, saying the part was obsolete - and had no response for how I would have been told something different just 30 minutes prior. 

I have never been treated more disrespectfully or rudely without cause and I would recommend steering clear.
Excellent and timely service. Very reasonable price to upgrade from Windows XP to Windows 7..

Mom and i went here tuesday morning.  Since we had never been there, we ordered a small breakfast.  The french toast was the best i ever had.  The bacon was cooked perfectly.
The staff is fantastic and the place is super clean.
We will definitely be going back.  The prices were really good too.  Low prices for fixed incomes is fantastic.
I cant wait to eat there again, and i will.

Moore Law Firm has been by my side for the last eight months. My father passed away early last year, and when a lawyer was needed. Moore Law Firm was recommended to me. Matthew Gobbato has been my probate lawyer and has done a great job. From Kelli the receptionist, and Carolyn the probate paralegal, to Matthew. All have been very courteous, and very helpful from day one.  Now that we can see the light at the end of the tunnel, things are beginning to roll pretty quickly now. They have taken care of everything, and been very involved with every step of the way. Always there to take my questions, basically have been there for me. I am diffinetly going to use them on future endeavors, and will feel very confident it will be taken care of with every effort used.

As others have said before me, I wish I could give ZERO stars. My radiator broke down recently. Thanks to my insurance, I have towing coverage. They dispatched the towing company, which is Mikes - now Sun City Exxon - and said that they would call me shortly to let me know when they would head over to me. I originally wanted to be towed to Midas, which was about a mile from where I was. I waited and got a phone call from Ray, the owner of Sun City Exxon. He let me know that the tow truck was on its way over and he also let me know they are also a repair shop and since I towed with them, I would get a FREE diagnosis on my car. With that being said, I happily agreed to be towed to their facility.
We get there and Tom, a manager looks at my car, tells me someone will call the following day with some prices as I arrived late in the afternoon. The next day, I get a call and am quoted $1400 for my radiator and other things that I did not want/need. They said I needed an oil change which made me weary because I recently had it changed. They took of what wasn't necessary and dropped the price to $1200. However the next day, Tom calls again and says the price stands at $1400 without adding anything additional and I said I would have to discuss with my boyfriend and get back to him. Decided to go with someone else with better prices and could tow my vehicle from the Exxon to his facility and so I let Tom know, he said he would make the arrangements. We get off the phone. Ray then calls and tries to reel me in one last time. I politely declined and he then says that my car can't be released until I paid $150 for their diag. Which was supposed to be free. I tried to fight it but it was just not worth it... They don't honor their word and they saw me as a gullible young girl who doesn't know better, wanted to just take all my money. So disappointed since they were so nice at first. They left my car in worse condition than when I arrived. Do not go here.

Quick, friendly, and professional service. I couldn't ask for anything better. Nidhi and Jesicca took great care of my shipping items and provided helpful guidance for a special upcoming overseas shipping project. I'll be back.
The best secret for breakfast or lunch in Sun City Az. Check out the pictures, now multiple the flavor of the food 10 times. Fantastic place to eat. Also Betty and staff are so nice!

I used to bring a friend in to see Dr. Thompson and we both just loved him. He had performed knee surgery on her. When it was time for me to consider knee replacement, in my mind there was only one choice. Yes, I had to wait for an hour in the waiting room, but the attention that I got was worth every minute. Dr. Thompson was calm, patient and very thorough. He explained my options and answered every question. It is not time for me to have surgery and I got lots of advice about how to avoid it. I then asked him to recommend a colleague about a trigger thumb, but he was willing and able to give me a shot in the thumb that had a 50% chance of success. It was VERY successful. Like I said, the wait was worth it! Once you get from the waiting room to the office, you can expect top flight service and attention.

Dr. Kevin Gasser is a bright, energetic and experienced professional with a demonstrated expertise in restorative work and the placement of dental implants in Arizona. His dedication to his patients ends with a passion for achieving profound life changing results via dental implants; but begins first and foremost with a willingness to listen to his patients' needs, concerns, and goals for their dental health. 

One of the unique aspects of Dr. Gasser is his specialized training from Dr. Paulo Malo, inventor of the All-On-4® dental implant procedure.  Dr. Gasser obtained an in depth and personal study of both the surgical and prosthetic protocol directly from Dr. Paulo Malo. Dr. Gasser has been offering this procedure and now works with All-on-Four cases routinely with patients from all over the world. Dr. Gasser has performed this procedure more than any single Practitioner in Arizona. 

If you are considering dental implants and you want to get your smile back, then you owe it to yourself to visit Dr. Gasser.

Very good spot for a sandwich. I wouldn't come here with a large group as seating is limited. My mom and I both had a sandwich and chips also with a drink. Tip and bill total under $20. I will definitely return if I'm in the area.

OH HAPPY DAY!   The new Betty's Rooste has opened!  Same great food and DESSERTS!  Liz is there along with her friendly staff.  Come in and see for yourself.
Now there are two Betty's to choose from.

Great little restaurant near the hospital. Seems to cater to the elderly, which makes sense due to its location in Sun City. Limited menus but good selection is salads, sandwiches; both cold and hot. Nice proportions and great service.

WOW.  I'm a new third generation Sun Citizen and who knew...I luckily drove by this place and saw their sign.  Day one I stopped in for some deli meats for lunch and meat for stew.....all great.  For New Years Eve we decided to  entertain at home and I returned for steaks....our guests had never had "good" beef and asked what marinade I used!  To quote my kids, this place is the bomb!

I took my car in because the brakes were squealing.  They replaced the front brakes and told me that was all I needed.  On the way home, my brakes were still squealing.  I thought that maybe they just needed time to seat or wear in.  Time went by and the squealing never stopped.  Just took it in again, and now informed the back brakes needed replacing.  I question whether they did the job right the first time!  Not very happy with quality of service.  I know there has to be better out there!

Excellent service! We dropped our PS3 off today to fix an issue with the red blinking light.  Their site says you get your equipment back in 3 days, but most of the time within 24 hours.  They called us not even 4 hours after we dropped it off saying it was fixed.
I was taken advantage of by this business because I had out of state plates on my vehicle.  Avoid this repair shop at all cost.  If I could it would have no stars.

Just stopped in at Al's after a few years living away from the West Valley.  It's the same as before . . . excellent!  They are closed SUN-MON-TUE, but plan ahead (it's a "Mom and Pop" kinda place and they deserve time off too).  I purchased some awesome steaks that melted in our mouths and some chicken breasts that were downright delicious!  I also picked up a couple of frozen meat loafs for the freezer.  Best meat loaf hands down.  What can I say?  I really missed Al's.  Nothing's changed.  I'll be back for sure.

We were very blessed to have found this law firm .Matthew Gabbato is the nicest young man and was so thorough in helping my mom draw up her estate and will plans.Wise and receptive and knew exactly what we needed to do.He is there for every call.This attorney was definitely raised right! Don't bother looking for anyone else! A true gentleman.And the staff are so kind and supportive.Thank-you Moore Law Firm!

I cannot be more frank about this place. They are just a machine to get as much money out of you as possible. I had procedures done on my lower back that were worthless. Facet injections done without any MRI or X-rays that had zero effect. I was scheduled to have an epidural steroid injection into my L5-S1 but they said they would need an MRI this time. I got the MRI and I come to find out on the day of the procedure (mere minutes prior) that Dr. Lucas hadn't even seen or heard of the results of the MRI! I feel that they just run test after test to compound the charges even more. If they ask you to do a drug test I would say no. I received a bill from the testing place for the amount of $925! They were nice enough to reduce it to $50? What kind of racket is this place. There worse than attorneys piling on billable hours. STAY AWAY! They are also horrible about follow up. I just put my 4th call into them to discuss my most recent procedure. Not one call back!
Our wii would not read any discs...took it in and they had it fixed that day! Much cheaper than buying a new/used one plus, all your data/miis/games are still there!! Great Job - Quick & Honest!
This place is terrible. My appointment was at 9am at 10:15 am i finaly get called back now i have to start the waiting all over.
Jim and his staff are top notch, honest, and reliable. If you don't take your car to them, you are just stupid.

We love the breakfast buffet. Service is excellent. I love the eggs, bacon, sausage, briskest and gravy, French toast, waffles, and especially the many fruits, and sides for a salad, and especially the banana bread pudding. Amazingly fresh and tasty!  
You need anything, just ask. In fact. The price is reasonable and on top of that, they have surprised us with a discount.  
Thanks JB's!! See you real soon!

This is the worst place ever. I went in for one appointment with problems of bad headaches and very bad fatigue. The doctor shinned a light into my eyes and said you have migraines and threw three prescriptions at me and said to come back in eight weeks, I started the prescriptions even though I had mentioned to him that I would prefer no pills. After the meds not doing a thing for me and the doctor saying that I had migraines that was it, no testing no nothing. Needless to say I cancelled my follow up appt with him and found myself a real neurologist that has already found something that could be life threatening by doing tests where this yahoo at the Core Institute just said migraines and here are your pills. See I'm also a tiny bit on the fluffy side of life  and he had the nerve to tell me that the meds he was prescribing may even help me lose some weight, I think that was totally uncalled for when we were not even discussing my weight! This doctor I think is so incompetent really needed to stop practicing medicine. It concerns me that he does this to all his patients and he could be putting people's lives at stake! Do not put your life in these people's hands.

I won't be back. They completely chaned the format of a document I emailed them to print so instead of it being 20 pages it was 40. On top of that they charged me a $4 computer usage fee???? I email documents to UPS stores all the time and NEVER have I been charged a fee. I guess they have enough Snow Birds that they don't feel the need to take care of anyone under 50. There are too many other stores in the area.  I won't be back!
If you are a female, forget about going here.  They talk to you as if you are a complete idiot and that you have absolutely no idea what you are talking about.

It was regretted for their services, my  car has little leaking, i spent  $1342.37 to replace drivers axle shaft, rack and pinion. After replaced the whole parts, it was still dripping oil, i go back 6 times to fix the leaking, ray and tom said it was the seal, told me done,  will No more drippings, unfortunately, it was again and again still drippings.  I will never never go this shop again, i felt so stupid, and bad luck to find this shop for repair, it waste my money and waste my time.  They cannot fix my car!!!!!!!!!!!  
Post NO STAR.

They did fix my car but I found out later I was overcharged probably $200.  Was that cause I was a woman?
My fella had his car repaired and they did a good job, BUT they put an item on his car which will require him to have another $1,000 repair.  He is really unhappy.
I thought they did a great job till all this came to the front.
ALSO, they seem to have lost their affiliation with AAA which seems suspicious.  WHY would AAA drop them???  
Guess we are not going back there.  
Really NO BUENO!

Update:  The car my boyfriend spent $3K on there to fix last year that Mike's claimed would last "forever" if he would just fix some things now has soooo many leaks it would be another $2K.  He's just chucking it and buying a new car.  
However, either Mike's doesn't know car repairs--which I seriously doubt--or they are so greedy that they blow smoke just to get your money.
Well, Mike, you got our money, but you lost 2 good customers....REALLY NO BUENO!
More disappointing because we thought Mike's was a good shop and had used them for a number of years...soooo disappointing.


UPDATE:  OMG!  Someone just pointed out all the horrible reviews on Mike's on Google and also all the complaints he has with the BBB!  If we had looked there before taking any car to Mike's we would never have let them do any work at all.  Wow...they have alot of complaints and horrible reviews...beware!!!  I think I see what another auto shop (not a repair one, tho, so they are not a competitor) told me when they said AAA dropped them.  I see why now.

At the Core Institute as I write this 2nd review. In spite of Allison V from Core sending me a message after my 1st review, nothing has changed. The check in people in the lobby are still unfriendly. I stood there for a good minute waiting to be acknowledged.  She was more interested in chatting with the person at the desk next to  her than she was in waiting on me.   Like I stated in my first review, the doctors here are very good but in order to see them you have to deal with unfriendly people and LONG wait times.

Excellent Business and True American Patriots!!

The staff was all excellent, quick, and efficient. The restroom was spotless clean. The place has good access.

I have had a very positive experience with this place in the last year.  I broke my wrist and had to have surgery earlier this year.  Dr. Matthew Weichbrodt and his team (Crystal, AJ, Peter) are terrific and did a great job with my surgery and aftercare.  I have also been back to see Dr. Weichbrodt about a case of trigger thumb and a bursa and although these were minor issues, he took his time to examine, treat and explain what was happening to me.  Dr. Weichbrodt has a great personality and I highly recommend him. His team is great also.  I personally have had a great experience with the reception staff too.  I have to give a huge shout out also to the x - ray tech named David who is so professional and nice and puts you at ease when he taking your films.  Also Brina (not sure how to spell her name) who does the casting is excellent.  She is friendly and also makes a perfect cast.  Last, but definitely not least, the physical therapy team is fantastic.  Stephanie, Destiny, Nicole gave me my life back.  They worked tirelessly to help me rehab my right (dominant) wrist and were patient and encouraging all the way through.  The reception staff at the PT area are also amazing.  Friendly and made scheduling easy.  I have heard a lot of negative things about the CORE institute, but my personal experience here has been excellent.

I recently had my AC units serviced by Bob Brown.  They provided excellent service, were on time for their appointment, and spent extra time to make sure everything was in order.  In the past, service technicians have been in and out of my home in 45 minutes for a two-unit service.  This took over two hours and was less expensive.  I will definitely use them for all my service needs in the future.

The food here is really really good! I had the Cuban sandwich with the fries. The pork shoulder in the sandwich was melting in my mouth with every bite. The bread was toasted perfectly and had great crunch to it. The fries there have this amazing seasoning and are very flavorful. For dessert, I ended up with the strawberry bar and it was really tasty. Great texture, and just the right amount of sweet. Highly recommend this place!

My folks live in Sun City, so I pass this Exxon every time on my drive over to my parents.

The business offers gas, car repair and towing.

I typically will use QT or Costco gas, but in November I was heading to my parents, I didn't realize I was close to "E" until I was driving up to the light by the Sun City Exxon. I pulled in thinking I would fuel up before stopping at my parents. As I was about to pull into their location, I saw their employees (???) physically standing on the corner of the business shouting and holding up Trump signs. Their actual store signage wasn't the latest auto repair special, but "Trump 2016" - they were being so aggressive in their shouting, I opted to drive west a few more miles to the QT, I didn't want to be heckled while I filled up my tank.

Cute decor in this bright attractive little restaurant. It is located at the front of a medical building facing Thunderbird Avenue and directly across the street from a bowling alley This restaurant is a great find! Quality food in a convenient location. 

Friendly service here, they actually remember their customers. I liked my breakfast of bacon, eggs, home fries plus great coffee! For lunch I drop by for my favorite sandwich, the BLT, that uses great applewood cured bacon. Daily specials encourage trying new dishes. Like the chili with delicious cornbread.

Lemon cheesecake is definitely a winner! Just the right consistency with fresh lemon flavor. Can't wait until the owner/chef prepares it again!
Always fresh meet with an excellent flavor. Not sure how to prepare it, Just ask.  The owners and their service are awesome!

This yoga treats the body, brain, and spirit.  Master Stephanie leads you through exercises to strengthen and stretch the body, but more importantly on a journey of meditation to relax and open your heart and soul.  I have been a happier and calmer person since practicing at a body and brain yoga center.

I can't believe I've never written a review for Ghostlight before! We come here quite often and every show is exceptional! The actors hang around afterward to chat and for photos.
Of course, the biggest complaint would be seating.This place is tiny and cramped. 
The restrooms are outside of the theater and the Ghostlight is in a shopping center that has seen better days.
Come for the performance and try not to nudge your neighbor too much.

It was crowded when we arrived, but we did not have a long wait. 

Everyone, and I mean everyone from the front office people, to the doctors, to random people walking by who worked there was very friendly. I was met with a smile by everyone.

The computer didn't record the forms I filled out online and I apologized to the guy who brought me back to the room (forgot his name) and he said they were having computer problems and typed everything in for me. And you know how sometimes even though they say it isn't a bother, but you can feel it is and they are annoyed- so not the case. He was wonderful. 

Dr. Scott seemed like he knew what he was doing, took the time to even point out the break in my xray to my little boy and answered his many questions. He didn't act like he needed to get me in and out as quick as possible and made sure all my questions were answered.

Rick the guy who did my cast was awesome as well. You could tell he took great pride in his work and cared about his patients. 

I saw that they were voted as one of the best workplaces in the valley. You can see that in the pride every employee took in performing their jobs. The place was clean and very nicely decorated. 

I would recommend this place to anyone.

I attended this venue for the first time (of many more to come) on Saturday.  'You've Got Hate Mail' is hysterically funny, raunchy and so befitting of our electronic culture right now. Kudos to the cast of 5! 

The only negative I have is the theater could use more comfortable seats (padding was negligible) so I was undecided about feeling bad that it was such a short play or happy that it was such a short play. Overall, I will be back (with seat cushion in hand). Great neighborhood venue.

Took system to PCSavants  602-492-3499 http://pcsavants.com/ and it was fixed within 2 days with a 6 month warranty. The gentleman repaired the damaged done by FIX AND PLAY which consisted of a broken ribbon, broken clip, and the wire that ejects and loads the disk (pulled separately from the board itself). Priced very reasonably charged $50. Fix and Play charged over $200 and never fixed the system. Go to PCSavants if you want your system to actually work and not be taken advantage of. Very honest and trustworthy individual. I will continue to take my systems and recommend PC Savants to those who want a fair price and a working product. 

***AND no Stephanie I am not the owner and this is a real review, just because he doesn't have a big shop, doesn't mean he isn't a good trusting person, he's a very honest and skilled gentleman who was able to fix the damage a big shop did, so don't be a hater on those who are hard working and honorable.

My mother and father used Jim and his staff before I came to Arizona and being from Wisconsin and knowing how to fix his own car ( my Dad) that's saying a lot!!  My parents have both passed and now I go to Jim Rose.  In fact, my husband and I just had a 1999 Chevy S-10 transported across the country from Virginia to Jim's shop.  He put on new tires and fixed the battery and the brakes and said we were "good to go".  He got done 3 days early and we are so happy with Jim and his staff that we wanted to share our experience.

Keep up the great work!!!
Daisy & David Anderson

I had a legal issue with a county in another state.  I tried to call them to find out what they wanted to no avail.  I wasn't sure what to do - get an attorney in that state or ignore the legal issue and hope it went away.  I decided to call Moore Law Firm.  They advertise in our local parish newsletter so I decided to go with them.  I met with Mr. Matthew Gobbato, an attorney in the firm.  After he read the documentation that I had received, he picked up the phone and called the other state.  I had zero luck contacting anyone on this issue.  He contacted the law firm at the other state, explained the issue and asked for a call back from the attorney.  Within 24 hours, he solved the problem.  I definitely recommend Moore Law Firm and Mr. Matthew Gobbato for your legal issues.  Everyone at the law firm was so helpful and polite.  Very fair and reasonable.

You might initially be impressed with this independent auto repair shop (SC Auto Repair, 10120 Bell Rd, Sun City) as I was with all the cars parked outside (really a tow storage yard) and all the plaques they post on their wall (never had a good experience in a place that tries to impress/ sell you on their service with things on the wall ) and think this must be a great place to have your car worked on....."NOT"....run don't walk.  What is really going on is they get their business primarily from Tow Trucks that I believe are contracted to bring in disabled cars and then when you are most vulnerable and at their mercy, they stick it to you in repairs and  outrageous prices.  They have one guy who's full time job is to work up the bill so what does that say for one small shop. They will engage in arguing with the customers when your unhappy and realize they're trying to rip you off.  If you should be fortunate enough to Tow your vehicle out of there and go somewhere else for repairs, they hit you with a Diagnostic fee in our case $120.00 which they never stated to begin with and  the Towing fee too . It cost us 184.00 to get our vehicle back from them and take it somewhere else we can trust to do repairs or they will hold your vehicle hostage and charge you daily storage fees until you find a way to move it (not only is there other Tow Trucks bringing in vehicles, they have one of their own too) big time business).  They will also put a mechanics lien on your vehicle if you dispute paying them what they charge which you won't find this stuff out until you want to leave. They have a BBB plague on their wall but that's got to be a joke cause they would have to burn the place up with complaints just posted here.....can you imagine this must be just a drop in the bucket.  If you get stranded and the Tow driver recommends this place, he is getting a kick back no doubt to reel you into the darkest experience ahead.

Update: This place wanted to charge us around 400.00 plus to put on a new starter which we had priced at the Auto Parts store for 65.00 rebuilt and 110.00 new "Retail". We also wanted an alignment done and they said it couldn't be done without fixing the suspension with an estimate of 1300.00 for that without the alignment yet. In fact I was first told it cold take several thousand dollars to fix everything wrong with the car.  As you know from the earlier review, we took the car to a reputable repair shop that replaced the starter labor and all for 291.00 and did the alignment for 65.00....and on our way....big price difference.  I was so pissed on how they tried to rip us off and cost us 184.00 for nothing just to get our car back and leave which we had towed at no charge by the reputable repair shop I think out of sympathy for what we had gone through at Mike's, I went back to Exxon Sun City (aka Mikes) and told the manager what we paid to get our repairs done because he argued with us that we didn't know what we were talking about and their prices and repairs are correct......well all he had to say to me now was good for me and we're closed.  I hear from another review here AAA dumped them but they still hang the plaque on the wall.  I am pondering filing a formal complaint against these people cause they are truly preditors.

Pay nearly 300 a year for bi annual ac check.   Things go well until the company is bought out by service experts.  In 2013 the tech starts telling us with each visit that our unit is about to fail, and starts hard selling us on a new unit.   Six months later same tech, same story.   Six moths later... Again, same tech same story.   Six months later we get a new tech...who says everything is FINE.   Six months later we get another new tech (the last one was no longer employed).     So I brief this new tech about my suspicions about the unit and ask if there is "incentives" for techs to sell units.  He confides in me that the "new company" pressures its techs to sell a new unit if the unit the customer has is 10 years old or older.  He says our unit is FINE.    I thank him for his honesty.   Now were told this guy is no longer employed with the company.  

So here is the question... do you want someone who stands to gain something in the failure of your AC unit to maintain your unit?

I certainly don't and can't trust these guys anymore.  In fact we cancelled our maintence program (12 years now) because of our lack of confidence.

For about the last 7 years, I have used this company to do annual check-ups and warranty repairs on my two 5-ton Trane units.  Up until recently, I would have rated them at 4 or 5 stars.  The last service (or lack thereof) caused me to look elsewhere.

Brief story..
