In January, one of our units quit heating.  I called the after-hours number and made an appointment for the following morning, with an 8-10am window.  Around noon, I called to see where the tech was.  The person I spoke to said something like "Oh...well the people I talked to didn't check our schedules here".  So, she scheduled an appointment for later that day, between 1 and 3pm.  Around 3:30, I called to find out where the tech was and found out he was running late.  A phone call would have been nice.  The tech arrived and diagnosed the problem as a bad fan motor.  He told me the part was in stock and he would install it the next day. Fine. I was at work and had my wife stay home all day waiting for him to show.  Around 4:30pm, I called and asked when he would arrive.  The person I spoke to said that she didn't see any service scheduled that day.  I told her what he said, and she replied "he can't say that!"  I felt she was a little snippy with me and could have been kinder.  I felt like saying "I'm not the bad guy!"  A few days later, a different tech showed up on time to replace the motor.  The only problem is that this did not fix the problem.  My unit was still dead.  So this new tech proceeded to make another diagnosis.  He had to call another technician to find out what the blinking led light error code meant.  He still could not figure it out, and a third tech had to -come out.  The third tech came out and discovered it was a faulty low-pressure switch and told me that the part would be ordered and would likely be in the following Monday.  Monday passed. No calls.  I called them on Wednesday.  They said that they were short-staffed and had to send someone to pick up the part.  The weather wasn't really cold so I said the following week would be fine.  Well, the next Monday came and went.  No calls.  I finally called around Thursday.  The person I spoke to said that they were having trouble getting the part.  I was then actually told that "maybe another company paid extra and got my part."  (I was thinking to myself...You did not just tell me that!).  I finally called and complained to the Service Experts corporate office.  Shortly afterwards, I received a call from the local manager.  He was nice and apologetic and assured me that they would do better.  I told him that I should not have to be making so many phone calls to track them down.  They should be calling me, the customer,  to to keep me informed.  He agreed and we ended the call politely.  Unfortunately, the same problem came up the following week.  The part hadn't come in.  I had to call them to see what was going on.  Then finally, the part came in and was installed.  The cost of the repair ended up being about $30 more than I was quoted.  No big deal, just another annoyance.  I feel that I was patient and gave them way too many chances to fix the issue.  The poor follow-up and lack of communication drove me nuts!  I decided to try another company this year for my annual tune-up.  I hated to do it, but Bob Brown Service Experts lost a good customer.

Jim and company are great mechanics and good people, but most importantly they are HONEST! You can find competent mechanics most anywhere, but honesty is the rarest and most valuable thing you can find in auto repair! They get my complete and unreserved reccommendation!

They replaced the rear differential on my truck. A week later on my way home from Mike's, the differential burns up! Oops, I guess someone forgot to fill it with the proper fluid. 2 weeks later they put another differential on and it finally works! Yeah. Oh and this cost me $2700 and they didn't even offer to get me a rental. These guys claim to be a "Top Shop" but I believe that someones relative works for AAA. BS! This place can suck my peanuts. CROOKS I SAY

******WARNING****** Another victim here. Sun City Towing was called to have truck taken to a diesel shop (not theirs). Tom calls minutes after truck was loaded and said he sees we are towing  your diesel and that we have diesel mechanics at Mike's Sun CIty Union as well. Ray owns the towing and shop so makes it convient to talk customers into bringing to their shop by saying we will give you 2-3 hours of free diagnostics.. Is this legal first of all?
Weeks go by and we(ray and tom) agree verbally to replace the motor with a used motor. Quote was 7200-7400 plus a few hundred for wiggle room.. Ok with that so far.
First used motor was not correct one.. Said it came with turbo - it didn't (no price change)
Tom agreed to swap my injectors since they were oversized and confronted mechanic after motor was installed and he stated no one told me to swap out. Will keep his name out as he is stuck in the middle of all this drama (his words). However yesterday he had a attitude toward me because he had to buy a $200 tool to pull injectors.
Lost my keys and registration is missing!!!!
Broke headlight, but glued it and Ray said its fixed ( he is ordering me one after not giving in to a glued part)
Truck there almost 7 weeks.. Went to pick it up last friday and bill was over $8800 WOW
BBB doesn't have a rating now on company.. Look into it as I did.
Parts were marked up 175-300% roughly.
They knew my budget from the get go and don't care at all. Had a sheriff assist me in a civil stanbye yesterday and the owner basically said your truck is running if you want it then pay the bill.....PLEASE DON'T GO HERE..
WILL BE FILING COMPLAINT WITH BBB NEXT.

CHRIS B.

We love Mikes!!    Don't let the name on this review fool you.  It is Currently Sun City Exxon.  Our first fortunate visit was when it was Sinclair.  Nevertheless, we love this Station.  We just moved a couple of miles from Mikes in Peoria.  We have two Mercedes.  One 1974 Diesel, and a newer, 2004, SL 500.  The 'old girl' as we call her, had the clutch go out at an inconvenient time (just moving, finances tight).  We had the car towed literally across the street to a German auto repair place.  We were STUNNED by the estimate.  We asked if they would install parts we furnished. They gave a flat no.  We called to have our car towed again.  This time the driver suggested Mikes.  They looked it over and cut the price in half.  The car was up and running in no time. We feel confident in their knowledge.  Tom has experience working on each of our particular models.  We have since had some minor issues with the old girl.  We are so grateful for Ray and Tom.  The car needed brake work.  They ordered and replaced the brakes.  Once we came home, drove the car for awhile, we had a nagging feeling that they were different.  We took it back, and they found that the parts they ordered happened to be faulty (there was no way to know that until we drove it).  They kept the car and made it right at no additional cost to us.  She has perfect brakes now.   We are planning to return, after vacation, to have a new alternator installed.  It's an old car... Things are falling apart from age.  We were quoted a modest price for the part and labor.   In addition, we recently took the 2004, and enough oil, a new filter to have them changed before a trip to WA.  We were extremely blessed when Ray had his mechanic perform this service, at no charge.   These are good people.  They are always busy, but that is a really good thing.  The best thing that has happened to us since moving to Peoria, was when the tow truck driver suggested Mikes.   We are loyal!!   Highly recommend these folks.

If I could rate this company without any stars I would! Everyone knows that it is impossible to live in Az without A/C in the summer! I called this company and set up an appointment for a tech to come out. The first appointment was cancelled via the company. The next day the gentleman came by and quoted me to fix my a/c. The quote was for under $300 and the part was still covered by my manufacture's  warranty. The part I needed to replace was a TXV valve. This valve is involved in the pressure to force the cool air out of the vents in the house. I was completely satisfied with this and let the tech know please go ahead and order the part! The next day my tech called me back and informed me that the quote wasn't correct and unfortunately he needed to order one more part (sensory bulb) and this part was $695 more and is not covered by the warranty! I told the tech to please let me do some research before we order that part. I called Lenox my A/C company and talked to a gentleman that told me that in all of his 25 years of working with and for Lenox he had never heard of this sensory bulb that is associated with my model of A/C. His advice was to call the company and get more information. So I called back to Bob Brown and got one of the 1-800 reps to give me the number of someone that could answer my questions. I got the personal cell phone number of a manager that helped this tech jack up the price of the quote and this manager then gave me an explanation that indeed I needed this part and never addressed my issue of why did the Lenox Tech have no idea why and what this sensory blub was needed! After getting a really bad feeling I called a friend's husband who works in the industry and gave him the whole story. He let me know that Bob Brown was full of crap and to call a person he knows is a tech. i called and within 5 days my A/C was fixed. Eddie(good guy) showed me the part when he removed it and explained to me that the sensory bulb is one piece that comes standard with any TXV valve! The whole time this company was trying to rip me off!!!! I am making it my mission to let everyone know, DO NOT TRUST BOB BROWN!!!!! Do your research and don't be a fool to there nonsense!!!!!

I was hesitant about going to place after reading yelp reviews to be honest. I talked to owner and he was really professional and cared about the concerns I had. The customer service was very friendly as well and welcoming compared to other place i been. They got my car up and running again within a day and a half. I will keep them in mind next time!

I highly recommend this company.  Jeff the owner and his team were amazing.  Customer service, honesty, and his team were great.  Jeff was awesome at explaining how everything worked and the possibilities.  I wouldn't go with anyone else as during these circumstances people could be over charged!  Jeff and his company gave us an amazing price and great workmanship!

I stumbled upon Pete's after my car was stalling out. I had just moved down the road and didn't know the area. I had an incredible experience. They diagnosed and fixed the issue and my car is running great! I continue to use Pete's for routine maintenance and appreciate that they offer courtesy rides so I can just drop my car off and get a ride home and back. In my experience, service has been timely and everyone has been nice, and they don't try to sell me on service not needed. Also, after my car needed repairs, they even talked through everything with my dad who is a mechanical engineer specializing in automotive since I didn't have a clue so my dad could tell me if it was legit and i appreciate them taking that extra time. Very professional.

PRO: The food is GREAT! Salsa was the only thing that was gross out of the food. The server was the owner and she was really nice and made some great suggestions when it came to the food. CONS: No high chairs when we asked for one she said they only ever have older people come in (we are in our late 20s early 30s) so that was a little off putting, also I ordered a tea and my husband ordered a lemonade I am picky when it comes to my tea and was not a fan of the tea so I asked for a lemonade in stead yet she charged me for 3 drinks when technically we only had two drink orders. Because of this we will probably never come back. :/ which is a shame because the food was good, but I'm not about getting nickeled and dimmed.

Was referred to the Core Institute by a Banner hospital after my motorcycle accident. My thumb had swelled up to the size of a tennis ball and at the ER they said there was no broken or fracture bones but thought I had skiers thumb. I made an appointment and was seen by a PA, a week after the accident. He found I did have a hair line fracture on the metacarpal bone by looking at the X-ray from the ER and was shocked they missed it. So I was put in a short hand cast and told to come back in a week for new X-rays. I came back and my appointment was at 8:00 am, I got there at 7:50 am. I was taken back to a exam room, sat there for 15 min and then the MA realized I needed X-rays so she had me sit in the waiting area for them. No one was getting X-rays done and the 2 X-ray techs were in the X-ray room gossiping for 25 min until one came to get me and took 3 X-rays of my hand. 2 X-rays were taken almost the same way, hand flat on the table and the only difference between them was the way I had my fingers, thumb never moved. The last was taken of my palm up. I was then taken back to the exam room and waited 30 min for the PA to see me. He came in and we went over my X-rays. 2 of the X-rays showed just a hair line fracture but the other which was one of the ones they took the same way twice had a completely broken bone. He then left the room to talk to a doctor, who I don't who and the PA came back in to tell me I needed pins put in. I asked if we could get a CT scan done cause that shows the bone better then an X-ray and I honestly believe the X-ray with the broken bone wasn't of my hand because the thumb bones were different shapes and sizes then the other 2 X-rays. But the PA said I didn't need it and I needed to schedule surgery ASAP. I told him I wanted a second opinion which he said I had every right too, but he would have the surgery scheduling dept call me. He had me taken out of my cast and put in a split in case I had surgery. An hour after I had left the surgery dept called and I told them I was seeking a second opinion at which point they became rude and gave me a hard about seeking it, so I hung up. 

I got my second opinion, they did a CT scan and found it was a fracture and the bone was not broken so no need for surgery. Its been 5 weeks since the accident, I'm in a Velcro cast and the fracture line is almost gone.

The Core Institute seemed fine at first but on the second visit I realized they just wanted to do an unnecessary surgery to get more money, they wouldn't do a CT scan do put my mind at easy told me they didn't care and the fact I never saw a MD once, even when they wanted to do surgery was BS. I never even got a call back to check up on me and see if I got a second opinion.
Repaired my air conditioning, engine mount, and serpentine belt.

There is much better theatre all around Arizona. I have seen a few productions at this venue and surely the director or owner or whoever had better people to cast than those I saw at the shows. Also, the audience members that I can only assume are common Ghostlight goers are rather rude and unwelcoming of new people even know they should be thankful people are even buying to see these shows

This review is about the Physical Therapy Department of The Core Institute in Peoria. My Physical Therapist, Heather Peden, is absolutely awesome! I suffered an injury that caused a bulging disc in my back, and a pinched nerve that shoots disabling pain into my upper thigh. I have never experienced an injury like this, and I was a mess during my first appointment with Heather 9 weeks ago. I was in pain, frightened, emotional, and in a wheelchair. Heather put me at ease right away with her warmth and compassion. Since then I have seen Heather twice a week, and now once a week, and I have made great progress. My pain is manageable, I'm no longer in a wheelchair, or using a walker or cane. I am stronger and know I'm healing. But, when I get discouraged at lingering pain or inabilities, Heather smiles her 1000 watt smile and reminds me how far I've come. She is extremely knowledgeable. She answers all the questions my husband and I ask, and we never feel rushed. In fact, when I'm with her, I have her complete attention. I am also impressed with the professionalism of the entire Physical Therapy Department. I never have to wait to be called back for my appointment, and everyone on staff and at the front desk is friendly. I (almost) look forward to coming! I highly recommend The Core Institute Physical Therapy in Peoria to everyone!

Spoke with mgr Joe on the phone inquiring about replacing my front brake pads. He laughed and said it wasn't the brake pads, that they last over 100k miles. That's weird i told him I replaced them 2 years ago and the brakes get a lot of wear and tear due to long commute to work, and i know my vehicle. So since this shop is close to home i gave them a shot. Mgr calls me and says that i need new front brake pads  and rotors. Weird my brakes aren't squeaking why the rotors. I told him didn't you just laugh at me when i asked you to replace pads. He wanted $500, so I picked up my car. He charged me $60 just for looking at brakes. I took it to Brake Masters in Peoria, and Jeff advised me that it only needed brake pads and the rotors were in great shape. Why would Pete Nelson Auto try to take advantage of someone that works 2 job to support his family? Please stay away.

Bob Brown is replacing a working unit ( that's right a WORKING unit that apparently needs an $1800 coil cleaning) on my mother in laws home with a new unit and an 8 year service contract for close to $18,000 when all is said and done.  It is n 1800 sq home and 1 unit.  I can't talk her out of doing it, but I can warn others.  Do not use Bob Brown service Experts.

In April, 2018 my elderly mother experienced extensive water damage involving both of her bathrooms and toilets and much of the carpeting in her house.  The entire restoration process took several weeks, during which asbestos was also discovered.  Multiple companies were involved in getting everything back to normal. The work that ServPro did was excellent.  All of the ServPro employees were punctual, professional, and very committed to making things exactly as my mother wished.  Additionally, ServPro acted as "general contractor", interacting with all of the other companies and, at times, the insurance company; coordinating the scheduling of the different contractors; serving as the single point of contact with me and my brother; and following up with us at each stage of the process. We would particularly like to thank Jeff and Anthony, and highly recommend ServPro of Sun City / Sun City West / Southeast Surprise.

Do not use this company! I'm only giving it a one star because you can't give it zero. We've had a maintenance plan with this company for a year now and every single interaction has been horrible. Staff never knows what's going on; there's no customer service; we never get phone calls returned when promised; technicians never show up on time; we've been billed incorrectly; etc. The last straw was that a technician came out to provide a tuneup as part of our maintenance agreement. A/C was working fine when he arrived. After the appointment, we didn't have the AC running until the evening when we turned it on right before bed. It's broken! Called back in the morning and they don't know when they can have someone come out; said they were going to charge us for the technician to come out (possibly the same person who broke the unit in the first place). Unfortunately, this review is based on a year's worth of interactions that have proven this company to be awful. Avoid.

It is truly unfortunate when a excellent company begins to fail in the quality of service, especially when one has been a client since 2008. Out of the last three services I have received, 2 would be considered poor to mediocre... especially the latest one as the tech was somewhat argumentative and also damage the expensive paint work in the kitchen. Touch-up are to be done as he had no notion how to position his ladder thus damaging/scrapping the paint on the wall. It was notice after he left. Also to be noted was the lack of follow-up either by the technician or the main office regarding information on the next contract. I have decided to use a different company in the future. What ever happen to quality assurance and follow-up but especially quality service. I rare complain but this time, it really hit the roof!

So I call Farmers and arrange for a tow to larry miller Toyota.The Camry was dead, I asked specifically to be towed. I leave for a few minutes, when I arrive back the tow truck has been here and left, telling my 83 year old mother(owner of the car) that it doesn't need to be towed, drive it up. Wow! So I get in the car that he started and left running, instead of my mom trying to drive a disabled vehicle up to the dealer,and what do you think happened? The car dies on the offramp for Bell rd in the middle of morning rush hour.I simply cannot believe that after arranging for my insurance co to have my car towed w a service that we pay for, that the person that they used to provide the service would refuse to do the work or even have an opinion as to what we should do. Let this be a lesson to never use Mikes Sun City Unocal for your tow service, EVER! These people left me dead in the water in rush hour traffic for 2 HOURS! This was almost my 83 year old mother in this situation. DO NOT USE THEM!

Most individuals entering a medical facility are probably not starting off Happy. I was one of them. Thank you Desiree for your chipper attitude, Dr  Darbandi for your calm and reassuring diagnosis and Abel for the extra options for care. I will say  "I left with a better attitude".       By the way, your reception and X-ray teams are highly effective.  They made me feel at home in X-ray.

this company messed up on my transmission warning owner is pos. Every review that give five stars is a fake review. Owner repossessed cars that people can't pay for because he charges ridiculous prices after fixing it and sell them on the lot scam need to be shut down

My wife and I ate breakfast at this restaurant located in the front of a medical building. It was quite busy and we looked at the menu prices and decided to give it a try. We weren't disappointed. My wife ordered a dish with carnitas and eggs and loved it while I ordered Betty's special scramble with ham, spinach and other delights. Delicious!  The fact portions are on the small side which is ok with me and we received our meals only 5 minutes after ordering even though the restaurant was packed. Very reasonable pricing. We will be back to try lunch.

This place has always been super busy the few times i have been there. When you make an appointment, they ask you to be there 30 min prior to your appointment. You get there, fill out a sheet with some info...and wait. Then you get taken back to a room to be seen by your doctor/specialist...then wait some more. 

i had an appointment today at 830. got there at 815, filled out my sheet, then waited. got walked back to the exam room...then waited at least another 30 minutes before the doctor came in. She literally talked/asked questions for 3 minutes, then rushed me out. Was not happy. 

Sadly, this has been my experience everytime i have been there. The doctor was very nice and cordial, but each time i saw her, i always had to wait much longer than i should have, and was always rushed out of there. 

i understand that its a busy place, but at least act like you care about your patients.

By far my fav place! Al and Trudy offer exceptional customer service and product. I was never a huge meat eater but i must say when you have the best its hard to turn away.They always offer cooking tips and techniques, which are greatly appreciated! The stuffed peppers are a must when you visit! My husband and I try to get up here every few weeks, sometimes just because we enjoy the two owners so much!

To start I LOVE Federico's....But NOT this location.  I typically get the AZ Burro at Federico's and it's always BOMB at the Litchfield Park, and Maryvale locations.  When I got it here, I swear that was not carne asada but GATO!   YUCK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I love going here for all of my plant and tree needs! The place itself is cute. There is a little pond for the kids to see fish and nice walkways. The customer service is phenomenal. They are always able to answer all of my questions, have a great selection, and the best part-their prices are the best around.

I am very disappointed in my experience with Bob Brown's.  I purchased a maintenance plan for my unit over the summer.  I had scheduled a maintenance appointment with the company, confirmed in 4 different ways, and the technician did not show up at his scheduled time.  Why would you make such a big effort to schedule my maintenance appointment if your technician did not intend to keep the scheduled time?   When I called the company's phone number, the after hours desk could not do anything.  Not only did I not receive a followup phonecall, but I had to call a week later just to get an explanation.  The explanation that was given was that she didn't know what happened and she is sorry.  I am certain that there are better companies that can do this work.

My ac went out and had another company come out and tell me my system was empty and had a leak at coil and because its older I need to replace it now.
I called bob brown and spoke to a woman I think named holly who sells new units I explained I was told by previous company I needed a unit but didn't really trust him. She insisted I have a tech from  Bob brown come out to make sure I really needed a whole unit and was very helpful. A tech name willy came out right on time and found a wiring problem within 10 mins and the system was not empty either. He explained different options for upkeep or replacement because my system is from 96' I am happy I have a company I can trust and actually diagnosed the problem instead of just replacing the unit. I will call them again and recommend to others.

EXXON at 10120 W. Bell Road, Sun City, AZ.  BOYCOTT and tell ALL of your friends.  Not my experience, but they treated my sister, horribly!  This place is a joke!  Drive a vehicle in for diagnostics, find out you owe $$$ for unauthorized work- $155 over your quote - told it has to be towed off the lot when confronted over the unauthorized work which has now incapacitated your vehicle.  They'll offer you a great deal on the tow through their company... another $100.  So...$255 in addition to the $145 for diagnostic testing.  Vehicle now sits.  SCAM MUCH?  Don't go there, especially, if you are female.  Refused to use partnered tow company, instead calling her insurance company, while THE OWNER bellowed, from behind the desk that he TOLD her she'd have to have it towed.  Didn't have to have it towed there... SCAM CENTRAL. -1,000,000

I would give this company a zero star but there aren't zeros available called them late last night told me that they would be there between 8 AM and 10 AM they have my home phone number and my cell phone number the service technician called my cell phone number at 9:15 I called him back at 9:38 and he advised me that he was not allowed to come out until I answered my phone then told me he had one call ahead and him I had to wait another two hours before he could come out I just. I called the different air conditioning company they came out the same day within a half an hour I will never use Bob Brown service experts again.

Thank you Allison from the Core Institute for your reply but why would I get one of your patient advocates involved?  It seems to me that unfriendly employees would be a training/company issue not a patient advocate issue.

Prices are a freaking joke!!!!!! All they want to do is over charge and take advantage of their customers!!! How is an AC unit cost $15,000-$60,000 and the same one elsewhere with all the bells and whistles cost $11,000!!! Highway robbery!!!
I did talk to them BEFORE they left their response here. They had no explanation for what happened and just said sorry. They also removed my review from their website.

First thing is trust the bad reviews! Car had issues insurance set up towing company. I had told them I want to go to the dealerships, RAY called me and persuaded me to use the towing companies repair shop with a free diagnostic. So I thought great after finding out it was just spark plugs and coils I decided to not pay $550 and do it myself. RAY chanced his tune and said I owed $140 plus $90 if I wanted it towed back. I understand people need to get paid but it need to be upfront and honest. After RAY refusing to give me my car keys until I paid and I had to threaten to call the cops I finally got my keys back and didn't pay. I tipped the guy who did the 15min diagnosis 20 bucks when Ray found out he rushed over to my car and yelled at me and told me not to pay his tech he will after giving me this line my techs need to get paid for their time. Learn from my mistake don't do it!!!!!

If you have their a/c/furnace maintenance program as I have had for twelve years have you noticed that they recently started sending TWO people to check your system? Previously (24 visits) just one technician attended and did a good job. But now a second man attends. It happened in April and again in October. The first said he was a "Customer Comfort" rep. In October the second  man said he was the new area manager who was there to ensure the technician does all the right things such as "wearing booties before entering the home". THESE ARE LIES. They are SALESMEN. It is obvious their main thrust is now to put pressure on you to buy their parts or costly labour even when you are under warranty. They did my service last week and even though it is October and hence close to winter, they DID NOT CHECK MY FURNACE, but latched onto what they claimed was a potential a/c failure mode with a labor cost of $1,800 to replace. Five years after buying a complete system from them, 2009, they charged $900 to replace a failed compressor. At this recent visit they also checked the wrong boxes on the Performance Inspection sheet. Their reading of Relative Humidity (RH) showed 38 which is optimal but they checked the box as "FAIR" which is less than 35. Filtration was checked in April as Good but this time they checked it as fair EVEN THOUGH I HAD FITTED NEW FILTERS THAT MORNING.
They said I needed the ducts cleaned which is correct but I told them I would not use them. They wanted $695 for their 'valued customer'. Sears does it for $150 without a contract.
Note, when I had my a/c changed it was working well after 15 years since the house was built. It was only changed because the furnace was bad and they recommended complete unit change. This year the neighbors either side of me each had their a/c replaced AFTER 24 YEARS USE. I tried to fill in a customer satisfaction form with Bob Brown but when I submitted it a message said SOMETHING WENT WRONG. I tried to redo the form but it would not let me because it said the contract number I was using had already been used. As soon as my contract is up I will be going to another, well researched company, who truly value their customers rathe than try to rip them off. It is a shame. I had been happy with Bob Brown for years but this 80 year old (51 years as an electrical engineer) has been round the block more than once and recognize when what should be my friendly vendor has become a high pressure rip off artist where the drive for profits overrule customer satisfaction.

this is a msall theater with only one room.  we did enjoy the show 39 steps though i cant see other complex plays working out in this theater.  majority of the audiance is in their golden years but the plays they show are for all ages. 

con- the seating is not assigned so if you are a couple or a group, you may not be sitting together. 

pro- the theater is clean, staff is pleasant and you are able to drink or eat a light snack at your seat.

Told me it would be 40$ for an alignment I go in wait for 1 hour no one even talks to me or tells me when they are going to get to my car, they get to my car it take them over 2 hours for an alignment, there's no way this should take this long after about 4 hours of waiting on my car they finally give it to me, but changed the price on me and told me it would cost 100$ like are you kidding me?!?! Awful customer service! Stay away from these guys they will rip you off! And my car is still not aligned 
If I could give a 0 star I would...

Ripoff alert! Called these guys October 5, 2015 to tune up my evap coolers. I told them I needed at least one pump and a general tune-up. I used to do this myself, but age and health motivated me to get some help this year. 

The technician, Eric, was outside for around half an hour. When he came to the door, I thought he was done and expected to pay around $200. Turns out he was just working on an estimate. His proposal included $463 for two pump motors. I must have bought a dozen of these items through the years and I know you can't possibly spend more than $30 at home depot. I am used to paying around $20. So a 1,000% markup!

It gets better. Eric thought I also needed two v-belts. These are the kind of thing you see in a car connected to the fan. They can't possibly cost more than $10 each. Eric wanted to charge me ... wait for it... $662!!! With the proposed fee of $238 for cleaning, $89 service fee and $378 for pads, the grand total would have been$1,830 to service two coolers. Another company is doing the work today for around $250. I noticed these guys are based near Sun City and maybe they have an easier time ripping off old people. 

As I was sputtering at Eric about how much these items cost at Home Depot, and was he kidding? he said I should probably get them at Home Depot, then. 

I called into the office today to get my money back for the $89 service fee since the estimate was not in good faith. The first guy I talked to, Jeff,  said Bob Brown Service Experts is a corporation and that the price for parts is set and they couldn't do anything about it. (I have a corporation too but I can't charge my clients 10 or 20 times what my products and services are worth. 

Finally Dan got on the line and said he'd refund the service fee and that Eric must have quoted the wrong prices. I find that difficult to believe since Eric looked ashamed and said he can't do anything about the prices the company sets. We both knew he had attempted to rip me off and was unsuccessful. I don't think Eric is a rogue employee that cooks up crazy estimates without the company knowing about it. 

Stay away from these thieves!

Do not take your car to this nightmare shop. I would give them zero stars if I could.  After the transmission died on my car, local tow truck driver recommended this shop.  Being new to the area, I said "sure, take it there."  Big mistake.

I paid close to $4,000 for a used transmission with allegedly 40k miles on it.  I asked owner for paperwork showing where he got the transmission, so that I could verify that it indeed only had that many miles.  Owner refused to provide that.  But that wasn't the worst of it.  IT TOOK THEM FOUR WEEKS TO FIX THE CAR! I tried my best to be patient with them, but every time I called it was some new story as to why they still weren't done. When their various stories started contradicting themselves, I called the owner out on it.  He then started yelling at me for accusing him and his lead technician of lying.  

But wait, it gets worse.  After finally getting my car back, the "new" transmission failed within two weeks! I was stranded on the side of the highway about 130 miles from home. I called the shop to ask what I should do, and they said "go ahead and get it towed to the shop and we'll take a look." As it turns out, they said that there was a leak in some gasket and the transmission fluid was low, so the transmission was burning up.  Wonderful.  My theory is that they forgot to refill the fluid reservoir when they put it in. Regardless, it was their fault.  I asked the owner if he would help me with the $450 tow truck bill, and he refused, despite the fact that it was his shop's incompetence that caused it and despite the fact that he had offered me a "12,000 mile warranty."  

So, make that $4,450 for a used transmission of dubious origins and approximately five weeks total without a car.  Mistake learned.  My only solace is that maybe this review will help someone else avoid the misery this shop brought into my life.

he quit now I have to see another (could be weeks)
don't waste your money on these people

I had an appointment that had to be rescheduled because of rain. BB mIssed the appointment. No one from BB called or showed for the rescheduled appointment that was Saturday. I was referred here by Banner Estrella and not sure if I should make an appointment.  The follow-up was in regards to an auto accident.  There is an open claim number but I was told that they can't bill third parties at the facility in Arizona but they could in Michigan.  I let them know that this was a Michigan policy and Michigan has no fault insurance.  The hospital billed and had no problems doing so as did the  City of Phoenix for the ambulance ride.  Both bills were paid.  Med Life offered to send an open claim letter but I was told that they could still not do this because it was Arizona doctors.  Very disappointing and I can only assume their physicians don't trust insurance companies.  I can see why the ratings on Yelp are so low.

Why were these reviews not recommended?  Pretty legit feedback.

Friendly & knowledgable.  Delicious beef, fresh housemade sausages, bone-in double cut pork chops, the list goes on and on.  Try the bacon burgers! I spent an hour at the UPS store on Bell Road last Monday. I had several fragile items, as well as a large collection of random items. Never go here I just had the worst experience I had to call multiple times to see if my daughter's prescription went through finally they said they had it and I told him I'd be there an hour and a half to pick up the prescription when I got there the prescription was not ready so I gave her all of our insurance information because I To was waiting on an rx. My tenant had this company out to repair an AC unit that was not blowing cold air. Eric (119-02080) came out to the property and replaced a capacitor for $361.00. Once the new Capacitor was installed, Eric proceeded to explain to my tenant that the fan motor was running in reverse and that it may be time to replace a 9 year old unit or he could get it back to acceptable if a circuit board $419, a fan motor $723 and a contactor $193 were to be replaced. 

My tenant called me in a panic about a $1,335 repair that NEEDED to be done to get cool air back in their home. 

I contacted my home warranty company, who sent out a technician from Xtreme Air and found that the newly installed capacitor was installed backward causing the fan motor to spin in reverse. The technician correctly connected the capacitor and the unit immediately started cooling the home and the fan motor was spinning in the correct direction. Balance due for the service call - $65.

This company tried and was unsuccessful in trying to scam my tenants out of $1,335 for unneeded repairs.

Worst flower shop I have ever encountered!!!

Very disappointed. Had Ossobuco. Nothing to write home about.  Lot of food, dry, no flavor.  Not busy but had to keep asking for service.  My dog is enjoying the bone!  Other Italian food I have purchased here has been really good.

The absolute best omelette I've ever had...it was cooked perfect, had plenty of goodies inside, big portion also, hash browns were also good, and toast is toast.....I go here for my omelette fix.... it really is awesome

Won't be going back.  The service is just terrible.  When you are paying fairly high prices to calm down an ice cream attack, you want decent service.  This isn't the place to get it. 

My husband and I have stopped-in a couple of times, as it is fairly close to our house, but we have regretted it every time. So we've decided to drive one more block, during our next ice cream attack, to the Fry's Grocery Store one block away and save ourselves about $6 and have lots of ice cream left over in the freezer!
Excellent value for lunch!  We had a Cobb salad and a soup/ salad combo. Good breadsticks. Nice patio. Friendly service. Would return.

We're done! We used to enjoy their breakfasts. Sadly, no more. Twice in one week. One weekend day and one weekday, both with the same result. Cold meals. cold toast, eggs, potatoes, bacon. No more. Not worth it at any cost.
Excellent food waitress was very attentive to us. This restaurant reminds me of a restaurant we used to eat st in Brooklyn NY. Very family oriented.

If I could give this place zero stars I would. Reserved a car. Went in to pick up the car and was told our VALID credit card was not a valid form of payment, that it needed to be connected to a bank account. Um, what?! That would be a debit card, and nope. Needless to say, we walked out, and went to enterprise, who rented us a car with the SAME valid credit card... zero issues. Sounds like they wanted to scam us and drain our bank account. The girl looked high as a kite. Stay far away. You have been warned.

Second time to this store & it surely will be the last!! 
First visit, I overheard a customer pitching a fit about not being able to return her rental on Sunday because they were closed but yet the website allowed her to book and pay for a Sunday return. 
I had to wait a few seconds and even interrupt the employees to get attention as I waited a few moments and no one had even greeted me. I had to upgrade my car and pay extra money as a car they were attempting to write me was a piece of shit. Other than that the first visit was OK.
Now my second and last visit, I reserved the car five days prior online when I arrived on day of pick up, there was not a one car available for my reservation! 
The two guys that were there were very nonchalant and said pretty much it is what it is. They told me they have one car out getting the oil changed and they did not know when it would be back because they were not mechanics!
Customer service is really shitty here!

I've been going to this nail salon for a couple years now and Do My Nails have always pleased me with their friendly customer service! Whatever I wanted on my nails they have always done it better than anyone else.  When I go places I always get compliments on how nice my nails look! Everyone that I have referred to them have came back and thanked me for the recommendation! They are so amazing that they are expanding! Anna , Joan, Mr. Nguyen, and Long are  great and amazing nail technicians! Thank you for such quality and friendly services! -Sheena

I was a walk in. I was greeted promply, told to expect a twenty minute wait, and only needed to wait 5 minutes.  The prices were reasonable and I'm thrilled with how the pink and white acrylic with the gel overlay came out.  Was glad I took the advice of one of the girls as this is my nails for my wedding.  I'd definitely go again.

I brought my Kirby in for repair and was extremely impressed with the service. Customer oriented service is always what I look for in a new business and I found it here! Thankful for the new ownership! Definitely recommend.

From what I gather, this is THE place to go on a Saturday night in Sun City. Be prepared for outdoor seating, a sound system, and some geriatric boogie-ing.

The food was alright. We called ahead for takeout, and because of the crowd we had to wait 25 minutes for a pizza and salad. They have a bar with open seats, so OK. Bar was pleasant enough.

Cheese pizza, meh, nothing special. Chicken Caesar was also middle-of-the-road. I get it though, you're catering to an older crowd, and there's probably not much incentive to go nuts with flavors of any sort. Keep it bland, keep 'em coming in.
The spoon and fork were dirty and looked as though they were recently used. The Kung Pao chicken was rubbery and had no vegetables. The fortune cookie was stale?!?

Tl; dr: quick service, delicious food. No complaints at all. 

Full review: There are a few things I look for in diners: speed of service, and quality. This may sound obvious, with most of them serving the same items, but not all cafes/diners are equal. 

Now, I'm a satellite technician and I work all over the west valley. Whenever I have a lunch break, I usually stop at whatever is close. Today it happened to be royal cafe in sun city. 

While the area is predominantly senior citizens, I love breakfast more than any other meal. So I sat by myself and ordered my food (a #4 combo because I'm a sucker for eggs, pancakes, and bacon AKA the classics).

The service was quick. I ordered, had my food, and ate it within 12 minutes.

Also, the waitress was nice and she didn't waste my time. She brought the check with the food so I didn't have to wait.

As for the food, it was all delicious. Fluffy pancakes, perfectly scrambled eggs, and crispy but not burned bacon. 

I tried this place in a whim and wasn't disappointed.

Dr Baker and his staff are the best!  I have followed Dr Baker from another practice to this one because he is such a compassionate and understanding doctor.  He goal is to help his patients to be relieved of pain.  He does not promise miracles and is straight forward about expected outcomes.  He developed a plan for me that eased my suffering that started in 1995.  I am now 90% better and able to have quality life.  I do know that at times the wait is long but I always plan for this because sometimes people just need more time and I prefer that the doctor take that time with them rather than leaving them unclear about what is happening.  I also know that if I need extra time and attention it will be given to me.  I take a book or watch his tv and schedule nothing else during the next few hours just in case.  I find this a small price to pay for excellent care.  The staff has always been wonderful.  At one point I had a concern about one of them but  I talked to Dr Baker and he addressed the problem.  It never happened again. I try to remember we get better results with honey than with harsh words.  Thank you Dr Baker and staff for your excellent care!

Truly a great thin crust pizza, best in the valley, very tasty crust, not soggy and wet, just the right amount of crispy. Toppings are good and plentiful(Sausage & mushroom). Sauce tastes good, not overpowering, you can taste pizza in every bite, and not just sauce. Ask to have it cut in squares, so much better......

I saw Dr. Seth. Although I liked him, I will not return to this office. It was hard to find, as his name was no where to be found on the directory or office door. I feel like he was working out of another Dr.s office. Shoved back in a corner. Then I waited over a week with numerous calls to the office for my mri to be scheduled. Then I waited again with numerous calls again for results. No follow up appointment was made, I had to keep calling asking how I get results. The main office would just tell me  they would let his office know to call me. They never did. I am ready now to just get my films and go to a new Dr. Very frustrating.
Just introduced to this great restaurant!  Awesome food, great pricing and friendly staff! Highly recommend it!
Great place , The gentleman in there was very informative on what I owned offered me a very respectful price ,store is very clean ,I will return.

I am so grateful for Jeanne. I cannot even express in words how much she has helped me, my family and everyone around her. She is truly an amazing light worker, healer, and teacher...truly an Angel on Earth. 

I have learned so much from her spiritually. One of the first things she teaches all her students is to operate from integrity. And that she does. She is honest, kind, compassionate, a great teacher and also had a great sense of humor! Haha! You will see!! Her classes are so comfortable and enjoyable. You always walk out feeling SO good and EXTREMELY clear. And will always want to go back for more of it!! All her classes are amazing, I cannot stop taking classes from her. I have taken several classes over and over again, because they were so good (and she gives you a nice discount when you have already taken the class). 

I started out as a reiki client after years of persuasion from another friend, during my first pregnancy, at that time I did not know I needed the reiki at the end of my pregnancy....soon to find out, there was a problem with my placenta and I believe because of Jeanne's reiki, my baby was able to stay healthy inside of me before he had to be induced!! So of course, during my second pregnancy, I made sure I was getting reiki from her regularly! My sister and mother started to take reiki classes from her, and soon after I started taking her Angel card reading, mediumship, telepathy and Crystal healing classes (you get SO many beautiful and fancy crystals!!).....and reiki, and then rest of her classes her offers! I guarantee you will not be disappointed but will want to end up taking all of her classes!! I cannot wait for my kids to take her classes and start learning from her!! Go to her!! She is life changing!!!

The decor is like out of a 70's flash back, retro nothing wrong with that. I had the house chicken combo. It was good, noodles are tasty but the fried rice left a lot to be desired.Friendly service and decent price. This is my 2nd time here.  I enjoy the employees they are very nice and friendly always there to lend a suggestion.  They have a great selection of menu items and great specials.
Best pedicure I've ever gotten, the guy really took his time. My gel manicure came out amazing as well. My new nail place!

What a tasty surprise in the middle of Sun City.  I was visiting friends there for a week, and they insisted we go. Friendly and efficient staff served up a wide variety of staples like juicy Angus burgers, spaghetti, steaks, as well as breakfast stuffs. I really liked the broasted chicken which was very flavorful and moist. I also loved their strawberry shortcake and homemade pies.  

The prices are very fair, and they have a few specials too. We went back 3 times in a week. I highly recommend it.

PS. I just noted that yelp lists it as a Chinese Restaurant. It is definitely not Chinese but American.

Great place! The staff is very friendly & welcoming. I've been here 3 times already & I'll gladly stay a regular  You can't beat their prices compared to other places & they have a VIP membership where you earn points for free stuff. You really can't beat that!

Outstanding restaurant in such a unassuming location. wonderful host, and sweetheart server, family operated I think. Yui Shan Scallops, Fu Young, and Pot Stickers  for the price. 3 Stars, but it takes a lot to get that out of me.
I  love the store.  Bargains galore.   I have yet to go in and not come out with something.   If you're into Chico brand, this is your store!

This place was recommended by our tax guy (Delisle consulting) obviously we trust Bill but sadly the food is just sub-par. 
We went on a Friday night,  it took nearly 10 min to be approached at our table. There was a one woman band singing karaoke,  she was decent but no one else was participating. Our waitress had a sense of humor but not the best. She cleared some of our plates just to set them on the table next to ours rather than bringing them to the kitchen (lazy) 
We ordered a pizza,  a beef sandwich,  salad & wings. All of which were flavorless and boring. Nothing authentic. 
I was thankful that we didn't order any Italian entrees, from what we saw coming out of the kitchen there was no WOW factor. We won't go back but I bet the seniors in sun city will continue to frequent the place as the food seems right up their Alley flavorwise.

I would have given zero stars if it were an option. I live nearby and thought I would pick up a burrito to take to school with me for the next day.

When I went to eat it in the morning, I decided that I would like it to have some cheese. As I opened the tortilla a found a piece of a metal sponge on the tortilla. I let that issue slide and I ripped that piece of the tortilla off.

As I ate it later and fought the horribly over-cooked flavorless meat (I had also ordered the Green Chile Burrito per the employee's recommendation) I found A BUG inside of the burrito!!! I was so disgusted!! I have never had something like this happen to me before and I ignored the metal to only find something even worse.

I then called them to explain to them what had happened and they asked if I wanted another burrito. I refused the offer, because really, WHO would want to eat there after that?!? I told them that I was just calling to let them know what had happened so that they could be more careful and clean and then they HUNG UP the phone on me!!!! They wouldn't even take responsibility for this nastiness!!!

I paid $4.50 for the burrito and I left a $3 tip so that I could eat METAL and BUGS?!?  This has been my ultimate worst food experience EVER.

I HIGHLY recommend that you NEVER go here. Sorry guys, but you REALLY screwed up!

Great people, worth the wait. I was in town from out of state on a visit and stopped in for a pedi. Super friendly, great conversation and awesome work. Next time I'm in for a visit I'll be coming back!

Got our day started with an excellent breakfast at Royal Cafe. Our server Sophia was very attentive from the time we enter until we left. Our food was delicious and fresh. Important for me, the toast was warm and soft with real butter. Portion sizes were large, to the point that I left food on my plate. We will be back. Sincerely, Art & Karen Huseonica, Sun City.
I recently needed floral arrangements for a memorial service. The Sun City Florists did a fabulous job. The flowers were all delivered on time and looked absolutely beautiful. Great job!

I moved back to the area after 3 yrs thought I would take a fun shopping break OMG really the sales lady in the floor today was so rude, granted I was not in my Sunday best but when she approached and asked if I wanted to try the few items I picked out on and said no I was ready to pay for them, she glares at me over her glasses and says Are you sure you know we have a no return policy if they don't fit. I know your polices I used to enjoy shopping in this store never again BtW I spent 66.00 the other lady you were so nice and gushing all over did not spend a dime.

I'm a gold club member of hertz and was treated like trash at this dump of a location. I find it odd that I can get a full size SUV in Hawaii for $28.50 a day but the best this dump could do was $60 a day for a Kia in SUN CITY ARIZONA! Are you kidding me? What makes it worse is that when I took the KIA back, I overheard the employee saying "We have cars starting at $18 a day!" I only received my "Special rate," after calling the gold desk and having the lady in the other line tell me that she could get me 20% off of my $75 lowest daily rate! This place is in a dumpy 1970s strip mall that needs to be turned in and made into a proper dump! Avoid at all costs, they lie and have no reasonable pricing model for vehicles at this location.

I REALLY wanted to be able to give this restaurant a good review as that would mean I'd found a great Chinese restaurant- finally- in the Sun City area, and esp. because it's so close to my new home here.  I was leery because of reviews I'd read here and on nextdoor.com, but was willing to give it my own try.  I ordered shrimp chowmein (called lo mein every other place I've been) because I figured "how bad can that be?"; then for precisely the same reason/in order to get an accurate assessment of their food, I also ordered cashew shrimp (I was craving shrimp).  The cashier/hostess was Very friendly and sweet, service for my walk-in/to-go order was much quicker than she said it'd be, and the interior decor (from what I saw of it) was quite nice.  Here comes the all-important BUT: the chow mein/lo mein was flavorless even after I added my own soy sauce at home.  Shrimp and onions were just dumped on top of the noodles in the container, not mixed in.  And the cashew shrimp turned out to be cashew chicken when I got it home, necessitating several calls to straighten out a refund for the difference. (Would have preferred a refund for that entree since I didn't get what I wanted, but at least it had a little flavor-though the cashews will no longer be crunchy at all tomorrow.) I doubt very much I'll be back, unless I decide to try the items that HAVE been recommended, given how desperate I am to find a new chinese place nearer my new home, than my new stand-by Big Heng.

I ordered a snickerdoodle blizzard but somehow got pumpkin spice blizzard 
Not complaining but just sharing it was bomb

This really is the only shop I go to get my nails done! I always go to Anna because she so sweet and I always have a great time when I see her. She's so attentive and I love how this shop doesn't make me feel pressured to add on any additional services. 
Everyone at the shop is so professional and makes me feel so welcome when I come in for my appointments. They are always updating their colors and adding seasonal specials which I love!! 
The prices are the best in the area and I will always support a great family business like this one!

Dr. Kowalski met me on my first visit. I was having severe weakness in my left side also a clawing resemblance in my left hand. We went over a game plan of the procedures we're going to take. I took a few tests at his location as well as an MRI at another location. The doctor was able to diagnose my problem. He was straightforward, Polite, And really had a sense of know how. He's working diligently with my hand therapist and orthopedic surgeons to come up with a final solution. I thank Dr K for all his help up till now and certainly look forward to what he has to say in the future.

I've dealt with chronic pain and a back injury for 8 years, and Dr. Baker with Novaspine is the only Doctor I will ever trust for advice and treatment. You never have to worry about getting unnecessary treatments or surgical advice, because Dr. Baker genuinely cares about each of his patients, and will not recommend anything that could be a waste of time and money. He  listens to me, he takes the time to really address my pain issues, and he makes me feel like I'm not alone. His PA Alyssa is amazing too. Really, all of his staff is amazing, I feel like a family member at each visit.  I highly recommend Dr. Baker and Novaspine Pain Institute !!!
Great, great place to get a fantastic nail or foot treatment. The staff are wonderful and personable and great humor from everyone!

Couldn't be more happy with the ring I bought for my fiancé and the customer service I got from them. Jill specifically was the woman who helped me, and she couldn't have been more excited for us. The service was unmatched and the price was incredible!

Just came to this taco Bell ordered some cinnamon twist for my two year old son went to taste one and tasted like cleaning product. Completely unacceptable told the girl at the drive thru and seems she didn't even care at all. Last time I come here.

This restaurant = an icon to sun city. What a wonderful  & nice place to eat. Friendly staff. Family orientated. This restaurant had been here since the late 70s -mid 80s. My parents & I used to eat here often  --bringing back wonderful splendid memories of enjoying family friends and good Oriental food. ---- Because it is located in a retirement community where many snowbirds have retired, it is almost a seasonal spot !!! Not many people were in the restaurant when we ate there. ... That was a plus as we felt we were honored to be waited on so well... we enjoyed the combo plates and fish and seafood. It was excellent and I would highly recommend.

My 2nd visit to this NextCare and again I was extremely happy with the care I received. 3/26/17
The staff was very caring and personable. Highly recommend!

Not so sure I trust their level of knowledge.  Twice now I went to urgent care and both time I was misdiagnosed and given antibiotics for conditions that did not warrant them. I find this disturbing as too many antibiotics will cause them to no longer work when the occasion arrives that you truly do need them.  First time, kidney stone but told it was a UTI.  Second time extremely sore foot which a second opinion said it was a degenerated bone joint.  Sure makes me wonder................

Love this place. Its like a neighborhood bar, but all grown up. You can enjoy a nice delicious meal. The entertainment is always great. Make reservations, gets crowded during the summer months. Service is outstanding.

Love this place!! Absolutely the best service ever! Awesome atmosphere! I have been a customer for years and wouldn't think of going anywhere else! They are always busy due to their excellent performance,  book an appointment prior to coming in.

When BE NAILS took over Del Webb Nail Salon, they promoted brand loyalty with a "Buy Ten Manicure/Pedicure  - Get the Next One FREE."
Essentially, spend $300 (plus tips) at BE NAILS and they'd give you a FREE $30 mani/pedi.  NOT SO, they are not honoring the promotion.  They tell you upon your tenth visit, "Oh, no, that was a mistake.  We give ten dollars off on your next visit."  When pressed to explain why FREE is printed on the card, not $10 Off, they tell you, "That is mistake."  Why wasn't I told that all the ten times I had my technician fill out my card?  FREE is FREE.  They were not concerned about losing a customer over this.  I walked out, never to return.  Let's say at a minimum, another 10 years of at least $300 a year; they watched $3,000 walk out their door.  Of course, I'm warning everyone of their deceptive business practice!
10714 West Bell Road
Sun City, AZ 85351-1075
(623) 974-4148

Terrible-went in due to all the amazing reviews, I went 25 minutes before 5:00 PM and they turned me away saying they were closing soon and couldn't take me in. Closing time on website and door says 5:00 not 4:35.  Very Poor customer experience.

Ever feel like people are dummies for NOT consulting Yelp? I often get into tiffs with my friends about which restaurants NOT to go to. I saw the sparse, lackluster views (especially from Iain B!) and said "I think this is a bad idea. Are you SURE?"...damn it, they just had to be.

This food is just as boring as the neighborhood. It looked well-kept enough, but was uncomfortably quiet. The menu was expansive, but I remained healthily skeptical about what and what not to order. While we waited, we were greeted with water and hot tea...

"Sun Devil" chicken/pork/beef sounded tasty, but I knew to call bullshit when it said "extremely spicy". So I settled for my staple at new Chinese restaurants: Lemon chicken. Why such an overdone dish? Because it tells me if they know how to make a chicken breast, the easiest meat to prepare, and they know how to make a sauce. They failed on both counts.

Sure, the chicken was cooked properly, but there was no detectable flavor in the meat itself OR the batter. It was sitting in a pool of a lemon syrup that didn't suit it at all. No hint of fresh lemons anywhere; it tasted like one half of a lemon meringue pie. It was WAY too sweet. My friend's Sun Devil pork came out, and I declined to try it. It was essentially chopped pork with plentiful diced jalapenos. What a snooze. 

Chang Lee is full of mediocre, uninspiring food that lacks quality, is overpriced, and no sides other than a smidgen of white rice (No wontons? Egg rolls, even!?). I really don't have a reason to return.

An honest and friendly place.  I have done business there  several times over the last year.  The prices paid and received have always been a very fair deal.  I tried doing business at the chain that advertises a lot and they were not as honest.  So I keep going back here.

Was my first time to try this place..... Was waiting for over 15 minutes until ANYONE will acknowledge you there.... So got up and walked to the front to get menu ... Then I asked casher ..... Can someone take order? Guess what? I just left!!!!! Obviously young people were not welcomed there! Not trying again !!!!!!

I had the best pedicure I've ever had!  I have had pedicures wherever I traveled in Mexico, Europe , Asia, Morocco,  New York and "G" at Do My Nails right here in Sun City did the best.  Gelacio. "G" is the most skilled esthethestian and seriously made my really ugly feet and toes look good.  This is a clean and pleasant salon.
_
The people here are really friendly. Great job!!! Keep up the good work. I didn't wait for very long at all. I would recommended this Urgent Care to anyone on the West side.

I was a little leary about going to an Urgent Care but not anymore. I was in and out in about an hour. The staff was super nice and friendly and the doctor was great! If Urgent Care is needed for me again, I will definately come here!

Im what you would call a hot dog connoisseur, and this place is as good as it gets! I have ate there several times now and the chicago dogs are the most authentic I have found. The chili cheese dogs and kraut dogs are always a good choice there too. They use all vienna beef products and everything is always fresh. Definitely my favorite hot dog place .

A patient should be treated with respect. The first appointment took about 90 minutes. The office was total chaos. Dr. Baker finally arrived after speaking with the medical assistant.  It was a quick visit.  He looked st the MRI on line. He suggested two shots in my back using sedation. Then things got bad. You hav to follow up with the nurse practitioner. The doctor was out of the office and the waiting room empty. Yet they kept me waiting to precisely the time scheduled.  Then we waited for the nurse. After sitting in the examining room for 35 minutes behind a closed door and nobody giving us a status as to why we were not being seen.  The office staff was rude.  To make matters worse, I requested to speak with the doctor. They would not even take a message. I asked for the office manager.  Once they were paid they couldn't careless how my well being. My back went out and my wife called on Monday for a emergevy appointment. The pain was terrible. My wife said they could see e on Friday a week later. Zero compassionate.  Only if the doctor realized what was going on with his staff. We requested my records as I was through with this medical practice. They wanted a fee for giving me back my records. Money hungry. Terrible customer service. The doctor did his job. If he spoke 10 words to me that would be a lot. On procedure day it is a assembly line. They put the IV in your wrist and one by one you are called back. You ake up and wheeled out to your car. Nobody is willing to take the time to answer a simple question.
I will not return. If you want to be disrespected then this would be the perfect place to go.  If you need help for a emergency you not be seen anytime soon. BEWARE!!!!!
Old school diner/coffee shop.  Food was very good.  Place needed a remodeling 20 years ago.....but if that doesnt bother you. ...... You will be happy.  Very elderly clientele.

BUYER BEWARE! I went to this florist instead of a big-internet 
florist for a birthday gift last week.  I looked for someone who was close to where I wanted them delivered and looked at the website prior to investing time, looking at the possibilities of flower arrangements for our Mother. 
 Sun City  Florists state they are family run and "Because all of our customers are important, our professional staff is dedicated to making your experience a pleasant one. That is why we always go the extra mile to make your floral gift perfect".  Right.
I felt they would honor  what is stated on the website to deliver a nice arrangement of flowers for a birthday gift.  I ordered a $43.00 arrangement and paid and a $14.00 delivery fee for a total of $57.00.
When we got a call thanking us, mom made note of the arrangement, and she started describing it to me- She told us about the arrangement noting flower types in the arrangement I would NEVER have ordered!  
When it didn't sound like the right kind of flowers (big, light-pink carnations which was most of the arrangement) had been sent, we asked her to send us a photograph. There were about  1/2 the amount of flowers that they actually used in the arrangement compared to the photograph online and it was so sloppy looking, I couldn't believe it.  
I was horrified that was what they actually sent and couldn't believe they had the gall to charge us $43.00! This arrangement looked like something you could buy at a Safeway store for $9.99.  An ugly arrangement with big, light- pink carnations.
When I called them to tell them how unhappy I was they told me that the time-frame for a guarantee was up.  I ordered these flowers on the 19th and they were delivered on the 20th of Oct.  That's less than a week ago and really beside the point. I told them I had photographs to show them how ridiculously off this arrangement was and they stated they had no email for me to send them the photos.  As a small high-end business owner in San Diego I would never treat our clients this Way!!!!!!  
Of course the owner wasn't there and hasn't bothered to return a call. If this happened in my business and someone was as unhappy as we are, I would make sure to make it right somehow- I would have rather thrown my money out the window then have Sun City Forists send an ugly, sloppy, cheap looking arrangement to my mother.
Shame on them.  They made sure to tell me on the phone they have a good reputation -
I don't know how if this is how they treat customers and overcharge for crap at the same time. NEVER AGAIN.

I have taken mom here several times over the past year, and without exception, she received compassionate and fast evaluation and treatment. 

Maricela, Alex, and PA Russell did a wonderful job with her on our most recent visit a few weeks ago. There was a glitch with the medication prescribed. Mom was diagnosed with a UTI. I mentioned that she had chronic UTIs and that the most recent infection was e.coli. However, despite that, mom was prescribed Keflex. When we got to the pharmacy, the pharmacist asked whether mom had taken that before, and I mentioned that she had a UTI. He remarked that Keflex was not as effective as other antibiotics for UTI. Sure enough, several days later, we were notified that her urine culture was back and they needed to change antibiotics. So it took a longer time for mom to really start feeling better. 

I don't want to sound like I know more than a provider with a prescribing authority and overall the care she received was outstanding.  We would definitely go there again.
It's ok. Had a lifetime repair warranty with previous owners, they don't honor it. But they did fix it in 2 days.

Solid diner with rock bottom prices. Kitschy atmosphere, elderly clientele. They know now to fry. The skillet dish is very good.  Stick with the diner classics and breakfast.  Old school menu choices like the Diet Plate. Delightfully authentic with zero pretension of being anything other than a solid diner.

If zero stars was possible that is what I would rate this office.  I had injections in June 2016 that were clearly never billed because all of a sudden I received all these bills in January of 2018.  The billing and insurance office is completely inept!

Service is NO good here. The kids that work here were arguing as we waited in the drive for our sundae's. As the girl handed us each desert, she didn't even make eye contact. Gave us two different totals AND messed up the order. My chocolate dip had a napkin stuck onto the dried chocolate... I will not go back to this location.

Very satisfied with the care I received today. We are snowbirds and our regular health practitioners are in another state. I needed to see someone quickly for a plugged ear and I found this clinic on Yelp--good reviews and nearby location made the decision.  The three people I interacted with were friendly, professional and did their jobs with skill and efficiency. I was seen quickly and didn't have to wait for long before the problem was taken care of--I was in the clinic and out the door within 40 minutes and feeling completely taken care of.  Full disclosure--I am a retired RN and know good care when I see it.  Will certainly use this clinic again if needed.

If you're in Sun City and are looking for a place to eat that's local, this is the place. I found this place by accident bc I didn't want to eat breakfast at Denny's.

The menu is pretty straightforward, and the prices are very cheap. The decor is definitely dated, but that's probably how the owners keep the cost of food down.

Just bc it's cheap doesn't mean it's not good! The food was pretty good. My friend asked for soft scrambled eggs, and was delighted to get them. The bacon was crisp, and not greasy. We both got the biscuits and gravy, which was definitely filling. In fact, I couldn't finish mine. If I'm in the neighborhood, I'll definitely come back.

If I could give this location No stars or negative I would. This is probably the WORST Hertz I have ever dealt with and I travel a lot. We had a reservation for a rental car for my mother while she visited with this location through AAA it was confirmed and guaranteed. Does that mean they cared or had a car? Nope. We got there to pick up her car only to be told "We over booked and don't have a car for you. There are 10 people ahead of you needing cars." They oversold by 20 cars at 10am on the day we tried to get it. The manager, Nicole, was worthless and basically said "Sorry, deal with it." Well we got AAA involved. We were called at 545pm when they close at 6pm and told they "finally" had a car. It takes us longer than 15 mins to get there and they would not make an exception. The manager guaranteed they would have a car ready and waiting the next day they were open. I called before going there only to be told again by "Tina" they didn't have any cars. When we explained it was guaranteed by the manager Nicole - we were told she called in sick and Tina could do nothing for us. When I asked to get the phone number for the district manager, she told me she would NOT give it to me and then told me to "Call back when I had a better attitude, and hung up on me." I get the feeling this office just does not care about making customers happy nor does it really want business. The inside was horrible and dirty. You could see where a trash was all over the floor, pictures missing from the walls, and the front door didn't even close. I would actually worry about getting a car from this place that is would fall apart. It is a shame this location is in a retirement town like Sun City where the clients probably don't really have other options. Shame on you Hertz for having HORRIBLE people working for you that seem to hate people and would take advantage of the elderly. I will NEVER be renting from Hertz again even if I have to pay a little more. Also we still do not have a rental car from them. If you want to not actually get a rental car when it is guaranteed, be lied to and disrespected, then hung up on, then please rent from Hertz and this Sun City location. If not then go somewhere else. You will be happier for it.

Pro's : Good prices. Friendly. Polished my shoes for free. Great repair. Timely fashion. Two day turn around. 

Con: Cash or Check only.
The Royal Cafe has good food at great prices. I have been here for dinner and breakfast and have not been disappointed either time.

Tried their Fish Fry on 5/26/17. I was there with 4 other friends. Three of us had the all you can eat fish fry, 2 had the all you can eat shrimp dinner.
I had the shrimp which was really good. Each piece was hot like it just came out of the fryer. The fish was hit and miss. One piece I tried was hot and tender, and others were tough like it was over cooked. The tarter sauce was amazing, the best I've had at any area restaurant. 
Couple other complaints of that evening, it was hot in the restaurant, I don't like sweating while I eat my meal, but that's what I did along with the others in my party. Then when paying after the meal, the elderly woman as the cashier, never asked if we liked the meal and how anything was. Never even thanked us for eating at their establishment! I'll have to re-think about going back.

When we moved to sun city 16 years ago Chang Lee was great Chinese food.  They must be ready to close down. You can see the place is needing work. I ordered vegetable fried rice...it had 2 snow peas..2 pieces of broccoli...few peas...too many carrots. It used to be the best. Egg rolls were filled with only cabbage. Sweet and sour pork had not one piece of pineapple. Wish it was like it used to be. Sorry but that was our last tim.
LOVE LOVE this salon.  They make you feel like family.  The prices are good, the employee's are the best.  And frankly I would never go anywhere else.

I ordered a spray arrangement for my Grandma's funeral and Sun City Florists did an amazing job with the arrangement.  It was beautiful and fresh and their service was outstanding.  I would not hesitate to use them again should the need arise.

If I could give 10 stars I would. Dr. Baker and his staff are excellent. The offices are very clean and professional. I've had back pain for over 10 years, I went in saying I don't want pain pills I want relief! Dr. Baker was great, he offered me topical non-narcotic patches and injections. He respected my wish to not take prescript pills. He actually said he preferred when his patients didn't want pain medication and were willing to try more effective procedures. I can't say enough about this Dr and his staff. The nurses at the 103rd office make you feel very welcome and comfortable. I didn't even feel like I was in a Dr office. The block injections I'm receiving have finally given me the relief I  have been looking for. I just wish I would have found Dr. Baker soon! I would highly recommend him to anyone, just be prepared to wait. That's a doctor office though you'll be there at least 1.5-2 hours but its totally worth it, he actually takes his time to talk to you and answer all your questions

I was seen 3 times at the clinic in Glendale.  The very first appointment I had with my doctor he got up when I was speaking to him to answer his cell phone, he did not say excuse me or appologize when he returned.  Then he barely listened to me when he did come back and gave me a couple of pills with terrible side effects.  The second time I went back to do the tests the staff was amazing because I didnt have to deal with any of the doctors in the office.  Third time I actually changed my doctor because the first one was so terrible.  My 3rd appointment (the one with the new doctor) I waited in the waiting room (alone) for almost 2 hours.  I have no idea what the hold up was but when I finally got up to go to the bathroom they cancelled my appointment and when I came out they were "surprised" and "thought you left" so I went back to see the doctor FINALLY after about 2 1/2 hours of waiting and he spent all of 7 minutes with me.  He did not look over what the previous doctor had done, barely listened to what I said, only looked at me once and even that wasnt eye contact.  I got more pills (different ones) and was pushed out the door like I was vermin.
