When trying to get refills on a medication I did like that worked the doctor would take so long to respond that I would run out of medication or they would not give me more than a 3 month supply without having to go back to see them for another 5 minutes for a new prescription.  

Oh and the last thing that finally made me completely throw this place away is the worst of all.  They obviously have NO regards for HIPPA or PRIVACY because the receptionist had paperwork from us clients on the desk in the printer and she went into the back office and left it out where anyone could grab it.  While she was back there I actually witnessed a FEDEX driver go back behind the counter to grab his package, didn't need to be buzzed in and nobody in the office ever saw him come in or leave.  If that is the kind of security measures they take with my health information then I am glad to be rid of them. 

This office is a total joke.  I thought that when they became the CORE institute that it would be better, maybe have better offices or doctors but it is the same crappy people, service & security as before.

***beware*** 

If you want to risk having someone steal all of your personal information as well as have doctors that dont actually listen to you then this is the perfect office for you.

I have been a Desert School FCU customer for 20+ years. I have NEVER had an issue, not even once, when dealing with DSFCU.  If there is a mistake, they immediately correct it. If I make a mistake, it's not a condescending "told ya so" mannerism. I have a vehicle loan with DSFCU as well and the rate I received was the best around. The staff at this location is always very helpful despite the fact that they are dealing with the elderly on a regular basis. I always am treated in a calm, cool, and professional manner no matter who I work with at DSFCU.

I took my daughter here today and our experience here was terrible. There is a very noticeable lack of professionalism. Payment was required upfront before being seen. Never experienced that before. 
The PA who saw my daughter did not communicate to us why he was prescribing an antibiotic. We had to ask. He didn't even say what was wrong with her. Finally told us it was a sinus infection.
The whole experience was so unprofessional.Avoid this place.

I recently  had a visit to this location for treatment of a severe earache.  I found the office staff curteous and very helpful. Norma greeted me warmly and after registration I was met by a lovely nurse . The P.A. Julie addressed  my ear problem  immediately.  The nurse did an excellent job. A follow up call was greatly appreciated.  I will recommend this Sun City location to family and friends.
Service is good and food isn't bad but 8.50 for a roast beef sandwich is something not worth making the stop for...Add a drink and fries ... Last time for me and the $9 sandwich

I've been coming here since I was a kid and it's delicious every time. My favorite entree is the garlic chicken. All appetizers are delicious especially the potstickers that are steamed then pan fried for a crunch. The staff is always courteous and prompt with food and drinks.

I woke up feeling absolutely awful. I was able to get in right away & I was seen by the PA,  Michelle Wine.  She was so sweet, and was able to tell me my diagnosis,  call in my prescription & give me notes for work/school. My insurance referred me & I am very happy that they did. 100 times

The young waiter by the name of Reuben with the short faded hair.Was disrespectful because he ask my friend Mother,a kind woman if she was interested in buying drugs AKA weed. I believe this guy needs to be investigated. I wanted to see for myself and sure enough he even ask me if I wanted to buy chronic. The food is wonderful but incident shouldn't happen. We notified the owner on 05/26/17. He said he will take care of it. I'm notifying yelp about it.

Not a happy customer!! Placed an order via internet on Fri 5/9 for a specific arrangement to be delivered to my Mother in law on sat 5/10. She received her flowers on Mon 5/12 and no way close to what I ordered.  Two days late and the wrong flowers, called talked with Janice, never an apology or explanation!  She made a new arrangement( still not the right one) and delivered them today and took back the other flowers. Who does this?? Your company's mess up! Future reference If you don't deliver on TIME and the WRONG flowers do something to make the customer feel a little better at least leave the flowers you delivered in error! UNPROFESSIONAL!

I had the pleasure of meeting Dr. Morales. He was extremely thorough. He understood my pain level. He gave a sample of a Flexor patch which helped. i used Dr. Baker and now I moved to SunCity Grand Nova spine has a office next to DelWebb hospital. Both of the doctors from Nova Spine have helped with my pain. It should also be noted that when you need any assistance April is is a patient liaison bends over backwards to assist with any questions or concerns. These doctors are committed to helping their patients that are in pain. Wait times in the office have significantly improved.  Sometimes in life good thins are worth waiting for. My doctors at Nova spine are miracle workers.

Living out of state, I googled then called this florist near the location where I needed flowers delivered.  The lady on the phone was nice, and the florist delivered the flowers same-day, actually in under four hours, which was excellent.  The arrangement however was only of average value for price paid, there should have been more flowers and more premium blooms for the price.  And most unfortunately, the card delivered with the flowers misspelled my name so horribly that I'm glad I found out about it because it was embarrassing, and the recipient (death in family) thought I was making some kind of joke.  So Sun City Florist did a great job delivering very quickly, but I will probably try a different florist if I again need flowers delivered in the area.

No stars it's that bad over an hour wait for our food and it was cold and no reason no apology for it didn't even offer to reduce the check never never ever go again food suck staff suck owner sucked  this star doesn't count only way I could post !!

A+ in service, friendliness and quality!  I love that they had on old sitcoms instead of the stressful news stations.  The only criticism that takes away one star is that the floors behind the chairs needs to be cleaned more regularly.  I will be back.

Well, I almost hate to write this review update, but feel I must in hopes that the owners will read it and make an effort to resolve some of the issues and bring their restaurant back to what I consider to be a good eating experience. 

It all starts with the food.  I don't know if they have changed cooks or if they are not storing fresh foods properly or what, but something has changed, and not for the good.  

We generally order the same dishes when we eat at Chang Lee's and so it is extremely easy to see, and smell, the difference in the food we are served.  Veggies are not fresh like they have been in the past.  This is not a good sign as fresh vegetables are key to an excellent tasting Oriental meal.  

The restaurant is also not as clean as it has been in the past.  It's almost like the family, complete with young children, have taken over the waiting area at the entrance to the restaurant.  Reminds me of when I was raising children and they would all walk in the front door and begin dropping their school bags, etc. on the dining room table and chairs.  The restaurants waiting area in the front now resembles a cluttered living room -- not very welcoming for restaurant customers!

I will say, in the defense of the owners, that the construction that has been going on in the parking area adjacent to the restaurant, could have easily brought these negative changes on.  For months and months it was very difficult to get into the parking lot, much less find a place to park.  

Since this restaurant is so close to home (two blocks away), I am hoping that the owners can realize that they need to "clean-up and go back to truly fresh."   If they don't, I see how they will remain in business.

Wow! I am a dis serviced Banner customer for this reason, I refused to even consider The Boswell ER! Express Urgent Care, totally exceeded my expectations! The entire staff was Professional, enthusiastic, compassionate, empathetic, competent staff working as a team to ensure high quality diagnosis and treatment! Thanks to everyone responsible for my quick recovery! Vivian, PA David, and MA David are consummate professionals! Thank you very much!

Remembering a past positive experience here, a friend suggested we eat dinner last night.  We were both disappointed in the food, although the atmosphere and service were excellent. 

I had the cashew nut shrimp which was presented in a clear sauce with either frozen or canned cubed carrots, peas, shrimp and sliced water chestnuts.  The shrimp were nice and plump, but I was grossed out by the off taste of the water chestnuts - like they had been sitting in the fridge in an opened can for a few days. Ugh.

Between the pale cubed carrots and the water chestnuts I kinda lost my appetite. 

My friend ordered the sweet and sour pork.  She said the meat was tough - and there was only one soggy pineapple chunk.  She also said the egg roll wasn't as good as before. 

We both said we would not return.

On September 5, I had a epidural injection for neck pain. I woke up today and my neck is 85% improved. Today I had a appointment for severe knee pain. While waiting for a knee replacement Dr. Baker gave me a gel injection. I walked in with great difficulty. After the knee injection I had PEP in my step. Today was the first of three injections. It keeps getting better. Today much of my pain has been controlled. Dr. Baker informed me this weekend he was working Saturday and Sunday to give his patients unlimited access to medical treatment. I have had pain in neck, knee, and shoulder. I am 70 years old. I want to remain active. Because of Dr. Baker he has given me a new lease on life. Dr. Baker and his staff are wonderful.

On September 25 at 8:14 am I brought in my 55 inch LG.  I was told within a day or two I would be called with an estimate for repairs.  Since then, I've called at least 3 times, each time I was told that there was nothing in the computer regarding my television but that someone would call me back later that same day or the next day with information and a repair estimate.  

I stopped in last Saturday and was told the exact same thing, only this time the older gentleman at the desk printed my invoice and wrote on it to have someone call me back on Monday.  I've also stopped in twice during your normally advertised business hours, including this afternoon a little after 1pm, and no one was there.  

To date, no one from your company has ever contacted me.

This is not acceptable behavior and is unprofessional at an extreme level.  At this point I don't know that my TV is even still in your shop.  So, barring a rapid and competitive response, I want to pick up my TV and take it elsewhere for repairs and have the $30 I paid a month ago refunded to me for failure to perform.

My osteoarthritis advanced to spinal stenosis and the cartilage in my lumbar section was gone. Bone on bone severe pain which prevented me from walking.  Also I dislocated my right shoulder twice. The cartilage was torn. Bone on bone pain limiting the use of my right arm.  Dr Baker performed the minimally invasive Radiofrequency Ablation [RFA] procedures on my spine and shoulder. Takes about 45 min.  No pain and happy back and happy shoulder.  Dr Clifford Baker is the best.
Great food and large portions. Service is always good. We will be going back today for lunch.

I returned to Nova Spine Pain Institute for severe knee pain/shoulder pain.  I was seen very quickly. The medical assistant was extremely thorough obtaining my medical concerns. Dr. Baker entered within minutes. He evaluated my condition. He is able to obtain medical records electronically from Simon Medical. They actually printed me out a copy which I didn't have. Dr. Baker scheduled injections, with sedation.  For the record I had a bad back. 9 months later my back is pain free. Dr. Baker informed me my insurance would cover a knee brace, he ordered a special brace. I agreed a brace would be very helpful.   I am very happy to report the staff changes that were implemented made my patient experience very good. I am very happy to say the office has made a very positive change. Dr. Baker is a very good competent doctor. I had a more than positive experience. I am glad I returned and gave the office a second chance. I am on my way to be pain free. God Bless Dr. Baker and his team.

I would give a negative 10 because of the dishonesty and rudeness how me and my boyfriend were treated . My boyfriend left an item of his in the bathroom when he went to go look for it it was missing , only 2 employees went to the bathroom after my bf when he confronted the manager she gave us an attitude and was plain rude calling us liars that there was nothing she would do . We asked politely because it was important to us they just told us to get out of the store we weren't rude or anything when asking about the item.

Fabulous old-school service, we love Setterberg!

Having a jeweler you can trust is almost as important as having a trustworthy mechanic... and almost as hard to find.  From the moment you walk in you are greeted with smiles and friendly conversation.  

We've mostly dealt with Rick Setterberg who will make you feel like a long time friend but the rest of staff is just as friendly.

Take the drive to Sun City, it's well worth the trip!

Went here recently for dinner I had a hot turkey open faced sandwich. While eating this turkey sandwich I noticed a black speck on the plate under a piece of turkey .Upon closer inspection I found that it had legs. I do not blame the waitress for serving it to me  because it was hidden under the turkey but I do blame the cook for putting it on my plate and the owner for not cleaning up this place the bathrooms are not really clean and I was told that the men's bathroom  The stall divider has rust all over it. You can generally tell the quality of a restaurant by the cleanliness of their bathrooms this place really tells it all . I WILL NOT BE RETURNING TO THIS PLACE EVER.

Had very good experience today, cashier was Rick, he knows his taco bell foods and makes great recommendations! Would have given 5 stars but i wanted breakfast and sadly this site does not participate in the breakfast program.

Most definitely one of the nastiest restaurants that I have ever entered. Will NOT go back.

The food was decent - certainly nothing to rave about, but you have to work pretty hard to screw up bacon and eggs.

The restrooms were filthy. Had I seen them before ordering, I would have gone somewhere else.

My coworkers mother just died. She and her mother both bank here at the Sun City office. My coworker went down there on her lunch today to take care of her mothers account. Her mother opened this account MANY years ago when my coworker was married with a different last name. The woman who was "helping" her today was EXTREMELY rude. She came back to work crying. Her eyes were red and she was so upset. Apparently the woman said about her last name being different now "Well didnt your mother know who you are?!" and gave her a bunch of grief about everything. I dont know about you but if I find out someones loved one has just died I try to show a little bit of compassion. We work in customer service ourselves and I cannot believe she was treated so heartlessly. UNACCEPTABLE.

This was my first visit and I was also a walk in. The salon is extremely clean which I particular appreciated. I asked for a basic pedicure without nail polish.  I was very happy with the results and especially the price at $18. I will definitely be returning.

A friend talked me into eating there.  I was surprise at the appearance.....old, run down and dingy.  Hardly appetizing.   Extremely old customers....that's OK, just an observation.  The food  is very inexpensive and actually not bad if you don't mind bland.   However, the server seemed to be doing us a favor by taking our order......had an attitude.   On the way in I was talking to my friend and the old lady who acts as cashier commented on what i said.....what was that all about?    If I want a neighborhood restaurant I'll stick to those on 83rd (restaurant row).  At least they are in the 21st century.

My husband chose this facility because it is convenient to our home location. They are prompt, efficient and cost effective with their 'in-house- plan ..... This is a 'Clinic' .... and he has been seen by the on staff Nurse Practitioner .... not an MD .... Some illnesses or conditions get referred and they cannot treat or address anything very serious ..... But, for the purpose of a Cold or Flu .... or simple Infection .... they are a good choice.

Doctor Baker has been my doctor for over 3 years helping me through neck and back issues like you wouldn't believe,,,,until the beginning of this year. We switch Medicare Advantage Plans And found out he was not going to be in our plan as my agent told us.  
I can only tell you that I'm  miserable and and can't wait for enrollment in Oct and to be his 1st patient in Jan 2019.
He is kind, gentle, understanding, compassionate and any other adjective you can fill in. Is office staff at the both locations I've been to were outstanding as offices go.  He doesn't give you the bum's rush either. His placement of needles during procedures have never given me any trouble.  He's the son I never had and he's the best.  His professionalism is a guideline for all that know him, and is respected by his colleagues because I've checked.
Disclaimer :  I'm not on his Public Relations team.......
This Place IS so cheap .. For señor but Their food IS incredible And the server so polite .. Even Its DAR from where I Live I Go here  .... I highlight recommend this Place ESP breakfast
Ordered at 8am delivered before 11. I was outside their delivery area and they accommodated me. Arrangement was beautiful. Will use again for sure. Think I have a new florist.
Called them up and they were prompt, courteous, and knowledgeable.  Mordi helped me with a security door that didn't have a key when I purchased the home.  Would definitely recommend!

I have been vomiting, with abdominal pain on and off since Tuesday. I went to the location on Thunderbird and 103rd Ave this morning to see what was going on. I was selfpay and filled out all the paperwork and then before taking me back the aid was straight up and honest and said for my symptoms they would rather refund my money and see me go to the ER. 

They weren't refusing by anymeans to see me but just knew they couldn't treat me with my symptons and gave me a refund.

I will continue to go there for this reason.

Had a reservation set up for Saturday at 10:00 and they called me at 9:55 after i was already heading up there to tell me they have no cars available.we will call you when one comes in.Waited till 12:00 to call them to find out about my rental and they said they were closed and I'm basically out of luck...Ended up having to drive my own vehicle because they waited till the last minute on telling me they have no cars...the 1800 number was a joke.Lady told me to reschedule my trip...At this point I told her to just slap me across the face through the phone...never will use this company after this experience...

Is this a daycare or car rental service? I dropped a friend off who received awful directions from staff on how to get here. When we arrived, I could see why. The place was swarming with children belonging to BOTH staff members and appointments were continually interrupted by screams in the back and interruptions for mommy.  Not very professional.

Rick and staff are very professional,  always very friendly and helpful.  took a ring in for an insurance repair and they did an amazing job from the start to finish.  We will be bringing all our items here from now on.

Jeanne is a very powerful reiki master teacher. She knows alot of symbols that you need to get better and besides reiki she teaches a variety of other spiritual classes that are v ery helpful and fun (mediumship, crystal healings, angel card readings,) and a whole lot more. Jeanne can clear all of your chakras and make you feel so wonderful after. I took 2 of her reiki classes and it is definitly worth it for most of your ailments. When she gave me a healing i felt very relaxed and so much better. Reiki is the way to go and the way to go is with JEANNE RUSSELL

I have always really liked this place but today I was unhappy. I had made an appointment as my time was very tight today. My appointment was for 3:45 and I even left work early to get there. I got there at 3:40 and picked out a color and sat down. A girl asked me if my name was Cheryl and I confirmed that it was. I then sat there and waited. And waited. And waited. Finally at 4:05 I got up to ask and verify that my appointment was in fact for 3:45. She confirmed that it was and said they would get me a chair shortly. I thought about canceling right then because I had to be in Tempe at 6:00 (which meant leaving my house at 5:00) and I still had things that needed to get done before I went but I thought I would give it a few more minutes. Finally a guy got up from doing someone else and went to fill a chair with water for me and had me sit down. I thought to myself that it would have been nice to be sitting in the chair getting massaged and letting my feet soak for the past 25 minutes.  I went ahead and sat down and he quickly finished the other woman and then came over to start on me. It was 4:17 by this time. The guy did do a good job and he finished at 4:50. I had wanted to get a design but I didn't have time for one so that was a little disappointing. So my advice to anybody would be that if you are pressed for time think twice about going because apparently they overbook.

My grandmother's flowers were delivered to Banner and they were fantastic.  She absolutely loved them.  It means a lot to a customer when the product received is even BETTER than the picture on the website.  Thank you so much!!!

Very friendly and attentive staff, but it didn't make up for bland food.  Had the sausage parmigiana.  LOTS AND LOTS of sauce, and btw, there was sausage there.  Sausage was very bland.  Strong in fennel, but not other flavors.  Sauce was very bland.  No flavors of any spice.  Tasted like straight tomato sauce straight from the can.

I had a dozen Invicta watches that all needed batteries. I was trying to get all the batteries replaced for my husbands birthday. The thing with Invicta watches is that they are rather large & the backs are hard to get off. I took them all to Setterberg hoping they could help. I expected to have to leave them for a day or so. But they were so helpful...they took all the watches & replaced all the batteries on each within a couple hours. My husband was thrilled that his watches were working & he could once again enjoy wearing them!! I would recommend this place to everyone.

This afternoon in the mail I received a rather fat envelope from Desert Schools Credit Union.  What they sent me was a bright and colorful brochure about their spanking new "Relationship Rewards" program.  What it REALLY is is an announcement that they are getting ready to gin up all kinds of extra fees for me, to include $2 dollars a month to send me a statement!  Apparently DSFCU has gone "big corporate" and decided to ape the big banks...$7 dollars for this, $7 for that, $35 for this...you get the picture.  I'm just a senior citizen who banks with USAA for the last 36 years.  However, because they are in Texas I have a small savings account with DSFCU so that I can access an ATM when I need to.  And, since I'm not a big borrower, or utilize one of their higher interest credit cards, I guess having to store a few hundred dollars in their vault has just proven too tiresome to DSFCU, or my ATM withdrawal every two months or so is just too much of a drag on their business.  I'm now researching on the internet, trying to find a credit union a little less greedy...one that will not be bothered having to house my meager savings.

While getting dressed yesterday I bent over and instantly knew that I had pulled my back out. This morning saw no improvement after icing all day. So this morning I searched several Urgent Care facilities in our area. Express Urgent Care on Thunderbird actually had a 5 star rating and that sent me right to their door. The staff and PC were all understanding of my pain and got me in right away. The PC recommended an injection of a muscle relaxant and in a matter of minutes I was up and out of there. Unbelievable....the last time my husband went to Fast Med on W. Bell he was in the lobby for over 2 hours....just waiting. 
Congratulations Express Urgent Care....you are awesome.

They must be popular. I was out in Youngtown and had a break so I decided go get my nails some. I got turned away. They asked if I could come back tomorrow. Disappointed I didn't get to check out their work & can't say that il be back. Too bad.

Wonderful salon with extremely nice people! Andy did an excellent job and really listened to what I wanted. He did the best job ever on free handing the powder to make white tips so that I had a more "natural" look. His daughters that worked there were very kind as well! Their prices are really affordable and they even have a frequent rewards club. Can't beat that! Highly recommended on quality, price and excellent customer service!

Horrible food! Their fried rice looks and tastes like white rice. When I called and asked them about it, they said they put less soy sauce in during the summer months because of the smell. I did not want to hear any further information on that one. If you want bland food with no taste, this is the place for you.

I just spoke to someone who said to call them back in a couple minutes and I tried to call back not even 10 min later and they closed their phones a half hour before the office closes. I now can not make an appointment until Monday and the answering service was extremely rude!

Went here recently for dinner I had a hot turkey open faced sandwich. While eating this turkey sandwich I noticed a black speck on the plate under a piece of turkey .Upon closer inspection I found that it had legs I would post a picture of what I saw however I don't want to gross you out. I do not blame the waitress for serving it to me  because it was hidden under the turkey but I do blame the cook for putting it on my plate and the owner for not cleaning up this place the bathrooms are not really clean and I was told that the men's bathroom  The stall divider has rust all over it. You can generally tell the quality of a restaurant by the cleanliness of their bathrooms this place really tells it all . I WILL NOT BE RETURNING TO THIS PLACE EVER.

I called and they confirmed they accepted my insurance and treated my issue.

I went in Sunday evening.  I expected the typical wait where higher priority problems skipped ahead of me but no one else was there (one person came as I did paperwork and another as I left).

I was in and out quickly with barely any waiting.
I was assured the person had treated my condition often (bruise under my toenail with accompanying swelling in toe) and the procedure was fairly quick.

I was given instructions on continuing care at home and potential follow up.  They did forget the prescription on the printer but when I realized his (when I got home) I called and  they are calling it into a pharmacy in the morning.

Overall a good experience and I would go back again.

Chicken parmesan sandwich was huge, lots of chicken, but a tasteless marinara sauce. Realized it could use more sauce, but for one dollar more, no way. Sandwich by itself, nothing else, not a piece of lettuce or a pickle. Same for my lunch buddy, a lonely sandwich. Do not plan to return.

Great little shoe repair shop...Needed the velcro replaced on a pair of sandals....They had it done in two days at a VERY reasonable price !! I'll certainly return when the need arises !   UPDATE....after 3 months, the velcro is not holding....and, I went back to have it replaced , and was pretty much told "tough s**t"..........He wouldn't even repair the stitching that had come loose....I will not return to this clown....shoddy work and he won't stand behind it....

45 min on hold yesterday!!! They may be the oldest credit union in AZ but customer service SUCKS!  Mom moved out of AZ, will move her $ out of there ASAP!!  I sent an email and that wasn't responded to either!    Obviously their employees are stretched very thin.
Met Eddie in February at their Sun City location and he was awesome.  
So today I have been on hold now for 12 minutes!

This is the worst rental car company I have ever dealt with.Reserved a car.Received a phone call on day of pick up stating they have no cars available.How does this happen?Called 1-800 number and they told me just to change the dates.They told me I could get a car at the airport,but it will cost you double what I was already paying.Can you slap me across the face too please hertz.They screwed up and did absolutely nothing to help me.Great company!!

Writing this review while still sitting in the restaurant.  Hunan beef was very good, spicy enough to cause some sniffles but still enjoyable to eat.  And the crab rangoon (called crab angels here) were great and I eat those everywhere I can get them.  Prices are reasonable and service was quick but it was not that busy when I got here either.
Amazing work and wonderful customer service!!! My ring looks brand new! Convenient location close to 101 freeway.
The service was great, the staff was friendly and the food was delicious. I had the Egg Plant Parmesan served with meat sauce which I enjoyed very much. I will gladly return.

Great service and fashion pointers by the helpful clerk! Unbelievable discounts, the usual is 50 percent off everything. I was drawn in by the sidewalk sale of 60 percent. Found a couple of attractive tops. Same brand I paid 3 times as much in Glendale at a boutique. Nice to know about this. Lots of different styles here, mostly polyester prints. Great prices !

I recently moved into a townhouse complex and the landlord did not provide a mailbox key. I was told I would have to contact a locksmith to get a new lock and key. I contacted Ace Locksmith in Phoenix and they came out the same day. The tech was courteous and kind but told me it would cost over $200 to get a new lock and key. For a mailbox?? That price is completely outrageous! I respectfully declined but still had to pay the $29 service fee for the technician coming out which I am very unhappy about. I wouldn't recommend them to others.

I received amazing service here when my car broke down while visiting Arizona from California. I am under 24 and did not have a state license or a credit card and every company I called seemed to need one or the other.

Finally, Hertz, at the 11th hour told me they could help me out and $100 and fifteen mins later I was ready to roll out.

Thank you for saving me!!!!!!

I found this through YELP  reviews and it was top notch.  Wong Lee gave me a great manicure and pedicure.  Massage and hot stones on leg and feet.  He was careful and precise spent almost 1.5 hours and the total cost was $45.00  He was so good I tipped him $10.00  It was my 2nd visit, the first time I had a gel manicure from another girl and she also did an excellent job.  Highly recommend this clean and careful place.

The doctors do nothing the initial day you come in. They ask questions then ask you to come back multiple other days to finish your visit. You'll wait a minimum of 30-45 minutes past your appointment time before being seen. The receptionist are preoccupied talking about their personal lives instead of handling their work. I was supposed to receive a call after the referral person got off lunch as I needed her to verify she had my referral before they'd let me book another appt. 6 hours later I never received a call, she must've taken a long lunch because when I called back nobody had even mentioned it to her yet. You're better off giving another office your time, business, and money.

Everything about Angels Touch Reiki has been wonderful. Jeanne is amazing. She immediately makes you feel comfortable like you are family. I've had reiki treatments both in person and distant healing. I enjoyed them so much I decided to take classes from Jeanne. She keeps her classes small to give you the attention needed. The products I've bought from her are high quality too. I make necklaces wrapping crystals and hers by far have been the best quality I've found. I highly recommend Jeanne and Angels Touch Reiki.

Nice to take flowers when someone is in the hospital recovery. they are sympathetic won't oversell you and you can bring in something to your loved ones that is well designed. Doesn't have to be huge to warm a heart.

The place is....uh...a dump in a crap looking area, but the prime rib dinner for $11+ is a spectacular dinner, well cooked, tasty and a huge piece of meat!  Good deal!
I've eaten here a few times with my neighbors, never been disappointed in the food or the service...just this ain't duh Ritz location or buildingwise.  
My friend eats breakfast here alot with her volunteer group.  I think they have some $2.50 eggs, toast, coffee, hash brown deal then.  She says it's good, and being the superior cook she is I believe her.
For a good, cheap dinner well done and good service, too...try Royal Cafe.
They have TONS of regulars so they must be doing something right.
I took a friend who was visiting from Chicago there today.  She just loved the food.  Especially the dessert. When the check came she could not believe the prices. She decides to treat me.  :)
I've been here twice now and have had equally great experiences. This is a family run business who are very sociable and take pride in what they do. This will no doubt be my new local nail place.
Have been going here for 3 years I would definitely recommend Jean the best at what she does never felt so good
Yuck!!!!!!!! First time coming here & I found a hair in my food!!!!! NASTYYYYYYY never coming here again!!!!

Read the yelp reviews and thought this would be a good place to try. I had lemon chicken and my husband had chicken chow mien with crunchy noodles. The chow mien was very salty and lacked flavor. Lemon chicken was not bad but not good either. It was tough to chew. We will not be back. Should have read more of the reviews going back further. Service was quick but that's about all I can say.

Dropped my Havana Joe shoes off to be resoled. Was told that they wouldn't use the same type of sole but it would be a good sole for standing on concrete all day. When I picked them up, the new sole was just glued over the old. If I were told that up front I would of sent them off to Resole America for the original sole replacement.
Done in a timely manner.

Recently rented a car from here and they were nothing but helpful. Brian helped schedule our appointment. When we arrived another agent (cannot recall her name) was very knowledgeable and sincere. She upgraded us for free once she learned of our situation.  The bereavement discount was appreciated as well. We will use this Hertz rental before anywhere else. The one close to our home was most unhelpful so the drive to Sun City was well worth it. Thank you to the staff at Sun City Hertz rental!
Excellent service and staff. Very clean facility. I was extremely happy with the care I received and would highly recommend this NextCare.

Chang Lee's is a small family owned restaurant with old style décor, food, and a full bar. 

I am surprised at some of the food reviews I have read
.  
I find their food to be consistent and not greasy - although I have not tried their curry.  Their fried rice is bland and could be better with some egg.  It is true that the food marked hot with the chili is only slightly hotter than mild. But if you want it really hot, just ask.  

I like their egg rolls, hefty and not greasy. The broth for the wonton soup is the clearest I have seen. One of my favorites is moo shu pork. The filling is moist and flavorful with pork, Chinese black mushrooms, cabbage, and more served in Chinese pancakes with hoisin sauce. Another dish I order is sizzling rice shrimp. Decent sized shrimp with a few veggies in a mild sauce, when poured on the rice sizzles. My better half enjoys the lemon chicken which you can order baked or fried.  

As far as service goes, the whole family is very friendly and will answer any questions you have.  They bring the food promptly, steaming hot.  Once we had to flag down our server for the bill.

If you want a relaxing meal in a quiet atmosphere with decent food, Chang Lee's is a good place to go.

Had the best experience at Sher's the older gentleman running the register was very sweet and allowed me to return an item my mother bought for me by 
mistake. I received a frequent shopper card in the mail and was able to use it to save even more money. This place has the best deal I've ever seen. Great selection and the nicest people working there.  Great prices too!

I am NOT a Senior Citizen yet and I love this place.  NICE staff, generous portions, they do NOT gouge you with drink prices and the food is quite good.  Other places around could learn a lot from their friendly staff.  I have had everything from breakfast to Liver & Onions (which is GREAT here).  They do not break your wallet on ANY dish.  Wish all the other places were as fair as they are with menu prices.  Many thanks!

Would give less than a star but sometimes its so, so.  Today i tried the triple crunch wrap.  Would have been nice if i had been told it had sour cream on it.  I had to throw it away.  About 3 bites in and i got a mouth full of sour cream and nearly puked.  The commercials dont even mention sour cream.
They need to make sure patrons are informed.  Im so sick now i cant eat anything.
Thanks for making me waste money.
Start doing better.
Love Dairy Queen! Great ice cream! Great sundaes and great blizzards. This is always a nice treat for me and my son.

Took out of town guest there for dinner last night.  Was totally embarrassed.
Asked our server several questions about the menu items.  Her response was either, I don't know, The kitchen won't do that, Don't order that it only comes out good half the time and They will charge you extra.  I was ready to walk out right there.  Finally decided on several menus items.  Asked for a pasta and sauce substitution on a certain dish, that prompted, The kitchen won't do that.  A gentleman came by, assumed he was the owner or manager.  Asked him if we could get the pasta and sauce substation on the dish and he said, No problem.  He conveyed the request to our server.  The dish came out with the right pasta but the wrong sauce.  Let's go back to the beginning.  The Calamari was rubbery and the sauce was burned, sweet pasta sauce.  The stuffed shells were passable, as was the linguine and olive oil.  Originally wanted the clam sauce bu again was told I probably wouldn't get any clams and was good only half the time.  The Pasta sauce was the worst I have ever had and was raised on southern Italian cooking.  Our server came back to the table only once and I had to hunt her down for the desert menus, to go boxes and the check.  Then had to look for her to pick up my payment.  I'm a retired foodie and never left a small tip.  I did last night and I will never return there.  GO ELSEWHERE.
T
I walked in and was seen right away. Very clean shop. Technician was friendly and professional. Actually the first pedicure that I've ever had! Will definately visit again.

It was ok. I went with a large group and I think the waitress was cranky because of it. She was slow getting beverages but the kitchen was relatively quick getting us our food, especially considering the size of the group. It was most definitely overpriced but I liked being able to sit outside. There was love entertainment when I went which was really cool. Food and service were ok, atmosphere was great, overall an average restaurant experience.

I have been going to this restaurant for a long time . The owners had another place in surprise which they have recently closed. While they had the place in surprise the service and quality of food seem to decline at this place.Now they are able to devote all their time to this establishment and it shows . They have recently renovated it and it looks much better.Food Quality and service are very good I had an Angus burger with fries and a drink for under six dollars very good. This restaurant is frequented by local seniors especially on Sundays after church when you may experience long wait times. Overall impression the food the service the portions and the price are very good for a restaurant diner
Great find! Great food! Really good service. Had the egg drop soup and it was yummy and home made. I recommend the shrimp and sweet and sour pork.

Awesome care, very attentive staff. Checked in online and arrived at the time I was told to and got right in after filling out a short medical history. Very clean & welcoming place. 
Would recommend over and over again!!

BUYER BEWARE! Took my True Value garden hose back today because it sprung a leak. I had the sales receipt and the original packaging that clearly stated Lifetime Warranty. Manger would not replace it. He said it was "abnormal" wear and tear. Save your money and spend at a store that stands behind their products.

If I could give him zero stars,  I would.  I scheduled with him to work on my central vacuum system with a home warranty company (American Home Shield).  He was supposed to come on Friday at 2 p.m.   I came home to be here on time... and several hours passed.  I assumed that he may have been held up on another job, which happens.  But when I texted him at 5 to see where he was and what his ETA was, he responded that he no longer does work for American Home Shield.   I responded  "Don't you think I deserved the courtesy of a phone call?"   He responded  "Left message yesterday"   - which is a lie. There were no messages.
Stay away from this guy. Monty is bad news in my humble opinion.

The Mr & I used to frequent this place quite often.  However, after numerous complaints about the cart of dirty dishes parked next to our booth went unheard, we'd finally had it.  Who wants to see other people's dirty dishes while you're eating.  Plus, the food was just ok (not extraordinary), the price relatively cheap, the service a bit slow and the mgmt unfriendly.  I'll never go back!

Disclaimer: This restaurant is located in Sun City. It is unlikely any of you will find yourself here in the near future and hopefully not even in the far future, as this is where vitality goes to die. But if you find yourself with a flat tire out in the middle of BFE or need to take Grandma out for a night on the town (bedtime by 8pm at the latest, sonny!), this is a pretty respectable choice. And in full confidentiality, it managed to surprise me.
-----------------------------------------------------------

I can't fathom why, but my family resides in the suburban sprawl of Peoria, which happens to border Sun City. I haven't been out to this haven for golf carts and cataracts since I used to live way out in northwest Glendale, but for my stepmother's birthday she wanted to eat at Little Bite of Italy. So we pile in to the car for the mini road trip out there from Tempe.

Having arrived early, Mr. Man and I saunter up to the bar and (gasp!) get carded. Seeing how we were mere babes in the womb compared to some of the patrons there, this was no big surprise. What was surprising was the house sauvignon blanc I ordered that tasted like sweet tarts. And cost a whopping $6.50 for a bitsy little glass. Whatevs. Old people's livers don't work as well as mine, so I can see how they can get away with upping the price.

I was also surprised at this freaky gigantic beer tap that was ordered for the table. It seemed like a little bit of frat boy flava delivered to a demographic that could be their parents or grandparents. It was a wicked cool cylindrical device that held three pitchers and had a chilled center at the base. A gigantic bong of of booze if you will.

Since I'm indecisive I went with the sampler: meat lasagna, chicken parmesan and fettuccine alfredo. Aside from the fact that it needed salt (again, my blood pressure probably isn't as high as the older folks), the meal was pretty tasty. The alfredo was lackluster, but I've rarely had good alfredo from a restaurant so it was no surprise. I also grazed on a piece of The Works pizza with sausage, pepperoni, onions, mushroom, red and green peppers. That was far superior and the left over pizza reheated to a lovely crisp in the oven the next day.

The entertainment was probably the highlight of the evening. There was a 50+ (don't want to offend by guessing wrong), petite female performer in what could have doubled as a figure skating outfit singing her little heart out on stage. She had a great voice, oozed mature sex appeal all over the male customers (no need for viagra that night) and took requests like the pro she was. All ages were shakin' what their momma gave them up in front of the stage, me included, and it was a surprising amount of fun.

I never knew Sun City could be so spry! Respect.
This place is amazing probably the best nail place I have ever been to. Super friendly staff. I highly recommend.

A friend's vehicle auto locked his keys inside, and he didn't have a spare. We searched Yelp for nearby locksmiths that did auto work in the Sun City area and Ace Locksmith came up. They were pleasant on the phone, told us they'd be here within twenty minutes and were here in ten! The service was performed quickly and by a pleasant young man. We received our Yelp discount, but even without the discount it was a bargain in this summer heat. I'd recommend this company to anyone in the Sun City area (and any other areas they serve).

Janice and her team created the most beautiful flowers sprays and arrangements for our brother's memorial.  With only 3 days advanced notice, the flowers were at the church on time, beautiful and awe inspiring.  Thank you for the comfort you gave us in our time of need.  Mom LOVED the flowers!

When your in the area , looking for cheep comfort food , this is the place, the breakfasts here are fantastic, the other entrees looked like large portions, and a nice presentation. 
My companion ordered the french toast, and he really enjoyed it. Kinda of a dive, the booths are old , the service isn't the greatest,  but...ah......but to have Mom's cooking.

The people are friendly enough, some more than others. I do not like when they talk in their native language because it feels as if they are talking about  us in the salon. I also don't like the fact that after you are done ,they put you under a light to dry but they don't say how long you have to be there. They are quick and do a good job ,they have many colors to choose from plus you can bring in your own polish. Their salon is very clean and they do take wallk ins.

Went here for the first time, and had a booth with very nice seats. Ordered the fried chicken, which was very good. I didn't care for the potatoes and white gravy, and really didn't like the soggy and overcooked-to-mush green beans. My husband ordered the Gyro omelette and a short stack of cakes. He loved his breakfast, which came with potatoes and toast. I will come back again to try to liver and onions; next time I'll order a baked potato and see how good that is.

I usually pass this location and go to one in Surprise because the location makes it a bit tough to get back onto Grand at most times of the day especially rush hour. The location is in an older part of town and nothing really stands out. We decided to go through the drive thru for a sweet treat after a busy day. We got a few blizzards. Service was good and we received everything fairly quick. The new Reece's blizzard with the cups and candy style is amazing. Wish they'd put it on the menu forever not limited time. Parking lot could use repacking as well. Nothing special, but the ice-cream is always good.

Fortunately for me, I did not experience any of the issues mentioned by some of the reviewers before me.  If you are allergic to dogs, though, you might want to skip this location, because there is an official, very well behaved greeter dog.  To me that's a big plus, so I hesitated to mention it lest dog-haters avoid the store, but allergies can be a big deal.  I would want to know if it were me.

With that out of the way, I think Consigning Women is a very nice shop.  They are a small location, but they have nice clothing and accessories well sorted out for you.  Don't think "used = garage sale prices".  The brooch I looked at was $60.  Not saying it isn't worth that, just saying they are well aware of the of value of their merchandise.  There is a strong cowgirl vibe, so if that's you, you are going to be especially happy!  The sales lady was helpful and friendly.  I hope to be back frequently.

Very pleased with the care I received today. I was in a car accident, unable to see my PCP right away, so I was referred to seek urgent care. The girls at the front desk were friendly. Filled out a little bit of paperwork. The nurse got me checked in and into a room quickly. Dr George was amazing and did a very thorough examination. He clearly explained everything to me as well as any follow up needed.
My family got right in with no wait. Dr Miller is awesome!

Our family has used this florist countless times - we highly recommend it.

Over the years Sun City Florists has produced beautiful arrangements for my mother-in-law in a nursing home.  I was able to phone in my requests from another state and ask the florist to do an arrangement within my budget.  Furthermore, I was able to customize the arrangement by specifying that the flowers look "cute" or "dramatic".  And the shop was very responsive, even though I cut it close at times and didn't phone in until the last minute...

This shop also did the floral arrangements for my father-in-law's funeral - very impressive, very beautiful, perfect for the occasion.

Candice Swanson PA-C  is the provider that I saw yesterday, and it was honestly the most horrible experience I've ever had at an urgent care facility. I came to this location on my lunch break because I was in pain, presenting symptoms of Mastitis. This condition is more common in breastfeeding women, but can also develop in women who don't breastfeed. As you may know, Mastitis presents the same symptoms as Inflammatory Breast Cancer which is an Extremely aggressive form of Cancer with a 5 year survival rate of only 40%. Naturally, anyone experiencing symptoms of these 2 conditions would be concerned as I was, I explained to the triage Nurse (who was a male) all of my symptoms and how I believe I may have gotten mastitis. He took my vitals, was very attentive and professional and walked me to the exam room. Candice entered the room immediately with no chart, no knowledge of my personal medical history, only what the bits and pieces of what she heard me describe to the medical professional who took my vitals. She examined my breast for all of 7-10 seconds and proceeded to tell me that I definitely  didn't have mastitis. Me, baffled by how she could tell instantly, I asked her "how can you tell?" And she replied and I quote "because you didn't jump when I examined you" explaining that my breasts would be painful and swollen. I calmly stated, that indeed my breasts are painful, swollen, plus more details that I won't publicly disclose on here. I proceeded to tell her I had a unexplained fever since last week and as she cut me off, she tells me my vitals signs are "FINE" and said "here's the deal, if I treat you today I'd be treating your FEAR, not a real illness" at this point she offers me a shot of some sort which I of course declined because why would you offer me a shot for "fear" which is an emotion last time I checked.... I'm visibly upset now, tears welling. Candice Swanson then told me "There is no test for mastitis (which I already knew) so no way for her to tell..." In that case why tell me 5 mins earlier that I "definitely" don't have it if you actually can't tell. I told her I was NOT interested in the shot as she brought it up again and I explained I'd feel more comfortable with oral antibiotics. She left the room, after 10 mins or so she came back after actually reviewing my chart this time. She opened the exam room door I was in and said, "ok well I guess it does look like you do have a fever and that could mean you really do have this infection going on so I'll send the prescription over to your pharmacy now"........ To my knowledge, and prior experience, any medical professional who is providing a patient with adequate medical attention should review their chart before an examination. Therefore, Candice Swanson previously stating "my vitals are fine" was a lie, because if she had reviewed them prior to telling me the only thing I had was "FEAR", the overall visit may have been a successful one. Maybe next time, if I'm feeling ill on a holiday weekend and my only option is to be seen at this urgent care, I could come in with an attorney and see how many doors are opened for a medical malpractice lawsuit. Had I simply listened to her and let her dismiss me after telling me "you definitely don't have mastitis", my condition may have worsened and she'd be held accountable for my pain and suffering. Makes me wonder how many other patients that are like me have left that place in tears like I did without the proper care and fair treatment they deserved.
I love this place  their French toast is to die for and its cheap .....highly recommended esp for senior citizens
They have the lowest around Peoria and Sun City for manis and pedis but I can't stand to patronize any business that has Fox News on TV's for customers.

One of the oldest and most established eateries in Sun City.  The ambience is early truckstop, but the food has always been good and the service OK.  We don't go here often in the winter while the snowbirds are here because we typically would go Friday night or Sunday morning and there is usually a huge crowd (anywhere from 30-45 minute wait.  Even in the summer it is crowded.  The service is usually good but you can have  a 5-10 minute wait just in line to pay at the register.

We had a great experience at this shop! My mom bought a new Miele vacuum with the help of Paul, the owner. He was generous with his time and knowledge and really helped us understand our options. We tried out the vacuum at home today on various types of carpet as well as tile floor. It works really great! We won't hesitate to return in the future. Thank you Paul!!

On 03/09/2017 at approximately 7:15 i went to this establishment. I ordered a banana split. I have no clue what it is they gave me . It looks melted . Some one needs to re train these people.  This place was great now its just trash..TRASH
Called to check hours, very nice girl answered and told me the hours. I went there at 5:30pm and was out with a script in less than 30 minutes. I would recommend them for sure!
Sent an arrangement of plants for Mother's Day and they were lovely! Living out of state you have to be able to trust a local florist and they did a great job!
This place is really good. The prices are so cheap, food is good, all booths, fruit pies, nice staff. Definitely an older crowd but I like that too!!

Been a long time since I had my nails done. I was  a little hesitant. The good people over at Do My Nails are very nice and very good.  Affordable too!  I really felt I got my moneys worth. I highly reccommend a visit there,  I will definately be going there from now on!

I have purchased gold and gems.  Once I saw one very nice piece and said I'd buy it.  Then they said it had been "mispriced" and wouldn't sell it to me at the displayed price.
While flying home from Europe I bought my wife a nice watch on the airplane.  The bracelet was too big and link would have to be removed.
She took the watch to them and they said they wouldn't do it and she took it Fast Fix in Arrowhead Mall.  They did it nicely while she waited.
Don't think we'd trade wtih Setterberg again.

More like a 2.5 but I am going to be gracious.

Neighbor wanted the Friday night fish fry, so I am back.

Food a 3
Service a weird, make your order and then bill is presented.  A 2 in my book.  Green beans were fresh and not over cooked.  All you can eat fish or shrimp...not the best but affordable...you want more?  They bring it.

Atmosphere is older and more grungy.  Could use a spring cleaning to get dirt and dust in order.  Bathroom clean and well prepared ... a 3.

Minus points for being non eco friendly.  Multiple plastic cups for sauces and salad dressings.  Add a baked potato and then there are 5 on the table.  USE small bowls please...very disturbing to me.  How many covers a night? A week?  A month?  Bad form and bad for the environment. 

Don't know what it is here but they don't respect space.  They crowd you and use the back of the booth to write other people's checks.  Just rude I think.

Positive note.  Manager Brian friendly and engaging.

The service was okay with the waiter but the paying for the bill was horrible, we waited for 10 minutes at the stand and no one came. They do not have a kids menu which was sad but they did cater more towards the elderly with discounts as well. I would not go back because it was nothing special but the retro decorations made it an interesting stop!
convenient location - often moved without notice or found ceilings falling or the restaurant flooded.  I quit going here because I don't feel they really value their customers.
Great company. I needed an extra run put in and my system tweaked a little. Monty came quickly, on time, did a great job, left no mess behind. Prices were very reasonable. Highly recommended.

The food is ok; a little pricey for the quality. The service is a bit on the slow side and I didn't feel very welcome being there without a partner.  It's about the only place in SC with music and a bar so it's popular but I only go occasionally and only because I live so close to that shopping center
First time here, such a lovely experience for us. Very kind and helpful staff. The coconut curry chicken was awesome.  Pu pu platter for 1 was yummy too. We will definitely be back

I love the passion and detailed approached that Dr Fernandez brings to her practice. Not many doctors will care to the level that she does. She instills that she and her office are there for you. They are also available for questions and concerns.  She will be your health advocate and do it the way YOUR body wants to heal the illnesses and not the cookie-cutter approaches of taking pills just to mask your illness. 

As a holistic healer myself whose specialty is to help others with raising the vibrations of their emotional, mental and spiritual bodies, I know that we need to bring our physical body up as well so that our 4-body system works optimally.  We need to bring the physical body in top performance so that we can function smoothly like four tires on a car. If one of the tires is deflated or over inflated, the car doesn't operate efficiently and will break down.  The same thing happens when our 4-body system is not connected and working in unison. We need to feel positive emotions, think positive thoughts, be connected with our core truth, and perform our machine, the physical body, smoothly. 

Dr. Fernandez does give you a complimentary appointment so why not see if she can be part of your own personal health team. She is on my team! Thank you, Tina Sacchi

This was the worst Chinese food I have ever eaten. I just spent close to $50 dollars on Chinese food and put it immediately down the disposal. I ordered Teriyaki Chicken, Kung Pao Chicken, Potstickers, Shrimp Spring Rolls, and the Shrimp fried rice. I have never tried Chang Lee before; I live just 15 minutes away. I should've known better when I went to pick up the food and there were two cars in the parking lot and no one eating inside the restaurant. When I got home and unpacked my food, I noticed an extremely fishy smell from the shrimp fried rice and the shrimp spring rolls. To my surprise, the shrimp spring rolls were actually egg rolls; I know the difference and the spring rolls are usually smoother and these were definitely egg rolls. They were extremely fishy tasting. I took one bite and spit the rest out. Down the disposal it went. One of my family members ordered the teriyaki chicken, said to be a favorite at the restaurant. The chicken was tempura battered and sliced vertically like it was a deep friend chicken breast. The sauce as quoted from my family member, "This isn't Teriyaki sauce, this is sugar water!" The shrimp friend rice was even fishier smelling and tasted fishy as well. The shrimp itself look like farm raised bait and it wasn't washed very well from the smell of things. Don't get me started on the the kung pao chicken. This meal had peanuts in it, and wasn't spicy. There was more vegetables than chicken. Extremely disappointed!!!! The potstickers were the only thing we ate. Not only did I waste food, but I wasted money. Do not eat here! Jade Star is so much better! And the shrimp is huge and fresher tasting.

absolutely disquisting!!!!!!!  we went with my husbands parents for breakfast, and his dad ordered a breakfast burrito, halfway thru it he found HALF A ROACH!!!! we called the manager over and showed the manager, he just looked at it and said "oh it happens..." we left right away and took a pic of the roach in the food, sent it to the health department, and they told us they had many reports against them.
Excellent pizza, crisp salad, nice environment with live music and big patio.

Sun City Florists has wonderful and friendly people to work with me. One of their cactus gardens wasn't available, but they gave me a different design that was bigger for the same price. They also knew what they were talking about regarding sales tax. They delivered the cactus garden the same day I ordered it even though I called around noon.

I have been to countless nail salons in the west valley but always find myself coming back to "DO MY NAILS." Great customer service from the nail techs AND very clean. I have gotten gel and acrylics here before special dates or holidays and loved my nails each time! Very unique designs and are very considerate to what I want done.

There is no one better than Jeanne, trust me when I say I have tried others and I always come back to Jeanne.  She is so connected to her spirituality, it shows in the work she does for you.  For over 15 years she has helped me, my husband, and our little dogs.  She is so gifted in all the work she offers.  I have taken all her classes and I can truly say that it has improved my life.  I have referred my clients and they all have nothing but great things to say about their experiences with her.  Her prices are not high and I highly recommend Jeanne.

Out of date senior diner. We had breakfast a couple of years ago, and it tasted okay, but nothing special. We decided to try them again, but for dinner on a Thursday night around 6:30pm.  We won't be back.  I ordered the special of Salisbury steak, Mom ordered the veal cutlet, and Dad the chopped steak. We all got the soup as one "side". We all had the chicken w/dumplings and it was good. It had us looking forward to the main course, and....what a let down. The Salisbury steak was barely warm, the mashed potatoes cold, with lukewarm gravy. I had the waitress take it back and saw that she microwaved it, and it still came back only slightly warmer than when she took it. Mom said the breaded veal had a sausage like flavor so the waitress did offer something else, and brought her the chopped steak instead. That did arrive hot, but after the rest of us were done eating. We also had to ask three times for the dinner rolls that the menu says you get w/meal. After finally getting them (actually 2 and a half rolls), I heard the waitress tell the party at the next table that she just gave out the last rolls, and would they like a slice of bread instead. Each meal was just 7.99, so I guess that's what keeps the senior coming back, either that or they are the only cafe in the area, maybe a bit of both. Dad said his was okay, but also not hot.

lmao. 
 
I believe the term is greasy spoon. But it was surprising because they had a load of business. 

There's no way I'm doing a review on this place. Or anything negative. They seriously had a ton of business so maybe they place just want for me. 

I mean the Patty melt was good but nothing special. So I dunno.

The food was fantastic and the price was very reasonable.  The waitress was very attentive and kept asking what she could do for us.  We never had to ask for a refill on pop or water.  The food arrived hot and quick.  The decor is nothing to write home about, but if all you want is good food at a great price, then this is the place.

The lobby is packed and the service is still fast and friendly! Love the staff here and the location, they do truly great work. Fairly clean and conveniently located, hot food is hot and ice cream is perfect! Thanks for all you do!
Fast friendly service. Portions are HUGE, beer is cold and very reasonable. Will happily return.

Never use this office. Customer service is HORRIBLE. When they final answer they put you on hold. When a person answers they are so rude. I did not get a car from this location. I will NEVER use this office. I would rather walk than rent a car from this office

My hubby is 61 today and loves great Italian Food.  My momma loved it too.   We took her to A Little Bite of Italy many times before she passed in 2002.. These many years later our experience was wonderful.  We were seated promptly  let our waitress know our food concerns and  each of  our group ordered something different that all came out of the kitchen at the same time hot and delicious..  We shared my hubby's birthday  cards and at the end of  our meal  a whipped cream vanilla triple layered strawberry filled cake with a candle  came out of the kitchen with  the staff singing.

No one  told them,  the cake was huge, a special treat  for my guy,,  Thanks Little Bite of Italy  for making  our Birthday Dinner truly special. I vote best service, food, pleasantries in Sun City,  AZ  .

LITERALLY MORTIFIED.. I have been going here for years to eat with different groups of people. We always enjoyed Sally the waitress.. We go here at least once every 2 weeks for breakfast the food is always great. This morning I went in to take a friend to breakfast.  We ordered our coffee started chit chatting ordered our food kept chit chatting till our much anticipated food arrived. The waitress set the plates down and a baby COCKROACH crawled from one of the plates. I managed to place a glass of water on top of it and showed the waitress. We immediately got up and walked out. I'm so saddened because I used to frequent here with my Grandmother who has now passed, I came here always for the great food Sally and memories. I don't know where they are going wrong but in the last year it seems this place is going down hill. From the decor to now this cockroach incident. You know that there are more because it was a baby. Ugh sooooooo disappointing.

So far so good! My central vac has been broken for a while now and I finally found Monty online and decided to give him a call. He was on time, was professional, and knew exactly what was wrong with it. He took it back to his shop and we are currently awaiting a part. He always answers his phone too, which is rare now and days. Anyways, I will update when it's finished :)

Poor customer service, dropped my ice cream on my table and walked away. 

I paid for it but don't act that way towards the customer.

Poor

Omg! This is like the best Chinese food. I love it so much! I bring in some friends and family members with me and always get the best food! I used to order from here when I worked in Sun City back in the late 90's early 2000's it's the same goodness. I wish they would expand and put a restaurant in Glendale, till they do I'll continue going back lol

They did such an amazing job with a sympathy flower arrangement for my Dad's passing. I don't know if it was just coincidence or not, but they timed the delivery of the flowers perfectly to arrive right when the memorial service was happening half the country away.  My grandma could not make the journey to the funeral, it was several states away and was very touched by the gesture. It made her feel like she was part of the memorial services for her son. For that, I want to thank Sun City Florists from the bottom of my heart. 

Really nice, friendly staff and would definitely use them again.

I've been to Hakuna Matata for mani/pedis at least four or five times now and it has always been a relaxing, pleasant experience. The staff is very friendly and accommodating and the nail technicians have always done great work. I've been to several nail salons in the Sun City area, but will continue to return to this one!
Went for sauerbraten special.  Food was OK.  Service spotty.  Atmosphere terrible.  Will not return.

I have used this location a couple of times, 
I am not a member, however my dad was! I am still dealing with probate regarding his death almost a year ago. I have been making payments on his house since that time. We I was made executor of his estate, I tried to close his accounts and transfer his saving to a estate account. That took for ever! Don't know if the young man knew what he was doing? But he had to call someone else during the whole time I was there. 
Other then that day, Desert Schools have been decent! I still continue to make the mortgage payments until his house sales. They have branches through out the valley, and that really helps. Their workers are always courteous. Since I have an account at a Credit Union in Cali. I have thought about transferring that account over to Desert Schools? 
Overall, this location is a little slow. Most of their customers are from Sun City, and that can take time. But it's not really that bad.
Ordered the meatloaf dinner, It was dry as shoe leather.Mentioned it to oriental waitress----she could care less.

We went there last night because my mother lives by there and wanted to try it.  Cute when we first walked in and sat down.   Pretty crowded..... bar was packed.  

Our food was VERY sub- par and i had the WORST  spagetti  with meat sauce ive ever had!   Everyone at my table thought it was disgusting so it wasnt just me

the drinks are not cheap at all for being in a strip mall next to the Dollar Store... Seems like  they are ripping Sun City people off.  My friend had sausage and peppers in a very small bowl for $13 and he said it wasnt very good either

Salad looks like  it came of of one of those salad bags at a grocery store 

The only reason I gave it one star is because the bar area looked fun.......

Everyone in my group said to give them zero Stars!!!!!!!

Considering the lack of fast food along this stretch of road, this place is open! I have had both good and bad here. I always get the chicken strips. It really depends on the time of day as to if they are fresh and hot. 1030 am, they are fresh! I have never witnessed kids working the drive thru, always mature adults. I am sorry previous Yelpers have not had a good experience, but it has not been bad the last 5 or so times I have been here. I will continue to come back! I did not give a 5 star because sometimes my chicken is not always hot and fresh, but still good.

Rented a Camry from the PHX Airport and was able to return it at this location.  Convenient! Cindy was a rock star...despite being the only one in the office, phones ringing off the hook, and three people waiting, she handled my return promptly! Highly recommended! 

My only complaint is that this, and the other car rental agencies, are located off airport property and you have to take a shuttle bus there.

Dr Fernandez is very patient and caring. She asked many questions to help better my visit. The office clean and the wait time in minimal. If your looking for an all natural Dr. she is the best! I highly recommend!!!!

This review is long long overdue This is a great place to go if you're in town. I took my wife here as a walk in customer a while back and we were greeted immediately by a very friendly person my wife said the foot massage was absolutely amazing.

My wife's nails turned out beautifully  I get to see my wife gets her nails done a lot in San Diego and this establishment has A better quality then I seen in many others. I really do wish they opened a spa here San Diego. The quality of the nails my wife still talks about to this day too bad we don't go to Sun City more often.

Thank you

"Royal"......no way.   Their ad in the Independent advertises all you can eat cod fish fry.   We had the cod fish fry and the portion was plenty,  but we were never given the option of getting more by the awful waiter we had.  The Board of Health should look into the place for sure.

Not being familiar with this facility I looked to reviews.  glad I did.  great place fast, not expensive, professional and friendy.  I had an ongoing cold. As and independent pay was relieved that the total cost for all my in house services were just $95.00
  This included a steroid shot.

We brought clothes to Consigning Women in Sun City, AZ to consign. When I asked, "if my clothes don't sell, can I come pick them up?". the woman said "Of course you can."  I asked "Is there a charge to do this, because some of the larger consignment stores charge you $5 to get your items back"  (They go and hunt your stuff down for you & they charge for that).  The woman chuckled and said "No, we wouldn't charge you to get your items back."   She never told me that unless the individual items are priced higher than $25, that it's an automatic donation.  

She saw my things and knew that none of them would be priced higher than $25.   When I reminded her what I was told, she states, "We would never say that, it's in your contract that it's an automatic donation.", as if I made up this story   I checked the contract & Yes it's in there, but why then, would they tell me I could come get my things if they don't sell?  She never mentioned  "Only if the item is priced above $25".   The store is small.  I know where all of my items are.

They are closed on Sundays and only open until 4pm on other days so I didn't expect to sell all of my things with those kind of hours but I figured, if they don't sell, it's fine because I can just pick them up at the end of my contract.  I would have taken them to Turnstyle or My Sister's closet where most of my things do sell, but they are further away.

If you consign here, bring a tape recorder for what they tell you, because without it, the contract is going to be what holds up.

The 1st time I stopped to inquire about selling our stuff here, the owner of the store gave me a snooty once over and said, You know we only take better luxury brands here, as if I'm not the type to have nice things.   I do not get dolled up to go to a consignment store.  I've read their website and paperwork and see what they have on the racks.  It's good to inform people of what you take and what you do not accept, but maybe without the judginess.  

I won't be shopping or selling at Consigning Women anymore.  Turnstyle consignment lets you pick up your things for free and when they tell you this to your face, they mean it, and also my items sell there.

Rude!

Went in yesterday. The wait was 2 hours so I told the front desk lady that I would come back later. She snapped back what their hours are and I told her that I'm aware of their hours.

Needless to say, I didn't return to this Urgent Care based on the impoliteness of the front desk.

My husband and I have been going there for at least 8 years now. We are from back east and when we found this place it was great, service was great, food great, it was our Sunday brunch place. 

They recently opened up a new restaurant on Bell and ever since then this place has been totally neglected. Service has declined, cleanliness declined,  food has lacked and the owner could care less about keeping his clientele.  Don't even bother complaining he is the definition of apathy. It's almost as if he wants the business to fail. 

So sad! Fortunately my husband and I have found another diner that is what royal cafe used to be. :-) 
I wouldn't be surprised if they tank or get closed down soon.

First, what's with the other reviewers whining about the location?  The metropolitan area does go beyond their cozy little caves in the east valley!

Moving on...hey look it's a non-chain place to eat in the Phoenix area -- AMAZING!  The food was excellent, the service was great, it wasn't overly crowded (i.e. no long wait), and it wasn't one of those pretentious "we're a cool Italian over priced fancy place."  It was the perfect place to get good food, relax and have a great time.  Something the west valley definitely has going over the east!
Drove across town sign said closing at 4 this Tuesday it was 3:45 and would not let us in. About 5 of us wanted to go in. Never shop Sher's again!!!

Terrible. I ordered everything vegetarian and specified to substitute the meat for beans. When I got my food, I discovered it has meat in it and was not substituted. You cannot get your own sauce, they give it to you with your order, that was also wrong. My bean burrito was basically just a tortilla folded like a burrito, there was next to no filling. My sons cheese quesadilla was the same as my bean burrito, very little filling, just a tortilla folded in half.

I had lost my key for my car and the locksmith nicole who came out was very nice and did a great job. Very good pricing and I was pleased with her work. I needed a key replacement and she was quick and had great customer service. I will definitely be using them again in the future.

I would just like to say thank you Tanya the PA that saw me at Express Urgent Care Saturday morning at 7 AM.  I woke up at 3 AM with an allergic reaction and a very swollen throat.  I was terrified.  I arrived before the clinic opened and the medical assistant let me in early.  They made me feel so at ease and gave me the proper treatment.  I have been taking all my meds and feel so much better today.  Going to see my primary care doc this afternoon.  If I ever have an emergency I will be back and feel 100 percent confident in the care provided.  Thank you again Tanya and staff!  I feel like you were all so good to me.  I know I would not have received this compassion, kindness and treatment anywhere else.  Chrissy Boyajian

I ordered a bouquet from Sun City Florists for Mother's Day.
