I live in California (my parents are in AZ) and for years I have ordered from the major florists websites and every time the flowers that were sent were not what I paid for and were horrible! Finally I searched for florist near my parents and came across Sun City Florist. Well, needless to say they did an amazing job! They went above and beyond and dropped off the most beautiful bouquet that was prettier than I saw on their website! If I could give more than five stars I would! I am now a customer for life and will only be ordering flowers from them!!!
I had a wonderful experience at Setterberg Jewelers. They repaired my tennis bracelet for me. They were quick , knowledgeable and very nice to work with. I will definitely go there again.

The manager needs some basic skills. She sent our server on an errand off site before he could cash us out so we had to wait because no one else is allowed. Finally she grabbed my credit card and took it to the front never to return with it. Once the server returned he brought me another check. The best thing about this place is the lovely lady bus boy that cleared our table and tried to get us moving along.

We just got a couple cherry dipped ice cream cones and they were almost white we thought they just didn't dip them good enough because most of the employees don't, but this time it was like eating wax. This Dairy Queen is BAD and even the stuff the managers make are terrible. 

Find a better location or place to go!!
Five star, based on the fact that it's Taco Bell. Convenient location, and I had a friendly and courteous experience.

This is a well organized shop that is clean and easy to access. It has a very nice assortment of collectibles in cases towards the back. Larger furniture pieces are in the front of the store and seemed to be priced higher than thrift stores or estate sales but obviously less than new. While the styles weren't trendy, there were good quality items. Will keep this shop bookmarked and on my "route".

For a Mom and Pop restaurant- it is pretty good. My parents love their Fridays fish fry. The fish is very crispy. I love their speghetti and meatballs and garlic Toast. Price is not bad. They have to work on thier veggie soup. But if you are not picky - the soup is fair. 

It hit and miss on the service. Sometime you get great service and sometime you get not so great service.
Had a great experience the receptionist and Doctor were all great. I will definitely come back to this Urgent Care again if needed. Dr. Mark was great.

Enjoyed breakfast here recently. It was our first visit but we'll be back. The food is basic but delicious. I had a breakfast special that included eggs, sausage and pancakes, all of which we're tasty. My husband ordered the breakfast burrito which was ample and filled with bacon, ham, onions and tomato. All that food and a pot of coffee cost only $12. I especially like that they leave your own pot of coffee at the table. The interior is dated but the table, dishes and utensils are clean and the service is friendly. The clientele is also dated so be prepared for some looks if you're nifty but under fifty.
Ordered flowers for my grandma's 102 birthday.  It was certainly a special occasion and they did a wonderful job.  The flowers looked fantastic and the folks at Sun City were very friendly.

This place is fabulous.  The Food, the service and the price were all fabulous.   The waitress was the best.   Funny and smart along with the other staff just fab.   I am a picky eater and I loved every bite of eggs and potatoes and the peach sweet.  Go  You will be very happy you did.

Great customer service! Friendly staff! Provided a fair quote for ring repair, and completed it in a timely manner. Very satisfied with the work completed, especially after I'd gone to a store in the mall that quoted me 90 percent more and told me all of the stones in my ring were loose and would need to be reset at a ridiculous price. You can trust Setterberg's
I will be visiting them again!

Over the last 10 years, I have been slowly furnishing a vacation house with great finds from Estate Resale at 99th & Bell--sofas, arm chairs, lamps, framed prints, china cabinets, sets of dishes, you name it.  Prices are very reasonable and quality is top notch.  Delivery can start at $50, but if you think you can borrow or rent a truck and do the job yourself, they will help you get your items to the door of the store.  (By the way, the previous comment about a bad BBB rating was based on ONE complaint in the last 3 years--and NONE in the prior 12 months).  The store now has a second location at Bell & Cotton in Surprise and it's also filled with great items.

Nothing fancy, service is good! Very reasonable prices. The owners need to spend some money on decorating. Chicken fried steak was the most tender I've ever had, eggs cooked perfectly. With home fries and toast for $8.99.
Went there yesterday for lunch. Is it legal to open a restaurant when the commode in the men's room is disconnected from the pipe in the floor and just laying there? How gross1

DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY!! I ordered this bouquet for my Mom.. I ordered the premium bouquet.  The first bouquet was small and the roses are on their last leg.  The second is slightly larger than the first bouquet received.  Still old roses and looks much smaller with a lot less flowers than on the website.  As you can see from the pictures neither one look like the bouquet she should have received!  When contacting the florists they tried to tell me they followed the "recipe".  Where are the yellow chrysanthemums if you followed the recipe? The lady on the phone was nice and seemed like she wanted to help.  However, the owners were in the background telling her what to say.  The owners state the type of roses they used are open like that because they have so many petals.    That's why they look so droopy.. this photo is taken shortly after they were delivered.   I bet they bank on the fact that the sender will most likely not ever see the flowers.. I will NEVER use this florist again.  They send out old crappy flowers that will most likely last 2-3 days.  They said I should be happy because they had to drive all the way to my Mom's house which is 25 minutes away.  However, I did pay the $18 delivery fee...  NEVER AGAIN!!
Loved this friendly and traditional restaurant!  Best I have had in years!  Lots of food and great service too! I will definitely be a regular  here!

I was very apprehensive about going here because of Yelp reviews. But I was craving Singapore noodles. So I got an order to go. Mai fun noodles are the skinny rice noodles that absorb whatever sauce it's got mixed in, and Singapore noodles has a mild yellow curry mixed in. The dish has pork, chicken and nice sized shrimp with assorted vegetables stir fried in. I loved this dish. A medium hot curry, which was perfect for me. It definitely had the wow factor. I can't wait to try other dishes.

Dr. David morales is probably one of the most narcissistic drs I have ever seen and I've been in healthcare most of my life and been around a lot of arrogant drs but he is by far one of the worst. He made me feel like a junkie coming into his office for pain management. He "informed" me that "fibromyalgia" did not warrant pain medication. Really ???!!!! Tell my primary care Dr that who prescribed it for me five years ago! He also told me I could "only choose one area of pain to discuss with him at my appt"!! When I said To him that that was impossible he told me that we could not move on until I did!! He was rude, arrogant, interrupting, hurried, unempathetic, robotic, and an all around D*CK !! (And I dont Use profanity) I left In tears without a prescription for my very very low dose pain meds. My PCP was speechless and upset when I went Back to see him and report my experience. Dr. Morales should be performing autopsies instead of dealing with alive people who are struggling with chronic WIDESPREAD pain !! This is a terrible dr. And office. I waited Over an hour to see him. The front desk staff was very rude at the Del Webb office. No apologies. Nothing !

Every time we come here, we receive consistent customer service, quality, attractive food and a lot of it for the price.

This is our go to spot, especially after a hard day and we need someplace quiet to unwind. Thank you to the family of staff who have made this place uniquely superior to most sit down chinese restaurants.

The food was good they were slow on refills. But I was trying to be understanding and then as we were leaving our server which is a blonde girl with her hair tied that came out chasing after us asking if we like the service and why we didn't tip. I have never been chase down by a server demanding for tip and reply when we reply why we didn't then she rolled her eyes at us and immediately leaves.  I hope everyone there is not like that.  that's how our moment was ruined and our experience there. will not be eating there again
They have the lowest rates around Peoria and Sun City for manis and pedis but I can't stand to patronize any business that has Fox News on TV's for customers
I needed to get a house rekeyed for new tenants.  They answered the phone right away and had someone to my house in an hour.  Quick, professional service at a fair price.

Well... I stopped in on a Thursday night. I was visiting a family member who was briefly in town and she was staying near this restaurant. The reviews seemed good so I figured it was worth a try.

It's located deep in a strip mall. The restaurant is a bit dated and stuffy. Everyone dining was seated on the patio, so we sat there, too. There was a gentlemen playing music on a stereo or DJ equipment (not sure - sorry!) and he was singing with the music, which made for cute ambiance. Unfortunately, this is where the pleasantries seemed to end.

After being seated for 15 minutes, I went inside to find a waitress to take our order. It irritated me that a large party was seated next to us after we were seated and their order was taken before ours. After waiting 50 minutes for food, the waitress said their computer system had died and the order didn't send to the kitchen, so it would be a few more minutes before we got our food. It was after 9:30 PM at this point, and I was starving.

The food: food was extremely average. Baked ziti was very simple. Fettuccine alfredo needed some salt but was OK. After finishing our food, I took the liberty of going inside, finding our waitress, and asking for the check because it was almost 10 PM and I had a good drive ahead of me to get back home.

Prices were relatively reasonable, but service was abysmal. Not going back.

The actual treatments by the doctor are overshadowed by the blatant incompetence of his administrative staff. After listening to his receptionist rail for what seemed like forever. She toldl me that I "was not covered by the VA" and that I had to understand how to determine if an insurance co was primary or secondary etc, I told her to please just be quiet, do her job. She stomped off like a two year old and told the Office Manager her story. The office manager told me that I was discharged for up setting the desk clerk. Can you believe this? I and my invalid wife were denied health care that had already been approved by our insurance because we had upset the little girl. Nova Spine institute is a medical joke.

I had been feeling ill with flu like symptoms although I had already had my flu shot about 6 months ago. On Valentines day morning I work up feeling just awful and as if bronchitis was setting in. New to the area and a So. California transplant, I looked to my new best friend, Yelp, for an urgent care center. This is how I found NextCare Urgent Care. They were absolutely fantastic! Very professional, extremely on point, and got me right in. The Dr. was great and staff as well. An x-ray was taken to rule out pneumonia which I have a predisposition for. Appropriate medications were given to me and I was then on my way. Although I have not seen a bill yet, I'm guessing their fees are in line as they had me pay my 20%. I even got a call back yesterday to see how I was doing! Having worked in the field for over 35 yrs, I really appreciate the level of care I was given. The Dr. even had a radiologist take a look at my x-ray. I highly suggest you use their online sign in. I did so and my appointed time was only 50 min. out and by the time I arrived and filled out the short health history form I was seen right away. Kudos to NextCare Urgent Care on Bell in Sun City!!
Not crowded at all! Stopped in to buy super glue, and was carded for my ID ...REALLY? Super Glue? Have we fallen that far to have big brother watching us on our super glue purchases?

I've always had great luck at this consignment store. I find a lot of work wear there. I live in Chicago and the prices for this consignment store are much cheaper with great quality. I've never had an issue with any of the sales people here. Will definitely be back

I made an appointment with mike,the shop was easy to find he was very patient and figured out what I needed. He took care of it in a professional manner 
I would deffinetly recommend these guys 
I even scheduled another appointment for them to change my locks in my home

Sun City florist did a great job on an arrangement for my sister. Due to a glitch in the online universe, the order didn't go through quite on time. But they were courteous enough to call and make me aware of the situation. They even made it right by putting extra love and attention into my special delivery. Thanks Sun City florist for helping me spread the joy ;)

ASK FOR SUE!!!!    I have to say that I received top notch customer service today!! As in the "Buyer Beware" review I also received an arrangement for mothers day that I was a bit unhappy with. They told me they would gladly exchange it. So I went right back in to pick up the new one they made. The new one they made also did not meat my expectations!  I was feeling like a diva because Im usually not so hard to please. Sue their top designer came out and asked me what I liked for flowers so I told her. When she came out with the new arrangement I almost burst into tears. IT WAS BEAUTIFUL!!! I was blown away. She also helped me to my car. She then informed me that she was designer of the year in Maricopa County! She informed me that if I call and ask for her she will get it right every time. I am a customer for life! Sue is my girl! Thank you so much Sun City Florist! You MADE my mothers day!!!!!

Very low key atmosphere, friendly staff. Asked to modify an omelette and that was not a problem.  Not sure if it a true Mom/Pop place but the staff acts like it   Only suggestion would be to change the coffee brand - a little weak. The portions and price make up for that though - by far.
If you like to "skip the line" and check in online, only to wait an hour to be seen, this is the place for you!!! Never will I come here again!

Stumbled upon Empire Coin while looking for a place to sell my small coin collection. I was pleasantly surprised, Mauricio was very friendly and gave me an honest buy. It is a very nice store with a variety of collectables, I will return.

This was the worst customer service experience I've ever had!  After waiting for an hour and still not having my car  it only got  worse as I spoke with their rude customer service representative.  I finally left and rented a car from enterprise who gave stellar service!

I went to this jewelry store recently & liked them very much. They spent a lot of time w me designing the exact setting I wanted. They also didn't try to push anything either. Very polite. This will be my new go to jeweler.

Surprise clinic on Wadell and Litchfield. Supposedly open at 7am but only front staff were there. They didn't even know if a Dr would be there. Minor nick but I'm on cumadin and they want me to go to the ER. Dr finally showed up and without looking at me says the same thing. Must have interrupted their breakfast. I had a major cut on my thumb and Dr From Med Post Urgent care fixed me right up using liquid bandaid. I'm going to my Dr's Nurse practitioner who'll take care of this problem. Bottom line if they couldn't fix this nick then I wouldn't have them treat me for a cold. Skip this place and try a facility that wants to work and care about the people who come in. Could be this place just doesn't like money that I would have paid them.

Been there twice now.  Will definately go back.  I really don't understand some of the other reviews.  I think way better than Olive Garden and don't have to wait in line forever.  No effing kids either!  Had pizza first time.  Did not need Alka-Seltzer later.  Had veal parmisian tonight.  Great, great, great!  All you can eat fish on Friday nights for $12.  Give it a try.  Not all of us in Sun City are dead yet!

The two women are so rude that work there! I am handicapped and as I walked in there was a handicap sign and a bill that said ring for immediate service well since the lady was on the phone and the two desks were empty I took the advice the sign said and the lady came from the back and rudely took the ball away and walked back and said before walking back with the aggravated look on her face she is on the phone she will be right with you.  I will never give a penny to this unfortunate sad business.

Reasonable service and value. The massage was good and worked on the sore spots in my neck. Would have like more arm and leg and glutes. Felt like maybe the masseuse was used to working with the more conservative Sun City client vs a more traditional sports massage. Still was a nice service and I'd return.

They are a good nail salon. They have everything I could ask for except trendy polish and styles. This kind of kills it. 

I asked for black matte polish with rose gold chrome tips. They couldn't do it because they didn't have the correct product. The staff is friendly but if you are about the A-nail game, this place isn't for you. They did a great job on my 10 year olds nails and pedi though. 

I might give them one more shot, but if they can't give me a pale rose matte color, I might just have to move on.

I have worked with Jeanne on a continuing basis for over 7 years.  She is wonderful and has been a tremendous help for me on my spiritual journey.  Jeanne always works in integrity and honesty and doesn't just tell you what you want to hear.  She truly channels the answers and helps you understand what you need to know.  I  highly recommend Jeanne and all of her services.

Stopped by one afternoon to have my Dyson repaired and the customer service was incredible. They were very knowledgeable and had my Dyson fixed up quickly. I would definitely go back for future repairs and purchases. They are very trustworthy and put their customers first. I was very pleased!

My daughter ate there last night 4/19/2018 taco and chalupa  an hour later we are in hospital she got food poisoning from this Taco Bell I called the manager just to give him heads up he was very rude and stated not from there impossible I told him what time and hospital verified it as food poisoning he still blatantly denied it could be from his  restaurant. My daughter works at a hospital she Knew right away what happened. Be Aware people Stay Away from this location

This is an odd situation that should have been handled differently and demonstrated an enormous lack of professionalism by Monty.  I suspect that Monty really does know his stuff BUT: he came to my house today to install an additional vacuum port.  He visited last week so he was familiar with the installation situation.  He came today and started the install but realized that he could not do it.  My concern is that instead of telling me or my wife that he could not complete the job, he just left making no attempt to let us know.  I called him and left a message when I saw he had closed the holes he made but the port was not installed.  I really feel as though he ran away when he realized he bit off more than he could chew.
Dr. Fernandez is the best! She takes the time to listen so she can prescribe the best treatment. Very clean office and professional staff as well!

This goes along with other poor quality chinese restaurants.  If this isn't the worst I have ever been at, it comes close to the first.  Egg Drop soup tasteless,  chow mein overcooked & burnt, even the steamed rice was tasteless!  Pretty bad when you leave half your plate uneaten and not take of doggie bag out!

Terrible service.
Not only did I wait 30 minutes for my food and was treated badly but everything on the order was incorrect.
I wasted money to be served nothing close to what I ordered.
This place needs to do better.
Although I think they're a little pricey for hot dogs, they're really good. Plenty of toppings to choose from so you can customize your dogs anyway you like them.

First time at this Salon and I would have to say it was a very pleasant experience.  My nails were shot from the last salon I went to.  They were fixed and look terrific now. Just a plain french manicure but it looks beautiful. I'll definitely be back. BTW They are priced reasonable.

My first time I ordered a pink lemon aid, quesadilla, rolled tacos, and chimichanga. 

I had to throw the lemon aid out after one sip there was something seriously wrong with it.  Other food was just okay. 

I tried it again a week later for another chance. I ordered a machaca torta. It was good but bun needs to be toasted more cause it feel apart after a few bites and I had to eat it with a fork. 

Bean and cheese burrito is good but its hard to go wrong with that. 

Service is very slow for not that many customers in there. Durning lunch hour it took a friend 20 min to get her food. 

I will go back as they seem to be improving.  It's a new establishment and I think they are working out their new start issues. It takes time to get things running smoothly sometimes.

Been here many times.  Super nice staff, quick wait times, you can set an appt time and they are really quick about getting you in for treatment.  They also offer a program for uninsured where you pay 35/month and visits are only 35! Good deal!

Great cafe. Walk in very welcoming staff. Large room but nice overhangs over each section makes it look cosy. Breakfast this am was a wonderful bacon and sausage skillet. Lots of meat. Lots of flavor and fresh eggs. Fresh hot coffee on table carafes waiting for you. Very reasonable prices. Worth a visit will try their lunch next time   My daughter had really good cherry pancakes.
I wasted lots of time and money with these people and never got relief. It was nothing but a cattle call. Totally incompetent staff.
Amazing service.  I definitely recommend them for anyone looking for personal friendly service and care for their jewelry.
Amazing customer service, they were very nice and the car was very clean and ready to go. I will rent from them again.

I just left the family dollar and had one of the worst experiences with their staff.

The family dollar that I frequent is always having register issues. Today while checking out the card reader got 'stuck' so I was told repay.

I was told that this happens all the time and I wouldn't be charged a second time. But of course I was. I was now short $90 for their mistake instead of $45. They said it should return in a few minutes as it does every time and of course it didn't. 

What makes me upset is that I asked the cashier multiple times. I said I don't have the funds for this to charge me twice and wait for a refund, it's a pretty bad week for me.

Of course they said it's fine it happens all the time and to swipe again.

They again say they can't do anything while giving me attitude and acting as I was unconvincing them. 
The so called manager Yahaira starts making personal calls in my face while supposedly contacting corporate. Keeps telling me she can't do anything and that I need to wait. It's out of their control and they can't do anything else.

I ask to speak with the DM and she refuses. I tell her to have him call me, she refuses. She tells me I can call corporate and then ignores me. I call around to 3 other stores until someone answered and finally I get a manager. Not even 1 minute in to the call and I get the phone number to the DM. Why was it an issue for her to give me his number? I've never in my 10+ years of retail being denied to speak to management. 

I call the district manager Mike Green (623) 889-1347 and he doesn't care and repeats the same story. Sorry for the inconvenience but this is not our fault. Call your bank. I said I called my bank and they said they can't help. No remorse whatsoever. When I ask what they're going to do about it he says nothing it's not our fault. I said both your manager and cashier says  it happens all the time!!!??? Like wtf let's just charge people twice who cares. 

Still doesn't matter, sorry can't help you.

I've never seen such lack of respect, not even at Walmart.

I say that the additional funds are for gas and money for the week which is so embarrassing at both the store and the DM and still they say sorry can't do anything. What if I had no other recourses, what if I couldn't feed my children, what if I had to pay rent, what happens if I can't get to work!!??This is unacceptable as a business to allow this to happen repeatedly. 

Yet it's the customer who suffers due to your staff being completely unaware of how to handle the situation. Telling lies in front of other customers and then blaming the customer for the fault. I'm sitting in tears for an hour frustrated and now out of luck.I would have preferred to leave everything then pay again and put myself at risk. 

I will make sure I contact corporate, the BBB, and every place I can review to warn others.

Absolute disregard for another persons situation when your company is at fault is horrible. They could have given me a gas card or something to help the situation they put me in but instead preferred to send me on my way.

I could feel my blood pressure climb and climb and I'm glad I didn't have some sort of attack from all the stress. This is so horrible to do to another human. Have some sympathy and fix your fucking registers.

If they think they're done with me they have no idea what's coming.
I ordered some flowers last minute for a friend's birthday.  They were wonderful to work with and very accommodating for a same day delivery.  The flowers were beautiful
Fehgedaboudit.  Ordered large shrimp and they served me what looked & tasted like bread or batter in the shape of large shrimp.
This is one of my favorite massage studio in the valley. Happy and courteous staff, well versed in several styles of massage. I have only seen Jean and would recommend her to anyone.

I Love  this place, with my six pack family, we each get our favorites. The staff is wonderful, attentive to our special night out, whether Anniversaries or Birthdays they respond with celebration and joy.
We always leave with a smile, full bellies and a bill for less than $125.00....  does not get any better than this...
Avoid this place!!! They have terrible service,and flowers are always dead.

The place really needs an update.  I kept hoping the guy from Restaurant Impossible would come in with his sledge hammer and go to work.   Been there for the Friday night fish fry a few times.  Always the same two soups; clam chowder (I didn't like it at all) and vegetable soup.  Choice of vegetables is always the green beans, which are also in the salty vegetable soup.  You will be thirsty later in the evening.  They serve Cod for the fish fry (usually 3 small pieces) and they will always bring more.  No problem with the portions.  However, during my last visit, my wife was served with one of the portions of fish completely frozen and uncooked, although it had the batter on it.  You couldn't even cut it.  They replaced immediately when brought to their attention, but you have to wonder why or how it managed to leave the kitchen in the first place.  They definitely cater to the older crowd.  Pricing is reasonable for this venue.

Well you might think this clinic would have reached and to explain the terrible service.  This is a cash cow business. Once the money runs out don't hold your breath in being seen with a emergency.  The appointment setters would not put me through to the doctor or the triage nurse.  I had to wait over a hour and was never seen for a nurse post op visit. The doctor was out and the staff were all on there cell phones texting. I walked out of my appointment and will not be returning. When the money rubs out so does the service. It is a patient mill, overbooking and the wait times or unacceptable. I have attempted to reach the doctor Bakeg even the office manager.  The appointment setters refused.  There is no care or compassion. You are a number. Find another clinic. Do yourself a big favor. I am in pain shortly after the epidural.  There is no follow up They clinic refuses to trust me even Medicare would cover the visit.  What a shame I had high hopes of getting better.  Very poor customer service.  We are treated as a number. Will I ever return?  Will I allow another family member to be treated by this money grubbing business? Don't hold your breath. Should I expect a follow up call to address my concerns? If they don't get paid I doubt if any call back will come.

Those who read my reviews know that I am a sucker for a good kitschy dive. There is no better, no kitschier dive than Chang Lee. It's quintessential, over the top decor always makes me smile and for those who turn their nose up to such things, you don't know what you're missing. The food at Chang Lee is delish. It is authentic, well seasoned, and served at all the right temps. Love that you can order the special and it comes with egg roll and chicken wings. The staff is friendly, polite, and attentive. Love that it's family owned and operated. I have come here many times over the years and I look forward to going back soon.

Jeannie is a Wonderfully gifted Reiki Master Teacher who not only gives powerful healing Reiki sessions but also is a great teacher of Reiki in all levels, but teaches a lot of other variety of spiritual classes that has helped me tremendously along my spiritual path.  She is also a gifted Medium and gives spot on Angels readings as well.  I highly recommend any of her services.

Manuel

beware! i spent 10 min with an assistant not even a doctor to be told i had a cold and should take some cough medicine. the wait time was very long even after i booked an appointment for a specific time.

they charged me $170. when i complained they said they would look ito it but turned me over to a collection agency i just went on the internet and found out that they have been fined $10,000,000 for medicare fraud! 

i now am going to file a claim with the attorney generals office if they don't reverse the charges.

Called in tonight for pizza. A little worried about some of the reviews but was very pleasantly surprised. This is an unpretentious neighbourhood pizza and home style Italian bar restaurant. Staff were extremely friendly and took our order as soon as we sat down and brought drinks immediately. There are a lot of older people in there (we are in our mid sixties and felt like teenagers) but what a happy friendly crowd. There was a young lady singing some of the oldies but goldies and a few people up dancing. We did wait 25 minutes for the food but it is all cooked fresh from scratch so it was worth it.  Would recommend this for good pizza and home cooking and will definitely go back.

I went to NextCare - Sun City - a saturday morning - in July - was pleased to see clean surrondings, furnishings, unlike other urgents cares I had been too! Lucky for me, it was only a wait time of less than 10 minutes (enough time to complete a short health history form). The front desk receptionist was so pleasant and made us feel welcomed.
Robert the MA brought me back, I answered a few short questions and then PA Carli came in - did an obvious assessment (allergic reaction to something!  couldn't believe my crazy swollen eyes and face!)  got a quick painless shot from Robert, pharmacy called- meds ordered - in and out in 30 minutes!!    BEST URGENT CARE  - in my opinion - this side of town.  If ever I'm in need of an emergeny setting- other than ER hospital - I would come to this location again.. *****   I highly reccommend this location!

First time customer and a guaranteed repeat customer.  I was greeted on the phone with a very kind and helpful woman who took all my information and asked when I needed the flowers delivered. I gave her a specific time and they made it there in a timely manner. This was probably the most beautiful floral arrangement I've seen or should I say sight unseen.  It was an amazing experience and I want to thank Paula personally for helping me with my flowers. My partner loved them..

FABULOUS jewelry store! I needed to get my ring sized down & found this store on yelp, & by their amazing reviews, I gave it a go.

Everyone there is SO friendly, the store is classy, & the owner is VERY honest.

They also buy gold & clean your rings @ no charge.

Batteries for watches are only $6.  All their prices I felt were fair for the quality service they give:)

My mom & I will definitely refer this place to our friends & family!:)

I've been waiting almost an hour. The doctor prescribed me medicine without explaining the side effects or method of taking the medication. 

I've also left multiple messages to get me off of this medicine and I've gotten 1/4 responses to my calls. 

I would keep looking and refer elsewhere.
Hands down the best margarita pizza in the West Valley but be warned you must love you some garlic

I am so happy to have found a teacher like Jeanne!  She has so much wisdom from her decades of experience, and it is apparent in her workshops and various healing sessions.  She has so much knowledge that she uses, and so your certain to gain some clarity and relief in dealing with your physical and/or emotional struggles.  She has proven to be an irreplaceable resource on my path towards healing, and I couldn't be more grateful!! Jeanne you are a true blessing!!

This is our go to place for pizza or Italian food when we want to stay close by. The pizza is thin crust with the right amount of toppings. The pasta choices are pretty standard. I had stuffed shells with a side of meatballs. Very good. The other members of the group had eggplant italiano, Mediterranean pasta, and the trio sampler. Everyone had enough to take home for another meal. The service was very good and the outdoor patio comfortable.

My mother-in-law and I stopped by today to get pedicures. It was a walk-in last minute. We got the sea breeze pedicure and it was amazing. It included a sugar scrub, hot stone massage, cooling gel, and hot towel treatment. It was super reasonably priced too. The facility was super clean and the staff was friendly and knowledgable. All in all I would definitely recommend this place.

I am in town on an extended visit to help with a sick relative. I needed to get my nails filled and had no idea where to go. I found this place on Yelp and after reading the reviews decided to try it. I was NOT disappointed!! I was a walk-in and got right in. Joan did an excellent job. My nails looked absolutely fantastic and have held up beautifully for the past 2 weeks. I was so impressed that I am going back today to have them done again before I return me.

Now the first thing you may want to ask is "Greg what the fuck were you doing 99th Ave and Greenway?" or "99th Ave?  Why the fuck didn't you just drive the extra three miles and go to LA?"  You would be right in asking me those perfectly reasonable questions.  

The answer is that for some reason which I still have not been able to figure out yet is that my girlfriend's parents live out there.  So this Friday it was her step mother's birthday and she wanted to celebrate at this little place in a strip mall in Sun City.  All I could say up to that point is "Hey, at least it's not a fucking Luby's."  

So we walk up to this little restaurant and there is patio seating out front and a quaint little dining room inside.  We were early so we decided to belly up to the bar and have a glass of wine. The bar tender carded me which was understandable given that compared to the average patron at this establishment I must have looked like a god damn fetus.  I order a Chardonnay and my girlfriend orders a Sauvignon Blanc.  Mine was passable hers was too sweet.  We had a couple other glasses and when the bill came for 4 glasses of mediocre wine I was more that a little shocked that they cost $26.  Oh well easy come easy go right?  

The reservations we had were for a huge table outside as we had about 20 people in our party.  There was live entertainment in the form of this blonde lady about 50 years old not bad looking who has a kind of karaoke set up that she just uses to sing.  I tipped her a few times so she could play some Nancy Sinatra, Stan Getz, etc. and she did a pretty decent job.  

The menu was pretty standard Italian fare.  Various pastas and pizzas, etc.  I took a chance and order the Fettucine a la Carbonara.  The reason I say I took a chance is because I have ordered this dish the world over and I have only had about one or two places make it properly.  This was not one of them.  They basically just put bacon over Fettucine Alfredo and called it a night.  Disappointing but at least the clam chowder and pizza was pretty good.  

I would have to say the most remarkable thing about this place was these weird really long tubes that they fill up and bring to your table.  The tube has a tap at the bottom that you use to pour the beer.  Very bizarre.  

The entertainment got progressively more fun as we drank and drank.  At one point there was this old dude dancing his ass off right there on the patio like he didn't have a care in the world.  I hope I have as much energy when I am his age.  We eventually did the same and danced the twist right there on the patio.  What started out as a pretty mediocre place turned out to be a pretty fun time.  

I don't know why the hell anyone reading this would ever find themselves at 99th Ave and Greenway but if you do you should swing by and check it out.
I will never order flowers here again. For $70 you would think they would be somewhat like the picture on the website. Super disappointed. I will be calling to let them know there's no excuse.

Used to like this place, but it's really gone downhill over the years. Forget trying to order take out--they either forget you called, or something because they never have the order ready! They started fish friday's, and ever since their food (eggs especially) have this gross fishy after-taste. It's a shame, because mom and pop sit downs like this are hard to find--and it used to be one of the best ones.

I don't recommend eating here, and honestly don't know how they always have so much business. Maybe it's the novelty, or people don't mind the quality of food as long as it's cheap enough.
This was not good at all. I ordered fish tacos and I got a Vandeekamps fish stick in a tortilla with tartar sauce.

Office people don't pay attention to what goes on around them. Upon arriving I stood at the window about 5 minutes before the receptionist acknowledged me. I asked her if they accepted our insurance and she said yes. While we sat there waiting for one hour, the office staff were eating their lunch, the receptionist was playing on the computer. I finally went up to the window and said when were we going to be seen. She didn't even realize we were there and never checked the sign in sheet. We sat there for an hour for nothing.  When she proceeded to give me the question sheet to fill in, I stated "You gotta be kidding!!!" and we walked out. While walking out my husband said "See if we recommend this place to anyone!" we then went to another Urgent care facility and was cared for within 10 minutes.

I went to the location on 91st ave & Thomas on Friday because I hurt my knee several weeks ago and have been in lots of pain and didnt want to miss anymore work. I went in and there were only 2 people so i assumed the wait should be too long. The front desk girls were not friendly at all and after 3 hours and an Xray that didnt show anything, they said they would sent me a prescription to the pharmacy for pain. I drove to the pharmacy and no prescription, called the next day and still no prescription. It turns out they had prescribed Oxycodone which CANNOT be sent electronically which you would think they would know considering they are the drs. So when i go back in to ask for it, I have never been treated so poorly. They screwed up my prescription and then proceeded to treat ME like a drug abuser just trying to get more drugs! I will NEVER go back there!

A great salon. They offer many services at reasonable prices. The salon is attractive and very clean. Everyone is very friendly and does a great job.
I always make an appointment and never have to wait more than a few minutes. I've seen them make every effort to accomodate walk-ins but sometimes they are totally booked. I don't understand walk-ins who think the salon personnel can drop everything and help them.
Do My Nails is the best!!

Service was horrible. We where there an hour before we even got our salads, which by the way were soggy. I went and complained to the manager, and she honestly acted like whatever about it. The waitress came only about 3 times to our table. Eventually we got our food which honestly was alright not worth the $80 we paid. I would rather have gone to Grande Pizza on 91st and union hills for better service and better pricing for food.

Absolutely loved the service!! I had the guy, which I'm sorry couldn't remember his name, gave me a pedicure. He actually gave me info on their reflexology that they offer without sounding like a sells person. I felt comfortable and was able to carry on a conversation with him. My nails are beautiful!! I will be back to hopefully do the reflexology and get another pedicure

Considering how much this location has gone through to get where it is now, I'd say they've made great improvements. New management took over a few months ago (or a year, I don't know--I've lost track of time. lol) and they've been fighting very hard to get to where they need to be. It's not easy working in Sun City--probably one of the worst when it comes to working with the people there--but the service takes it in stride! They're tough, and they do their job. I don't mind eating there.

Very friendly and helpful. Gave four stars because when order arrived it was not the quality expected. This order was made from out of state. When I called I was told sorry you are disappointed and that was the end of that. It wasn't until the out of state florist got involved that they were willing to help. 
When I took the order back to the store they went above and beyond to make sure I was happy. 
Again a four star review because they should have fine the right thing from the beginning.

Seemed like a great deal online and when it arrived it was much smaller than anticipated.  Should just maybe state it's a $40 bouquet vs a $70 bouquet "on sale".  

Flowers were appreciate by the recipient. There were fewer roses than anticipated and a lot more less expensive "filler" flowers and greens.

Awesome!!!! Kymberlee and her team were so professional and helpful. My wedding band cracked and their team repaired and rhodium plated my set. It looks better than new. I can't wait to come back for my new anniversary ring. See you soon. 

Here are before and after images

This is one of those small, neighborhood places that is easy to pass up - I oughta know having done just that.  But tonight we stopped in and had dinner.  It was great!  We ordered the fish which (for $7.99) is a great value and ALL YOU CAN EAT!  This entree includes three sides.  Although the salad was a little watery, the soup was pretty good and the green beans - not bad.  The place looks small from the outside but inside it's huge. Lots of room, great lighting, pleasant music and the staff was awesome.  From our hostess to our waiter (Ruben) everything was smooth and easy.  We can't wait to go back for breakfast!  

If you believe in supporting local businesses while trying to save a buck, try the Royal Cafe.  I think we've got a winner here!

Ordered a Monterey burrito (carne asada, cheese and beans) husband ordered a big burrito (chile relleno, beans, rice cheese, guacamole, pico, and carne asada) we got both wet style. The enchilada sauce on top was disgusting! Super salty and gelatinous. Gross. How hard is it to make some real enchilada sauce or at least buy a good Cannes version. Carne asada was a grey color. No char marks or signs of quality grilling. Looked boiled. We both said our burritos smelled fishy and left with our hands smelling fishy. How was that possible with carne asada? Not going back. Should have listened to the other reviewer!

My visit here was so amazing. The entire staff was fantastic and very friendly. The procedure I had done was painful but the PA that worked on me kept me talking and trying his best to keep my mind off the pain and what he was doing. 

I will be going back here for any other treatments that I may need.

So....if you like lots of bland food for little money...this is your place.  Stick to the breakfast foods if you want edible.  A bit greasy spoon but, it is a cafe in an partially abandoned mall after all.   Came twice so as not to skew my review.

They do have specials which the older crowd loves...

Wait staff was friendly.  Owner, well.  Let's just say do NOT sit in the booth near the cash register.  She actually leaned over me to hand something to the cashier!?!?  FTF?  I called her out asking for her to be aware of my personal space (I was nice enough  not mention that her chest in my face which was boardering on twisted)...her reply?    "it was only for a second, I am in a hurry".  HUH?

Gonna go two stars as the wait staff was on point, kind to my mom and tried hard to give a good experience.

Just had lunch here Friday the 13th. Wanted a fish fry.  The worst fish fry I ever had. It was one pice deep fried to death with the skin on. It had no taste was very thin and the tarter sauce was sweet. 
One good point, the French frys were good. 
Will not return.
I was sick with running nose and headaches.  Came in to see doctor.  I was very pleased with how the doctor treated me.  Staff were also very friendly.  I will come back if I am sick again.

My wife our friend Kathy R. and myself stopped here for lunch. As soon as we stepped in, we were greeted by Lacey who was extremely friendly.  Lacey gave us ample time to Perouse  the menu until we all deicide what we wanted. 

For starters I ordered the Calamari for my wife & I . It was alright, thinly coated but not really fired the way I normally like. It was decent but not special. I've had way better here in Arizona..

Our waitress brought us the beverages we ordered then took our meal order. Dinner gets off to a good start here with a nice basket of garlic bread sticks,Our entrees came shortly thereafter. Our friend started with the soup which she said was absolutely delicious.  For her entrée Kathy got the Ziti with a side salad. She raved about the garlic dressing. And kept going on and on about it until her meal came. She thought the Ziti was outstanding.  For dessert Kathy got the home made Tiramisu. It was soaked in brandy and espresso, layered with sweetened marscapone cheese and kahlua.  Topped off with cocoa powder. She thought it was outstanding.

My wife Carol decided on the  Sausage, peppers & onions (Mild Italian Sausage slow baked with sweet peppers, onions, marinara sauce and spices with side of pasta). Carol thought the dish was superb. For dessert Carol got the Lemoncello Marscapone Cake. Carol loves lemon and said it was A delightful and light lemon flavored cake. It was and rich and loaded with delicious Lemon flavor.

I got the Veal Parmesan it came with a small dinner salad and pasta w/ marinara sauce. The pasta is extremely high quality-- perfectly cooked. The veal parmesan was tender and prepared nicely. I always judge an Italian restaurant on the Veal Parmesan if they have it or the eggplant parmesan. In this case it was the veal. The dish was classic  Italian fare, nothing really different than what you find on every menu Italian Restaurant in Arizona.  But it was pretty tasty. For dessert I ordered the cheese cake. It was creamy and rich but nothing special.

FOOD: Food was very good. Kathy R. and my wife was impressed with the quality of their dish. As for me I thought the food was good but didn't knock my socks off like I was expecting. While everything tasted fine, I did not taste any heart or soul in the dishes and Italian food normally has a lot of TLC along with heart and soul put into their dishes. SERVICE:Lacey provided us with Tremendous service. PRICE: The prices on the lunch menu wasn't terrible. CONCLUSION: Nice atmosphere.  Relaxed, unpretentious, and comfortable in a way that makes you want to spend time just chatting with friends. The portions were just right for lunch not to big that you left stuffed but not  small where you left hungry. You cannot go home hungry from here.  RETURN FACTOR 100%. 
  
    ******************* What does my OVERALL rating mean? ********************
5 stars -Highly recommended.  I would be willing to drive out of my way to this business. It is that good. This place represents their industry or cuisine very well! 
4 stars - Highly Recommended. I would frequent this business. 
3 stars - Not that good but not that bad. Just average. I wouldn't mind going again. 
2 stars - I would not recommend this establishment to friends or family. 
1 stars - DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND DO NOT patronize this business. I would RUN AWAY from this place and you should too! DON'T WAST YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY AT THIS ESTABLISH 

The portions were huge, the prices were very reasonable and the food was fantastic!  I would definitely recommend Little Bite of Italy and I'll certainly go back again

Always an amazing experience at Setterberg Jewelers. The staff is so knowledgeable and personable and their selection includes something for every style. Love their estate options - including this beautiful piece that my husband bought for our anniversary. Support local!

I moved into a new home in Peoria and wanted the locks changed, I gave Ace locksmith a call and they were able to set up an appointment with me later that day, the technician was quick and efficient and charged the most reasonable price in town! I would highly recommend Ace Locksmith to all my family and friends!
I have been to a few Urgent Care places in the Valley, I have to say by far this is the quickest, nicest, fun staff I have ever met!  You guys rock!

I would never go anywhere else in the area, I have tried the one by Fry's, Safeway, and on Grand.. None of them are as nice and knowledgable as this group of people. Great job Do My Nails!  Almost forgot their new spa chairs, amazing to say the least.

We have been going to Chang Lee for about 10 years and had the pleasure of dining there today for lunch. We were introduced to it by friends in that area, and although we live in N. Phoenix, we look forward to heading over that way to have what we consider to be the BEST Chinese food anywhere. We have, in the past, just driven over just to eat there. My favorite is the Lemon Chicken, and my husband's is the Westlake Duck. The dumplings and the spring rolls are outstanding, too. If you are in the area of 99th Ave and Thunderbird (Sun City, at the end of a strip center), you're in for a T-R-E-A-T. It isn't fancy, but who needs fancy now-a-days?  Their food is just scrumptious!
Bill T.
Phoenix

My mom ordered the lemon veal, and it was nasty, voted so by her friend that tasted it as well!!  The server would have nothing to do with replacing the meal, or compensating in any way whatsoever, the manager had the same attitude. Ultimately my mom left, on her birthday, hungry!  

They claimed if they replaced food for everyone, they wouldn't have a business. Well, they won't have our business moving forward!

This place has a disgusting smell when you walk in and then the food is just ok.  My husband and I had breakfast burritos, I have to say my bacon was crispy which was the only good part.  My husband had sausage and he ended up with food poising, so we will never go back.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. 
First, do not be thrown off by the location. Its in that run down strip mall on 103rd ave and Olive Ave. While the building is a bit dilapidated, its super clean inside. Everyone speaks very good English which is a plus because I didn't worry about communicating what I wanted. 

I came prepared with pictures of the full set of stilletto acrylics I wanted. I was paired with Bebe, who is a sweet, kind, woman in her mid 40's. She said she's been working at the salon for 3mos and she loves it. 

Before doing ANYTHING we settled on the price of what I wanted. There are boards hanging on the walls with all the prices as well, which you don't always find. Bebe made sure I was OK with the price which was $40 for a full stiletto set with one design nail. Super cheap! 

My nails took an hour and 15min and I freaking love them. I haven't had nails in over 10yrs and recently got a wild hair and wanted them done. This place had the highest reviews on Yelp in Peoria, and I can see why. They are professional, personable, and can do exactly what you ask for. Already booked my next appt in 2 weeks!!!

BEWARE!! I had batteries replaced in two watches. I ask how waterproof the watches would be after having the backs removed.  Steve, an employee, told me that i could shower with them on.  The morning after i showered with one of them, the inside of the crystal was completely soaked.  I took the watch back in and it was opened to dry it out.  After drying out overnight the watch would not run.  The store called me and told me  that the watch would have to be sent to the certified Seiko watch repair company at my cost.  After getting nowhere with this closed-minded witch, the owner, (p)rick setterberg, completely refused to repair the watch  or send the watch out for repairs at his expense. THESE PEOPLE ARE
 VERY NICE WHEN THEY THINK YOU WILL BUY SOMETHING,  BUT REFUSE TO STAND BEHIND THEIR SCREW UPS.

I moved here recently from east coast.Bought a bistro set and lamp which I really loved! I thought most of the prices were good.Selection varies from week to week.They held on to my items for awhile til I was ready for them and delivered quickly.No complaints on my part and I would recommend to buy from them.

I used to go to another Urgent Care, I wasn't happy.  I am so glad I found this office. I have been here twice with my 7 year old son this year.  They are amazing and so caring!  I love the way they called to check on him a few days later.

The office is clean and the staff is GREAT!

This the best place ever! The staff is great, the prices are amazing, and they provide a great atmosphere. I will not go anywhere else since I first came here.

Great job guys!
I'm sorry, but when you are scheduled to be open till 9:00 PM and I get there at 8:30 PM and you are already closed because of a slow day, you don't deserve my business anymore.

The staff at this establishment is very good at their job. I was seen right away and the service was top notch. They listened to my concerns and my needs do to a certain condition, and they easily worked right around it! It is also awesome that this is a family run establishment that Is kept up well and is very clean. I will Definitely be returning!

I was referred to this jewelry company by another jeweler.  I brought some vintage sterling jewelry with gemstones and was going over some of the pieces with one of the employees. I'm not quite sure how much time I spent there but I have done research on my pieces and just wanted to get a second opinion and possible appraisals. She constantly kept saying they weren't what I was saying they were (sapphires or other gemstones) because of this reason or because of that reason.  After going back and forth discussing my gemstones that she said was just glass ( when I knew that they weren't) she said she had to answer the phone.  While she was on the phone I decided to browse at that point she was only several feet away from me on the phone and I heard her say, "there's just some crazy lady here right now....." and she looked at me and saw me looking at her. I said, "crazy lady? You're calling me crazy???". She waved me off saying she wasn't even talking about me.  There was only one other lady that had just walked in to drop off a piece of jewelry to get a clasp replaced.  I was actually extremely hurt because I was excited to finally get one on one time with a gemologist. I was at a loss for words and just went back to where my items were and tried soooooo hard not to cry.  I ended up failing at that. As I was leaving in tears the other employee ( much kinder and patient) asked if I was ok and I said no and pointed at the other employee (who was still on the phone) and told her what she said. The other employee on the phone yelled out that she wasn't even talking about me. The employee that asked if I was ok followed me outside to try to talk to me and apologize, but I was too embarrassed at that point to even talk.  I just said that you can't run a business like that. I told her that you can't just slander your customers by calling them crazy to other people like that and she just apologized as I got in my car and left. I literally pulled over and cried for like 10 minutes and decided not to give up. I went to a pawn shop (not to sell my items), but because had been amazing in the past.  I was greeted by everyone and then a gentleman had asked me about my items and I told him about my horrible experience and what happened. He was extremely empathetic and could tell I was trying not to cry again. At that point he said "I have a gemstone referential meter and refroctometer that even tested if it they were simulated and he offered to check them out. He had a new "Gemlogis Pistachio & Gemlogis CIEL ONE.  He was absolutely amazing to work with and sure enough, all my gemstones tested POSITIVE for EXACTLY what I told the previous jewelers! My stones were pink, purple, blue and white sapphires, rubies diamonds, topaz, citrine and even Spinel!!! I am still very upset and embarrassed with the way I was treated at Setterberg Jewelers. I even had a clear bead from a bracelet that tested positive for Spinel!!! For the record I even took pictures of every piece getting tested along with the results.

Folks around here know the Royal Cafe. A lovely little find in the Sun City community. I see faces that have been there for years. After a couple trips, they remember your order.  Never a better fresh blueberry pancake...Speedy, tasty and so reasonable. Where in the world can you get a .99 cent coffee????
First time at this location, very helpful and friendly associates. Unfortunately they didn't have everything I was looking for but did have a major portion of what I had on my shopping list.
Good food, great atmosphere. It was very clean, as opposed to a lot of restraunts in the area. I'd definitely recommend a remodel, though.

Chang Lee deserves some love. I've been coming here with my grandparents since I was a kid. The prices are right, always get a seat, service is great and the quality is consistent. Their style is a bit different than the other area Chinese places. I recommend the egg drop soup, house chicken and spicy shrimp. The location is a bit unlucky as the restaurant has had to deal with construction projects in one shape or another for the past couple years.

Give them a shot! I love it.

This place sucks!! 
The doctors are great but staff sucks.. I waited over 30mins for an ENG test .. The tech was waiting for me.. and i was waiting for him..  i asked how much longer will it be and they acted like they had NO idea who i was.. he asking for his paient as i sat there. HOW ANNOYING!!! WHAT KIND OF OFFICE IS ThIS?!?!?!?!? he wasnt happy either being backed up 30mins ALL DAY NOW! .. This place is THE WORST!!!!!!! DONT GO HERE!!

I do not recommend this place for authentic Italian food. All of the food was very disappointing, where we sent back a dish and ate only a few bites of the others. The pasta Mediterranean did not come with the vegetables it stated and had no seasoning or flavor. The lasagna was frozen and premade as the meat was the consistency of spam. The calzone was airy and filled with too much cheese that was not fully cooked. The service was unpleasant and not helpful. They were not friendly. The server could not speak English or pronounce our dishes. Oreganos is a 10 compared to this restaurant!

I called this shop 15m before closing the day before the Fourth of July asking if they could send my mom get well flowers the next day. They were closed the next day bc of the holiday but the woman that answered the phone asked if they could deliver that night. I was so thankful because my mom was in the hospital and had had a rough recovery. The owner of the shop picked out a wonderful assortment of flowers and it certainly brightened my mom's day! I often will order flowers through a website and I will no longer do that bc the flowers are not as advertised. These flowers were beautiful and worth it. It was like small town service. Thanks to this shop. They are amazing!

We are from a different side of town(San tan valley) and thought we would take a chance with trying sometime different. Best decision we've made this morning! The moment we walked through the door we were greeted by the cutest little lady hostess. Immediately she seated us at a table and offered us fresh hot coffee. Within seconds our server Ruben approached the table notifying us of the daily/weekly specials. We took advantage of this low-cost quality food special. To our surprise, our hot, fresh, delicious food arrived within 2-3 minutes after placing the order. Being a restaurant manager myself I would definitely have to say the customer service provided at this establishment is Beyond exceptional. Ruben could not have been more accommodating. He sent us on our way with a to go coffee as a bonus. This is a perfect cozy place to dine inexpensively. We will definitely be returning in the near future as well as sharing this information with our friends and family local to the area.
Horrible customer service! Huge line of customers, all the employees are too busy to help them! Same story every time I come here. No respect for your customers!
They came quickly and helped me get to work and my daughter to school on time. I would highly recommend them to family and friends if they need this in the future

I've only been here for breakfast, and they always have a good specials.
Consistently good breakfast, some waitresses, more attentive than others.
Popular neighborhood restaurant for sun city, will be going back again!

So, one night I was on a desperate hunt to find my favorite hot peanut mix at Walgreens, and decided to venture into Sun City. My girlfriend and I just so happen to pull into a local Walgreens at 99th Ave and Greenway. As we attempted to find a parking spot that was not occupied by a golf cart, she looks over and sees this little Italian restaurant tucked in this  strip mall, alongside a dollar store and clothing boutique that most likely closes at 4pm daily. 

Anyways, for the next few weeks my girlfriend bugs me about venturing back into Sun City to visit this "cute little restaurant." So what do we do? Head out on a Friday night date to Little Bite of Italy. You know, what all the 20-something year olds do on the weekend.

Upon arrival, we were pleasantly surprised to see a large white tent on the patio area, occupied by live entertainment. Now, this 'live entertainment' consisted of a man in his late-50s singing karaoke and strumming on his guitar to the accompanying oldies music....but I must say, he had a very good voice-- the voice of an angel, if you will.

As we peered around the patio, the next youngest person was most likely 30 years our elder, but that was to be expected. I decided to order the baked ziti, and she, going with the safe bet of chicken alfredo.

As we waited for our food, an elderly couple got up and decided to get down and dirty on the dance floor. I do not know the names of many dances, so let's just call their dance the waltz. The couple waltzed it up for a while, putting on a rather impressive show for the patio. At one point, i made eye contact with the dancing man, resulting in him sending a huge smile and a little wink of the eye my --as if to say, "check out the lady I've got on my arm."

Our food then arrived. My baked ziti appeared to have been baking for days, as the sauce was dried up and almost non-existent. Instead of complaining, I sucked it up and ate it--all while listening to the girlfriend state that her alfredo is delicious.

So, when it was time to pay the damages, I was a little more than shocked as to the amount I had to pay. Personally, I would've enjoyed a dollar menu burger from McDonald's a lot more....but the entertainment and people watching remains priceless, and unmatched.

Doctor Baker believes in the three"C"s of medicine. He is caring, compassionate, concerned and competent. He is successfully treating me for neck, back and knee pain. He orders testing to rule out underlying issues. He actually called my hose to inform me of ex rays he ordered from Simon Medical. What a wonderful caring Doctor!! I feel like we are family. I also need to give a shout out to April is patient advocate. April has a heart of GOLD. What a awesome team!!

I like the people who run this Restaurant. The food is good. I have one constructive criticism and that is the Sweet and Sour Sauce. It's pink and not all that good. I ordered BBQ Chicken Wings and the wings were good but the sauce wasn't BBQ it was the meh! Sweet and Sour Sauce. I hope the Owners read this and try another recipe for their Sweet and Sour Sauce. I would be much more likely to patronize this establishment regularly with these changes..
These guys are the best, I don't see how other people have had bad a bad experience here. Some people just love to complain.

My favorite boutique to shop for all my needs! So exciting every time I go there! It changes and I'm transformed into the cutest best dressed lady in our park!!! I love going in and being helped by the sales women who help you find all your needs and accessories. Wish they had a store closer, but I would travel anywhere for these cute clothes

I wanted to take my grandma out for some dinner and since this place is a block or so from her house, we decided to give it a try. 

Upon arriving we could tell that it was busy, but there were still empty tables. We waited for 5 to 10 minutes to be seated and then another few for our waitress to take our drink orders (water, nothing from the bar). At this point I should have taken better notice of the patrons around us. Nobody had food in front of them and several tables looked anxious as if they had been waiting for some time. Our waitress returned to take our orders and then we started what would be the longest wait in restaurant history...

We literally waited for 35 minutes from the time we placed our order to the time we received our dinner salads. 'Oh good sign' I thought as we received our salads, thinking dinner couldn't be too far behind... well I was wrong. We sat and sat and sat for another 25 minutes. Eventually I told my hard of hearing grandma that I was going to settle up on our waters and side salads and we would go grab some Arby's. She agreed and I hunted down our waitress. When I told her I wanted to tab out, she looked at me with disbelief and stated she would have to get the manager. Then she proceeded to clean a table. I was disgusted and ready to go. And I would have too, if my sweet little grandma wasn't sitting there. Our waitress returned and asked if we could wait 2 more minutes. I looked around and mentioned there were at least 2 other tables ahead of us. She stated that they ordered pizza and it takes longer than our orders. A few more minutes passed and our plates came out. 

The food was nothing fancy, but did taste alright. I had stuffed shells and grandma had manicotti. 

Next time I take grandma to dinner we will make the drive to another place and avoid the excessive waits.

I saw the prior reviews but don't understand where these people are coming from as we've been here at least 5 times and have enjoyed the food, service and value each time.  The only explanation that I can provide is there may have been some inconsistencies due to this being a new location.  We've not experienced this chain previously so don't have that basis for comparison, but found the food to be authentic and flavorful.  Typically, we order take-out for home dining (with beer and margaritas!) so can't provide comment regarding onsite dining . We've ordered a variety of items like tacos and burritos which include their (shredded) beef and adobada, rolled tacos (=flautas), carne asado and huevos rancheros and enjoyed each dish.  We're planning our next order which may include pollo & chorizo (they'll accommodate special order requests) and tortas.

Although the staff here is very very nice, the food at best is just meh....I visited recently with a friend and found the menu and food to be uninspired. I ordered the soup, salad and breadsticks. First of all, it bagged salad and about a cup of it at that. It's not a bread stick, it's a slice of garlic toast. And the soup, the soup was pretty good. It was semi-homemade chicken noodle soup. It's not unlimited but it is only $5. You do get what you pay for in that respect.  My friend ordered the mostaccoli with meatsauce and salad. The pasta was overdone and the meatsauce was pretty salty. 

I suppose for the older crowd that this place attracts in Sun City, this food is great, but honestly, it was nothing special. It wasn't bad...it just wasn't good either.
This restaurant is absolutely horrible! The service was terrible the food was bad in the restrooms were filthy as was the dining room I would never go back

Something is wrong with the map on yelp, it direct you to a location far north from the actual location.  Olive and 103rd is the correct cross street.

Map quest the address

I asked a business near Chang Lee's if they would recommend their food, and everyone said yes. I was greeted immediately upon entering Chang Lee's by two less than enthusiastic waitresses. I ordered take out (sweet & sour pork, fried rice, and a coke).

While waiting in the lobby, I noticed several displeasing things. There was a half full coffee carafe in a soda/water mini fridge, their fish tank had scum all over the inside with little foliage or rock (these help de-stress fish), and their TV was set to Unsolved Mysteries--not exactly an appetizing show.

I received my food and headed back to work. The soda tasted...dirty. I don't know how it is possible, but my Coca Cola in a Styrofoam cup tasted as if there were dust or dirt in it. I couldn't even choke it down.

The pork wasn't bad, good flavor, but very fatty. The rice was nothing special, just a filler by far. Hardly any veggies or egg included in it. 

I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Wow! People from surrounding areas seem kind of mad at this place. It is not a dance club. It is Sun City folks, not Scottsdale. This place is about fun and people watching. 

The pizza is great! We have had the white pizza several times and love the thin crust and toppings. 

First time we went, we were looking for something to do, So I called and asked if they had music. The woman replied, that they had 'R&B' that night. We went expecting a band. Instead, we got Ronnie and Bobbie  (?) who sing to songs AND wear costumes to fit the mood! It is very quirky, but fun. Tons of regulars hang out to dance and visit. we felt kind of out of place, since we were 10 - 20 years younger than the crowd, but they said hi as they walked by and made us feel included. The singers handed out small flags to wave during their rendition of 'Boogie- Woogie Bugle Boy' So, I got up and waved mine, mortifying my GF. Good fun!

Where to begin. Staff, not friendly, not helpful. Owner, not available. Ambience, dirty. It is appear r that the owner is cutting corners when ordering takeout and they charge you for soup and salad and yet the same order eating in it's included. And instead of ordering new menus, they had staff use a black marker over the soup and salad portion of the takeout menus. When bringing out the food, not a word! This place relies on its karaoke and booze to stay alive. The food was not memorable . Will not go back. Proof that the Sun City crowd Ned's to demand better restaurants. Bye Cafeterias and little bite of Italy, a new generation is moving in.
Best place in town, period! They are clean, professional, very friendly, and totally skilled at what they do. So inexpensive, too!
Dr Baker is the Best! His staff is awesome. Always pleasant and worth the wait to get to see him
Best experience ever at any urgent care or regular doctors office! Everyone was friendly and the doctor wasn't just about getting money.

Gross! I got a combo platter of chicken curry. On the menu it had a red pepper next to it, meaning to signify that it was spicy, but the curry was extremely bland, and it looked like greasy water. I assume that it is because they have such a thin curry that the dish was served in a cup-shaped fried egg roll wrapper. Not only was the sauce a disappointment, but the chicken was extremely fatty. 

The fact that it was a combo platter meant that I also received side dishes... First of all, their fried rice has no egg or veggies in it, so it's just soy sauce-soaked salty rice. The egg roll was okay, although it was the heaviest egg roll I've ever encountered, since it was primarily fried wrapper around meager contents. There was also a side of horribly MSG-laden lo-mein. Finally there were two buffalo wings which I never got to because by that point I was not really wanting to eat any more of their food offerings.

First bad meal out I've had in a long time (food-wise, anyway... at least the staff was pleasant). Maybe they have other foods that they are better at making? I don't know, and won't be back to find out!

The doctor did not provide any useful but harmful medical advice to my 10-month-old daughter. I told the doctor that my daughter was sick for 5 days already, but the doctor prescribed her a medication that has to be taken within 2 days of the flu symptoms are developed. The doctor did not tell me this requirement until I found that out from the prescription instruction inside the prescription package. The medication cost me $150. I kept calling the office but the front desk and doctors did not try to take any responsibility. 
At the time of visit, the doctor only told me that my daughter needed to take the medication and drink more water. She did not do anything useful to help my daughter from sickness. Now they are charging me $100 for office visit.

I kept calling and left voicemail to the Administrator (Duke Nguyen) for compensation of wrong medical advice and wrong prescription, but the front desk of Surprise office and Sun City office  and the Administrator always AVOID me. When I call in, they always say the administrator is not here, there is nothing I can do for you. You lost your money and you still need to pay us. 

If you think the doctor here is better than google search, you are wrong. I really do not know why the review is so high, but my experience tells me it is not true.

If there is a government department that I can report this issue, I will definitely go there and charge them in court. I have the voicemail left by the doctor as evidence of misleading prescription and advice. Thank you to T-mobile speech-to-text voicemail feature.

We tried to rent a car from this location recently.  When we walked in the door we were ignored by a woman who appeared completely overwhelmed on the phone.  Eventually, she began the car rental process.  This woman gave the impression she was about to have a nervous breakdown and is extremely slow.  After 45 minutes, we decided to leave without the rental car.  We drove to nearby Budget and rented a car in about 10 minutes time.  We'll never visit this Hertz location again, and we rent cars several times a year.

This place screwed my friend Marlena. She paid $59.99 for a service call and they said they would be back the next day and they weren't. She continues to try and call them to no avail. Now she is sitting with no dryer and out of $60!
Good service. I like the dim atmosphere. Food was pretty good overall. I like to put together my own Mooshu pork. I appreciate a thinner pancake as I watch my carbs.

I had a productive cost comparison visit to this Hertz location managed by Neal Redman. The customer rep Yatta did a wonderful job with comparing cars and insurance options to give me a better deal with exceptional value when compared with the other local car rental companies. I'll definitely be back in the coming weeks to rent my car from this location. Sincerely, Art Huseonica, Sun City, AZ

I wish my builder never hired Monty.. Monty is unprofessional and doesn't back up his work.. also he doesn't answer phone calls for months .. when I need service on my whole house vacuum I will definitely be calling another company
Very clean and welcoming.  Well supplied and great chairs. They honor appointment times with no waiting. And best part, you can't beat the price.

The reviews are accurate, this place is a gem.  Andy was wonderful and did a terrific job with my pedicure. I was pleasantly surprised to receive a sugar scrub, hot rock massage and warm towel wrap with the  basic manicure. I will be back.

The staff "EVERYONE" is so kind and friendly.  We have never had a bad experience.  This location isn't the closest to me but it is worth the few extra miles   My son who is 8 is never afraid to come here because they treat him with respect and kindness
Cute little place with super nice staff. Choice of seating, great prices and nice diner atmosphere.

Have to say, the MOST disappointing dining experience ever in the Sun City area. Management does NOT care. Slow service, mediocre food. Won't recommend to anyone and certainly won't be going back anytime soon.

Very good food. Meat off the grill has great flavor and service was very good. Old interior so watch out for the booth seats.
Would very much go back.
Price is right.
Terrible!!!Please avoid.

The food was okay until a cockroach ran across our table. We immediately got up to leave.  Went to pay for our check and owners didn't even offer a discount for our dinner. My husband killed cockroach on the table and they saw it.

I just had breakfast here went to pay my bill and was under 8 dollars 3 eggs 2 sausage 2 pieces of toast and coffee, food was on my table in less than 5 minutes. I don't Yelp much but this place is absolutely worth  a 6 star review. I'm coming back tomorrow, and every time I have a job in sun City this is my spot
