As snow birds we have eaten at the Royal many times over the last several years, but before I knew about yelping.  So, taking everything into consideration I can honestly say this is a great place for breakfast which is what we usually come for.  They do a bustling business and on Sundays you have to get there early or you will hit the 'after church' crowd and then you have a bit of a wait.  The staff is friendly and helpful and if it's not busy they are fine with letting you sip your coffee and finish the crossword puzzle.  

We've eaten dinner there a few times too.  I've tried the chicken breast and fish of some sort and was pleased.  The baked potatoes are good, the salads are fresh and their dressings are great.  The times we have had dinner they have usually served fresh green beans as the veggie.  I have not tried their home made desserts but they look delicious.  

So, this place is really a very high three in my yelpimation.

Pretty empty place and took a little more time than expected to get a drink order in and finally the soup and sandwich order.  At least the food came out quickly.  Nothing to write home about and don't think I'll go back.  Not worth the time, Peoria is close and better restaurants.

I am very impressed by this place. I have been to 3 shop around the area and this place by far is the best, great customer service, very clean salon and great techs. This will be my new go to mani and pedi. I highly recommend this salon! I will be back.

Not the most luxurious of salons I've been to but I guess u get what you pay for 

I got the sea breeze pedicure which was really nice for  $31. They do a regular trimming and polish then added scrub to legs oil and lotion massage to leg and feet with hot stones. Also they did a callus file and where polite. My chair stopped massaging half way through and I couldn't get it back on for some reason it died or something.

I got my brows waxed for $10. They where good but a little overly shaped than I usually do back home but it's not bad.

No wait was nice.

Another great store!  Most items are a dollar but some are a little more. Almost everything is a great bargain. Should look at labels for experation dates but that's usually not a problem. It's amazing what you can find here.  Such a huge variety.

Convenient local location, but every time we go there, the line is long and they are always struggling to find enough cars for all the reservations.  I don't know if that is the fault of the local office or if it is Hertz in general, but what is the point of a reservation if not to make sure you have sufficient cars available.

I recently moved to the area and had been going to my previous nail salon as a loyal customer for the past 8 years. I wanted to try a new salon since I moved so far away from my usual place, and I was super pleased to say the least. It's not very impressive from the outside, nor the inside really, but they can DO some nails!! I would highly recommend it to anyone, but definitely make am appointment first. They're always busy- for obvious reasons.
Mordy was able to rekey my mothers house after keys were stolen. The work was done quickly and at a fair price. He came out on Saturday within an hour of so if calling.
I had a wonderful service here today I only took an hour and 15 minutes. Thank you urgent care of Sun City on 103rd and Thunderbird.

It took over two months to get an appointment with Dr. Boulware for an initial consultation.  I arrived early, and was seen late.  I saw this doctor for about 30 minutes. He told me what he though the issue was, but did not tell me that it was his official "diagnosis". He handed me a sheet of paper with referrals. He did not help me at all he just made matters worse in the end.  I learned of my diagnosis a month later, to my surprise, by the billing department (over the phone!). They told me that BCBC did not cover the diagnosis and that I had to pay up or else they would contact collections. I called BCBS and they told me the Dr. is a professonal and that they have to take his word for it.  I called the clinic back and asked to speak with the doctor, and they refused to allow me to speak with him.  

Stay away from this doctor if you have any issues. Like I said I was diagnosed and didn't even know it until his billing department contacted me.

Stay away from Arizona Neurological Institute!  I believe they inaccurately and prematurely made a diagnosis (after only seeing me for 30 minutes), and now I have been screwed over because of this because my insurance company doesn't pay for this type of "diagnosis".

I drive 45 min just to get my nails done. This place is THEE best! I've tried other nail salons but nothing comes even close in comparison. They are very precise and detailed with their work to make sure it is to each customers satisfaction. I love the feeling of being out and complimented about my tastefully designed nails, thanks Joan you are the best!  

For those that write about being turned away, ever heard about making an appointment? If you read about the place being so good, be prepared for them to be booked up or at least call.. :)

I first choose Ace because it was in Sun City. I sent a request for price opening my trailer and making a key. They ask for a picture. I sent a picture and never heard back. To me that is poor customer relations .
Great service. Very honest and receptive. Used for our Central Vacuum. Will definitely use again.

Yates, Neal and Cameron provided the best customer service a person could ask for. They were quick, they offered alternatives and they were a pleasant as could be. The store location was perfect for my Sun City vacation needs. And the store hours were adequate. I will use them on my next trip in 6 months! Mahalo, Jan

Monty is such a good person and is great at what he does. He cleaned out my vacuum, showed me how to work it, and was very professional. He reminds me of my Dad, who I happen to think is awesome! I will call him back for any future repairs no doubt about it!

I didn't even want to give this place 1 star. I was at the avondale 
Location. I've been experiencing strange light headedness, constant dizziness as well as neck tightness and pain and head numbness. Went to my primary for a referral in hope for an X-ray or scan. Had a negative experience at a different neurologist and was hoping this would be more helpful. Nope. Was quick to diagnose me as depressed and suggested I needed a psychiatrist for an anti depressant instead. What I joke. Still have no answers why I'm struggling daily.

Omg I just had my worst pedicure ever. Although the people were very nice my pedicure was terrible! The water first was so hot I jumped and pulled my feet out, then the top of my ankle started to burn because the callus remover was on my regular skin burning it, then my water was switched to ice cold and I never got any sort of leg massage or anything. I get pedicures every 2 weeks and this was just terrible. I've never had to say a thing before but here I felt like such a complainer. I won't go back no matter how close they are to my home.

The staff at this location is nice. However, the online check in process is worthless. I checked in at 4:30. They sent me a text saying my appointment was at 4:58 and to come 15 minutes early for paperwork. I did. Then I sat until just after 5:30 before seeing someone. And the walk ins were still put ahead of me.. Not sure what the point of checking in online was. I would have been better if going straight in vs sitting at home waiting and consequently falling further down the line.

These guys are the best. Just getting into coin/silver collecting and they've been great. I went to three other coin shops, each of which acted like they were too busy/uninterested in my "small potatoes" purchases. From the first visit they've been super helpful and honestly had the best price over spot I've found. I brought my three young boys with me the last time I visited, and they gave them each a gold plated quarter just to help start them collecting. We now spend every allowance payday there and they're always patient and kind with my kids. Can't speak highly enough. Thank you!

I was feeling under the weather and needed a place to go get a check up. The first NextCare that I called had a 3+ hour wait. Then I called the main number and they told me that the one on Bell had only a 20 minute wait and she could put my name in now. I said "go for it" and headed out.

When I got there I was greeted by a nice lady behind a desk. I filled out the traditional paperwork and paid my co-pay and 3 minutes later I was being taken to the back. 

After a quick pre-checkup I was taken to another room where I was told the doctor would be right in. About 5 minutes later the doctor enters, she shakes my hand and asks me what's wrong. I tell her and she immediately apologizes for me feeling so badly and starts to look me over. After figuring out that I had a really bad ear infection she again apologizes because "that must really hurt". She told me how we were going to fix this, she shook my hand and walked me out front. I grab a prescription and head to the pharmacy.

Three days later I get a call from NextCare. They are making sure that I was recovering and feeling better. They wanted to see if they could do anything else. Since I was starting to feel a lot better I told them I had nothing else they could help me with at this time.

Overall this is probably once of the nicest urgent care centers I have been in. The facility is very nice, the staff are incredibly kind and caring and I really don't have anything negative to say about this experience. Hopefully I don't need to use them often but the next time I get a cold, I will be heading right back to this place for sure.

Came in for their lunch special. It's a great deal and the food was amazing. I had the shrimp and lobster sauce combination plate. It came with a nice big g crunchy eggroll, egg drop soup, and delicious sausage ragoons. I guess my grandpa and grandma are regulars here and they absolutely love it. The food definitely has a lot of flavor! 

The restaurant is pretty cool inside and I could totally see romantic dinners happening there. It's decorated with so much creativity! The staff is pretty cool too since they have to put up with my Gramps!
Got a philly. menu said it was sirloin. sandwich said it was roast beef. nice try thO.

My wife introduced me to this place about 12 years ago and it's one of our favorites. We love the eggs rolls ,lemon chicken,shrimp fried rice,beef fried rice and Mushu chicken. It is very rare for us to find a menu item we haven't enjoyed. We get delivery but still enjoy dining in when we can. We have gone here so long we are regulars.

We are first time diners this evening and we enjoyed the experience.  Our server was excellent and the atmosphere was calming.  

It was a hot and humid day here in Sun City, but we decided to order a pot of tea.  It was a familiar and good choice for us as we have always found ourselves recounting fond memories over many a pot of tea, this day was no different.  

When our meal arrived, we were both anxious and desiring the food to be tasty.  We were not disappointed.  My House Special Chow Mein was delicious and included pork, shrimp and chicken with lots of crisp veggies.  My husband's combination dish was a welcoming sight to him as he was desiring an ample meal.  (I posted photos of our plates, as you can see for yourself, we received generous portions!)

Since our condo is only a few blocks away, there is no doubt, we will be back to sample more of this restaurant's delicious offerings.

Went in Nov 2015 for a UTI - NO PHYSICAK exam, just dr asking questions. got a prescription, then two months later got a bill for $2,000 of lab work.  My insurance got stuck with $1000 of it, and they want me to pay the other $1000.  There was no mention of labs being done, no exam to warrant it.  Now going to collections because Urgent Care will NOT admit they make an error - have tried to talk to office manager (Duke), and others - they will not return calls or fix the issue.  How many seniors have they done this to??????

Dr Baker has helped me get through some really rough times with my cervical and lumbar spine issues.  Can't thank him enough.  His team is courteous and efficient and they always get me in quickly and provide the best patient care I've experienced.  The BEST pain care management doctor in the Valley, bar none.  HIGHLY, recommend Dr Baker!

The first time I came with my mom "zaharra" I believe that's her name did my moms pedicure and I had to ask to have her re paint them because they looks so terrible! My first experience was good. Now my second time was no such a great experience. "Zaharra" did my gel manicure and my pedicure. I wouldn't even call it a manicure as she completely rushed it and didn't do anything other than stick my hands in water and then put the gel coloring on . She had a client waiting so she completely rushed . When she painted the gel on my toes she painted the cuticles so it looks bad. I told one of the ladies in the front and she tried to make it "look better" but  it's just a really bad job! She told me I could come back another day to get it fixed ummm no you should've taken it off and fixed it when I was there. I was excited when I found this place because of all the good reviews but just like every nail shop in Arizona they don't seem to do good past the first time.

These guys sold me a dishwasher that would not drain properly.
My house smelled like a sewer. They said I needed to run an extra rinse and that would fix the problem. 
Finally I called another store. That solved the problem and I found out that Denny's had sold me a used machine
THEY ARE CROOKS!!!

I decided to try this restaurant out with my father in law and 2 kids. Upon entering, I was less than pleased by the decor. It just looked outdated. For the price they charge for the food, you would think some of that could be put into making the place look appealing.
I ordered the house special chicken combination plate. The way they serve the main dish in a little fried shell of sorts was interesting at first... However, after I realized that the only crispy chicken (which is how this was described to me when I was asking about the dish) was right on top.. The rest of it was drowning in the sauce at the bottom of the shell and completely soggy.
My daughter ordered the pork chow mein.. The carrots were brown and old looking, the water chestnuts were so rancid I had to spit it out.. (when I removed all of the water chestnuts from the dish and placed them to the side, I explained to the waitress that they had definitely gone bad, her response was, "I will let the cooks know")... Not even bothering to replace my daughters food. The pork was bland and in little fatty strips.
The chicken wings that they give you with the meal were probably decent, as they looked good, but after the water chestnut incident, I didn't want to chance eating anything else. 
My father in law got the sweet and sour pork... He didn't really tell me whether he liked it or not, but only ate a few bites.
My other daughter is 2, so she got some noodles and rice from my plate.
The booth was very small and narrow... Extremely uncomfortable to eat with the table top pressing into my chest.
The only thing I really enjoyed was that the diet coke was amazing. They must have just cleaned the dispenser or something. 
Bill total was $43. Not even a discount for ruining my appetite with rotten food. 
The waitress was nice, she still got a 20% tip... But I will not return.

We do all our banking with desert schools and have been very pleased. On July 25 we switched our auto loans there so we can have everything with them. Eddie who does auto loans was Fantastic, He got my loan to what I was paying with other credit union from when I bought the car.  He kept following up with me everyday to make sure all was right and ready. Well my wife had bought a brand new car in January also and hers was also financed through another credit union. I asked him what he could do on that one and again he worked hard and diligently to actually get her a better rate and terms. So now we don't have to mail her payment anymore and can do everything on line with desert schools. Eddie was very persistent in getting us a better rate and with his detail and follow up on all the paperwork. He has a great personality and a joy to work with. We have been with desert schools since we've moved here and been very happy with the service of this branch.

So o posted in 2014 about Do My Nails. Not only am i still going to Joan and Anna, now my in-laws go all well. I always get the best complements on my nails. Make sure you call for an appointment, those ladies are in high demand!

This is a great salon.  The staff - all family members - are friendly and so helpful.  They are meticulous at their job - my nails have never looked so good.  The pedicure is heavenly.  And the prices absolutely cannot be beat.  I was delighted to find this salon and am so happy to pass the word along.  Try them out!  You won't be disappointed.

WARNING!  Without elaborating on the problems encountered I would like to attempt to balance the previous writer who has a strange 5 star bias considering our experiences.
After our problem developed I researched Estate Resale on the Phoenix BBB and found they are rated F on an A+ to F scale.  Too late for us and I didn't file a report but I suggest you do your research before buying anything from them.

http://www.bbb.org/central-northern-western-arizona/business-reviews/liquidators/estate-resale-consignment-in-sun-city-az-23001571#reasonrating
The best part of the food is the toast. EVERYTHING was soaked in oil. I would not come back The waitress was as sweet as pie. She was the best part of meal

My husband and I are snowbirds and we are here for the winter.  My husband fell off the ladder and I brought him to this urgent care because my neighbor had great experiences from them.  The doctor and staff were extremely caring. They got us in right away and got xray of his hips. We were in and out in less than an hour.  Thank God my husband did not have a hip fracture. It was just a "contusion."  He was given pain medication. ( I have given the ladder away to a friend ).   Great place! We have no doctor here in AZ and we will use this place for our medical needs.

Hi there...
My name is Sam, I live in Dallas/Texas visiting my parents in Surprise Arizona.
My Dad picked up some cold due to the weather, took him to Express Urgent on November 12, 2018 Care at 16578 W. Greenway Road, ste. 202 Surprise, Arizona 85388, after diagnosing him by a doctor, we were told to take to another Express Urgent Care for x-ray since they can't do it at their office since the x-ray technician is not in for this day.
We arrive at the other Express Urgent Care @ 13755 N. Litchfield Road ste. 105 Surprise, Arizona 85379 around 3pm on same day.
We drop the x-ray sheet we received from the first office at the front desk and we were asked to wait for my Dad's turn to get the x-ray done for him.
My Dad and I were setting in the lobby plus 2 other patients, male and a female, they looked Hispanic.
My father stands up and starts walking around in the lobby, a minute later he tells me that he needs to step out of the clinic, due to the cold he was having phlegm and stepped out to spit it out, seconds after my Dad goes out, the x-ray technician who was a male, comes out of the clinic gets into the lobby and he is calling the name Jorge pronouncing it as Horhay, that did not get my attention thinking he is calling the Hispanic guy, we nobody answers, he steps out of the lobby going outside looking at my Dad and calling him Horhay, he gets my attention at this point, my father hears him and starts walking back to the clinic, when he is few feet away from the tech. the tech goes loudly: let us see if you are pregnant or not.
What this x-ray tech. have done is very rude act, I am 100% sure that he thought my Dad is Hispanic, does not speak English, and he is alone.
First of all, my Dad is not Hispanic.
Second of all, his official first name is Gorges and not Jorge.
Surprise, Arizona is a city where a lot of seniors live and retire, a lot of medical services exist in this city due to the business that come from these seniors, Express Urgent Care and their employees should appreciate this opportunity because their salaries come from these seniors, my Dad is one of them.
Myself, I was thinking such people like this x-ray tech. are extinct since the dinosaur's time, I was mistaken
Express Urgent Care has to take some action against this tech. and I need to see this action in writing.
Expert craftsmanship and great service. Owner made adjustments to the  straps of my new sandals while I waited. I highly recommend this shop for all shoe and handbag repairs and adjustments.

Charged a .39 cent fee to use my credit/debit card. The sign in the window said debit cards are charged. However I handed them my Visa debit/credit card and they used it as a debit instead credit. I did not give them a PIN number. It should have been impossible for them to use my card as a debit without the pin, so how did they do that? I think someone should investigate.

While the service was okay, the food left much to be desired. Carl ordered the fish fry with three sides, slaw, cottage cheese and green beans. He said the fish, slaw and cottage cheese were okay, but the green beans were tough and woody. I ordered the Greek salad. They were out of Greek dressing so I chose Italian which had a sweet flavor, not compatible with the salad. When the salad was served, I went right for one of the kalamata olives which I dearly love. To my surprise, it tasted like it has been soaked in kerosene or some sort of chemical. The waitress asked how the food was and I told her about the olives. When I told her of the awful taste, she said that kalamata olives have a different taste. I told her I knew that because I eat them several times a week. She said she would bring me some regular olives and brought a dish of sliced black olives which I ate on the salad---just not the same. The ambience is quite shabby. I had anticipated a nice dinner since several friends told me how good the was as well as being very affordable. I do not plan on returning.
This is a very cute boutique. Each of the staff members is very nice. And, we found a few great deals.

Best Italian place in the Valley! My boyfriend and I go to Little Bite of Italy quite a bit. It is our favorite restaurant! Charming, down home kind of a place!  My boyfriend is half Italian and has been to a lot of Italian restaurants. The sauce is amazing!  My boyfriend gets the veal parmesan and I get the chicken parmesan. He loves how they pound the veal! They even have entertainment on Saturday nights.  Check out their website for details. Great owners, great service and excellent food!  We love Little Bite of Italy! It is also casual so relax!

Take the time to read the other one star reviews! STAY AWAY FROM THIS OFFICE!!!!! The most unprofessional medical office I have ever dealt with! Too bad they couldn't get zero stars, because one star is being way to generous!

Tonight, while driving home, I experienced a hankering for Chinese food. I knew of a couple of spots, but they were out of my way. I decided to grab some takeout from this buffet on Grand that I knew of when I drove past this place. I saw a sign out of the corner of my eye, thought it had a Chinese sounding name, so I flipped around and decided to give it a try.

Upon entering the restaurant, I noticed it was very quiet for a Friday night. I thought it might be in the process of closing, but they weren't. After perusing the menu, I ordered the lemon chicken, same as Taric. After placing my order to go, I chatted up the owner about how long the restaurant had been there, how business was, etc. She was incredibly warm and friendly, and after hearing about how the economy had recently took a toll on their profits, I suggested that if the food was to my liking, I would stop in for return business.

In short, I'm grateful that I didn't read Taric's review beforehand, otherwise I may have been disinclined to visit. The lemon chicken that I had was fantastic. It wasn't at all overcooked, had a great flavor, and was served on a bed of delicious fried rice. Since my order was takeout, the lemon sauce was on the side. Expecting it to be super sweet and syrupy (as Taric suggested it was), I poured just a light drizzle on my chicken, and I found it to be just the right flavor, so I added more.

As for the accoutrements, not only did my meal come with a wonton and a hefty eggroll, it also came with a fried shrimp. The combination meal that I ordered was considered the smaller portion, and it was filling. My out the door total was less than nine bucks, so I have no idea how anyone could call this food overpriced.

All in all, I had an excellent meal (that totally hit the spot after 90 minutes of hot yoga) for a reasonable price at a local business that I will be more than happy to continue to give my business to. This is officially my spot close to home.
Last minute call handled with humor and great service!  They put a beautiful arrangement together for me!  I have used them for years for that very reason!

The doctor (Kowalski) is condescending and untruthful. I asked if the doctor could furnish me with a letter (that I was fully prepared to pay a document fee for) to assist my disability case. The letter only needed to state that Dr. Kowalski was my neurologist and was providing me care. The doctor advised me he would be happy to provide that but I would have to see his receptionist. The receptionist told me that the woman who provides that is out of the office. After almost 2 weeks of contacting them numerous times, as well as my attorney following up with them, they advised this is not something they provide. If the doctor is treating me, why won't he say it? If he refuses to admit he's seeing me, why is he seeing me? Why wouldn't he tell me that he doesn't do this from the start? I'm very upset with this office for this among other issues I've had with them. It's a lot of run-around nonsense.
My parents live in Sun City and love this place, they have generous portions and are well balanced for seniors, the breakfasts are good and they offer crepes.  Very much a diner.

they make you wait on hold for 20-30 minutes 
they make you wait for your test results and give them to you when they see fit  they dont care that you stress out waiting for those results and you call in for the results because the results are in and come to find out the office closed early because it's Memorial Weekend glad you get to enjoy your all's weekend while I stress my weekend away while they laugh and have jolly good freaking time yeah 
I have had 2 E.E.G's done from this same Dr and I called earlier in the day and was told I would get a call back from the M.A

i have been to some crappy doctors before but this office takes the award for worst office lack of care for patients PERIOD , ya would think they would change after people bitch and complain but guess not they will never ever see me again they will get the money I owe them and then Im finished I would rather die of a brain disease then deal with this office again and the Ma for the Dr I will give them a star even though they for sure dont deserve one

we have been going there 4 years-it has really gone down hill bad
the woman behind the counter are NOT friendly
the portions have shrunk in size

Great doctor but horrible rude front desk staff. They were the most rude, sarcastic and immature excuse for front desk staff. 

The two gals were terrible to me, my husband and three other people that came in the lobby. 
They need to be replaced.

Came here on a quick search. There was no  line and they were quick and friendly.  They even have onsite X-ray and radiologist which was able to give fast diagnosis. Excellent faculty and facility. Even though office is showing a little wear, don't use that a reason not to come for fast efficient medical service. Thumbs up.

These people are by far the lowest class personnel I have ever delt with in my life.

Locksmith came out super quick. Gave us a heads up he was on his way. Over all he had a great attitude, great customer service. He got the job done great.

I took my 5 year old son to the urgent care because he coughed for over a week.  The doctor at the urgent care ordered an XRay to make sure no water in his lungs and a prescription...  There was one person ahead of us so there was no long waiting.   I now have peace of mind that my baby is okay and that his cough is just due to the reflex.  I will definitely come back and use the services here at the Express Urgent Care.

Seabreezepeficure shall be taken an hour but not only 1/2 hour ... Not enuff message, others
My feet have some crack
I am disappointed

I called many other alleged central vacuum service stores.  They would not bother coming to our house.  Monty came on first request without any excuses.  Monty found the leak in the attic in 10 minutes.  That was an attic that had to 120 degrees.

It was great to have our central vacuum repaired after two years of calling other services that rude at times as I begged them to come to our house.  I was prepared for a $1,000 cost to replace the 20 year old unit.  Instead, Monty repaired for $70.

Thanks Monty!

Breakfast is pretty good, and highly affordable.  It's the war going on between the waitresses that really gets you.  They won't help each other, not one bit.  The one with the coffee pot will walk right past those who aren't in her "station."  Avoiding eye contact in amazing fashion so you can't even flag 'em down.  It's clear the "blonde bomber" and the "chubby hispanic" originally met at Panmunjom.  A refill on water?  Fuggedaboutit!   They won't tell the other when a new customer sits in the other's station.  It's all out war.  Time to fire them all and start over IMHO.  I tried calling to talk to the owner, Tom about the battle going on out front.  From what I overheard I'm pretty sure the waitress just set the phone down and waited a while to tell me he wasn't there.

My first time at sun city florists and it won't be my last, I believe it was the owner she was so patient with me, I walked in not knowing what I wanted.. I just found out my neighbors husband passed and he was very young and not knowing her well I wasn't sure what she would like, I just wanted to put a smile on her face for a few minutes letting her know I was feeling her pain.. the flowers and teddy bear they put together were beautiful, she loved them thank you Sun City Florists

Can's understand all the negative remarks regarding "seniors".  Get real people, it's Sun City.  My son and I go there every Sunday for breakfast and we love not having kids running around, or babies crying while we are trying to have a conversation.  Plenty of good food and fair prices.  We try to always sit in Carla's section, who is our favorite waitress, but no matter where we sit we always get great service.  


Terri & Chris

Phoenix, AZ

Carol was a sweet waitress she was on top of all her tables. The food was good except the bacon was way to crispy for my liking. :) but I WOULD deffinatly come back!!!! I want to try a open faced sandwich.  Thanks Carol again for being GREAT!!! ;)

Best customer service I've had in quite awhile. I thought hospitality was a thing of the past. It was very nice to go to a local business and receive not only top notch service, but be treated fairly and with a great attitude. I will be returning for any service I need. The prices are great and everything is high quality! Thanks so much for making my business with you a pleasent experience. I highly recommend!

I have had many Reiki sessions with Jeanne. She is an awesome, loving woman and I always leave feeling so relaxed in touch spiritually. I have also taken quite a few classes and have enjoyed them all. Jeanne is definitely worth visiting!

Been at this restaurants numerous times to see Tom and Jerry perform. The food was very good but the wait once you are seated to order your drinks is not good. We had to ask several times for a a server. Also do not come back after food is served to check on your food or refill drinks   Servers need more training.

I pass this place everyday on my way home from work for a few years now & decided to try, since I'm on the hunt for some good Egg Drop Soup.
They complimented us with some hot tea for starts, we got our soup and it was amazing. Then we ordered Shrimp & Vegetables and Lemon Chicken dinners. All were so very good. We will be back.
P. S.
The presentation of the food was Beautiful!!
Staff great and friendly.  Great pizza and Italian dishes.  Freshest salad I've ever had.  Always a great time.

BEWARE OF $1100 URINE TEST IN OFFICE! This is a practice based solely on fraudulent lab billing. Office vist $134. Xray $62. Urine collected in their bathroom $1100 for which I was billed insurance allowable of $726. I dont do drugs. Did not ask for prescription medication, yet I left there with habit forming prescriptions to justify lab order.  If interested, checkout Bloomberg, CNN and others on this latest fraud trend in pain management, referred to as "liquid gold".The practice claims no responsibility for the women collecting urine in their bathroom as ordered by Novaspine MD. Criminal practice.
5 stars for real? Yes and here is why. The food is above average for a diner, the service is above average, place has been nicely remodeled and the prices are outstanding.

Absolutely horrible! Do NOT go here. Its a gamble. We saw grear reviews. I was sick and had strep throat. I went to the one on 91st and northern and they were great. Ran tests. Told me unfortunately i did have it (which i knew i did i had all the symptoms plus my daughter had it the week prior to me). So my husband stopped by this one on his way home. He also had the same exact symptoms as me. 

The doctor who saw him quickly decided he didn't need a strep test (he went to a different place where they did a strep test AND HE HAD IT!) so the doctor sent him home with nothing. Not only that, she had the courage to talk bad about the military.

We're both veterans and we do not take it lightly when people talk poorly about the military. Is it the best organization ever? No. Does it deserve some respect? Yes. Absolutely.

Seriously if I could give this place a -5 rating i would.

We had there desserts a couple of nights ago and we're intrigued enough to try them for dinner.  We arrived at 7:28 and they said the kitchen was closed.  The sign on the for said they were open till 8. The staff said the kitchen closed at 7:30...which it wasn't. I didn't see the owners around.  Felt like the staff was trying to leave early.  Disappointing.

In between 11 an 4  you can get a cheeseburger, fries, a drink and a sundae for 5 dollars. 2 people could easily split this meal. I personally have not had a problem with the service and the place is clean.

I love this place, it gives you good food for an amazingly low price. If you like a comfy mom and pop shop this is the one and I have never had bad service. 
The fries are so good the liver and onions are delicious the eggs and steaks are so good!! Salads great!! The veggie soup is so good!!
I will continue to come to this place, I am glad to have run into it so many years ago! 
Whenever I am in the vicinity I pop in.

This is a small restaurant, but it can be made bigger with the two extra side rooms. The place isn't fancy but very homey and filled with friendly servers. We really like Terry, she is quick, fun and attentive to your needs. The food is really home down cooking and they have the best crispy chicken salad I have ever had. Do yourself a favor and try this place out.

Want to tell you about the consignment shop that picked up my Dad's desk and legal size filing cabinet.  They charged 70.00 for the pick up and then called me to say they cannot sell the desk because it is outdated.  They sent it for donation.  That was a great desk and not damaged.  They said they could sell the filing cabinet for 70.00 so it all was a wash.  EXCEPT THEY TECHNICALLY "STOLE"  MY DESK!  They saw a picture of the desk before they agreed to pick it up.  We could have sold it on Craig's List but ran out of time since we were only in AZ for a week to clean out my deceased sister's house.  They took advantage of a desperate situation.

The male owner or manager of this joint is a total ass, very rude, and I have been here multiple times and he continues to be an asshole.

The food here is really good and the prices are great, the atmosphere is pleasant and the female owner or manager is very pleasant.

We decided to deviate from the norm last night and decided to check out little bite of italy.  It's tucked away in the back of a strip mall lacks curb appeal.  The interior was more reminiscient of a bowling alley with ugly carpeting and uncomfortable orange and yellow chairs.  Above the bar hangs an Air Cav unit emblem indicating the proprietor spent some time in Nam and it in no way embodies an italian restaurant hopefully the food is good.

We started with an order of toasted ravioli which was actually quite good, My meal included a salad and breadstick (singular).  The salad consisted of tomatoes, lettuce and onions.  Not being a fan of Tomatoes or Onions I reached for the parmesan and made the best of things.  

(NOTE: There are these things call croutons, they're crunchy and they're awesome!!!)

I was also served a single lonely breadstick in a basket, feeling guilty I shared the breadstick with my wife.  

For dinner I had ordered the linguine with clam sauce.  I ordered a half order but the portion size was still very big.  there was a lot of clam on the pasta, unfortunately the sauce was a bit of a let down and something was off about the taste.  My wife had ordered a stromboli but we couldn't help but think she was eating an oversized hot pocket.

The service was ok, our waiter was young and seemed absent minded and a couple of times we joked about dine and dashing because we were going to catch a movie after.

To be fair it was mothers day and the wait staff may have been off their game.  and the pizza looked good so at some point I'd like to come back and try the pizza.  the pizza will determine whether they gain or lose a star.

If you're in the neighborhood might be worth checking out, but not worth the drive if you're not.
Love Dr Fernandez! She takes time to listen and advises options. She has helped improve my overall health and I am grateful to her.

I always go to this location when I'm sick and my pcp is unavailable. I never have to wait long to be seen and the staff is always friendly.  I feel like the doctors and assistants really care about my well being and they get me on a medication that cures the infection fast.

I used to stop by here every month or two to see what's new and maybe pick up something for the house. NOT ANYMORE! The heavy set lady with red hair & a limp, is the owner...she is real piece of work! As a customer, she & her staff were always quiet and kind, in a sort a Sun City, to themselves, kinda way. As a person selling items with her, well let's just say, she doesn't have the time of day any longer. Since we had fairly good relations with this business over the last 8 or 10 years, we thought we would give the yard sale remnants a chance with them. I tried going in the store to get an update on the items we gave them. You'd thought we just asked them if they ever found out who there daddy was. "Well - you need to make an appointment to pick up your items" I told her we were just checking up on things, is all. "Well, I don't know...it would take me some time. Items could be at this store or at the other store, ya know!" August of 15 & we haven't heard a word out of them, whatsoever!!!
My quesadilla was completely black on both sides. I understand accidents happen, but why would someone wrap something like this and serve it?

I ordered take out as I was in a hurry... I expressed concern over gluten/flour in the sauce. The hostess taking the order was very helpful and  after confirmation with another employee ( who recommended the special I ordered, advising me not to eat the wonton and eggroll) I placed my order.  My order was the lunch menu special recommend $6.95  shrimp with lobster sauce, and fried rice. (Normally it comes with an eggroll and wonton, but  not being able to eat those I passed and they did not charge me the upgrade from steamed to fried rice) it totaled almost $14 bucks! Not thrilled with that total I questioned it and the change was made from the dinner to   the lunch menu special. The food was pretty bland,  but as a salt lover, I was NOT left lacking... there were no veggies to mention in the fried rice... I would have truly given 2 stars but boosted it since fhey were so helpful with the gluten free issue, I KNOW not to eat an eggroll, but they took the time and care to make sure! :-)
Friendly, fast, and amazing service. Great pricing and customer service... couldn't ask for a better experience. Would definitely recommend to others. Thanks Garren!
I was pleasantly surprised when I had a mani and hawaiian pedicure today! Vikki did an awesome job!! I will definitely be back!

I had the absolute worst experience here.  It wasn't the specific doctor (he was just fine and nice) and the location is beautiful .... but the medical assistant(s) for Dr. Syal either have no sense of patient need or have their heads up their asses.  I have several examples to show this but here's the back story.  I suffered a concussion and seeing a neurologist was one of the final steps because the intense headaches weren't going away.  I don't mean, pop an OTC medicine and I'm fine.  I needed prescription painkillers to even somewhat reduce the pain.  So here we go:

Example 1: I saw the doctor on a Wednesday afternoon.  He gave me two prescriptions - one migraine medicine and one narcotic painkiller if that first prescription did not work.  He asked his medical assistant to call it in for me so I gave her the pharmacy name and location.  Was it called in that day? No.  Was it called in first thing in the morning? No.  Was it called in after I called around 11 am the next day? Yes.  I had to call the doctor to REMIND HER to call in my pain medicine.  Thanks dear, the last 24 hours, I had no medicine and nothing to help my headaches better.

Example 2: The migraine medicine was rejected by my insurance because I had already had the maximum amount filled from an earlier primary care physician appt.  The pharmacist was so apologetic and told me she would call the doctor that morning (Thursday) to try to file an exception with my insurance company.  Did I hear back from the doctor that day? No.  Did I hear back from her within a couple of days? No.  Did she finally call me back after I called the following week to follow up on the exception? Yes. Then she had the audacity to tell me it would take another 72 hours before hearing back.  Well, if you had called the week before, it wouldn't have been another 72 hours.  Mind you, I'm still waiting and it's been about 3 weeks since this happened.

Example 3:  The doctor wanted me to have a brain MRI done so I was waiting to hear from the imaging center to schedule an appointment.  When I didn't hear back for a few days, I finally called the neurologist.  The MRI authorization was never released.  Are you kidding me? They released it after I called and got a call from the imaging center the same day.  

Example 4:  I finally got the brain MRI completed so I called the neurologist for the results.  They told me they would only call if something was wrong.  Okay, we may have different opinions here but I am the type if a test is done, I want to know the results, whether they're good or bad.  Don't make me sit on my thumbs for a week and just have to assume it's okay.  God forbid my results fell through the cracks and there was actually something wrong and I'm just assuming everything is fine.  It's a brain MRI.  I'd like to know 100% that nothing is wrong but apparently their time is more valuable than their patients' peace of mind.

Example 5: Since I didn't hear back about the MRI on Tuesday (it is Thursday) like I was supposed to, I called around 9:30-10:00 am and was told the medical assistant was away from her desk.  It is 4:30 pm and she never called back, although she had enough time to....

Example 6: Deny a prescription refill for me.  Go back to Example 2 regarding the fact I was supposed to have that first prescription filled and never got it.  Now, they're denying a refill of the only prescription they gave me.

I'm not really sure I need any more examples.  This is a doctors office.  This isn't a restaurant with a bad server or the food wasn't great.  A doctors office should NOT have this many complaints.  Plus, this is a specialist office.  It's for patients that a primary care physician cannot help them with their neurological issue.  Shouldn't they be a little more concerned for their patients' well-being?  To add fuel to the fire, examples 5 & 6 occurred on the Thursday before New Years and they were closed Friday- Monday.  It would have been nice if they had the decency to return their calls before their four-day weekend.  I finally called my health provider after examples 5 & 6 to have me referred to another neurologist because I can't take medical assistants having their heads up their asses and being completely incompetent

The Royal Cafe has the best chrispy chicken salad around town. The restaurant is a little on the older side as far as looks, because it had been around for a while. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner all times of the day. The desserts are homemade looking and some might be. 
We go there for R.R. meetings, and they have two big rooms to hold meetings in besides the restaurant. The rooms are very quiet and no noise comes in from the outside. We have a favorite waitress named Teri but there are plenty of other good ones there too.

Giving 3 stars to match the current rating, let me know if this is not allowed because I ended up not eating here.
My friend lives nearby and we were trying to find a breakfast spot in the area. We stopped here, I am not sure if it was a holiday or if they had some sort of special, but the place was packed. There was a long line and the layout it is not well setup for this type of situation. But, on top of that, the crowd in line was not very friendly, I would say they were borderline aggressive. They were rude if you asked if there were in line, but also they would not move so one could walk to the end of the line. We fought our way there, then looked around and at the same time decided it was a good idea to leave.
Bottom line, what I am trying to say is that apparently they have decent food and very good prices, but if you are very sensitive to good manners you may be better going somewhere else. Let me know your thoughts.
The best and most reasonably priced around..and I love that they rarely take walkins...they remember every customers name which is amazing!

My experience was HORRIBLE. I almost regret even purchasing a table. I went in with my WELL BEHAVED toddler. A woman bombards him and LECTURES him about how he has to look with his eyes and not touch (I understand that but as an adult she could have spoken to me) Instead she made my son cry. After that I was about to leave but I spotted a table at an ok price. I had to HUNT this lady down to even ask about buying it. She kept blowing me off! FINALLY I asked the woman if there was someone else around to help me with a purchase. That's what finally got her attention. I followed her to the front to pay and asked if they could hold the table till the next day so I could bring my husbands truck instead of paying a ridiculous delivery fee. She replied in the SNARKIEST tone, "Well you have to pay for it in full we don't do any holds." Thank you Mrs Obvious. The next day, I had my father come along to help me load the purchased table up, two other women with the same condescending attitude where talking about me IN FRONT OF ME! "Well no one even called to say that they were going to be picking it up.""Why wouldn't they call?""That's so rude." HELLO! IS IT AN ISSUE I WANT TO PICK UP WHAT IVE ALREADY PURCHASED? NEVER AGAIN!!!

The good news is - both the RN & PA were good at their respective jobs. The bad news? They both have terrible bedside manners.
The RN checked my husband's vitals, etc and then asked about his symptoms. I started to answer, and she cut me off. Only talked with my husband (which I understand intellectually, but she was so rude). My husband does not like doctors, fibs about his illness(es), and his medical history. I wish she would have done the courtesy of listening to me AND my husband. 
The PA was thorough in his exam and questions. His bedside manner was dry and humorless. People come to Urgent Care with anxiety and a little compassion goes a long way. Thankfully he listened to me AND my husband. We got a diagnosis, some prescriptions, and were on our way in a half hour.
I did use the online booking. It saved us a wait and I appreciated that.
God forbid we ever have to go back (bc of illness or emergency) but if we do, I'll know what to expect.

We have been coming to this adorable Chinese restaurant for years and we have never been disappointed. We have tried almost everything on the menu and have even had special chef creations and everything has been absolutely delicious. It is adorable inside and the service is always Awesome!  We have young children and they beg to come with us because they love it too. We will be back again soon!

I've been to this restaurant about 6-7 times since 2013 when my parents retired here and I come out to visit. I've always had an exceptional meal - my secret - order the thin crust pizza. I have not tried the veal, calamari, etc. Their thin crust pizza is really really good. Try their large with sausage, mushroom, and fresh crushed garlic. I like chicago cut personally. Outstanding. If you want more zagat rated fare, there are many places to visit 30 minutes away, but if you want great tasting comfort food right in the heart of Sun City, try this place out. Oh yeah - full bar, sidewalk seating if you want, and quirky live music on the patio from time to time. This is Sun City - it beats the heck out of the buffets your parents may want to take you to - tell them, take me to that little italy place with the sidewalk seating. The servers know us and have been efficient every time I've gone from 12:00 noon to 3:00 in the afternoon to 7:00 pm at night. I've had pizza deep dish in Chicago on Wabash Ave and thin crust in New York Times Square and authentic in Vienna, Austria and this place makes good thin crust pizza. Try it. I go at least once each time I visit the parents, and this is my first yelp review - I've really enjoyed eating here.

We are new to the area, coming from Ohio to Arizona. We had sold most of our furniture on the move. We were out driving around and noticed the Resale Estate Store. We stopped in and looked around and found the Resale Store to be clean, very nice and the items in the store to be very good. I found several furniture pieces for our new home, that were very nice and priced fair. The owner and her staff were very nice and helpful to us, as we shopped. We will be back time and time again. I have a new house to fill ! thanks again, ladies for all your help. We also stopped over to another Estate Resale Store on (Cotton?) in surprise with our son. The people
working there were just as nice and helpful. Happy Happy wife, here ! Jim and Deb R. ( I also loved the fact, that per the owner, all furniture comes from ( Non-smoking homes). I don't know how she's does that but I am glad she does!

So yesterday, a little after 3 pm, after working 3 night shifts in a row, I awoke in a panic realizing that I had completely forgotten my mother's birthday.  I live near L.A., she lives in Surprise.  I searched flower shops in her area, called 3, they were either closed already or unable to help. I called Sun City Florists and a lovely woman named Janice answered.  I explained my dilemma and asked if there was anyway I could get a delivery that afternoon. After speaking for a moment with the other pert at the store, she came back and said if I chose something already put together, they could do it. She described several of the bouquets available, I chose one, added a balloon and a note and paid.  Less than 2 hours later, my mother received a beautiful bouquet, that she has called me twice to thank me for. She said the delivery man was lovely and even carried then inside for her as the bouquet was large and he noticed her wrist was in a splint.  
Now I can't guarantee that they would always be able to do this, but I know who I will be calling next time I want to send flowers to my mom. 
Thanks again Janice for making me look like the thoughtful daughter!!!

Wasn't really quite what I expected. I go out dining with friends on the weekend. And We went here Friday night. First off the service was Sloooowww! Then after we get our drinks, they bring salad and "Breadsticks" Guess what you and your fellow diners only get ONE Friggin breadstick. No body asks if you would like more.
The food was ok, I liked my meal, But my friends didn't care much for there's. Im quite easy to please. The Seats on the patio were a bit uncomfortable for my old butt. The prices seemed slightly high for what you were getting. In all honesty, I would have been happier with "Olive Garden" my friends agreed with me on that. 
Hope you all have a better experience.

This place is horrible!!! I went there with my bridal party tonight and the mail lady didn't listen to what we wanted they didn't have anything and my nails along with my bridal party's nails turned out bad mine are sharp there was glue left everywhere on all our nails. I'm sooo mad because this is for my wedding so I'm really disappointed!!! I have to go home and fix our nails  then on top of it they charged us for extra crap that they shouldn't have charged and made an excuse that is what for something else! Bullshit!!!  If I could give 0 stars I would!! Rip off!!
Nothing near authentic Chinese food. Wife had Chicken Egg Foo Yan, very little chicken, egg foo Yan was pre-made pattie. Don't waste your time or money.

The old bats that run this place must have left their broomsticks at home or something. My wife took items there for them to sell, waited 3 months and did a follow up call just to have the old bat say "she needed an attitutde to deal with my wife.". If this is how they treat their suppliers cause its a consignment shop word spreads fast. DO NOT DO BUSINESS with this place. You can not get any answers, they act like thier shop is loaded with customers....half of your customer base is older then 60.  Cant go lower then 1 star

I went in for a pedicure and they did an excellent job. The chair had a nice massager and the water was nice an warm. Everyone was very friendly and engaged in conversation. I would definitely go back.

I had dinner from Chang Lee last night and one of the items I ordered was Sweet and Sour Pork. I was very good with a thick, fruity sauce. Very good sauce!
I am now giving 4 Stars but still wish the Sweet and Sour dipping sauce for the egg rolls(good egg rolls) was perfected. I also had the fried won tons and they are normally a throw away but these had flavor a an excellent fry.

Always have a great time 
Excellent quality and service 
Been going here for 10 years and always enjoy it
Yes it is an older crowd place in Sun City,but you need to understand it for what it is and have a great time 
Staff has changed a few times,but that is normal for most places
So relax and enjoy
Sun city high prices. No public restroom. Nothing special about the place. Staff is friendly but nothing more than any other business. Just your average sun city used furniture.

11/11/13. I showed up to Be Nails for my eleven o'clock appt I had made the month before with the girl who had done my nails and the one who has done my feet.  When  I got there they showed my appt and told me to have a seat.  In a few minutes a man comes to get me and started taking back to his station.  Three different times I asked why he was taking me and where was the girl I had an appt with.  He completed ignored me!!! I then looked at him and said I am now asking for the fourth time why are you taking me and where is the girl I made the appt with.  Again no answer and instead I'm taken over to have my feet done.  So this girl comes over to do my feet and again I asked the same question of her.  Again I was ignored.  She proceeds to throw the blue crystals in the water and they splash up on my pink pants and now I have blue on them.  She says nothing. Then she turns on the jet and it comes off and I'm sprayed all over with water.  She tries it again and it happens again.  By now there is this lady standing next to me, who I realized later was the owner, trying to tell me my appt was at 11:30 and I was a picky customer.  Again I asked where were the ones who had a made an appt with and she stands there yelling at me telling me I'm a picky customer.  I stated what had happened with the crystals and the jets and politely suggested that they might not want to use that spa.  She then proceeded d to go off even more on me.  I told the girl to dry my feet that I was leaving.. The owner is yelling at the top of her lungs at me to get out right this minutes you are a horrible customer and picky and don't ever come back in front of the other customer.  I am 66 years old and never been kicked out of anywhere but with a owner like this this business will go under.  I HAVE NEVER BEEN TREATED SO RUDELY IN MY LIFE.  She blamed me for everthing and I'm the one standing there wet and blue spots on my pants.  DONOT GO There.  I have since from out she treats her employees the same way. My heart goes out to them

I needed locks fast and that is what I got! The locksmith was friendly and very accommodating. They provided alternatives that were just as effective but saved me money! Prices were very reasonable and I would definitely recommend that you use their services when needed. Thank you!!!!

I have driven by this place countless times and yesterday I decided to make an appointment because I don't really like any other salons around here. I am so glad I did! I finally found a place where I don't feel like a burden for getting my nails done. Everyone was very welcoming and all customers were greeted by name! I am looking forward to going back!
I dropped my shoes off for heel repair and picked them up 2 days later, completely fixed and good as new.  Reasonable prices, friendly and efficient staff.  I'll definitely be back!

I agree with 5 stars! This is an American, comfort food, breakfast, lunch, and dinner senior cafe par excellence  and here's why. 

Food is very good. We ate dinner there. They make their soups there fresh and from scratch. I had the vegetable soup and it was excellent. Full of fresh veggies perfectly cooked and the broth was rich and flavorful and perfectly spiced with a very low salt profile. My wife had the meat loaf with fresh veggies, and I had the spaghetti with meat sauce and freshly sauteed mushrooms, onions, and green peppers topped,  both freshly made with scratch made sauces. For desert we had the freshly made Pineapple Upside Down Cake, with fresh pineapple. Great prices too. Both complete dinners were $8.99. Service was prompt and friendly. Dining room and restrooms were clean and in good maintenence. 

Maybe if you were expecting a fancy, white table cloth place you were dsappointed? But that would have been your fault...

Dear reviewers,
This place is amazing it's a hidden gem. Very tuck away in a quiet plaza that has a tattoo shop and a little beer stop next to it. The outside might scare you if you think it should be a sunshine place. But inside it's so cute and little just for whatever services you need. Nothing over the top or fancy they don't need that since all the services they do always come out way way way beautiful. I been here twice so far, and I plan to come back for more and this is coming from a person who is scared to go to salons. I only had my nails done now 4 times in my life and one of the times was at Lish nail salon and let me tell you they do way above and beyond what Lish can do. The main person I see here goes by the name "G" he is very cool and knows how to get nails done to just what you like. Seems like I found a nice spot for nails.
Nice place for breakfast. Friendly staff, prompt service. Good prices.  Coffee snobs beware:  Coffee weak!

Taco Bell goes VEGAN! FAKE NEWS
Beef chalupa? Or just lettuce?? 
I don't really care  about this but I thought it was funny. This place has bad reviews and now I know why. If you don't care about what you pay for, go to this place for sure. 1/10. Side note. The male who took my order sounded like a robot.

Yes it dated, and the price might seem like a deal. However my choice of the country breakfast #10 on the menu was a mistake. Biscuits are hard and seem old, gravy had no flavor and my over easy eggs were closer to raw. The bacon was precooked and did not even get heated up in a microwave. Might be $6.99 but not a value.

Well, this will be the 7th review, and the 7th single star review...just read the others cause they are right. So sad, I had such hope. I thought we were so lucky that they could squeeze us in, and only saw two reviews. As I look today, there are 4 more (not reccommended) reviews, who knew.

Last year I brought in some of my dad's items to Resale Antiques & Home Furnishings at Bell and Cotton Lane in Surprise, AZ.  One item, a knick knack shelf sold right away. Another item was a peach color Victorian Lamp. Occasionally, I would go in to check on the items I left there.  Today, I went in to see if dad's Victorian lamp had sold. First we couldn't find the lamp then...there it was... 
The glass shade was missing on the lamp and the circle light bulb was uneven and appeared broken. I was stunned. I asked what had happened to it and the gal said she would find out but then went on to help another unhappy customer checking on her items. I went back to the counter and asked again and the same girl said she would find out. She went into the back room then came out and started helping another customer. I handed her a piece of paper with my name and number and asked her to find out about the lamp and to call me. I think it would have been nice for the owner to call and tell me what happened to the lamp!

Big sale this week.All sort of little gadets that you really don't need but you want them anyways. Prices are really cheap and new stuff brought out all day long. Items for your yard, all kinds of tools  and hardware, holiday decorations and polo shirts and t- shirts. Lots of fun hunting thru boxes and time really fly's fast.

Nice staff, super friendly!  A+!  The bad....appointment at 10:00, it 10:56 and we're still waiting.  We arrived at 9:30 to ensure all paperwork was completed.  Please stop overbooking your patient load.

This has to be one of the greatest Hot Dog joint I have ever been too.  The customer service is excellent and the customization of the dogs are endless.  Excellent choice of the potato buns instead of the soggy poppy seed buns.  This place is so damn good, I eat here at least 2-3 times a week while I am at work.  A must try

This is absolutely the best nail/pedicure salon in the north west Phoenix area. Everyone here is very skilled and so caring towards every client.  And the prices are so reasonable. It is such a treat to be pampered and spoiled while I am there.

We have been eating at Chang Lee since the 80s. The food is good, decor is amusing, a little dated, but not offensive. I appreciate the independently owned restaurant these days, where everything is not cookie cutter the same as another. It is a quality place to go.

Terrible customer service, my wife and I went into the store had 4 or 5 things we were thinking about buying.  We asked to plug a piece in to see if it worked, found a note on it that says as is, will light up but won't rotate.  After a minute of looking the woman asked do,you want it to not, I think that was rude but, I said yes for 25 bucks I'll take it and see if I can fix it.  She tells me it is 100 dollars. I point to a price tag on the item that says $25.00 as is , she pulls the tag off and repeats its 100 dollars.  I guess their prices vary depending on what they think you should pay... we left all the items and tell everyone not to go their now, hopefully it will close and a reputable business will open

New management but same poor training and employee attitude.  Cold food and when asked the employee if the wrap was supposed to be cold.  She said it wasn't because she made it herself in the microwave.  I said you better check the microwave and she gave me more attitude.  Don't expect much here!!!!

This humble-in-decor restaurant is one of our favorites for reliably good food, friendly staff, and an inexpensive outing.  It's family-owned, and pride-of-ownership comes through... especially in the home-made desserts they showcase near the front door.  Their soups are also home-made, and Sunday's Chicken Rice soup is so good we've frequently taken home extra containers for the next day and to freeze for when we desperately need a momma-love-comfort-food fix.

Their menu is full of familiar standards, but their daily dinner specials show a talent for individuality and a flair for adventure.  I love their Chicken Mensajero (broiled chicken breast with freshly steamed onions, mushrooms, and green peppers)... the cooks in the kitchen understand flavors and how to bring out the best in food combining.

Having worked as a waitress, I was also impressed by an overheard conversation as I passed by one of the dining booths.  One of the owners (the wife of the family), and the primary baker (the mother-in-law), and one of the waitresses were in discussion.  The owner asked the waitress, "So how do you think it would work better for the wait staff...?"  No wonder all the employees like working here - they're treated like people, and not machines!  And their happiness rolls downhill into treating customers as welcome members to the table.

Do not shop here unless you want to be treated like dirt by 80 year old people!!!!

The old ladies are witches!!!!!!! 

They literally made me CRY not once but TWICE ON TWO DIFFERENT TRIPS!!! 

I will never go here again!! It's such a shame since they have really awesome things to buy but I can't cry every time I want to spend my money because the people there scream at you, won't help you, tell you to leave because theyre closing in two hours.... they tell you they have to stand there with you to look at the merchandise and it's your fault they can't go do something else because they have to help you. They screamed at me when I asked the price of something and i asked why it was out when there was no price and they walked me back and made me put the item down and told me to literally not touch anything......... I don't hate people but I hate them

Worst experience ever. We sat down and they took our order. 35 mins late we were still waiting for our food. They told us they were backed up but did not offer us anything. After 50 min we got our food to go. Couldn't talk to a manager or anything. Don't go here if you appreciate great customer service. I felt bad for the waitress as it was out of her hands. Will not be returning and will be letting everyone in sun city know!

The entrance gave you a warm welcome. The staff were pleasant and made me feel comfortable.  I had choices between massages. The masseuse was professionally and she knew her trade. She attended every ach and stiffness. Will come back.

My Mom and I LOVE this place. Not fancy and rather dated decor but who cares when the servers treat you like family and know your orders and special likes. The food, especially breakfast is GREAT! Love the Chorizo and eggs, biscuits and gravy and well, everything. Sofie is our favorite server but everyone is sweet and very attentive. GREAT PRICES, service and food will keep you coming back.

I have shopped here since it opened. I love this place & can always find something I value or remember --- things my Parents & Grandparents treasured while I was growing up.  It always brings a smile to my face to walk thru the doors & see everything. The Ladies there are friendly & helpful. I can spend hours just going from room to room to see everything & take home my treasures. Thank You ! You're an awesome place.

Dr. Fernandez is a very compassionate physician. My father is a patient of hers that is being treated for prostrate cancer. Her treatment plan is improving his overall health and PSA levels are dropping! She truly is committed to healing your body. She educates her patients so that they understand how our illness possibly came about. She utilizes the latest in scientific studies and treatments to help restore your health. She understands that true healing is also a combination of spiritual and emotional healing by encouraging peace and relaxation in our lives. She has also been very accommodating with my father's appointments. I highly recommend Dr. Fernandez if you are seeking to restore your health! We are blessed to have met her!

My insurance agent referred me to Hertz because they offered a very good rate while my car was at the body shop for a two week repair. Raymond picked me up at the repair shop and drove me to the office to arrange a rental. Two other employees were busy chatting and initially ignored me upon entering. That was not what I would have expected in a service oriented business. Eventually I completed the rental transaction. I did not read any of the reviews here until it was time to return the vehicle and that gave me some thought for concern. I can understand why some felt employees were not very professional however Raymond was definitely the exception and on returning the vehicle to the location he completed the check-in and arranged for a ride back to the repair shop.  His customer service skills were excellent and I was happy to have him as the person I mostly interacted with so that is why I gave them four stars.

I was sent to this location by the location on 59th and union hills because the location did not have a ex-Ray tech on sight I had the lady make me an appointment I been here since 8:55 and my appointment was set for 10 it is now 10:29 and they have taken back 3 people that came in after we did and the stupid app of there's has text me 3 time first telling me you will be seen by 9:45 then it was a reminder that's are appointment was at 10:00 and then to tell us we where next and then they came and said she going to do your ex-ray but we are going to take the two lady's before is mind you I have my 14 year old that still has not been seen will never come back to this location some BS going on here

First of all, Paradise RV Resort is not a RV resort; it is a mobile home development. Of the roughly 950 spaces, only about 150 are for transient RVs. I suspect these will disappear as they are sold to permanent residents.

The remaining 800 spaces are occupied by permanent single-wide mobile homes.

What does this mean?

- Very dense living

- No green space in the RV spaces

- No picnic table on the site

- Only a single central building with showers and toilets and few of them

- No cable TV for RVs

- WiFi is very spotty. I think I am now using a permanent resident's unsecured WiFi connection. Thanks.

Otherwise

- The staff is helpful and friendly

- There is a large pool, several excellent tennis courts, saunas, a computer room, library and many other amenities.

- Over the air television is excellent

- There are many scheduled events

- Age 55 and over; no children

Just know you won't be among fellow RVers.

Amazing job, quick response/execution and affordable! They just left my house and I had to leave a review. Called them on a Wednesday afternoon, we're here at 730 on Thursday and removed over 3 tons of junk from my home, and on top of moving it, they sort the donate-ables and donate them to a good cause. Customer service was amazing, prompt, and dealt right with the owner.

On top of it all, Kevin was friendly, happy to help and the garage was spotless when he was done. I'll absolutely recommend xpress to anyone and everyone I know with any hauling needs.
Had my husbands phone screen and lcd replaced. Price was fair and service was fast! Will be back again to get my phone screen repaired!
Got the fish fry for the wife and she is picky were from Boston and she loved it all you can eat c'mon , I got the liver and onions it was great, prices great, cool little hidden gem!!!!
My uncle used to live near there. I took a friend one night and we both had the green chili burro, enchilada style. I recommend that. It was wonderful. Kind of pricey but good food.

I moved to Sun City from Northern Arizona in November and while my kitchen was being remodeled I had no way to cook so I looked for something close that I could get a sandwich or salad.  I was amazed at the wonderful specials that were offered everyday so I got more than just a sandwich.  Told my friend about it and she too was pleasantly surprised.  She then told her husband and so on and so on.  Now it has become a regular meeting place for several of us, several times a month.  The facility is always clean, the waitresses very friendly and the prices are great.  The amount of food is unbelievable so we usually go at lunch and always get a "go box" which we then have for dinner.  Every time we go we get something different and plan on going through the whole menu.  

Terri M
Sun City

I ate at Ninos for the first time and within two hours I was violently sick. Vomiting for 14 hrs, fever, headache, etc.  Today is the 5th day and heavy diarrhea began at 6am lasting 3 hours.  I've been in bed a week.
My husband and I ordered the same dinners (chicken enchilada and beef taco with rice beans, ice tea) except I ordered the hot green salsa.  
It doesn't take much in a kitchen to make someone sick with food born illness.
I am reporting them to the Health Dept no matter how nice they are or how many great reviews they have accumulated.

Nice guys. Good prices. Even though I'm a new golfer these guys didn't make me feel uncomfortable . They helped me pick nice and comfortable shoes, made suggestions even for shoes that were not the most expensive in the store. Not pushy or rude at all. Definitely will be going back to see these guys for my golfing needs. I only wish they were a bit closer to my house.
Got the walleye...best fish and chips I've ever had. Great service. It's in a bowling ally with limited hours. Had to hurry to get out by 8pm.

I came here today for lunch and the drive through and parking lot was packed. The car I was in got the last currently available parking spot. The parking lot is incredibly small and if  the drive through backs up there is no where to idle but in the parking lot as well blocking the already small lot. This is obviously nothing they can do to fix so if you are in a super hurry maybe don't plan to sit down here to eat during busy lunch hours. 

Other than the parking lot, the food coming out took a little longer than I would think it would take fast food but then again the parking lot was packed so I'm not surprised. Everything else was business as usual and everything I would expect from Jack in the Box fast food. I ordered the sriracha bacon jack with curly fries and that was pretty good. It had sriracha mayo on it with jalapenos, bacon, tomatoes, and lettuce. The tomatoes were surprising really fresh and plentiful.

I will say the breakfast was very good. Food was cooked just right.  Our waitress was super friendly.

Here is my BUT: Their was three of us, my mother is in a wheelchair. We walked in and the woman. behind the counter never said a word. She just looked at us and rolled her eyes like, oh lord another wheelchair. I think her name was Arline (older gal). Just grabbed three menus and just tossed them on the table and gave us a dirty look and walked off.

And ever time she walked passed our table, she would give my mother a dirty look and just roll her eyes. So if you dont like people who are in wheelchairs, maybe you should stay at home and be a nasty person their and not in public.   When we were leaving and to pay, she never said thank you either, great people skills too.

If we ever return their for another breakfast and she is working, we will ask for someone else to seat us.

Great golf shop. Super prices, friendly, knowledgeable staff. Just about anything you would want for your golf game in a friendly, not pushy atmosphere. Nice return policy for clubs and stuff, just in case what you purchased turns out to be not for you. Opens at 8 am. Wonderful mix of new and used clubs at good prices. Not much, if anything, negative to say about Van's.
Being a valley native I have had my share of Mexican food. Sonoran is my fav and this little place does it up right. Great service and excellent red chili
Pete is the man. He cooks up a serious breakfast menu and all of his food is top notch. Glad I found this place. My new favorite.

This is one of the cleanest stores I have had the pleasure of being in. Staff is friendly.....but it's not consistant. And there is usually only 1-2 checkouts open even when the traffic picks up. The produce is fantastic tho. And the prices and the sales are what keeps me coming back.
Consistently good, fast friendly service.  Great daily specials.  Love to support the little guy.  Heads up...they only except cash or check, no cards...

One of the most compassionate I have encountered. My brother and I have been patients of his for almost 15 years now
I never feel rushed in my appointments  And he is very thorough
Went there the other day. Long wait for service and there was only about 20 people there. Waitress was slow and disinterested. Food was so so. I doubt I will ever go back.

Stopped by this Safeway to get a few grocery items to make dinner and a gluten free cobbler and they had everything on my list! To my surprise this location carries a lot of vegan/gluten free products that a Safeway location a few miles away does not carry.. Produce section is clean, organize and organic veggies/fruits are clearly labeled. Employees are helpful/friendly but my cashier whispered a few curse words under his breath because he kept incorrectly ringing items in.

The smell of oils about knocks you on your ass, but this place has an awesome array of outstanding pipes and vape stuff. PLUS The guy who runs it is just about the friendliest person ever. This is definitely a must-do if you're into any of the scent things.
Good food and service. I will be there tomorrow for fish. Best coleslaw in the area.
Came out and found our heating issue right away very professional and new what he was doing i would definitely recommend this company
