We also got a cinnamon roll thinking it was all homemade cinnamon roll and it was a cold dried out out of a package cinnamon roll don't order one you can get them at the store for 50 cents. Took 45 minutes to be seated even though there was ten tables open. I believe this is the worst restaurant in Sun City that I have ever ate at.

Since the west valley doesn't offer more choices, I really can't complain much. With the small amount of space they have, they sure have a lot of inventory! The workers are really nice, and always checking to see if you need any help. I wanted to try out a certain iron, no problem at all. I grabbed an 8-iron and went to there hitting area, and took a few swings. 
One thing I really liked about this location is the employees really took the time to talk with you, made you feel welcomed! Because of that, when I am ready for a new set of irons, they will be getting my business. 
Funny when I started this review I gave them a 3-star rating, but by the time I finished it. I raised it to a 4-star rating! Looks like I talked my self into giving them a better review. Even though I am a big fan of Golfsmiths, this place isn't to bad at all.

Although I live in California, I suddenly needed assistance for my elderly father in Sun City, AZ last October 2014. I was traveling at the time and was given AZ Best Home Care as a referral by my Dad's hospital and primary doctor as being highly rated and affordable. I can not say enough GOOD things about how this company went above and beyond arranging emergency care for me via my cell phone for THAT day. It was a Friday and they managed to accommodate me anyway. The manager, Brian D, was excellent and went almost immediately to my parents' home to assess the situation. He had a full schedule, but juggled things to go out of his way to help me. He was a godsend and truly cared about trying to help me in my panic. I could go on and on, but suffice it to say this company is excellent and truly affordable. I paid up front, over the phone, for what we had agreed was necessary and at the end of that period ALL unused funds were immediately credited back to my credit card.  I HIGHLY recommend this company and would not hesitate to use them again!!!

By far the best people in the golf business. I recently was waffling on the idea of getting new irons. While price is always a consideration, it's a pretty easy formula to have personable people that want you to be happy. I've bought nearly all my golf equipment at Van's for the last 26 years. I said it many times that the people at Van's are the best.

Been here several times and even got take out once! The service is wonderful!!! Friendly/ humorous staff! And the food, oh my goodness the food is out of this world! Authentic, fresh, delicious food! Even my takeout meal was great! We will keep coming back
Rudy takes pride in his work and makes sure the job is done well. His prices are great and I highly recommend his services.

These guys were great!  They were able to make an appointment quickly, showed up on time at the start of their 30 minute window, got done quickly and cost less than half of what the other company wanted.

I had called a national company who gave me a 2 hour window, still showed up late, and wanted twice as much money as I paid to Xpress.  I love that they are a local company and highly recommend them!
They are not in a rush to sell anything. You can have plenty of time to make your selections. They are there to answer your questions and not to push anything on you. Good selection of t's and balls.

Worst meal EVER! Went tonight with two sisters. We were surprised the place was so quiet, and yet it took FOREVER to receive our food. We did finally see our food put up on the window to be delivered, but the one and only waitress didn't seem to be paying much attention. She spent a lot of time chatting with some friends before going to help seat new customers and then chatted with someone else before serving us. I ordered the French Toast - c'mon how can you mess up French Toast? It tasted HORRIBLE and was ice cold to boot! I tried two bites and pushed it away. Inedible. One sister ordered the Philly Cheese Steak. She got a HUGE ball of gristle in her 2nd bite. She gave up on it and ate just a few of the fries. We went tonight as the special was liver & onions. A real fave. of my other sister. It was so overcooked she said she didn't taste liver at all, she wasn't sure she wasn't eating a very skinny overcooked steak. It didn't smell like liver either. She was starving and ate 1/2 before giving up too. When the waitress came over with the bill she just started picking up the full plates and didn't even comment on the fact that two of us had left the food practically intact. We said that at least we can eat the free ice cream and asked for chocolate. She told us no chocolate, vanilla or strawberry only. REALLY! Well that just capped the evening, so we didn't even get dessert. We told her the food was inedible and she just kind of shrugged, picked it up and walked away. We went up to pay the bill and told the person there the same thing and she just said she would tell George. Almost $30 later and we all left hungry and really upset. Nobody cared. We'll spread the word. DO NOT EVEN THINK OF EATING AT GEORGE'S! UGH!
Awesome customer service and quick turn around.  Great communication as well.  They kept me informed of the entire process. Overall great product and awesome company.
Love Ninos!! We visit family every Thanksgiving and we visit Ninos at least twice while we are here. Probably our favorite Mexican restaurant including the ones at home in CA!!!

We have been using Open Range Pest control since we moved to Arizona. Delane and his staff are friendly and extremely helpful. They are responsibly priced and we never see bugs and weeds as Open Range Pest Control take care of both. Highly, highly recommended for any pest control and we'd evening services. Worth every penny!!!

This is my second time using Grand Canyon and they only have gotten better with time! They sent me a text message and phone call when my tech was on his way. He even wore shoe shocks on my carpet. Very friendly did a great job. My ac is working better than before. Great company and will use again and again. You should too!

I LOVE this place. That green chili is the bomb! They serve Pepsi products which of course is best with Mexican food. 

I'd do 5 stars if they would step into the year 2016 and accept card payments. I never carry cash, so I always have to stop at Wells Fargo in the parking lot first.

These guys worked FAST and GREAT! Nice clean work and fast delivery/on-time. They made it easy on the phone to set up an appointment for the blinds to be installed. Met 4 different people, they all were helpful and respectful on helping me pick out blinds and get a good deal on them. THANK YOU EMPIRE BLINDS! Cant wait to work with you guys again soon!

A nice place to have a lunch and get away.

The staff and atmosphere at Nino's is friendly and inviting. This is a calm place to have lunch, not a noisy place, mostly due to the customers and location (Sun City).

I have eaten here a few times and its worth the stop off, but it's not worth going out of your way for. Another reviewer said it best  - this is old people mexican food. The salsa lacks kick, but still has good taste. All of the food I have tried is nothing special at all and the Mexican Pizza was depressingly bland and greasy. The one shining star here is their cheese enchilada. There is just something about the quality and flavor put into the filling that surpasses more well known places.

Give them a shot if you are in the area and want to try something new. It's nowhere near 5 star quality or even 4. Unfortunately service alone can not make a restaurant for me. Food quality needs to be original and superb and this just averages out.

This is a place I will go back to, just to explore the menu and hopefully find another hidden gem in the menu.
Always crowded and always great food! This place is a place I have frequented since I was a little boy. I love their chili relleno and tacos! Highly highly recommended!! Get there early!!
excellent food, reasonably priced, good service! Never had a bad meal! There Taco salad is delicious. Grilled chicken salad is outstanding. They have a nice menu to choose from!

Our first time here. 

First thing I noticed is the service. It was very slow. We were seated quickly but ordering and getting our food took more than 30 minutes. I do need to say the servers we did have were very nice and apologetic for the slow service. Someone may have called in sick, who knows. 

We ordered the Mexican omelette and the biscuits and sausage gravy.  Both were very good and we would eat here again.

Best fix, excellent price. Quick and friendly service. I couldn't find anyone better! Search no further, this is the place to take your phone and tablet too. Thanks Jordan for the great service and repair.

I am very happy so far with the service at Open Range. I walked the yard today after record breaking heat expecting to see scorpions all over the place and did not see 1. We had been seeing dozens every night outside and a few inside each week before Open Range came out. Our worst invaders were the almost microscopic baby scorpions that were crawling out of the cracks literally. We have grass, trees and a pool so I was just hoping for a little better but Open Range has exceeded my expectations. Whatever they use for scorpions is a miracle working secret weapon. We were trapped in a 2 year contract when we first moved in with a company that charged over $200 a quarter and we were still seeing scorpions and all kinds of bugs with them spraying twice a month. Open Range is very affordable and easy to work with. Tim is our bug guy and he is great. He is friendly and knowledgeable and is not afraid to tell it like it is. I am keeping this company for my pest control needs. I just wish we had found them two years ago!

This place has the best chimi's in the valley! The beef is always tender and full of flavor. The price is good and the service is great! I will continue to take people there to celebrate their birthdays as well as eat there myself.

I have been eating here for a long time there food is always good. Everyone treats you like family. Prices are good the only real down falls are the close early and are not open on Sundays. But there nothing wrong with being closed on Sunday also they do NOT take credit or debit cards only cash and checks.
These guys took care of my broken iPad quickly and beat everyone's prices. Definitely recommend.

Hit and miss with food quality - maybe it depends on who is cooking that day.  We were there in Dec 2016 and ordered the Walleye dinner and Gyros plate.  LOVED both - perfectly cooked and delicious.  If I had written this review then, it would be 5 stars.  However we went again last week (Jan 2017), ordered the same identical plates and were totally disappointed.  Everything was underdone.  The walleye, fries, gyro meat, pita = all undercooked and not hot. We probably should have returned it all.  Doubt if we will take a chance again.

Great green chilli burro enchilada style...like traditional Mexican food here 50 years ago--and you can get it in a mini version, which is a normal portion. Very disappointed in the ground beef taco--meat blah, and a preformed taco shell that tasted like the boxed ones from the grocery store. A plus is a cold glass that was served alongside the cold bottle of beer. Mini cheese crisp was great ans shareable for 2.

This place has gone downhill a lot in recent years. More and more often there are issues with orders and service. The hours and days they are open seem to be more sporadic as well. Plus they still don't accept cards... We're almost to 2017... Card readers are cheap. Get one. 

On the most recent attempt to eat here we were actually turned away and told we couldn't order. The excuse was that they were running low on food and weren't taking any orders to go. Tons of people order to go here and it seems like incredibly poor planning to run out of the items to make the things they serve, especially on a Saturday night. This is a consistent theme here too. Things frequently aren't available on the menu. 

At the moment they've lost our business. We used to order weekly, and routinely. It then turned into monthly or less and now having this issue I believe we're done here for a while. It's sad too because they have pretty good food and a nice atmosphere. But if you can't get the food and the service is so so... Why stay?  Plenty of other places until I decide to try this again in 6 months.

Horrible food. Who has a Mexican food restaurant and doesn't serve Carne Asada. They only have ground beef and Chicken!? Plus they do not accept debit cards. Save yourself the time and either walk over to the frozen food section at the Fry's next door and get yourself a frozen Jose Ole Burrito or go over to Taco Bell across the parking lot and save yourself $15. Did I forget to mention that the young girl at the entrance is so rude.
This is the best Mexican food I have had hands down.... Will make this a regular stop for dinner!!!

Getting my windows tinted by an expert and honest dealer.  I highly recommend Cutting Edge for your window tinting needs.  Rudy and his team are great and he has been in business here for many many years and that alone should tell you something.

I love this place.  The food has always been great and so is the service.  The prices are good to.  I miss the owner, he was fantastic, but the great staff helps.
My mom loves the soft tacos a lot.

I needed a last minute clean up at my home.  Kevin was friendly, punctual, very efficient....and prices are very reasonable!  I highly recommend you contact Kevin if you need any kind of clean up/junk removal from your property!

We decided to try this place because of the amount of good stars and reviews......BIG MISTAKE! When we arrived, it was 45 min until their closing time. There were only 2 other couples besides us in the place. Like someone else mentioned, the salsa was very bland. When we got our food, we had to constantly blow on it because it was piping HOT! It was almost as if they took the whole plate and put it in the oven to cook. My tongue had a burning sensation for a whole week. I had the chicken tacos and they were ok (nothing to brag about). I also didn't like that you had to use cash instead of paying with any method of payment you wanted. The staff was pretty nice, but I won't ever return to this place.

I have been using Open Range for over 5 years. They have been consistent, reliable and professional. I went thru 3 companies that consistently disappointed me. Open Range always backs their service!! 

I love knowing I wont see any bugs in my house!

My AC went out and a friend of mine referred me to Grand Canyon AC for there good service, fair pricing, and professionalism. I am incredibly happy that I went with the recommendation and I will be sure to recommend them to others. Thanks GC!

I dont like liver but my mom got it.  I tasted hers and it was fantastic.  It was tender and flavorable.  It was really great.  The portion would be enough for us to split.  I now like liver.
Also, low prices and great service.  My mom loved it there and wants to go back soon.

Made an appointment for an eye exam and was told I'd owe a $40 co-pay. No other information was provided. When I went to my appointment, I was told I would need to pay another $45 if I wanted to get a prescription for glasses, which was my sole reason for making the appointment. I felt as a consumer, I should have been asked if that was my intent or if I was having medical issues with my eyes. I felt this company deliberately withheld the fees so that I wouldn't go elsewhere at a much lower cost to get my prescription. I could have gone to another eye center for a $30 co-pay and received my prescription. I was told I really didn't need a new prescription since my current one hadn't really changed. When I asked for a copy of my old prescription, they charged me for a new prescription for $45. I just wish that these people would be honest about their pricing and allow me to make a decision that best suits me. The doctor (Alison Kitzerow) was rude and I have no intention of returning to Barnet Delaney Perkins for any further eye care.

This is one of the old standbys in Sun City, and we have eaten there numerous times.  The place is quite large and seats a lot of people. Menu is varied and not too expensive, and the food has generally been good. Service is usually quick, and responsive.  Only drawback is that I thought they must have hired their waitresses on who had the most tattoos all over their body.  That,s not always the most appetizing sight while you,'re eating.  OVERALL, you can expect good food at reasonable prices, but nothing too special.  The owner's family opened George's Cafe about 2 blocks away in the Lakeview Rec Center, and I think they have lost some of their customers to the new place.

Have been going to this place for years.  They are now taking advantage of that.  I made an appointment and was made to wait while three walk-ins were serviced before me.  Then the manager, Jimmy, was disrespectful.  Will take my business elsewhere.  Also, their prices are getting outrageous.

I visited Sonora Quest at 5310 W Thunderbird Road in Glendale on Saturday, 8/18/18. I didn't have an appointment so I was fine with waiting. The waiting room was packed & patients were lined up in the hallway when I arrived @ 7:30am. There was a gal at the door checking patients in. I asked if they had my orders. My doctor had told me on 8/16 that the order was in. I was told they would check. After waiting 2  1/2 hours I was called to window. I then was told they didn't have my order. I told them you had me sit here for 2 1/2 hours to tell me you don't have my order. I asked about it when I checked in. The response was "you can always call in to see if it was received".  This is partly my doctor's my doctors fault as well but a patient should not have to wait 2 1/2 hours to find out they don't have doctor orders. Totally unacceptable.

Save yourself a trip and check another Verizon store first. This store seems to have forgotten what customer service is about. I went in here yesterday to have the information from a defective iPhone 7s ( purchased from Verizon) switch to a replacement phone sent to me by Verizon. When I went in to have it done, they told me it would be 10.00 dollars. Why am I paying because you sold me something defective under warranty. I went to a different Verizon and no mention of a fee. I called corporate and the told me the manager didn't know the policy and since it was a direct store, there should not have been  a fee. Can you imagine being a customer for 8 Year's and having 3 lines and this is the way they treat you. Smh.

Staff and Dr. Perkins are very professional. They took good care of my father, everything they did was explained and very prompt. Dr Perkins was very good, funny and easy to talk to and  understanding.  I would recommend Dr Perkins and staff to everyone at this location.

This a great place !! All servers are super super nice ..!!  Good is very good ..!! Atmospheric is the best the owners of café come around to the tables n chat with customers that's a plus customers feel very important.. great place !!!

I see the 3 previous reviews are bad, our visit was nothing like it. Not one car in drive thru. 8 cars in parking area. Not only was Caleb friendly, he repeated our order exactly as ordered. Including the large water (no charge, like other places) we visit my mum every other month in AZ & the service was so good, as was the chicken sandwhich & my daughters mini pancakes, we will be back. Probably one of the more perfect drive thru experinces we have had. We travel 3000+ miles every few months & have had our share of lousy service. This was a nice change.

We've had two of our vehicles tinted by Rudy. And my folks have had several cars done - including antique vehicles. They all look great! He is meticulous about the job he does and his prices are so inexpensive too! 

We can make faces at people passing us by and they can't see us. Only kidding! But seriously, if you need tinting, this is definately the guy to go to!

These guys are awesome! They did a window tint job on my Honda Civic Hatchback, removed the previous tint and added new darker tint! They really took their time to put in some quality work! My back windshield was complicated to work with as far as tinting but these guys did a great job making it happen! Now my car looks great and stays cooler.. I would most def recommend these guys to anyone! They do quality work for a very fair price!

I am a salad person but cant have it here.  I can only eat iceberg.  Romain is to soft and gets caught in my throat.
That means NOTHING with lettuce.  No salad bar, taco salad, burgers, anything with lettuce 
Please get iceberg for the many who cant eat other lettuce.
The lettuce is the only reason for two stars.

I had cataract surgery two days ago performed by Dr. Perkins in the Sun City office ... I was pretty much blind in my right eye due to the cataract and the results of being shot in the eye with a BB more than 50 years ago ... The results have been fantastic and my eyesight is vastly improved in just two days ... I know it is far from being completely healed but with a little time, I'm confident I will have 20/20 vision in the subject eye ... It tested at 20/25 less than 24 hours after the surgery ... My eyesight improves by the hour, literally! ... The entire staff is amazing and all very professional ... They are kind, courteous and very effective in their respective jobs ... In all, I was helped by probably 15 or more and each was excellent! ... The actual surgery took something like 5 minutes or less and was totally painless and stress free ... Follow-up has been great and each person on the staff really conveys a caring and concern ... Was there a downside? ... Sure, I didn't look good in the blue surgical hairnet!!! Thank you, Dr. Perkins and the entire team at BDP ...

I have been going to Ninos for about 12yrs off and on. Surprised it took this long to write a review. I've learned when it comes to Mexican food, different things matter more to some people than others. I've seen people judge a restaurant based off their rice and beans (really!?!)

Ninos is a wonderful and small family owned business. They are busy most days and for good reason, the food and service is great. Their family knows mine now and are always so friendly when we come. They will take care of whatever you need, 

I have never had anything I didn't love off their menu from simple tacos to chimis. I think their ground beef is exceptionally flavored and tastes great. I love their chips and salsa. The salsa is a puree style, not the chunky like some people prefer. They do make a delicious guacamole too, just straight fresh avocados. That's why it is so good though, not processed or premade stuff. 

The building/suite it is in may be a little old as well as much of the clientele, but it is a very comfortable and affordable family meal. 

WARNING though, last I paid attention they only accepted cash or checks.

We love living in Paradise RV Resort!  Yes, there is maintenance to be done as in all resorts.  This is a very friendly, active park.  Many amenities.  I was a snowbird from 2002 until 2012 when we became residents of Arizona.  Suits us to a T!

Stumbled across this place while visiting a friend in Phoenix. The manicurist Lee was amazing. Her attention to detail was great and she was really lovely. She goes out of her way with her pedicure and I would come back once a week if I could just for a pedicure. Go and see her! Ask for Lee.
Sad that that do not have a self serve checkout like frys and Walmart does. Check out would have been faster with a self checkout stations
Get's better all the time.  We love Nino's and we love the new menu.  Fifi and all the girls are great!!  We get the  #1 Taco, Enchilada, rice and beans....Yummm.  Great prices too.

Horrible hiring manager  (Nancy) Don't bother applying here, Nancy will just put you through the hire process Then completely ignore you and/or avoid you. I waited over 45 minutes, two different days to show her proof of I.D something that takes  (5 min or less) and she couldn't be bothered. She told me to have a seat when I first arrived and she never got back to me. She continued to watch me patiently wait, while she kept pussy footing around. UNPROFESSIONAL POINT BLANK! DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME work somewhere else! no wonder that place has a high turn over rate I'm surprised they're still in business. Last complaint: Dirty tables disgusting! And food is over priced if you want my honest opinion.

If there was ever a 5 star, local business, this is it.  I have been buying my golf equipment here since I have been in AZ, 9 years.  Great customer service from all the employees and the same prices that all the other golf shops have.  The exception is the satisfaction guarantee.  If you don't like the club you bought, you can bring it back and get full credit for the next one, twice if need be.  They never shirk on this and there is no better way to find out if you like your clubs than hitting them while you play.  If they don't have a club in stock, they can get it quickly from their other stores or order it for you.  You can't go wrong while supporting this great local golf shop.  Jack and his crew will help you with any of your golfing needs.  I bought a new set of Ping G irons from them and have set all time records with my golf scores.  It is simply the best place in the Northwest Valley to shop for golf stuff.
Great Greek breakfast. Fair prices and good portions. Excellent service.

As far as grocery store's goes... this one was pretty good.  Every store varies from layout to layout even within the same chain; but I had no problem finding everything i needed for a 4 item brunch for 20 people.  There a whole flower and balloon area with a pretty decent collection of things to satisfy most customers unless you are looking for something very specific. One thing I will say is that the person that was helping the people infront of me with the balloons was having trouble with the register so she brought them to a different counter; BUT send over the guy working the starbucks counter (oh yeah they have one) over and he helped me out.  So I thought that was pretty nice of them.

Passing through the area on a road trip and chose this place due to the number of stars on yelp. 

I quickly learned this restaurant and area is home to older folks, but the food was overall alright. Only choices of meat was ground beef, shredded beef, or shredded chicken. The chicken burrito enchilada style only had chicken in it. Basically the same thing as the chicken enchilada; the only difference being one used a flour tortilla and the other used corn tortillas. 

The service was good, the food was edible, and the environment is very nice and quiet. 

4 stars? Maybe for this area, but not compared to all the other restaurants I've been to.

Great staff. They went to bat for me with a manufacturer of an expensive laser. The easy answer was to tell me I'm out of luck since it was several years out of warranty. But they sent it back to manufacturer and when they couldn't get it fixed they persuaded manufacturer gave me a new unit.  Awesome customer service!

Warning - the food and salsa MAY seem bland to you, unless you customize your order.  But if you have a special diet they will take care of you.   

And the portions are Huge!

They add very little (if any?) spices / salt but have them handy for you.  Ask for it hot/spicy or ask for hot sauce or HOT salsa if you want to customize. Don't feel guilty about adding salt even to the hot salsa.  Normally salsa at a Mexican restaurant is WAY too salty for me but I add salt here.  

Only place i know that doesn't make me feel like a goof for asking for my chicken chimi with no beans.  Yum!

We moved to AZ about a year ago and have been using Open Range Pest Control during this time.  We have been extremely happy with their services. I did not have one spider, roach, or scorpion in my house all year. Outside I saw a few crickets, and I mean a FEW, but nothing else....and our yard backs up to open desert.

They make it very easy to schedule an appointment with their email system, and are quick to post a paid invoice.  When you email them, they get back to you quickly.

Today I had them apply pre emergent weed control. The technician was very careful to apply the product so that it was not on my pavers, but also make sure that our gravel was completely covered.  The product they use does not smell. We had another company apply a treatment previously, and it smelled so bad you didn't want to go outside, and I had yellow stains on my pavers, and walls.  I was thrilled to see that Open Range uses a product that is much more consumer friendly.

We have had the same technician all year, which is great. He is polite, neat, respectful and doesn't look like he belongs on America's Most Wanted! 

We have been very happy with this company!!!

I was in Sun City helping a friend and she recommended this place for lunch.  
  She is a fan of the fried walleye pike and wanted me to try it.
  I opted for the pancakes, which were delicious!  A huge portion, so huge that I brought some home and had them for dinner as well.
  I tasted her fish and it was amazing!  Tender, tasty, not fishy and fried nice and crispy but not oily.  
  The prices are very reasonable, the portions are large.
   Service was ok, but they seemed to be short staffed as I only saw 2 servers and the place was busy.
  I look forward to going back when I am in the area again.

Great for a quick stop for a forgotten item on vacation. However, we went grocery shopping here and were disappointed by the limited fresh produce options. Their limes were bruised and discolored from being old and their prices were not worth the quality. We ended up going to Sprouts down the street and were much happier.

First time I used this guy it was all good, I waited for my car and it was finished in a reasonable amount of time BUT the second time was a disaster and here's why.  I decided to use his services a second time because his prices were fare as long as you paid cash. I took my car on at 8am he said it would be 3 or 4 hours I waited and I waited and no call so I decided to call him, he said he had it sitting in the son to cure the tint lol of course I didn't believe that, I knew it was a stall tactic so when 4pm rolled around I decided to go to his shop and check for myself because his hours said he closed at 4pm and I didn't want my car to be there over night.  Well when I pulled up they had just finished it and had pulled out put off the garage... cure my ass... when I walked to the back they were wiping out down cleaning all the counter prints and smudge marks off that's when I noticed all these scratches all over both year quarter panels from someone leaning over the car cleaning the window and mind you I saw them doing that when I walked up, so as soon as I saw the scratches I immediately said what's all of this and I pulled to them,... well the owner immediately claimed that was already there and of course i knew better than that because i had just washed and waxed the car before i took out to him plus i know my cars inside and out but even with all of that he still claimed those scratches were already there.  It turned out that the owner wears a apron on which he keeps a plastic scraper in and those scratches came from him leaning over the car rubbing that plastic scraper as he wiped my window both sides were the same way, so in a panic he grabbed some cleaner and started rubbing frantically to remove them and luckily they came off but I truly believe If they hadn't he would have veametly denied causing the scratches and that is enough for me to never take anything to this guy ever again he lies and I do not recommend him for tint or anything else the episode was pretty distressing especially considering what you would have to go through top hey some lying SOB like this to cover damage such as that good luck.   I know this is a long review but I thought it was important to explain this story so people would understand who this guy really is before they took there business to him.   From now on I will take video and pictures of my vehicle before I leave it anywhere.   Don't forget he had my car all day when he said it would be only 3 or 4 hours.

Met my mother here to get our pedicures done. My first time here, and it was a good experience.  I was greeted right away the moment I walked through the door. I was immediately told to pick a color and sit in a chair. I wanted a fall color since we are in the month of October. They assisted me in picking the best color. I was able to relax in their chairs, and enjoy my visit with my mom. I felt like they were attentive to my needs and made sure my toes were done perfectly.  My mom ended up liking her color as well. We enjoyed our time and our toes looks great too.

I have gone to this Verizon location several times. Sometimes for a simple problem, but sometimes for "headaches". I stop by after church on Sunday's about 1 pm. The same young woman is there every time and she is EXCELLENT!!  she is friendly, helps me with options, and answers my questions clearly. I have also watched her with other customers. She is the same with them. I now drive from Surprise to Sun City because I know that my problems will be solved when I shop here.   Today she was there but a really nice gentleman helped me. He even went to my car to see exactly what I needed. Thank you.
So thankful I will be able to take my sunglasses off in another day, and re join the land of the seeing.

This place is in rough condition, lots are mostly dirt and not raked clean, with ruts in many spots. The majority of snowbird residents are hard to get along with. Age appears to average 75 and joining any activity is tough because of the long time cliches. Lots of old lady gossip and people with nothing to do but cause trouble for rv owners! 
The park is made up of mostly aluminum clad park models that are in need of updating.  If you consider staying here in an rv, ask for a spot near other rv'ers and not park models. By the way, careful driving in here, the majority of residents need to be re-tested for a driver's license!
Don't even consider buying here, bad investment (many for sale)!
The pool has chunks of concrete missing along the top edges. It screams bacteria. The sewer and water systems are in bad shape and constantly being repaired.

Why does this place even have a Starbucks? It makes me sad that Starbucks is represented here because the workers suck and don't even recognize you're existence and take their sweet time in even greeting you. Never will be returning to this Starbucks, even if it's the last one around.

This company truly understands the meaning of exceptional customer service!  I have used their services several times and they have always responded quickly and been reasonably priced.  I won't hesitate to recommend them or call upon them again should the need arise.
This place is Good Mexican food!  Love the Taco Salad. My husband had the Chili Relleno, Enchilada, rice and beans. It was REALLY good too!!!  Yummy  Yummy Yummy
I got my Jazzy Red some Tint... Loving it.. Great Price. Great Job.. Thank you so much Ruby....

This is a lovely park that is a permanent home to many folks.  The "park models" are very well kept, the grounds are neat, clean and well groomed and the RV sites are nicely level with full hook-ups available.
This is also a park that offers a huge variety of activities!  Everything from wood working, to stained glass, to swimming, quilting, painting, and so much more I can't even list it all.  
We stayed twice in April and plan to make this our home base next year for a month during Spring Training.

The Staff employed by Care From The Heart have simple Nursing degrees at Best. They are NOT Trained or even Required to be educated for working with individuals going through Alzheimers, and are thus basically Incompetent when it comes to treating patients/clients appropriately.

Care From The Heart was hired to assist my Mother, Whom was afflicted by Alzheimers, with simple things she used to do as part of a Daily routine, but due to the illness became struggles of mental acceptance. [bathing, changing into clean clothes, tidying up around her house, fixing adequately nutritious meals, etc.]

Most staff sent out to care for my Mother were Patronizing and Placating when interacting with her. And whenst my Mother would have a symptomatic mood swing, would become Personally offended and leave their shift early, sometimes not returning.

My Mother is Gentle, but Strong-Willed. Non-violent, but Verbal. The only times she got into a mood swing were when the Care From The Heart staff grew unprofessionally frustrated, and Impatiently tried to FORCE her to do things she was not Ready to do.

The Activity sheets, kept in a Binder, for the Family and their Boss to review, were Frequently scribed with unvarying, Routine entries, when they were not Simplistic and akin to Milking-the-Time-clock.
Great food and service. Breakfast all day with a friendly staff.  Reasonably priced, too.

Bad bad bad store, rude rude store, I was told not to put my water up on the counter with her bad attitude (check out woman) then when I complained the customer service told me that she got my message and told me with an attitude that I should have a nice day. I told her that I would and that I would never shop there again and I won't . This has happened three time to me. I only went there three times.

It is a great place to go for something as important as your eyes, they seem to work well as a team and  Dr Hanley is the only one I see and he is absolutely the best! It is one of the things that I do not worry about because I 100% trust his opinion.

The staff and Dr. Perkins are all very lovely people.  The first issue was they did not know during the pre-op which variety of cataract surgery my husband was having.  We found that very bizarre!  There are several types available and we did the selection for the "type" during our appt. with the financial counselor.  The second  issue they give you coupons that do not work.  We spent 2 days and hours on the phone to fix this issue no to mention going to CVS, Walgreens and Walmart to get them filled.  Bless Lisa at Walmart for getting the bull by the horn. After two days we got the RX. The third issue, they overlooked giving us a RX my husband needed for his surgery. Soooooooo back to Walmart we go.  I am crossing my fingers they phoned it in so we can pick it up!  If Dr Perkins didn't have the stellar reputation he has,,,,,,,,,,believe me we would have gone elsewhere!
Food is a little bland , not much variety , go there for the coffee if your forced to kill some time.

Old People.  Everywhere.

I love old people.  But they are slow, so if you're not in a rush then you'll survive a visit here.  Just watch out for the golf carts slipping into your parking space right in front of your eyes.

This place has a Starbucks inside, which is pretty cool.  Unless of course, their cash registers break down leaving you stranded with ice cream melting in your bag while you wait 10 minutes for the registers to boot up again in the 120 degree Arizona heat.  

I guess I should really blame Microsoft Windows for sucking.

This place has typical grocery food with a decent bakery and bread selection.  Not bad for the basic needs of the elderly population, but nothing fancy.

HORRIBLE! This Place Is A Shit Show, the do shit work for a super expensive bill ! And they chipped my paint trying to pry off a part of my car to feed the wires through, they took the cheapest way out and made my lightbar look like shit, I'm contemplating on filing a law suit, hopefully I can help people not get screwed over by this low life establishment, owner and all employees are snobby and inconsiderate assholes. They didn't even care to tell me that their work was shit, I get home to find a pet of my car not even flush with the rest of the body ! These guys just stuck it on and said "F**K It!" Here are photos of proof on how horrible this stereo shop is and how much they don't care at all!

Have stopped here before on occasion when in the area, but this is not my main grocery store usually shop at the Safeway on Happy Valley. What a shock the POOR SERVICE and just plain RUDENESS of the employees was from start to finish on my visit today. 

First off came in for some fish from their full service seafood counter. When I got to the counter there was one woman being helped ahead of me. Noticed two other employees behind the counter other than the one waiting on the lady in front of me, but thought this guy must be the seafood counter guy. Apparently not as when this gentleman finished waiting on the lady he simply walked away from the counter completely ignoring me. Didn't look at me, acknowledge me or anything! He moved to the back of the shop and started talking to another employee. WOW! Got the attention of the third guy behind the counter and got what I came for.

Second strike came at the checkout stand. Got to the express lane with one person in front of me (an employee) just finishing up his transaction so I thought this would be quick. NOPE! just then another employee walks up and starts questioning the cashier about his schedule and all three of them start discussing their work schedules. Again completely ignoring me not a Hi or hello or any sort of acknowledgement after a minute of this I picked up my items and went to another check out. Thank goodness this cashier Jeanie was quick although one item was rung up at the wrong price.

Third strike came at their customer service counter when I went up there to question why the salsa I bought was rung up higher than what the shelf tag said. First off no one was there so I waited as well as two other people for someone to show up. Someone did come up and help me after a couple of minutes, but AGAIN no greeting or acknowledgement at all when this you woman comes up. She just stared at me like I was bothering her. So I start to explain that I had been charged more than what the shelf tag was on the Salsa I bought. She still says absolutely nothing just takes the salsa and walks off. Even the customer behind me asks "Did she just walk off?". So the customer service clerk returns with the shelf tag and literally grunts to me "That's last weeks price". That is the entire conversation from this customer service clerk. She did refund my money on the item, but what a nasty person

Been a 30 year plus loyal Safeway shopper and this is the worst experience I have ever had at a Safeway.

Rooms are very nice.  Staff is delightful. They work very hard to keep things clean, keep residents happy.  Food not so much. Mom has lived there over a year and food used to be better.  2018 not so good for their food.  Tried to talk to managers about it and they won't listen.  Meals are a big deal for seniors and they should do better.  Need better recipes for dinner and supper, breakfast probably the best meal.  Very accommodating for doctor and dentist visits, grocery store, etc. Someone comes in to do hair and nails weekly for nominal fee. Cost of competitive with other similar places nearby.
This is a great family ran restaurant with excellent food and great people. I love taking my friends family and office there often. It's a great experience every time I go.

I can't say enough good things about BDPEC in Sun City. I just had the cataract with lens implant done in my second eye. Everyone in the practice was outstanding. My experience both times was great. This team really has it all together. Hooray everyone at BDPEC.

First off - the staff are very friendly working at this location. Good variety of golf gear but not a great variety. The clothing section is minimal. They do have a club fitting range that is digital. They also have a club building and repair shop. For the most part, it is a one stop shop.

Never any check out help. No employees on the floor either. OK store if you want 1 or 2 items, but be prepared to wait in line.. Kind of hysterical to watch the people fight over the handicapped spots out front. No do it yourself check out lines. Prices are much higher than Walmart  or Frys. I live right around the corner and flat out refuse to shop here.

I had a black out shade installed on a large bedroom window. Arrived on time both times, first for the consultation and then for the install. I am very happy with my purchase.  Clint and Matt went above and beyond!
Thank you

This staff was great, went in for a driver and was asked to demo several driver .  Was taken to the driving stall and found out I was using the wrong stiffness on my clubs.  After finding the right shaft I started hitting my shots better.  This is a true "customer service" business I will continue to do business with them and tell my friends about them.

Okay, I was a little worried about this Mexican establishment, because it is not big at all. It is all family owned and they do not accept credit cards or debit, they only accept cash or checks.  They have never done cards for over 20yrs and they are still going strong. They are closed on Sundays as well, so keep that in mind when you want to go here to eat. My meal was very tasty and very yummy.  I had a chicken chimichanga with rice and beans. My Mom just ordered a cheese enchilada.  The chips were not very good, and the salsa was too spicy for me. Plus I wanted ice tea, since the table right by me had just ordered it and it sounded great, but our waitress said no. Dont have any.  I tried not to make a big deal out of that, and was fine with water. Other than that, it was great.

Lots of Veterans are referred to this clinic. I went in for my routine check and whole thing was done in about 40 minutes after my arrival. It didn't exactly feel like a very thorough exam since I was a military aviator and seen thorough exams, but staff and doctors are friendly and very helpful answering questions.

This is a terrific family owner & operated restaurant. Their HH margaritas ain't Z Tejas but they hit the spot. 
The food is good and service even better. Everyone has a smile & kind word for you. 
The menu is your standard Sonoran/AZ fare. Salsa is better than what you get in a lot of higher-end place.

My family has been coming to this place FOREVER. I love it! The food is delicious, the service is efficient, and the prices are right. I will continue to come here, and highly suggest it to anyone. It is however, a hole in the wall... which is usually where you find the best food. I wouldn't suggest you take someone for a first date as the decor is mediocre at best, but if your date is not stuck up, and they like good food, go for it.

Care from the Heart was wonderful taking care of our Dad. They were quick to answer our questions and take care of every need of our Dad. The care person was outstanding and gave great care to our Dad. We highly recommend them.

Dr Donoho was my dentist for several years in Arizona and whenever I'm home I still stop in for cleanings. He's helped me through countless cleanings and one major dental procedure when I was a teenager. 

Ive lived all over the country and have tried several other dentists but I always find myself coming back to Dr Dan. He always is incredibly clear and transparent with what I need done. The entire staff is warm and welcoming. 

Let's face it- no one likes the dentists office but Dr Dan and the team make it enjoyable. I'd highly recommend him to anyone in the area looking for a dentist. From making the appointment through payment it's painless and easy.
Sad and 0 service
This place is the bees knees , good prices and good work, and honest guys. Defiantly will let them finish tinting my entire show room truck

The ribs are fantastic.  They fall off the bone.  I have had ribs many places but these are the greatest. Its a big meal and inexpensive too.  We like going on monday so we can have split pea soup, but tuesday is great too.  The cooks are really good.  We love the wait staff too.  Never had a bad server.  
I highly recommend jimichaels.

Excellent service.  Their pricing is great.  If I ever have the need I will use them again.  They came and picked up and old swing set, a large shed and some other misc stuff in my backyard.  They even cleaned up the area before they left.  great job all the way around!!

This is the worst eye care center ever. Terrible customer service, high price and poor quality services. The first prescription was incorrect for right eye. Waited 1-1/2 hours even with an appointment for recheck with Dr. Brussels to get new prescription. Later, wanted to have new lenses from Costco in an old pair of glasses. BDP would not give me a copy of my prescription to Costco, first telling Costco they would fax the prescription, then telling Costco I owed for my exam which I did not (spoke to Annie in Billing). 

Called BDP again and was told I had to come in for a recheck (and pay again, of course). I never received a copy of my correct prescription and BDP will not give it to me. This is a scam, they are churning for additional fees. Very unethical company. Avoid at all cost.

Made a reservation through Encore Thousand Trails for this resort.  Due to family issues we cannot take the trip.  Called over 30 days in advance to cancel reservation.  We were charged $25. cancelation fee.  we were never told about the cancellation fee when we made the reservation. There are many choices in the Phoenix area and we will use another facility on our next trip.  We do not appreciate a company that will nickle and dime customers to make a buck.

I'll make a long story as short as possible I had stopped shopping at Safeway eight months ago because food was severely expired by years in some cases!! Images can be provided, with date on shelf signs and food in hand in front of signs! Bags for groceries tear and dump my food in parking lot, ALL THE TIME!! Customer service at desk when these issues were pronounced could only say "sorry" never had more then that and were uninterested!!! I went back last week for a second chance, NO INTERNET PROVIDED!! APP CANNOT WORK WITHOUT IT, or data, which I attempted to is and kept getting a pop up "TRY AGAIN OR CANCEL" I shopped and today stopped In again and the app still gave that pop up so I went to the customer service desk where the lady was LICKING HER FINGERS going through papers!!! She licked four times before I said, be careful licking you may put germs in your mouth, SHE COMPLETELY IGNORDED ME, so I said, or you may give us germs, SHE CONTINUED TO IGNOR ME!! I was less then 1.5 feet away from her ear, so I know she heard me, she continued to  LICK!! Never even looked at me!!! Unprofessional!! Horrible experiences! I walked out!

I previously used a mobile repair company that damaged my phone and i was in need of someone to fix my phone ASAP! I came across break and fix and they got me in immediately and had the best prices! Jordan was very nice and made conversation the whole time he was fixing my phone! I'd recommend this place to anyone! It was a great experience overall
These guys are amazing! There prices are great and they really try to help. I had an issue with my first replacement and they asked no questions & replaced it with no hassle.  Highly recommend! :)

Called several places before this guy and they all quoted me high prices.  This place gave me a fair price and did an excellent job that's why I'm giving him 5 stars.  He had a nice little shop that's open to the waiting area and you can see them working on your car, i like that.  It's clean and well kept plus there's a TV to watch to kill the time of you are so inclined.   Did i mention the owner is very professional.  Just call around and get some quotes then call this guy he will pick up the tax if you pay cash also.

Stopped in to have some questions answered. We signed in and stated our reason  for being there which was a waste. The next free helper asked why we were there without even looking at the sign in sheet. We wanted something removed from our bill but they couldn't help anyway, we had to call the company direct. Helpful but yet not helpful.

Not real sure why this place is here, three times I have been at this store for help with my phone. Either they are not allowed to touch the phone or can't sync the phone because"I may have a gun in the car".  Oh My Gosh!!!!what a waste of retail.   Verizon sure sold out.its sad. Service is not scary, most usually anyone that can sync a phone can sync it safely to a car. Please don't accuse people of being a shooter! We just wanted help.
This place has gone downhill.  We have ate here many times. Food is lacking veggies selection. The Salad bar is lacking everything

Fast and very efficient service. Very friendly and professional with hands down the best pricing. I was so impressed with same day service. Randy and his crew are awesome. Highly recommend. Thank you Xpress.
Fast and great service replacing my Droid internal battery. Highly recommend.

Jay is very knowledgeable and helpful about the products he sells. He has always gone out of his way to make sure I am happy when I leave his store. The other associate (Bailey) is also very helpful and knows what I want as soon as I walk in. They have a small, family business and want their customers to be completely satisfied when they leave. You can ask them questions, and they'll have the answers and they'll spend time with you if necessary.  They make great suggestions based on what I like. They also have a fantastic variety of vape juices and are constantly adding more. The atmosphere is a bit like walking into the family room of a friend. They are a bit further away from me than the place I used to go, but the extra mileage is worth it. I highly recommend Jay's to anyone.

Typical diner food. Super conveniently located next to the hospital. Was disappointed with my omelette, but the hasbrowns were great, as was the corned beef hash and the pancakes. Would return again, for sure. Though, the service wasnt the best, it also wasnt the worst.

John Neubauer, Bridgette Fette, Kayla and the rest of the staff could not have been more accommodating, loving and helping my father Jerry before he passed with ALZ. They worked so closely as a well oiled team to manage his stay and assist us in all our needs as we went through this very rough stage of life.
Many thanks to this named team and all that we're not mentioned.
Steve

We used to eat here at least 1-2 times a month.  The margaritas are good, but everything else, NOT!  

There is one waitress we keep getting who is so stone faced, we are surprised her face hasn't broken.  I mean, I always feel like I am saying the wrong thing.  NOT friendly AT ALL!!!  

The food is only GLORIFIED TV dinners.
Very accommodating to elderly patrons. Always clean and friendly. Food is good, if unremarkable, and reasonably priced. Dined there a number of times and have always come away pleased.
Dr. Donoho is the ultimate medical professional. He is very passionate about his work and is very personable. Dr. Donoho truly cares about your well-being. I would recommend him to anyone.

Do not book here if you have a smaller trailer. They will cancel your reservation without so much as an apology. You cannot count on having a place to stay when you book here. Unacceptable business practice.

7/6/18 - Nino's was just checked by Maricopa County Environmental Services and made the "Dean's List" on CBS 5 News for a full pass, clean kitchen! So happy to live nearby and enjoy this wonderful restaurant. CONGRATS!

These guys did an amazing job clearing out SO much stuff from my grandmother's house after she passed away. It was a huge job. They are quick, professional, and personable. The cost was beyond reasonable! Thank you so much for making a daunting task less stressful.

We had a major ant issue inside our house. The owner DeLane came right out and took care of it. We have not seen one single ant since he was here. At my old house we were dealing with scorpions and crickets and he got rid of those right away also. He truly takes pride in his work. II honestly and truly can recommend open range pest control.

Absolutely love this store for the purchase of clubs. Their fitting staff, particularly Ryan, is friendly, very knowledgeable, and skilled. Both my husband and I have purchased a set each from them over the past year, and when it's time to upgrade we will be back.

We called today to have a large entertainment center hauled away. The father and son team were fantastic to work with. The fee was very reasonable, they were able to come out the same morning, they were experts at getting it out to the truck with no damage. I will definitely use their service again and I would recommend them to friends.
If you want good fast food go to the restaurants in Sun City. I guess if they do it right the residents get mad because this place is 10 times better than the one by me!

I have heard so much about this place so finally thought I would give it a try.  I ordered a plain and simple taco salad.  The first bite just turned me off.  The lettuce was soggy and mushy and there was some odd spice in the salad that I could not identify. Whatever it was, was not good at all!
The waitress gave us about one minute to look at the menu and was there to take the order.  Asked if we could have a few more minutes.  She was back in about a minute again.  We ordered and were checking the place out and in less than five minutes the salad was delivered.  I felt so rushed.  It was obvious that we were not moving to her liking so finished what I wanted of the salad and left.  From the taste of the food and the attitude of the service, I will  not go back.

I honestly don't know why anyone reviewed this place positively.  Every peice of my lunch, taco, taquito, and tamale, all came out of the freezer section at the grocery store.  The best part of my meal was the water.  A terrible, disgusting meal that is best avoided.  Please do yourself a favor and don't go here.  Find a real taco place and enjoy some authentic food
Great customer service, good prices and fast turn around.  Great communication as well.
Excellent Greek breakfast. Generous portions. Fair prices . Excellent service .

When my elderly Dad who lived alone need help with his day to day activities I found Care from the Heart.  The lady they sent out was a Godsend to Dad for 1-1/2 years until he recently went into Assisted Living.    She helped him in so many ways as well as becoming his best friend.  Our family is so grateful to Care from the Heart for their outstanding employee who made a difference in Dad's life and put our minds at easing knowing he was well taken care of in his own home.  I highly recommend their services.

Absolutely garbage business!! If you want a druggie inside your vehicle this is the place for you. Also they give you a price over the phone and once you get there they try to con you into making up charges for other things like removing factory tint etc... very unprofessional once you question their pricing.  Don't waste your time guys, there are much better prices from better places in the valley with more trust worthy people to do the work.

Sun City AZ - The product quality was good but that's where it ends. We planned to use our own installer, but scheduling was impossible so we asked Carpet Corner for a reference.  They recommended one of their installers and said, "They have been excellent."  

Well. they weren't!  The gentlemen who quoted us overcharged for the job and subbed out the work.  The sub cut the tile in a way that left a lot of waste.  This caused me two 70 mile round trips to Gibson Road because they shot through the initial tiles purchased.  The job should have taken 63-64 tiles and took 70 instead.  Additionally, they did not seal the grout and told me to do it in 4 days.  Wait, it doesn't end there.  The metal divider was not installed between the drive the porch. (Which the owner outlined in his services when we haggled over the price).  The installer told me that I should have told him. What?  Communicate with Ryan (Owner). 

All this being said, Carpet Corner discounted any ownership of the shortfalls and offered no financial restitution for the extra trip and tile purchases.  They said that since the installer was selected after-the-fact, that the recourse situation was different.  

I will conclude.  $700 for a 112 square foot job (exterior) is exorbitant, especially when I have to seal the grout, purchase the divider, and never saw the owner who bid the job.  Stay away from Carpet Corner unless you have your own installers and definitely stay away from Savvy Floor Installation unless you want a good gouging.
Fast service, excellent job Jordan. Thank you so much...we will definitely be back! We are really happy with Break & Fix.

Whenever I'm not in Los Angeles, the Bay Area, or Manhattan, I am continually amazed at what can be done when space is not at a premium.  Shopping at this roomy Safeway, which has its own gas station, is nice.  It is appropriately air conditioned for its location and there are carts stored indoors if the ones outside are too warm (particularly a consideration if you are going to put a child in the cart).  Otherwise, this is a normal Safeway.  Alternatives include a nearby Albertson's and Sprouts Farmers Market.

I thought my car looked good before I brought it in. Looks even better tinted out. Pro service along with some great laughs. I would recommend Cutting Edge to my friends, no doubt. 
I read the other review and it sold me. 
Thanks!
I called a day before spoke with Jordan gave me a price and I went the next day. The price stayed the same and very professional. In and out within 25 min. Very good customer service

WOW !!! A Superb dining experience ! The staff was attentive and polite and unhurried.  The food was FRESH and Flavorful with good portion sizes. This was an EXCELLENT dining experience! !!!!

STRONGLY RECOMMENDED
Food is delicious and the staff is awesome! Thank you for the excellent rice, beans and tacos. No coca-cola but who cares! Lol

Rudy did the window tint on my Honda Ridgeline. I had difficulty deciding how dark I wanted to go with the tint. Rudy was patient as we discussed the options. Then he showed me several sample tints and how they would look. 

The man puts a lot of effort in ensuring you get just what you want. His attention to detail is great and very reassuring. It has been three years and not one issue with the tint or its durability. 

Did I mention his price was extremely reasonable? You have got to give him a call, you will be glad you did.

Went there Saturday for lunch with a few friends.  The place looks like a dining room at an old age home...walkers, canes, wheel chairs.  ( I use a walker ),  I ordered the coconut shrimp.....where was the coconut?  They really need a new recipe for the cole slaw...not much taste.  The best that can be said for this place was Casey, our waitress, a very pleasant young lady.

Woke up yesterday morning to no A/C and it was humid and hot!  Tried to contact our home warranty company, and finally after 3 hours they called me back.  The assigned a service ticket and the contractor was pushing the repair visit out 6 days!  No way!  It's summer in Phoenix, are you kidding!?  So my husband called Grand Canyon, they agreed to quickly dispatch someone.  Unfortunately he was on a plane from LA to PHX and I was at work over an hour away.  The tech didn't need access to the house for the likely repair, however, he did need my credit card info.  And guess what I had done just that morning when I left in a flurry due to the A/C issues...left my purse and wallet at home on the counter.  Between scheduling issues, travelling conflicts and lack of payment method - Grand Canyon was great!  Kathy @ office was fantastic and understanding during my 'rant' and the tech, Todd was fantastic as well because I oddly had to have him go into the house, find my purse and get my credit card from my wallet for payment. Talk about crazy day!  Came home last night to the house cooled from 85 to 78 (in only 2 hours) and by later last night finally to a very comfortable temperature.  Very quick service and polite!  Would definitely recommend Grand Canyon.

Kevin over at Xpress Junk Removal is the best. We've used a couple junk removal services in the area that are good, but Kevin is GREAT. He is extremely kind, great communication via phone, arrived on time (able to access the house without someone present which is super helpful during workdays!), did a great job (Xpress takes everything including cleaning supplies) and - of course - has the best prices. Kevin is extremely reliable and just an all around great guy. We wish we would have known him before so we could have used him all the time! At least we know him now and would recommend him to anyone.

I came 15 min before they close so I was really worried on the quality of food I was going to get. There was only another table taken and me. The service was great and my avocado Swiss burger was freshly made. Everyone was friendly and attentive.

I love this restaurant's lunch specials. That being said,  my husband ordered the Walnut Shrimp for lunch today. Ugh, never order it! Fried shrimp on a big bed of mayonnaise with some candied walnuts thrown in. I'm not sure he will get over the nastiness of it. I'll stick to the Shrimp and Vegetables.
Very responsive, professional and good pricing. Would highly recommend.

We always order takeout/delivery and the food is always great. I don't like to go in there and eat because it's not the cleanest place, my first clue was the dirty windows and door walking in. Bathrooms really needed a cleaning also. The service was great when I did eat there.

I called for a second opinion after a quote from the first plumbing place that was recommended to me. I found these guys on Yelp. 

Working on an issue at my Dad's house, I am not sure what I am going to do or who I am going to use, but even at this point I have to say that the customer service from The Plumber Guy has been outstanding!! They have been friendly, quick to set up an cost-free appointment, prompt, and seemingly honest in their assessment and quote.

I'm still trying to decide what to do, but I feel like if I used these guys, I would be very satisfied!!!

We went there for lunch yesterday and what a mistake!! I ordered Chicken Moo Goo Gai Pan and the veggies and chicken pieces were so huge I couldn't eat them. I had to ask for a knife and the bok choy was so tough even then I couldn't cut it. The sauce was so salty, I was drinking water all the rest of the day. When I made a comment about the size of the pieces, our server said next time we come in to tell them I wanted everything cut into smaller pieces. Really??? 1st I'll never eat there again and 2nd - no other restaurant asks you to tell them how you want the veggies cut.

We also ordered Cashew Chicken. Oh YUCK!!!  The sauce was so dark in color, it tasted burnt. Again the veggies were huge and tough and the sauce was extremely salty. We wondered why there was only 2 other tables filled at lunch time - now we know. Stay away. There are so many other good Chinese restaurants around that you don't have to waste your time on this one.

Funky decor. Fresh food.  Nasty Attitude.  Came several times as I like to be fair.

Hard pressed on this one.  Prices are fair.  The dishes we had were quite fresh and sauces good.  Male waiters have language issues but will focus and repeat (good enough for me).  

Issue:  nasty woman waitress.   She doe NOT listen.  She tells you "you won't like it" if you ask to add a vegetable to your dish.....I insisted and said I would pay the one dollar fee.  Ended up with five microscopic pieces of broccoli....so small in fact I did not see them at first.  She snapped "they are there" and proceeded to pick up my plate and shake it so the tiny broccoli  pieces rose to the top.  I asked for the manager and she walked away.

She then sent the skinny waiter to give me the bill and avoided me.  I did not even wish to eat after that.  If it hadn't been high noon and I was on my way to an appointment I would have raised a fuss.

Big question is will I return.   Debatable.  

Maybe to-go or at non-busy times....and most certainly NOT in her section.

This place is not much to look at but the food is delicious!  They don't have a kids menu and the service is just ok but not bad.  This is our third visit and every time the food has been great.  The egg rolls are very tasty and not greasy.  The crab puffs are yummy but not a lot in them.  The potstickers are not my favorite but my husband liked them.  

We always get the orange chicken it's awesome, not too much breading and they give you lots of sauce!  My children love the sweet n sour chicken which is also lightly breaded and has lots of yummy sauce.  

We will be back!
The service was fast, our food was great & our waitress was very nice! My fam & I will deff be going back... There banana cream pie was amaze!
This place is great!  We've never dined in the restaurant, we always get delivery.  The food here is awesome!  The pork fried rice is the best!
We had, my husband and I some jewel fixed up and repair,  the work was wonderful and a good fair price.  I will go back, good people!
Brought my wedding ring here after a pregnancy forced me to have it cut off. The repair is seamless, and they resized the ring to fit perfectly. Great service and personalities at this business.

drop by here a few days ago. Really like the way this place looks and runs. The lady bud tenders are really good looking and helpful. They answer all of my questions throughly and in a nice manner what i really like was that they have all of the meds tested and display on cards. There display was also really cool. I got the 4 grams for $70 deal i pick up 2 grams of blue dream and 2 grams of phancy kush. would be back again

Wife and I came here for dinner, had egg rolls, pork fried rice, & shrimp w/lobster gravy, they put green peppers in the shrimp w/lobster gravy that ruined the taste of the food, we won't go back there again. Menu options also not to my liking.

YOU'RE GOING TO WANT TO READ THIS!!!
TO ALL YOU PATIENTS OUT THERE!!!!!!

Upon my first visit, 7/3, I was treated with kind hellos all around and what I felt was a friendly/knowledgeable staff. Unfortunately, the manager, John or Johnny as some of the staff referred to him, apparently, doesn't know much about mmj. How can you manage a dispensary when your staff know more than you do? Pathetic! Someone needs to give that blonde girl the position, she apparently knows more than he does. 

The quality of my first visit was beautiful! The feminized phenotype with no seeds! Yummy! It was a classic bait and switch though. :( THEY SOLD ME PLANT MATERIAL/POLLEN SACS! 
Apparently, this place charges more for a better looking female phenotype and flowers than the male counterparts. SOUNDS LIKE FOR PROFIT TO ME!Sounds like you're trying to profit off the good flowers and sell the bad plants that produced seeds instead. 
LEAST YOU COULD INFORM YOUR PATIENTS PLANT MATERIAL FROM A MALE PLANT OR A FEMALE PLANT THAT DIDN'T GROW FLOWERS AND GREW POLLEN SACKS IS IDEALLY MEANT FOR OTHER USES THAN SMOKING. 
Or maybe you use them for concentrates? 


On 7/4 they had a special for the holiday. I noticed the same "strain", black knight, was 1/2 oz for $75 tax included. So I tipped a $1 when I purchased the same "strain." PEOPLE, know your bud. THIS PLACE IS DISHONEST. They may have not lied to me, but I noticed they take advantage of using different seeds, clones, etc. while growing one batch. The only reason I say this is because I believe they switched my bud when I went back to complain. 

I know my different types and how plants grow in general. I'm well educated on the matter. . I even asked the gentleman when I bought the 1/2 oz, "if it was the same strain or the same kind as yesterday?" He and a girl agreed it was the same strain as the day before. Unfortunately, it wasn't the same phenotype. They are trying to keep the beautiful female plants for newbies or something else, because apparently they can classify different phenotypes as the same batch, according to, AZ state law, Prop 203.

This new bag of mmj I bought was full of big, dark seeds. Mixed with tons of small little unformed lighter in color, seeds. Hmmmm. . . 

Now if you know anything about MMJ, and the cycles of plants, how they grow, what happens in the lifecycle a of a plant. You would know this place made a dishonest sale of MMJ. 

I am still waiting on the GM to follow up with me with a phone call. They have my number. . . Still nothing. Maybe tomorrow when they see this review. 

To the staff, I appreciate your friendliness, but your compassion upon my second visit was kinda unprofessional, in my opinion, you want an honest review, here: you guys need some honest appreciation for human kindness. Your lack of interest in providing me with the same phenotype of plant, or flower, was dishonest and I know you guys know what you're doing. To the manager, if you're aware of this, sham on you. Selling bud full of seeds, whether they be big or small. 
The only reason I didn't go through the seeds there with you was because I believe someone switched the flower in my bag upon my second time coming in. 

SERIOUSLY, this place is only good if you want cheap bud because they apparently don't have high quality flowers. (BS) Hey I may be back if I need some seedy, lack of flavor and full of pollen. Not full of ThC or CbD. 

The way I see it, and the way one of the staff saw it, there was a bad batch, it was cheaper because of that. They knowingly sold seeds whether they want to admit it or not. Johnny knows. Unfortunately, he doesn't know much about MMJ. 

I would also like to point out, i have no problem with "lesser quality", or "less beautiful", due to different phenotypes, as some might call it, however, the way the flower, between the two batches was 
completely different and you really could have disclosed the differences to me in stead of acting like you knew nothing. 

Also, they stole my seeds that I purchased from them in my 1/2 oz. They claim it's illegal for me to have possession of them and for them to sell them in MMJ but they claim to not have a clue about any seeds of any kind. I live in Phoenix and was in the area of surprise for the weekend, so at least I didn't waste gas on that place.

The Rehabilitation staff (physical and occupational therapists) were wonderful.  They helped my friend to recuperate and get some of his strength back.  Some of the nurses and caretakers were also quite friendly and helpful.  However, the food was certainly nothing to write home about.  In fact, I've tasted better wallpaper paste.  Dry, tasteless, bland, colorless, pieces of cardboard describes it well.  And even that can be excused since dieticians are more interested in wellness than good taste.  But the social worker at that facility was the most un-helpful person   I'd ever met.  When I needed to discuss who to contact to help my friend at home, she threw some pamphlets at me.  Then she scheduled an appointment to talk with at 10 am.  When I got there at 9 am, she was already there upsetting my friend, talking to him about arrangements that he knew nothing about.  Needless to say, she could have put him back into heart attack mode.  Thank goodness, I'd gotten there early.  I threw her out of the room and took care of his home care myself.  It's amazing what a crazy old cat lady can do when she's pissed.  huh?

This place is horrible! Went there and was not attended or acknowledged.  When someone did come by it was 30 minutes later and he was so rude , he didn't even sit us down, instead he kept doing other things.  Don't come here at all! They have no customer service skills! I will take my business elsewhere.

The food is priced right, and the portions are huge. My hubby's beef and broccoli was cooked perfectly, the broccoli was crisp and the meat was tender. The egg soup was full of stuff, including some pieces of mushrooms. I ordered the lo mein and thought it was just okay. The chicken pieces were big chunks and good quality, it just needed more veggies! I'll order it again, but request more veggies. 

This was our first time, and we'll be going back for sure!
Doesn't look like much from the inside but the food is great. No complaints with quality of food. Price seems slightly above average. Will return/would recommend.

My friend and I came here with her kids. She says they order delivery all the time but had never dined in. I ordered the walnut shrimp and it was delicious!!! We ordered the potstickers as an appetizer but they came out after our meal and weren't that great so prob wouldn't order those again. I will def come back to this place though. Great prices for lunch specials with big portions that you can either share or save for later
Super quick and great Customer Service!  Looks like they offer a lot of services and are fully equipped to take care of your MDV and travel needs.
Loved the food.  Ordered delivery so I don't know about the wait staff or ambiance.  Delivery was fast, the food hot and tasty.  Definitely will order from Jade Star again.

Ok after a long thought I will give this place a one star. It's apparent that the manager/owner? Does not quite know the tricks of the trade. Reminds me of the tv show restaurant rescue because they need help! First off:
The kitchen crew was complaining and taking the entire time. Conversations bled into the customer floor and that's a no no. Then THE COOK CANT KEEP HIS HANDS OF HIS FACE! Gross!! In his ear and on his hair. The manager jumps in to help puts on gloves but does not instruct the crew to do the same. 
Second:
The help looks frustrated at the lack of incentives is ovbious. Very not motivated at all. Waited for ever, sat down without menus or drink requests.  She checked on us once? Maybe twice for coffee top up. Tables are dirty and condiments are empty :(. 
Third:
Cleanliness is next to godliness and Jesus doesn't eat here lol.  The forks were dirty had to reject them. The kitchen is dirty just look at the backsplash and see how often they clean up. Bathrooms? Don't bring reading material you're not gonna be long if you know what I mean.  

Lastly the food:
Ok then here is the element intent. 1-10; ten being best this was a 3. When you over cook bacon then you have rookies in the kitchen. Sausage was undercooked!!! (Dangerous stuff lol). Eggs were not over easy more like swimming in grease. Potatoes not even mostly loose ends. Pancakes were not even. Looked like I made those at home (and I suck). 

Overall:  there are NO good bfast places in the west end unless you make the drive to Nicks Dinner on  Litchfield and Waddell ave.   I used to frequent a Carrows in Cali all the time hence why I came here. Sorry folks but nothing to see here. Grab a bagel or something.
