I went in earlier today to see if I could get an appraisal on a little pendant I have owned for a few years now. I had gone to a few other places and was quoted low prices that I was unsure of... I mean it was small, but a diamond with white gold nonetheless. I found John Wallicks company on google and heard great things. I went in there and was immediately greeted with friendly faces asking how they can help. They gave me their honest and professional opinion, cleaned up my little pendant and it looked like new! Unfortunately I had to part with it for personal reasons. They gave me an excellent offer after looking at the piece and even explained the quality of the piece with diagrams and such. They are very informative and personable. I wish I had gotten the name of the nice gentleman and lady who had helped me today. I recommend going here for any jewelry needs. They have a beautiful showcase of various items for sale as well. Thanks again for the quality service.

Dr. Sink and staff were so compassionate and took great care of our loving 17 year old cat "Sonny" I only hope that when it is my time to go I have a Doctor who cares for me as much as Dr. Sink and his staff care for the animals they treat.  Tim

Went to the AZ licensing place and the line was out the door and about 100 people in line. Saw a sign that said you can go to a third party to do title transfers so i headed home to look one up on the internet! On the way home I drove by Quick Stop on Bell about 98th. Walked in and the guys were fantastic and very knowledgeable! They did all the paperwork and had me out the door in under 15 minutes with a new title! Their fees are darn good for how long i would have been in line at the licensing department! Will make Quick Stop my home place for anything related to licensing!

On April 24th my Dad had an unscheduled quintuple bypass. His surgeon was amazing and he was always in great hands with amazing care. He was in the hospital for just five days and for the most part his care & the staff was exceptional. There were a few instances, mainly when he was scheduled to leave this past Saturday that made this review a 4 instead of a solid 5.

What I really didn't care for was learning about the fact that after spending two days in the ICU and three days in recovery, my Dad never once got a bath of any type. There is no excuse for this and it's completely unacceptable!

Had some questions about an issue I was clueless in. I was given tons of information and even a call back that really helped me figure out how to solve the issue. Very friendly, easy to understand. Will use in the future for accounting services
Beware of the gummy bear edibles from Hong Kong-------gave me the runs each time I used them

Whatever you do free your mind from the Denny's experience this is not a Denny's. OK let's start at breakfast hope your hungry because their breakfast is the best along side and bottomless cup of coffee. Now go to work be back for lunchtime they have every imaginable sandwich under the sun both hot and cold served with delicious sweet tea or pop. Finish your day at work shower and grab the family because it's supper time with a while huge selection of kids meals to choose from to steaks so delicious you'll want to come back again and again. I know all this because I used to work here and the staff and customer's are the world's best. This post was not paid for I made it because I really do love the food.

Went there with my husband food was ok, ordered the shrimp with lobster gravy this place added green peppers to the meal,  Never had pepper in my shrimp n lobster gravy before and this ruined the taste. Will not return there again.
Came for plumbing repair. Percise arrival. Great customer service. Job well done. Jeremy was the best representative you could ask for. Informative.

I gave this review one star because it is required to give at least one star.  My granddaughter started preschool here today and it was a far different situation than had been represented when her mother toured with her.  We will not be taking her back and would not recommend this facility to anyone for preschool.  When my daughter toured this facility, there were 20 kids in the room and 3 teachers.  When my daughter dropped my granddaughter off this morning, she said it was very chaotic and there were 25 kids and only two teachers.  When I picked up my granddaughter,  it was utter chaos and I asked the teachers how many kids there were and they told me 27.  The two teachers were quite obviously very overwhelmed.  Also, my granddaughter was crying and complaining of pain in her throat when I arrived.  She informed me that a boy punched her in the throat.  This kind of thing happens with kids, but I do believe if there were more teachers present, this would help this situation improve.  Neither of the teachers had five seconds to talk to me about what had happened in regards to this, as they were so busy trying to manage 27 kids.  My granddaughter's water bottle was still in her backpack and had not been touched for the almost 4 hours she was there.  She was very thirsty and drank a whole bottle of bottled water when I picked her up.   I spoke with Stacey, did not raise my voice, just spoke with her about my concerns that they needed another teacher in that room.  She very obviously did not care at all about my concerns.  After we had left the facility, I then called to speak with Sarah, who informed me that Stacey told her I yelled at her.  I would encourage them to watch any video that may be available where they will be able to see that I did not yell.  This is concerning that Stacey would tell Sarah something so untrue.  It is also concerning that they would care so little about my concerns and the obviously overwhelmed teachers.  Sarah stated to me that the state regulation is 13 kids per teacher and stated there were only 24 kids in the room.  I told her the teachers themselves told me there were 27 and I suggested that they could go above and beyond what the state requires and hire another teacher.  At that point, Sarah got very angry with me and hung up.  Again,  I most certainly would not recommend this facility as a preschool.
Great prices.. Great weekend deals.. On the vape pens... Check it out .. Good staff..

My dad came in for a blood transfusion. His RN is Kathleen in the ER department. She was very friendly and attentive and explained very well what was going on.  The rest of the staff seems friendly as well and professional.

I had to drop it to 4 stars just because of the way the discharge doctor acted towards us when he found out we had been doing alternative cancer treatment for my dad. 
His name is  Dr Danny Wang. My mom told me he was being rude and mean, so I spoke to him on the phone, I said it was my dad's decision and our decision to support what other means of treatment are available besides chemo. 

Hope Dr Wang is more polite to other patients next time. 

My dad said the rest of the staff was great.

Not quick at all! Needed to come in just to add my dad's name to a title !  My dad is recovering from surgery and is in so much pain and instead of expediting things and making them quick like they advertise , they let a new girl who doesn't know what she is doing continue to make mistakes and having to start over. I understand the need for training , but not while an elderly man who is in pain has to sit and suffer .

Great experience for me. I went in to get a Power of Attorney notarized. There were only a few people there when I went, so I got helped quickly. I handed over the paperwork and my I.D. he filled it all out for me and then asked me to sign. Done in less than 5 mins. and only cost $3.00!

I am writing this as a former employee. I cant tell you how many times I heard hospitalists, nurses, cnas, and PAs talk crap about their patients in the ER, definitely discouraged me from ever visiting not only their ER but any Banner ER. The bathrooms around the hospital dont even look like they're cleaned regularly and definitely doesn't smell like they have in sometime. Nurses on the floors are rude, and have bad attitudes. The department I worked in was horrible, bad training, excessive call outs without repercussions, my direct manager was horrible and two faced. When I was hired she kept saying she wants everyone to be successful in this department etc but she waits until things become giant issues to even address it. You never saw her,  and shes completely unapproachable when you did see her I had to go over her head to get my log ins to do my job because after 5 weeks after my hire date I found out she never requested them in the first place and I was supposed to go live the next day. Other coworkers in my department had bad attitudes, the lazy ones are rewarded while the hard working ones get more stuff piled on and treated like crap. They made inappropriate racial jokes and if they didn't like you they'd act like you dont even exist they have no sense of professionalism.  I am sure a few of them were high when coming into work everyday. My direct manager is clicky with certain co workers, obvious favoritism. If one of those said co-workers didnt like another co worker they'd spread lies to the manager who then wouldnt even listen to your side of anything. You're guilty until proven innocent and even then in their minds you're guilty. When I was hired there I was warned about the high turn over rate and I can see why, it's truely one of the worse places I've worked. If I could give this place 0 stars I would.

Unorganized, staff do not review patients records so be careful of allergies. I was made to take test and medicines I did not need just for them to make money. I was very disappointed in the care and will never go back or take anyone there. when a nurse of 24 years cannot even insert a catheter correctly. something is wrong in the air. what is happening to health care? smh...

This place is great! Robert helped me with a title transaction after a death in the family and he was wonderful. I would drive from any location just to have them handle any other future services. It was professional, speedy & friendly. Thank you!!
Eh. ER nurses are hit or miss on friendliness.

Well we ordered delivery online. And I guess they hadn't checked their online orders...because an hour later I called and asked where the heck my food was and they were very apologetic.  They got the food to my house within 10 minutes after I called.  It was hot and DELICIOUS.  Probably the best Orange chicken and general chicken I have ever had.  Big portions too! My husband and I ate and had enough leftovers we will be able to eat a full meal tomorrow too.  I will definitely be ordering from them again,  but will probably order over the phone.  They are very nice and acknowledged their mistake so I was not upset  because of that.  They even threw in a free rice because of the long wait.  So I'm a happy customer.

My family has been doing our personal and business taxes with H&S Accounting for several years now and are very satisfied with the service provided. They are efficient and customer friendly, and always complete our work by the stipulated deadlines. The staff are very knowledgeable and pleasant to interact with. Based on our positive experience, I even recommended them to my two uncles who also switched over from their previous accountants.
They were absolutely wonderful came by with a get estimate. Very polite and professional. They finished our large back yard very quickly with a fountain and walk way! Super happy with the work!
This place is delish!! Prices are reasonable too n food comes out quick. I always get the lemon chicken. Nice n crunchy ;) people are nice too!

The restaurant was dirty food on the walls in the booths, carpets windows everything was dirty. It had musty smell just not good the service was ok never came back around to see if we needed water or anything. There was an employee sitting there listening to his phone so loud you could here all the way across the restaurant. Its a shame there food is good but we won't be back.

Poor. Went there for breakfast. Decided to give it a second try. I specifically asked for crispy bacon and over medium eggs. I told the server that last time my eggs were over easy instead of over medium and said to make sure they were over medium this time.   I also asked that the bacon be crispy, not under cooked. 

Well, my breakfast comes out.  The first thing I see is a lot of "something" on my plate under the little syrup container. Hmm, I wonder. Is that syrup or grease? You guessed it. There's about two tablespoons of bacon grease on my plate. Strike one. 

The next thing I see is that two of my bacon pieces are crispy, but the other two are floppy. Strike two. 

Then, the eggs. I flip them over, and sure enough, the yokes are runny, but even worse, so are the whites! I don't think they even qualify as over easy!  STRIKE three!

The server asks how are the eggs? I tell her not good and show her. She brings a saucer and says to put the eggs on it to be redone. Ummm, kinda hard to do when they are liquid all over my plate!

She come back to collect the plate. I tell her never mind, that I'll just have coffee. No offer to redo or comp the meal. No apology, just "okay." Won't be back.

If you have an after hours emergency DO NOT CALL THESE GUYS. You call the number they list on their website for emergency services and you then get a voice message stating if it's an emergency to call another number they read out quickly, and ONLY ONCE, so if you are not prepared for them to do that you will miss it and have to call again to get it.  They really should put this number on their website, they have a section for emergency services where they repeat their main number as the one to use, why not just place this special number they really want you to call instead of just having it on a voice message only. Who has time for that during an emergency you will just call the next plumber on the list.

Has a good menu and decent service but the place always seems half-empty.  Even when it used to be JB,s it was busier than this.  Food is well-prepared, but the waiter in the back section seems to spend more time schmoozing with customers than actually waiting on tables.  Warning: when it was JB's, the back room area was always freezing cold, due to some glitch in the air conditioning.  Now it is rarely used due to the lack of business, but wear something warm if you are seated back there.  This franchise is owned by the corp that owns Coco's, but does much less business than the Coco's a few doors down.

We are newcomers to Sun City and never tried Carrow's before.  Husband and I both tried the 2 for $20 Nov special.  Both of us chose the turkey dinner, side salad and shared apple cranberry cobbler a la mode.  We were impressed with the flavors and quantity. Enough leftovers for another meal!  The "manager" was aloof when we arrived and even tho it was a quiet afternoon, he walked by dirty tables without helping bus. The waitress eventually bussed all tables while he tried to chat with her. Not showing leadership. Otherwise would have been 4 stars.

I love the atmosphere and the bud tenders are great. Good pre-rolls that actually burn. Flower is a hit and miss with them. Sometimes you get great flower then other times not so much. I guess it's like that with any place.  Also love all the deals and specials they run. If you're in the area to me they are conveniently located. Otherwise I drive to the city.

The food is consistently good and fast for take out. The staff is friendly. Ive never had any issues with my orders. Eating in the service tends to be a little slower but I usually get take out and it's consistently 5-10 minutes. The vegetables are always fresh. The fried rice for take out is a little greasy but its very good.

Very good service. From the second I stepped into the door till I was helped to my car everyone was fabulous I stayed in C339 for 3 days and shift after shift was perfect from RN to CNA to toilet plunger food bringer , I could go on. Everything I could ask for in a hospital stay.

Fried Rice special: (shrimp, chicken, pork), it was very good, the pork was a bit overdone but if tasted fresh and it was seasoned well.

Orange Chicken: Excellent, it comes in a large dinner portion for 2 with white rice. It was yummy, the chicken was tender and flavorful with a sweet and slightly mild hot orange sauce. the breading was light and fried perfectly. The taste of the breading was mild and slightly sweet.

As the terminator said, I will be back.

So how did I get here?  My wife choose to take us on a date that involved us flipping a coin at every major intersection. Heads we turned right, Tails we turn left.  13 rights and 4 lefts later we end up almost 20 miles from home at the intersection of Bell and 99th.  Chinese food sounded good so in we went.

It was a Saturday night and they weren't very busy, so that made me question going in.

First off the food was great.  The egg rolls are some of the best I have had in a very long time. I had orange chicken and my wife had general tso's chicken.   Both had the right amount of crispness, not too much breading, and good white chicken meat.

The ambiance and decor isn't as amazing as the food.

If I did take out it would be a 5 star.  Since the inside look was less than appealing I give it 4 stars.

Great food.... definitely worth trying!!
This is the worst restaurant in Sun City, BAR NONE. The service is slow, the food is cold, and the management is incompetent.

Moved to Sun City about 6 months ago have tried Jade Star several times. Absolutely love everything on their menu. The shrimp are big and tender, the chicken dinners are all superb, my wife love their beef and snow peas. It's so convenient to order on line and delivery is fast and very friendly. This is my go to whenever I want Chinese.

I came here to see Heather Medansky over two weeks ago. I have ADD and explained that I have been on adderall off and on but not since I moved to Arizona. She's the first therapist I've seen in Arizona. She prescribed me wellbutrin instead because it's non-addictive and adderall can leave holes in your heart. This was the worst reaction I've ever had to a medication, I called the office three times to explain this. I got no response to messages, no calls back. The pills made me suicidal. I called again today and was on hold for over 20 minutes before I gave up. This is the worst experience I have had with a medical office. She saw me once, prescribed the wrong drug knowing I knew what worked, and then ignored my calls. The pills made me incredibly depressed and I felt like I was losing my mind. I cannot believe a mental health professional would do this.

We stopped for lunch at this Coco's at the end of September and had a good meal and very good service. Left a good tip and evidently the waitress retired on it! Today 10/17/12 was a different story. One waitress in the whole restaurant at 8am. Very slow service. It took 25 minutes for the food to arrive and it was terrible. A Denver Omelet that looked like scrambled eggs with water running out of them and large hunks of cheddar cheese with the grease running out if it. Another dish of the Florentine Scrambles had the cheese on top of it so hard I thought it was still in a cellophane wrapper. After getting the food, we waited for another cup of coffee since the waitress said she would be right back with the coffee. 5 minutes later, no coffee. Since the food was disgusting and the service so slow, we walked out and went to another restaurant (JiMichael's Lakeview Restaurant) for breakfast. After a while at home I called to speak to the manager about the experience this morning and guess what, nobody would answer the phone. This is not a restaurant we will likely return too.

I have been looking for a Chinese restaurant with a burst of authentic Chinese flavor on the west side and think I have found it! Ordered the sesame chicken and beef with vegetables, both were delicious and highly recommended. Very reasonable prices as well. Probably a restaurant better for take out since they didn't play music and we were eating in silence but the staff was friendly and got the food out to us quick.

We've been there about 4x now. Everytime the food has been good. Love the cream of broccoli soup. They have a good senior menu and prices also. The 2 for 20 are a good bargain. Gluten free menu with quite a few choices .The small sundaes @1.29 hit the spot

I saw there reviews on Google and had received my late grandmother's ring that need to be cleaned, sized and the prongs fixed. I was shocked that they only charged me 177.00... NOW  it's my engagement ring.thank you to the staff for making this ring even more special. You guys will always have my business.

We received a flyer/menu on our front door for this place so we decided to give it a shot! I am so glad we did. 

We ordered house lo mein, orange chicken, crab puffs and dumplings. We were told it would be delivered in 40 minutes. We heard the doorbell ring in no more than 30 minutes!

The food is awesome. I highly recommend both the lo mein and orange chicken. The crab puffs and dumplings are awesome as well! 

I would give it 5 stars, but one time we tried the mongolian beef and it was just a little bland. Try it out!

Location is right behind the uhaul rental place.  The place itself looks very small from outside, however once you are in it's the opposite. Check in process was quick and easy. Simple forms to fill out if you are a newbie. 
The meds are all visible and well labeled for ease of shopping. You can open and smell but cannot touch, which is cool because I lean towards fruity and smooth but not earthy flavors.  There are three levels of quality here. Good, very good, and omg good (plus the eats).  The good stuff is well priced, while the premium stuff is pretty straight forward. Although they had 20% off some premiums this week so it changes.  Points towards your next purchase is available and a plus. 

The people are all courteous and knowledgable, and although you'll likely be assisted by a security guard no worries, thus far pretty cool peoples here. The place is clean and modern. Good spot overall.

BEWARE, BEWARE, BEWARE  BANNER BOSWELL E.R.

Last Sunday I visited my mother and found her to be very lethargic, not alert, and generally out of it.  Her caretaker said that her feet had become very swollen, and they had not been when I saw her two weeks before.  The caretaker also said she is barely eating, and is stopped walking from her chair to the bathroom and release herself in protective panties.  She only walks in the morning from her bed in the bedroom, to chair the front room, and back again at night.

This is absolutely abnormal for my mother who usually can walk fairly rapidly throughout the house.  That she was not eating, not reading the newspaper or doing crossword puzzles which she always did.  I was very concerned and called her doctor, who responded to my call the next day, and came out to see my mother on Tuesday, performed an evaluation, and drew many vials of blood for testing.  Results came back on Friday.  The doctor, Susan Ward, called me, saying she was quite concerned because two of the blood tests came back with highly abnormal readings.  This coupled with her behavioral change and lack of eating, indicated to her, and urgent need to go to an emergency room.

Paramedics took my mom to the Banner Boswell ER on Thunderbird in Sun City.  Before any tests were taken, the doctor walked in the room after my mother had her vitals taken by a nurse, very chipper and happy with a loud voice saying you look fine.  I explained the situation and her behaviors, and he asked if she was back to normal now?  I said no, my mother did not even understand that she was in the hospital, which is totally abnormal for her.  The doctor appeared very unconcerned and says well will find out what is wrong and get her back to normal in no time.

After several vials of blood were taken and 500 mL of fluids are given, and urine obtain from a bedpan, we waited.

Now my mother has atrial fibrillation, but refuses to see a cardiologist, she has stage III chronic kidney disease, which is normal for someone 99 years old, and she did make plans to see a nephrologist.  Her heart is weak because she so inactive, due to the pain in her legs which was recently compounded by the urinary infection which was causing aches and pains and lethargy, as well as her sleepiness.

The ER doctor (Jones) came in, and said she appears to be fine, and that they were going to release her.  I strongly objected, stating my mother is not normal.  She was confused as to where she was.  She did not know what time it was.  She kept sleeping the entire time she was in the bed except when attended to by a nurse or a doctor, which is highly abnormal for her, as usually she is quite alert and talkative.

A bit thereafter a nurse came in with orders to see if my mother was mobile enough to go home, as the doctor stated that in her condition would probably be dangerous for her to go home with only a caretaker for eight hours.

Well, the mobility test consists of walking from her ER bed to the ER but room entrance which was about 7 feet, and then walking back again.  It took my mother all of four to five minutes to walk 14 feet and yet they wanted to release her.

I told the nurse how can they possibly release my mother in her condition, she is not normal.  She is confused, she cannot walk more than 14 feet with somebody helping her and with a walker, she could never make it to 50 feet to bed from her living room chair where she spends most of the day.  I emphasize that this was an entirely new condition, that until a week ago she had not had that much of a problem ambulating, eating, concentrating, reading and doing crossword puzzles.

The nurse said he would convey this information to the doctor.  The doctor never came in, instead a social worker came in, and was quite rude.

Basically she said, your mother should never have been brought to this emergency room.  There is nothing acutely wrong with her that can be treated.  She went on to say, what you should do is either putter on full hospice care, or get her the medical care she requires.

Get this, her regular doctor, Susan Ward, is the one that stated that she should be taken to the emergency room.  It was not a decision my mother made, nor that I made.  That social worker stated the options were to make her comfortable until she died, or give her the care she needs, but she cannot have both.  And she is being discharged now.  She asked whether I could stay with my mom, to which I responded that I was having hip replacement surgery in three days.  She responded "well, the doctor said she is going to be discharged even if it is only to her home with a caretaker there eight hours a day.

They absolutely refused to admit my mother and treat her for any of the conditions that she was suffering from.  My mother has a doctor that takes care of her at home, that comes to her home every three months and more often if needed, such as when she came out to draw my mother's blood and ascertained that my m
Ray is great. Very knowledgeable and helpful. I've been a customer for years and purchased numerous rackets and he always takes good care of me.

We always order takeout/delivery and the food is always great. I don't like to go in there and eat because it's not the cleanest place, my first clue was the dirty windows and door walking in. Bathrooms really needed a cleaning also. The service was great when I did eat there.

We had quite the dinner experience at this restaurant on Christmas Eve... I think the limited employees who were working on this night lost a bet and were required to be there that night -and if they were miserable they were going to make sure EVERYONE was miserable. They yelled at each other from across the room. They argued about who would seat us and begrudgingly found a table for us. The waitress practically threw the silverware at us when we asked for it. It took over 30 minutes for our food to be served. We ordered prime rib and it was served cold. My husband and I still laugh at the absurdity of the whole situation.  We will never go to this restaurant again

This is my very first experience with a rehab facility and I'm glad it was because this place is more like a hospital and it eased me into the harsh reality of what these establishments are typically like. 
 
Very good quality of care received here.  Excellent rehab.  Also, it smells clean when you walk in. The lobby is very nice and has a pretty cool doll house on display. There is a gift shop in the lobby which is ridiculously overpriced.   As you continue down the corridor you pass the vending machines (very important to know where these are located) before coming to the rooms. The nurses and staff were friendly and attentive and it was very clean.

water pouring from our kitchen faucet when in use, unable to find the 
leak.  called the plumber guy and got an appointment for next day
Julio showed up on time, actually a little early..explained problem to
him and he proceeded to tighten the faucet head..."it was difficult to
get the egg off my face"  never thought to check that the head was 
loose...Julio informed me that this was a "courtesy call" and i would
not be charged the $79 fee...   Will definitely utilize their services, if
needed, and recommend them ....Thanks Julio, and
thanks to The Plumber Guy....

We enjoy the muffins they serve here & I usually order them to go.
The honey Bran raisin muffins are unlike any others anywhere. 
They have some sort of
Honey product that makes them super moist & really tasty. 
The parking lot is a bit goofy to enter, its old and needs updating.
We haven't tried anything else on the menu yet.

SPICY MI FUN NOODLES, OMG!!!   So I have been going to this restaurant faithfully for the past 10 months honestly because it is close to my job.  I haven't always got the best services, so I never gave a review,  but I must say it has gotten a WHOLE LOT better.  I always eat the same 1 of 3 different items on the lunch menu and usually its pretty good. Today I decided to try the SPICY MI FUN NOODLES................EXCELLENT, even the waitress has calmed down and is much more friendly....... Now I don't mind spending my money here, GOOD FOOD & GOOD SERVICE

I had az pool come to my home so they could provide me with an estimate for pool repairs. After getting an estimate we could not refuse.. we decided to move forward with the company. I spoke with Candice, a sales rep for the company. She the best! Exceptionally great with communication and very honest - she means what she says! AZ Pool got the entire project done within the deadlines. We decided to hire them on to take care of our landscape as well. Couldn't be happier with the work they do for us! I would highly recommend this company to anyone needing any of the services they offer. After all, honesty is the best policy! THANK YOU AZ POOL!!!

I can't understand why anyone who has eaten in this establishment would give this 4 stars out of 5. To put it simply, this has to be the worst Chinese restaurant in the West Valley. I order Seafood Soup; with the understanding that there would be shrimp, fresh vegetables, with broth that had flavor. Instead, there version of Seafood soup consisted of Egg Drop broth, small portion of processed shrimp, and something that looked like crab meat which was horribly seasoned.

My wife ordered Sweet Sour combination dinner which supposedly had pieces of chicken that really turned out to be totally made of bread. Gross Gross Gross!

My wife and I just go batty when we try to find a really good beakfast place on the west side. I do not think it exists. Anyway knowing it was going to be a sliver above Denny's we went to carrows. We got exactly what we expected. A sliver above Denny's. Oh well the hunt continues for a good breakfast on the west side.

Boswell Hospital! didn't like the picture that's showing for Boswell hospital ..because this has been a great hospital the staff in the cardiac unit at the ICU is amazing and I'm very thankful for each and everyone of the nurses and doctors!

Notaries always on duty. The fee at the time of this review was only $3.00. Can be a bit busy at times. The person that helped me was very knowledgeable,  I just handed over the form & he did the rest.

This dispensary is by far the worst experience I've had . My half ounce is awful it is filled with tiny seeds so far over 100! I left a review on Facebook they do not even respond to customers . Do not buy from here they don't care about the quality of Meds . I urge everyone who has been duped by all greens to file a formal complaint with the department of health . It is bad business and they need to make it right . This is medication .

The food is very good here.  We have eaten here twice, and both times we were very happy with what we ordered.  No complaints, good value. 

A quick suggestion to management: Please do not vacuum the carpet right beside us while we are still eating, and don't mop the floor 10 feet from our table so that we have to try and taste the food through the strong smell of ammonia.
Place was tucked away, and once i found it, i probably had the smoothest MVD experience.  The place is clean and no lines.  Great experience, and very efficient and  friendly staff.

This place is fanatastic! The ambiance is odd, very quiet and full of old folks, but the best Chinese places are always a tad weird. The food is great and the prices are rediculously low, especially their lunch specials. I would highly recommend checking this place out.

While waiting in the ICU waiting room with family as my mother-in-law was critical, it was very disturbing to listen to three volunteers conversing so loud between the three of them, that our family could not carry on important conversations. Families use the waiting rooms not just to wait, but to comfort each other, and these volunteers displayed a total lack of respect for that. They are using it for their social time.
Was not the best but i was hungry and it was filling but if i had to choose between here and traveling further i think i could waste the gas...
Great shop to do business, really friendly crew. Nice to have on the west side of Phoenix metro near Grandmas house!

I was on my way out of the Phoenix area when I needed some food. I stopped at this Coco's in Sun City excepting average. This was better than average. The service was very good and fast. The menu selection was great. It seems like there were too much to choose from. I couldn't decide. A great place to stop if you want to get something delicious but you need to get on the road quickly.

Our Hot Water heater went out and our Sears Home Warranty sent out Junior from BK Plumbing.  He was professional and knowledgeable.  He advised us our 75 gallon hot water heater needed to be replaced.  After calling sears he came back and said I have some good news and some bad news.  Good news Sears approved the replacement of the hot water heater, bad news is, since our heater was 75 gallons Sears has to buy the new unit and BK then can pick it up.  Two days later we heard back from Sears and BK plumbing, and we set up an appointment to have the new unit installed.  Bk Plumbing advised Sears covered everything except $289 including the initial service charge of $60.  On the day of the appointment Jason and Junior showed up actually 15 minutes before the scheduled appointment.  2-3 hours later we had a new water heater and it works great.  Before they left Junior went over the operation of the new water heater.  This is a great company and if you need work I would recommend.  Also if you have a home warranty please ask your company if they work with BK Plumbing, if they do ask for them.  One last thing there are no hidden charges, what they tell you it will cost is what they charge.

Robert and the rest of the staff are amazing. Great organization and highly skilled people make your experience a pleasant one. I travel further to them due to their outstanding service. This place is impeccable!

I switched to this clinic based on a suggestion from my groomer. Dr. Sink's staff is MUCH MORE personable, friendly and helpful than the office I moved from was. I am pleased with the service that I get here.

Dr Sahni has been my provider for many years and he is the most caring provider I have ever met! But unfortunately I cannot say the same about his current staff. Jessica is a horrible medical assistant! It takes forever to be able to schedule an appointment, referrals are never done on time, my medications are not being filled on time. It's annoying! I shouldn't have to be the one pushing her to get things done, NOTE: ITS YOUR FUCKING JOB! Last time I was roomed she smelled like weed, as if she went to her car to get high. I wanted to make a report with the office manager but again no one ever answers the phone!! Its unfortunate for such a professional Doctor to have such an unprofessional staff. I have an upcoming appointment soon.. and I hope Dr Sahni terminates her because he should not have an unprofessional medical assistant be the one to represent him!

Slow service and food was room temp when it finally came. Eggs Benedict not good unless warm. Tex-Mex omelette flavor was good but dish was not hot. Now we know why parking lot was half empty on a Saturday morning.

I went to All Greens one time and it'll be the only time.  Walked without even buying product.  Let me explain.  I'm a concentrates only person.  Some of the concentrates they were trying to peddle were black and dark brown in color.  I'm used to 80-90% THC tested.   Their stuff is 40s and 50s.  Not only that, but you could tell their concentrates guy has no idea what he's doing by the consistency in which the product was coming out.  The "top shelf" concentrates not one of them was clear or pressed.  All murky garbage.  Picked out a few varieties however.  4 grams.  They seriously tried charging $160.  Almost double what you pay for better quality product elsewhere.  You want good concentrate?  Don't bother going here.  Go to White Mountain Dispensary a half mile west of there on Bell and get product in which the dispensary gives a crap about its quality and patients health instead of turning a profit.
This is the most professional tennis shop in Phoenix. Ray the owner is the BEST. Ray takes the time to listen and help all levels of players Ray is 100 percent customer focused.
I went to the ER to visit a family member. We had to wait about 10 minutes to get in. Other than that, the hospital seemed clean, and staff seemed competent from what I saw.
As a new hydro-grower, this shop has it all. The staff is very helpful and knowledgable. This is a great West Valley go-to store for all your hydro needs.

Where do I begin!  I discovered this "gem" of a store from someone I worked with.  I took in several of my mother's pieces to have resized, fixed, and cleaned.  They did such a fabulous job that I brought in my daughter-in-law to design an addition to her wedding band (using one of my mother's diamonds.)  Richard truly took his time with us and came up with a design she loved.  She will surely go back with my son to show what he created!  I would not hesitate to recommend this store to anyone.  I really needed to find someone to trust with my beloved mother's jewelry and I found that trust in John Wallick Jewelers.

My wife, friends & I have been eating here for over 3 years and we've never had a bad meal. The lunch specials are wonderful, filling and inexpensive. The dinner meals are delicious and filling. I've had their Mongolian Beef, Lo Mein, spicy pork and all have been very tasty. Their War Won Ton soup is excellent.
Try it, you'll like it.

Tried again.  No crazy waitress this time!  Food is on point and fresh. They decreased portion size to normal--personally, I like that.  No MSG: No problem

 Really what I am looking for: Price point, ease of use, freshness of food.  I will return.

They do delivery, so for convenience on a hot day....just saying!

Had this 3 times for lunch, Kung Pao shrimp twice which is the best I've had. The sauce is so amazing and spicy, and they give you large shrimp! I also had the shrimp fried rice, which was good as well with those jumbo shrimp. I did try the orange chicken, wasn't a fan of the texture, didn't eat that. The sauce was yummy, so I might try orange shrimp next. The spring rolls are pretty good.

ONE STAR FOR LUNCH COMBO INCLUDES EGG ROLL AND CRAB PUFF WHICH WERE YUMMY BUT Gosh I wish I could say this place is adequate at best but it is not. Food is always over cooked staff very rude if you You ask for any . Soup always very old and  snotty,yuck , tried egg drop and hot and sour. Tried pretty much   4 different dishes,garlic chicken,sweet and sour chicken, Chop Suey, and Kung Pao Chicken, Unfortunately its the only chinese by my work and I keep hoping at least one dish will rise above the rest. Call be an optomist,or a fool but I love all kinds of Chinese and rally wanted to give them a chance plus they are so close it's convenient. Anyways I now drive an extra 4 miles 8 round trip down Bell Rd to get descent chinese food. What a bummer.

I recently had a bowel resection at this hospital, I was in the hospital for 3 days and during the 2nd day I began to get a herpes simplex on my lip. 7 days later and now I have a full blown cold sore and a sore inside my mouth. I got this infection while in the hospital. I suggested to the interviewer that they should have an open box of handiwipes on every food stand in every room. Who knows how many patients go the bathroom in there room and come back and touch where the food is served. Also every patient that comes to the front door of that hospital has got something wrong with them  yet there is no place to wipe the germs off there. All the grocery stores I go to have handiwipes inside the front door and the hospital does not. Also my surgeon told me that if I was going to get an infection in my incision I would get it here.

We were replacing all of our floors. The owner of Cornerstone flooring will take all the time you need. He isn't trying for a quick sale you might regret later. He will answer all your questions. And more importantly will answer the questions you didn't know you needed to ask. His installers are the best.  I would recommend Cornerstone without reservation for any size job.

Horrible! My wife came in for gall bladder surgery. While they were inserting the breathing tube they cut her throat. Sent her home the same day and within less then 24 hours her throat was now infected, swollen, almost shut and Her neck was now twice the normal size. They also managed to blow out both arm veins from the IV. Since we then had to go back to emergency so they could fix the mistake they created, they now can't get a new IV in either arm. She almost died due to the complications. Very upset! We have hired an attorney. Check out hospitals before u need one.
Phone number no longer active and the website is just a bunch of links to spam. Assuming this place is no longer around
Came  on time as promised. Fixed the problem right away. I will put them on my list for future plumbing needs.

I've eaten at the Coco's numerous times over the past two years.  The staff is friendly and very pleasant but the temperature in the restaurant is about 60 degrees every time I've gone.  Seriously, I wear a jacket and scarf inside even when the temp outside is warm.  The mediocre food and the arctic temperatures have driven me and my family away.  We now go to the Coco's on Bell Road.  The temperature there is comfortable and the food is much better.

My wife and I visited this restaurant recently, and we will never return. The place was empty, and a short-haired girl was sitting at a table in front. She was the hostess, but didn't have the ambition to get off her chair and seat us. We seated ourselves....then waited probably 5 minutes for this girl to ask for our drink wants. We both ordered coffee, and I take cream. She brought the coffees with some cream for me in a separate container. I poured the cream and it came out in chunks! Entirely spoiled! Our food was good, but the ambience, along with the attitude of the people working there had already convinced us that we would never return. The place wasn't clean by any means either. Do yourself a favor: make the short drive to Good China on Union Hills Rd. near 83rd Ave. Clean, very friendly staff, and great food!

The staff is just unbelievably compassionate. My mom has been staying here for three days so far, hoping she gets discharged today. Rose who is in charge of EVS literally came in just now and wanted to make sure my mom was being treated right and everything. Made my mom cry and everything. What a wonderful employee. Aaron from the ER sounds like Aiden from SATC, lol but really good RN, very patient.

Quick service, great attitude and no line. Much better than going to the DMV.

They're a little tough to find. Just go to the north end of the building that Hertz is located in. Plenty of parking.

Horrible service, went for lunch and was ignored for about 20 minutes and ended up leaving. Tried to give the restaurant a second chance and went back a second time. The waitress was extremely rude. When I motioned to the waitress to come over she yelled across the restaurant what do I need to scome over there for ? I had originally ordered my meal to go because I didn't think I had time to eat there but ended up having time to eat and was told I wasn't allowed to do that ... if I'm a paying customer and the restaurant is not full why would you refuse to let me eat there? I will never eat there again .

Disappointed and so wanted a good Chinese meal in Sun City.  Ordered for takeout and it was ready and hot!  However, the combo meals were a disappointment. Each comes with entrée, soup, lo mein, fried rice & a crab puff.   Fried wontons (with cream cheese) were substituted with no notice for the crab puffs. Egg drop soup was ok.  Lo Mein was tasty but a bit sticky like maybe not fresh.  Fried rice was more like brown colored white rice - absolutely no flavor nor vegies. We love fried rice but this was not as expected.  Entrees: shrimp with lobster sauce - shrimp was very good, large and tender.  General Tso's chicken:  rubbery chicken cuts so we couldn't eat it.  Orange chicken: very good!  Why would the chicken pieces be tender in Orange Chicken but not tender in General Tso's chicken?  This restaurant was empty at 5pm and it's hard to imagine how they stay afloat in Sun City without specials for the seniors (like 2 for 1, etc)  Maybe would have given 4 stars if not for the fried rice and General Tso's failures.

I have been a client here for a while now. It was the first place I went to. Everyone was so welcoming and helped educate me about their medicines. 
They have daily specials and they also have the option for loyalty customers so that you have the option of discount prices ALL THE TIME! they are exceptionally well on customer service and make you feel right at home, even if you are brand new to the MMJ world. Great fluffy flowers, edibles, drinks, ointments...this place has it all!

The staff here is wonderful! I would recommend to anyone that has to take their loved one in for any procedure.  First of all, when we arrived and left, there is staff outside waiting to help either by transporting with a golf cart or just helping you get out or into the car. Then we went to the floor where my dad was getting his procedure done. There was a tech there that called my dad back. She was SO hilarious. She started by sayting "ok the next contestant"  When something so serious is being done and you have someone like that who is making the mood alot less stressful..well I give thumbs up to that!  It made me and my dad feel alot more easier about the whole situation. Thank you Boswell!

My son started going here as an emergency backup at 7 mos old and he is now 11 mos old and going there full time.  I couldn't be happier! The teachers are nurturing and caring and the infant room is clean and intimate leaving little chance of the children getting hurt or not being watched.  Every teacher there makes an effort to get to know the families and the babies go on "walks" and have great interaction.  Communication is always very open and I love the atmosphere.  It's a bit on the pricey side, but I would pay whatever was necessary after a bad experience at a different daycare chain.

Well, this place gets the all-time award for the WORST "Chinese" food I've ever had and I've been eating it for over 35 years and nothing can be this off. Disgusting. On top of that, the person there waiting on tables should be banned from the place. I saw something today that
I couldn't believe and have never seen in any restaurant, EVER. She answered the phone and somebody was asking about their food. She must have become tired of talking to her, because she said, "Can you hold for a minute???" and put the receiver down. Only to go and do other things in the restaurant....clear table, etc. Then, when she was all done, she walked over to the phone and got rid of the person on the line. She was clearly wanting the person to hang up.I've NEVER seen anybody in any restaurant do this. Absolutely no regard for the customers OR the food. When it came, it was so bad I left 90 per cent of it on the table and got out of there as fast as I could. I wouldn't give that food to a dog if it was starving. Again, I know this food. If you got a good meal there, you're lucky. Oh, did I forget the sick feeling on the way home? Yep. You know what I mean. Never again.
We come here for breakfast about twice a month and to purchase pies for speacial occasions. Service and speed always varies but we like the atmosphere and the food is always good.

My wife and I stopped in for dinner tonite at 645 there were 4 people about ready to leave and another table of 2 we were seated and asked what we wanted to drink. Then our order was taken....the phone rang and the only person working the floor answered the phone and told the person he didn't have time to take an order. We got our food and my eggfoo young had noodles which my wife ordered and her chicken had my fried rice. We motioned to the waiter that the food was mixed snd just brought us 2 empty plates to switch the food ourself...nice touch. I then wanted hot mustard and went to the counter and the phone rand again and he told the person calling they were closed...this was a bit after 7 and the sign on the door has hours to 9 every nite. I then tried to cut my eggfoo young with my fork but it was too hard and dry. When the waiter came by I told him it was not eatable. He then gave me the check for 2 both meals. I went to the desk and asked for the manager and of course it was the same guy. I told him I was not paying for a meal I could not eat. He said give me $15 the bill was $21. I gave him the money and will never return. The Arizona food inspection dept should visit this place dirty and strange smell from kitchen....
Wonderful management and staff... Great environment for kids!  Bright Horizons uses emergent curriculum to enhance and individualize learning.  They are not just babysitters!

My son attended Bright Horizons in Sun City since he was 3 years old. He went there for one year. I really  love the staff at Bright Horizons. Stacey the assistant director is always willing to give you what you need and is a very kind and caring person. Our son's teacher Ms. Jewelie is amazing. She has a great balance between love and discipline. All the teachers we have encountered are very friendly and nice. I feel a bit sad that we will not be continuing his education next year at Bright Horizons, due to the fact that it is too far to drive.

The school has both part-time and full-time opportunities. And was very flexible with us when we need it. To me the school felt like home.
Tried their delivery. Food arrived on time and hot. The food is really good. Loved the house fried rice.

This is our third time here and we could not ask for better service!   The food is VERY reasonable and delicious!   Coffee is good and bottomless OJ!!!!  We had Trent and he was fantastic! Melissa, the manager, came by numerous times to ensure everything was ok...was a very pleasurable breakfast!
Was in there with my partner took almost an hour just to get food service was very slow as if she didn't want to b there and it was at lunch time but the place was empty

I have never been to a Carrows before.  I was pleasantly impressed with the service, coffee, and food.  The service was welcoming and friendly, i.e., we were seated quickly and received menus and coffee.  The coffee was very good and the menu had a lot of choice for all appetites.  I had a selection from the light menu which contained whole grain panakes, scrambled eggs, and ham.  It was a perfect portion and price with good flavor.  

The service was fast and we received our orders quickly.  This is the perfect place to take your grandparents to for a quick bite.

First time visit last night - my wife was a bit skeptical since we arrived a half hour before closing and we were the only ones there. But that's Sun City on a weekday night. Wife is gluten free but Jean our waitress helped her. Food was great!! And the portions were more than adequate. We'll be back ... a lot.

Was lied to several times by nurses and doctor, once I mentioned lawyer they called security, they will not prescribe proper medicine and lie to you about the laws, I had Arizona state board of pharmacy on the phone and they refused to talk with them, currently I am on my way to another hospital to see if we can get treated with proper medication, and it's not for opioid.....they just don't want to do their jobs....they should not be able to receive federal funds if they do not want to help people with different insurances.  I am will to listen to anyone else who is having a similar experience and let's get a class action going
good food but poor service! waitor kept saying he was tired..it was very obvious. Also him and a woman with short hair stood there speaking their language and laughing. That was odd.

We're always scared to call a plumber because we haven't been able to trust them in the past. But tonight we had a water emergency and called The Plumber Guy and couldn't be happier. Ignacio was one of the most professional contractors we have ever used. He was so nice that my husband and I wanted to invite him to dinner! :o) He arrived quickly worked efficiently and let us know the price even before he began the work. We are definitely repeat customers. 

Robin and George Gardner
So quick, in and out in under 10 minutes. I'll gladly pay a few extra dollars to skip the dmv.

I visited this chain 30 years ago in South Phoenix when I was in town for a wedding. Needless to say I was thankful that I brought along Pepto Bismol. That was the last time I had a patty melt and the last time I went near any Carrows. 

About two months ago my wife wanted to try it having never been there. I mentioned my previous experience but agreed to give it a try.  We were seated almost immediately and our waitress brought water then returned within a few minutes to take our order and we waited. We waited. We waited. Finally after other patrons started leaving we asked another waitress if there was a problem. 

Apparently the only cook on duty was new and couldn't keep up with the demand. Finally after 70 minutes we asked our waitress if it would be much longer and she said she would check. She came back shortly and said our order hadn't been started. We got up and left. The manager asked us as we walked out how our food tasted and we told him he couldn't possibly be the manager otherwise he would have known the cook had issues. Avoid this location is my best advice.

First of all I'm a nurse, I brought my father here for difficulty breathing due to a mass on his neck and in his throat so we go in and I start telling the receptionist my dad's symptoms and all his info and the receptionist says it's weird your answering all his questions with an attitude and I say he's having difficulty breathing which means he can barely talk. Just a complete rude person that should not be at the job she's at if she doesn't understand that you can't really talk while having difficulty breathing. The nurse at triage was great very sweet. Still sitting in ER after 30 minutes with my dad having difficulty breathing, that's not acceptable. Probably wouldn't come back here if it was a 911 emergency. Only came here because it's around the block from my dad's house next time we'll travel a little farther away for better customer service. I knew the reputation of this hospital as I deal with this hospital frequently but thought maybe all the bad rep was just talk and give them a chance but the receptionist blew that.
This place has horrible customer service the waitress was rude! Will not be coming back to this establishment. Food was at best a 5/10.
My wife & I have eaten here for several years. We've had lunch & dinner. The food has always been wonderful & the service is very good & prompt. Great Chinese restaurant!

This place is amazing. The staff is super nice! I came here for my TSA pass thing, and had an appointment with Candice. She was cheerful, genuinely kind, and efficient. This was such a pleasant experience and infinitely more convenient than going to the airport. 

They do DMV or AZ calls it MDV stuff too. I've been wanting to convert a van (I don't even have one yet!), and Lucas looked up for me to know what I need to install in the van to convert it to a recreational vehicle for insurance purposes. Above and beyond for someone who wasn't going to be an immediate sale. 

I highly recommend this place. It's so refreshing to go places that enjoy their work.

I have been here several times for title/notary service as well as licence plates and registration needs. The wait is always minimal which is awesome. Anyone unlucky enough to sit at the DMV all day just to be told you have to return with additional documents will appreciate this place. Fast an efficient service with friendly and knowledgeable employees. I will continue to use Quick Stop.

What's not to love about Jade Star? HUGE portions, great service, unbelievable prices and yes - YUUUUUUUUMMY food!  Brought a large group here over the weekend and we all ordered combo dinners for around $9.00. Food was excellent and the leftovers even better. Some recommendations: General Tso chicken, chicken fried rice, spicy pork, chicken & mushrooms, Kung Pao chicken and egg drop soup.
BK Plumbing now The Plumber Guy has excellent customer service. They are very reliable and take pride in a job well done. I would highly recommend them. Great Job Guys!

If you are looking for any type of flooring, Lyle Harrenstein at Cornerstone Flooring is exceptional.....he KNOWS his products. He takes the time to get you the best deal possible and his installers are outstanding!   We are very particular about any work that we have done in our home.  We replaced carpet with wood floors in two bedrooms and carpet with ceramic tile in a walk-in closet....we couldn't be more pleased with the results.  Their product/installation prices are competitive and the personal service we received was first-rate.    Cornerstone Flooring earned our highest recommendation!

We were really looking forward to eating here. Locals we met highly suggested it before our Wi-Fi was up to log into Yelp.
Service was poor, food was OK, atmosphere was OK. Just OK. Not good enough to get us to return and recommend this restaurant. We had a substitute server who normally works at another of the owner's restaurants, one food item was under-cooked, server was absent after food was delivered; no drink refills, then had to get check from cashier. No one claimed to be the shift manager. Ugh.

We've been using them for several years now.
Scott Lemley is our CPA here and he is awesome!
Thorough, effective and efficient.
This is a company you can trust.
I'm glad I came here. They always take care of me when I come. Today I broke my toe. Cast time.

Thank you Scott for making my tax prep quick, easy and trouble free!  I see why everyone has given you 5 stars.  You are a polite professional as is your staff.  I highly recommend H&S for your tax prep needs!

I wish I would've read the reviews BEFORE going to Carrows.  We went there 2 days ago.  The waitress was anxious to take our order, then we waited, and waited, and waited.  My husband ordered breakfast, it didn't look too appetizing , but he said it was good.  
I ordered a Pastrami sandwich, which looked great on the menu for $8.59.  My sandwich had 2 1/2 pieces of grisly pastrami, a slice of Swiss and a couple of pieces of onions, it was totally flat.  I called the manager over and said, "this sandwich costs $8.59."  Her mouth fell open, she apologized and said she would remove it from our bill. She was very kind and embarrassed.  I will try to download the photo of the sandwich. We won't be going back there again!
I had to change this to 5 stars; the quality is consistently awesome, and we never wait more than 20 minutes for our food to arrive when we ask for it to be delivered!

This place was pretty darn good!  The crab puffs were my favorite omg! The mushroom chicken and orange chicken were very good.  The beef broccoli ok.  We were short one crab puff though. The egg drop soup was a little too thick for my liking.

Delivery guy was fast.

We will definitely be eating there again!!

I am giving this company 3 stars because of the following:

The customer service was excellent once I got someone on the phone. He was personable and arrived at the property promptly and fixed the problem.
HOWEVER!!!!

Rodney F. was accurate when he stated that the website's number for emergencies was not an accurate number.  I had to number hop just like he did. I complained about this. I felt he was vague in his explanation and didn't really take my complaint seriously to do anything to change the narrative.

I almost fell over when he charged me over $800 to stop a water tank leak which was causing flooding in the garage.  I realize it was after hours, but I felt he took advantage of me because I was calling from out of state.

Boswell Hospital is in Sun City - major geriatric center so you know the staff is used to working with hard of hearing and slow moving patients.   I have to say that the staff across all disciplines/professions that we interacted with were exceptionally friendly and professional.  They made my 90 year old fathers stay (pre and post bowel surgery) comfortable and very upbeat.  The surgeon, Dr Goodman was very matter of fact and took time to answer our many questions on each of his patient check ins with my dad.   Would recommend this hospital to anyone in need.  This is our 3rd encounter with a Banner hospital.  Top notch across the board.  And it's very telling that so many of the employees have been at Boswell 5+ years!   So much better than encounters at Abrazo facility - West Valley Hospital which was horrible.   Even the cafeteria at Boswell was great and very reasonable.

Have never eaten in the restaurant. Always have ordered take out or delivery.
That being said, love the food here! Always spot on for this picky Chicago couple. Great portions, friendly delivery driver. A couple of our favorite menu items are the chicken fried rice, Mongolian beef and don't get me started on the pot stickers, num! Jade Star has become one of our families staples.

Although this doctor is good his office is horrible. They don't do what they are suppose to do. My husband has to call every time to get them to follow through. He has been out of his medicine for two days now and informed them before it ran out and the pharmacy had tried to contact them to get his prescription renued but nothing. They never call my husband back when he leaves a message. Changes must be made.

We've been coming to this particular location for over 7 years at least 3 times a month because we always received the best service from our server, Fey, who just happened to not be working this evening.  we were looking forward to having the "2 for $29" entree & wine dinner.  When we arrived, there were only 2 parties of 2 dining.  There were 3 servers & no manager.  We received no greeting & were told to take the 4th booth on the left.  We were neither walked to our booth nor handed menu, whatsoever.  We sat for 15 minutes without one serving coming over to us at all, not even to give us a menu or even offer us water.  We both stood up & walked around & still every server ignored us.  We stood at the cashier counter for about another 5 minutes, expecting the friendly attentive manager who usually checks us out so we could make him aware of our disappointment.  all 3 servers walked by & still ignored us.  so, we left & landed at to Coco's on Bell Rd. & 98th Ave., only to be greeted & served as we're to be served.  When Fey isn't there, things are not up to par.

My son went here for a little over three years and I couldn't be more pleased. Extremely professional, resourceful, and communicative--this place has an excellent environment for both parents and children in such a crucial stage of their development. Thank you especially to Ms. Jewlie, who opened doors for my husband and I to see and interact with our son in wonderful new ways.

Had to get an appraisal done and the price and turnaround was quick and perfect price. Staff has always been super nice and go out of their way to please their customers. I will always come back and recommend to others!

If you go to the emergency room here & you get PA Daniel Schultz, ask for someone else. He knew I was allergic to a medication but he still attempted to prescribe it to me. I found out after going to my PCP a week later that Daniel had misdiagnosed me. Given how rude he is you would think he would at least know what he's doing.

Dont get lied to!!!! I went in for their awesome half ounce ounce deal and was flat out lied to i had to use price to determine thc cbd content since no one could tell me so i spent a few bucks more then the normal sale and was assured it to be worth every penny and that was a complete lie. Not only is the medicine incredibly harsh its very low in medical benefit i will never be duped by them again. I wish i would have read more reviews before i visited. Im sure most of us out there are on a limited medication budget and when your lied to and spend it on garbage it really hurts not just your wallet but your body as well from lack of medical benefits. So disgusted!

What, it's not cool to review a hospital?  Ok, I'll make it short.   As a recent transplant from Kaiser in Woodland Hills, Calif (where I was very pleased with the hospital and care)....well this is a big step above.  I don't want to go back, but I would go here if I had a need.  And I'd ask for Barbara in intensive care!!!

This is so much better than going to the DMV. There were a nice bunch of guys that helped us out and they were friendly and helpful.... not anything like any of my other experiences at the DMV. If you need to take care of anything having to do with your title or car registration, go see these guys. :0)

We bought our new tile from Cornerstone Flooring Brokers on Bell in Sun City. They refuse to take back the excess tile on a refund.  I even offered to pay the freight back to their factory. I'm now out $355.00 on excess tile. I would advise you NOT to buy tile from them unless you can be accurate on the number of units needed for your project. They recommended we purchase 10 to 15% over for waste. We did that and now I have $355. Of tile left over. We made that purchase based on their figures. They were not the least bit sympathetic. Apparently their recommendation brings them additional income from your project. I now have 9 boxes of leftover tile for a total of 132 square feet at $3.29 which includes a discount for cash. If I would have used a credit card.... I wouldn't have suffered the loss. Cash discount is not worth it. Remember, don t buy from Cornerstone if you are in the Phoenix/Surprise/Sun City area.Try Kennedy Flooring!!!

I am new to tennis and have had a hard time finding a good selection of tennis equipment. My friend told me about this shop and I was very surprised and happy to find it! Great selection and found just what I needed. Ray was knowledgable, friendly and helpful. They have a great demo program for $20 you rent 3 rackets at a time to try over a few weeks. Exchange any you don't like and try out others until you find the right one, and the $20 goes towards your purchase.

NO stars. This place has incompetent unprofessional nursing staff that do not know how to handle chest pain, do not know how to assess a patient. Neglected my grandmother whom complained of chest pain for over an hour until we the family decided to call 911. This place was reported to the Banner compliance line and to the state board of nursing for their un professionalism nursing and neglect. Their supposedly charge nurse Kerri Ann walked in texting and made no eye contact with the family nor bothered to ask the patient how she was feeling. Their physician assistant advised family not to call 911, because she thought we were jumping the gun. My grandmother got admitted for 4 days to the hospital with angina- chest pain. I have yet to hear from the so called administrator that said she would talk to the family about the incidence. But we'll see how she answers to CMS-medicare agency and the state when they make a visit!

*****Over Charging for the hell of it**** 

You can't make this stuff up... Tony tried to bamboozle me.... Arizonans Phoenicians here's my story. 

Plumber guy came out because  I needed a new water heater installed, I already had the replacement waiting for Tony when he arrived.  I asked Tony what the price would be, and the first thing out his mouth is "you know water heaters are expensive." Then Tony said let me find you a coupon I knew this was going to be an AZZ Reaming. Tony then says we have a $75 coupon; an the total would be $412 rip-off it is 3 connections,  lighting the pilot and Tony would be done for $412 I will find someone else.

I went to visit my mother and when I came out my car didn't start. I went inside to ask for help and was informed that security did not offer this service anymore. Unbelievable. With the amount of elderly in this area and the possibility that the weather could be extremely hot, its fathomable that that this staff should look the other way and leave people out in the heat to wait for tow truck without offering to help. Seriously!!!  Those jump start devices cost only a couple hundred dollars. What is the deal?  I'm embarrassed that Banner-Boswell has chosen to save $200 rather than helping people whose cars need a jump start.

A friend recommended me to this pharmacy and I have to admit I was skeptical at first since I'm used to going to large pharmacies like Walmart or Walgreen's.  But I'm glad I went because the manager was super helpful and genuinely concerned for my well being.  I was not feeling well, and he sensed that and offered to deliver the medicine to my home since I live within 10 miles - for free!  Its an amazing and unique service.  Since then I've gone back a few times and always get the same amazing treatment, such as really good advice on what over the counter medicine to take to minimize side effects.  It's like having a friend in Pharmacy.  I am done waiting forever for bad service at the other large pharmacies...I'm sticking with Rightway, and highly recommend it to others as well.

This pharmacy does not help people in need. My son had PCL surgery and was prescribed pain medicine. His knee was hurting so while he was in physical therapy across the street, Core referred me to them. They refused to provide service/fill his prescription because his phone GPS said we lived 7 miles away. He said he only helps people 5 miles or closer.

We are a totally satisfied customer of The Plumber Guy! Yesterday was the second time we've used them (different plumbing problems each time) and we would definitely call on them again if the need arises. First of all, I like that they have someone answering the phone when I call the office, rather than an automated attendant. Patrice in the office was friendly and helpful, she looked up my account from previous, and arranged for the same technician (Jeremy) to come out for the service. Jeremy is extremely knowledgeable, and he was able to resolve my problems quickly on both occasions, and the charges were very reasonable. We highly recommend The Plumber Guy.

I would give it 5 stars if I would! Zippity-zap quick service and this place has the nicest staff. there's this one nice girl there that always takes good care of me who's name I can't even pronounce.. is It Kir.. Karen? Kirian? Oh who cares but that's some quick fucking service if I've ever receive some ! 10  out  of  10  points

If we could give it a zero we would. We sat in the waiting room for 45 minutes and watched the lady up front in the drivers license area laugh at everyone and be rude cause she couldn't help them. Like it was the customers fault they didn't know she was incapable of helping. When we were called she treated us the same. Like how dare we ask for help not knowing she couldn't help us. Why laugh at us any everyone who walks in?! Most horriblely I've ever been treated anywhere. Don't waste your time.

I've eaten at a lot of Chinese restaurants and many of them don't make their soups and dishes fresh when ordered, but every order we've gotten here has fresh ingredients with each retaining its distinct taste. Their War Wanton soup is the best I've ever had and so is their fried rice. Since most all shrimp sre farm raised these days they have no taste at all, no matter where you get them. But the shrimp in the fried rice and other dishes here are not only very tasty but cooked just perfectly. I'll admit, the atmosphere leaves something to be desired but I'm rating the food.

Spent 2.5 days there recently due to a sudden illness.  I found the nurses fine and got good service whenever I called.  Due to my illness, I couldn't stand up, so had to use a bedpan for 2 days and never had to wait for it which was great.  All the Aids were nice and helpful.
Only negative person I encountered was a really rude white guy in the emergency room who has a beard that is grayish mixed with light brown, so avoid him if you can.
However, I became suspicious there as they were going to run additional testing when I started saying I wanted to go home--and within a half day I was on my way home sans tests, so I think the further testing was unnecessary and a way to puff up the bill to my insurance.
Food there is horrid, and if you like cheap ingredients that is your place to go.
Drs. were fine, no problem.  Overall, no problems with the staff at all.
BUT, having spent time at Arrowhead Hospital where everything was superior makes Banner look just ok.  I had a choice of places to go, and next time I am going back to Arrowhead for sure.

Destroyed everything in their path... my A/C, an astro turf dog run, flexible irrigation lines, PVC sprinkler lines, water drainage lines, flagstone walkways. They literally destroyed all of this at my house. They did pay for an A/C company to "repair" my A/C that they put a hole through, but now it has a big hole in the fins. Unfortunately we weren't the ones paying for the work, the previous homeowners that we purchased our house from paid them. Also, when they put the gas line in our BBQ, they didn't put the shutoff valve by the access door... it's at the back of the island BBQ and nearly inaccessible. Shoddy work, utter destruction, and a very high price tag. Save yourself time, money, and the headache and use a different company.

This company is terrible. They charged me a lot of money to make a modification to my pool that broke the cleaning system. Then they charged me more to put the system back the way it was.

If you want a company that knows what they are doing and does not charge you for their mistakes, look elsewhere.

Have used Yelp for years but never written a review.  Today is the exception.  Used The Plumber Guy to replace the hose's on the kitchen faucet.  The best part is, they had a guy in our area and he was to the house within a few hours (I know this might not always be the case).  Estevan was our service rep and was outstanding.  Talked us through the repair and even gave us some advice going forward in dealing with our aging faucet.  Next time I won't try and fix my plumbing issues myself, I will call The Plumber Guy.

Howard & Marianne in Sun City

 Give a 5-star rating to Scott Lemley with H&S Accounting.  Scott and the entire staff are very professional and courteous.  Our taxes include Schedule C for small business, investment issues and dual residences.   We have been with H&S Accounting for eight years and would highly recommend their services.  Scott will relieve your IRS anxieties.

Great prices, but be sure to double-check quantities and weights at checkout. The packaging for various weights is nearly identical (except for very small fine print label), so I will often get more or less than what I ask for. Has happened on several occasions. ALL of the staff is very kind, but I get the feeling that they are too stoned to be handling inventory. Too many mistakes.

Good food, service a little slow, a little dated and you do have to put up with a lot of whiney elderly clientele who send the waiter back for a lot of petty trivial stuff that takes away from handling other customers,  more like babysitting seniors.

Following surgery and three weeks at a nursing and rehabilitation center, my mother had to be re-admitted to the hospital.  The care she received in the Cardiovascular Surgical ICU was excellent. The nurses and entire staff were caring, gentle, and absolutely professional. When my mother's condition worsened, a member of Banner Hospice met with us and arranged for my mother to be moved to the fairly new in-hospital hospice service. Again, the staff there were exceptional and did everything they possibly could to make a very painful experience as comforting as possible.
I visited this pharmacy twice in the last week.  The pharmacist was knowledgable and went above and beyond to get the prescription we needed. Highly recommend!

Horrible service!  I had my dog neutered and dew claws removed.  They put on the wrong size e-collar (cone around head) when they sent him home after surgery which caused my dog to be able to pull out the stitches and get his paw infected.  They refused to take responsibility for the wrong decision to send my dog home the way they did. Their excuse was they didn't carry that size of e-collar in stock..helloo...why are you operating on my dog when you are not prepared to care for him???  Maybe go out of your way to find the right equipment whether it be call another vet or something instead of doing the wrong thing.  I called 4 other vets in town and 3 out of the four carry the proper collar and the other one was just out of stock until Tuesday.
