So they totally tried to pawn the responsibility on me that "it was recommended I buy a larger e-collar" Which they never actually did.  Excuse me...do I look like a vet or even know how to properly fit this on my pet?? No, they are and failed to be the professionals in this situation and send my pet home with a speedy recovery. Instead they sent him home with guaranteed failure.  They even had the nerve to charge me to rebandage his paws for my last  post surgery follow-up.  So now he had to have a penicillin shot and stronger antibiotics and they act like it's my fault--absolutely RIDICULOUS!!

I will not be bringing any of my pets here in the future or recommend to anyone.  
I had to go to another vet to do their job which was properly fit my dog with an e-collar that was twice the size of the one they put on him and they wouldn't even refund me that cost.


They are cheaper than other vets for a reason.

I'm very upset with this establishment currently. The business hours online & on door state open until 9pm. However I placed my order online for pick and go to get it and it's closed. My family was waiting on dinner. This is very unprofessional and we will not be back, in fact I will be telling family and friends about this. Word of mouth gets around. Instead we went to Panda Express and they were more than happy to provide fresh food and take your business. Good luck with your shady restaurant.
Great service. On time, reasonably priced. Ive used them 2 times already and would definately use them again should the need arise.

Absolutely amazing! I wish I could give more stars. Carlin came out to quote us a tankless water heater, the price was around what we thought and was able to start today. 
We ended up getting a tankless system and a whole house filtration system as well. 
Extremely professional and answered all my questions and I feel we got a reasonable price for what we bought. 
Please know These systems are not cheap but long term worth the money investment. Watching him take the time to do all the modifications that have to be done from a regular 13 year old water heater to this one are not for joe homeowner to do, hire someone. 
We will definitely call them for any other plumbing needed items or maintenance!

I remember what Army chow tasted like when you're out there on maneuvers...I'd rather eat that crap then the Jades Chinese slop.  And to boot the
service sucked too. Pass on this place.

Great staff helpful and friendly, Dr. Ashworth and Dr. Johnson are outstanding Doctors my puppies see both of them and they care deeply for my babies as they would there own pets, I have and would recommend Sun City to anyone.

Great experience, great staff and superb equipment. I would highly recommend renting an RV from Sand Highway, they are the best. Communication is outstanding and their equipment is new and easy to use. They helped relieve the stress of vacationing in an RV.
Barber Dave is very rude unprofessional & un capable of cutting hair the way the customers want's it! This has been by far the worst barber experience of my life!!!!

We used Dr. Brown a couple years ago for our beloved and my first pet China to put her down as she was very old. She was fantastic and couldn't have asked for a better experience during something that is incredibly sad. My China was at peace and felt no anxiety has she was sleeping when Dr. Brown came over and never woke up. Dr. Brown is very accommodating and you know she truly cares about the pets and making sure they are at peace.

Took my 35mm lens in to get calibrated , I normally drive way out to Chandler to get my camera serviced.   I was very happy with the service I received.  Lens is in perfect focus!    They had it done and ready back in 1 day.   I will be taking my camera here for its annual service.

The NECS is located in a strip mall area anchored by a Coco's Restaurant and other popular stores frequented by the geriatric crowd (e.g., shoe repair store, HR Block, etc).

The two small, Asian women working the shop were pleasant, greeting all customers that entered with soft, cheerful voices.  They seemed like the type of people you just wanna hug, even though you know absolutely zero about their lives/personalities.

Store layout--When you walk in, the small storefront is covered wall to wall with clocks of varying themes, designs, and prices.  They also carry a nice selection of grandfather clocks and sophisticated desk clocks that you might present on a special occasion to an office colleague or employer.

Watches--The register is directly in front of the door about 20 feet in, and once you make it to the register, to the right is an entire section of mens & womens watches with a multitude of bands and colors imaginable.  They are all priced between $10-14 and for fashion watches, are fun to peruse.  I believe I spied a few glass cases with some higher priced watches of the Seiko brand.  I didn't look closely but doubt this place had any designer watches, which probably speaks to their clientele.  

Other inventory--They also carry an assortment of things I imagine are appealing to their main demographic--the 65+ crowd.  They had fancy, marble covered pill boxes, rings with large gemstones that hid digital watches underneath, and little table top trinkets in the shape of objects you'd find in a home (e.g., piano, toilet, etc) that incorporated a miniature (and functional!) clock face into the design.  If my grandmother, who resides deep in the South Pacific, had use for a dollhouse-sized toilet with a clock, I'd definitely buy one.

Hours--They're usually only open 8-5PM, M-F and 8 or 9-4PM on Sat.  So, if you're too busy to check it out during lunch hour and can't make it before 5PM, you're out of luck.

Customer service--They are pretty darn fast, even when there's a crowd.  You can watch them replace your battery while you wait and that takes about 5 minutes.  I even had them remove some of the links on a watch I purchased from their store.  They didn't charge me for removing the links and for my other watch, it only cost $2.50 to replace the battery.

I'd definitely recommend this store for expediency and customer service!

I am WOWED by this pawn shop!! I needed a cord for a electric guitar to the amp. These guys went above and beyond to find one while I waited on the phone and to give me a SMOKING deal that made me super happy!!!

THANK YOU Arizona EZ-Pawn!!!
The food is always hot and fresh. The service is usually great. Definitely a fan of this Arby's location!

I, too had a very bad experience.  Notified them by registered mail after multiple phone calls, to which they never responded.  Have been trying since January to get an itemized list of what was removed from my mother's property.  All phone calls resulted in mailbox is full or no respond to messages left.  Was charged 145.00 for removal of articles taken and cannot find out what they took.  Unfortunately, when I enlisted their help, I was very vulnerable.  Had lost my mother unexpectedly and shortly after, learned that my husband was terminally ill.  Lost him the week before my mother's contracted sale.  So was unable to oversee what they were or were not doing.  I do not want anyone else have to deal with this type of stress.  Clifton was the person I dealt with and just recently saw that their website has not been renewed through the Go Daddy site, so do your homework.  Do not get taken in as I did. They have no conscience.

What a breath of fresh air!  After dealing for several years with both Chevrolet and Honda dealerships for service and being continually disappointed, I found Sun City Auto Service somewhat by accident when needing a battery replacement on my 2014 Corvette.  I have now had both the Corvette and my 2016 Honda Accord Touring Coupe serviced by Sun City.  They know the meaning of the word "time" and when you set an appointment and keep it, Rawy and his crew takes care of you in a very timely manner and at very fair prices.  They are very thorough and clean in their work.  Unless I have warranty work (or recall), I will never use another dealer for service.  I highly recommend them for fixing or servicing your vehicle...and believe me, I am very picky.
Been taking my vehicles to Rawry for several years now. Great place, honest and reliable. No complaints just praise!

Such an incredibly friendly helpful place.  They really treated me and my mom very well.  There is no pressure.  They give you great service and let you know what recommendations they would make for your vehicle and give you estimates.  You decide how to proceed.  Refreshing to find an auto service company like this.

We have been going to Vicki / Precious Paws since we moved here 4 years ago and have not had ONE negative experience.  Sure there are closer groomers but not one that we could trust the way we trust Vicki with our little girl.

She gets really booked up so plan your visits, you won't be disappointed!

Disgusting. Sticky. Dirty. Humid. 

This place is nasty.

The food is not good, and everything in there is soiled with food or sauce that had been dripping down.  

YUCK!
Best sandwiches and fries by far of any fast food. Best Gyros....just delicious. Love you old Arby's! You've always been the best.

Been there few times. The food is good, I love there greek salad. They have chicken kabob, which is not considered Greek actually, it is middle eastern.
The place is great, it need just a little more cleaning.
Good service  clean  friendly employ free parking   easy to find love the Gyros  will be back

From the moment I walked in until the moment I left, I felt so comfortable with Lynn, dental assist & Dr. Chang! I was very fearful of getting the
numbing shots but barely hurt which was pretty impressive!  Dr. Chang was a very calming presence which soothed my anxiety. Crown tx wasn't that bad after all!

I was pleased with the care my yorkie received while boarded for four nights. When I picked her up she wasn't distressed and acted calm which only told me she had been treated well. I like that I can bring her food and bed so the routine is as normal as possible. You are able to request eating schedules - something I have never been offered at other boarding facilities. The staff was friendly and professional. The fact that documented proof of current vaccinations made me feel like Ellie was protected from other boarded pets. I was even called to confirm they had received the certificate. Thank you for a job well done. I'm not able to say that as frequently as I'd like the way the world is today.
Had worked with The Wild Flower AZ as a photographer not one time! Oh Wow, the flowers are always so amazing! I would definitely recommend her for any occasion!
Audrey is the best!  She styles my Mom's hair just the way she likes it, and she is very pleasant to talk to.  My Mom loves her!

had an alignment done, left outer rod & camber bolt were only hand tightened.  Left messages with Casey for owner, Rawley to call me back. Never did.  A sign of poor customer service.  take your money but when at fault wont reimburse you. They dont even deserve a 1 star for ignoring my calls.

I just had batteries replaced in 4 watches and had 2 bands adjusted smaller... While I waited. Very polite and efficient. Extremely inexpensive. I paid 13.25. I can't imagine getting that service at any other jewelry store that quickly or that inexpensively. I highly recommend them.

I recommend Precious Paws.. they are so sweet here and my T-bone loves to come here and get his baths. Sat they even brushed his teeth on the house. Check them out! Thank you for being sweet to my furry baby.

Was in here earlier this month.  Purchased a gun and a nice watch. They were very willing to negotiate and even took a little bit more off because I purchased two things. They were very helpful and friendly with any qurlestions that I had as well.

I'm usually driving through sun city and I happened to stop by Sunset Bistro and oh man I'm so happy I stopped here. The food is amazing, the service was on point. Very nice employees and very respectful. I at least stop by 3-4 times a week. Amazing selection. If you have a chance. Stop by you'll love it

I wanted to introduce my niece to Arby's. She'd never eaten there before (is that even a thing? Who doesn't like Arby's?) and was willing to give it a try. The lady at the register was friendly and was training a new employee. She even apologized for it. I told her no worries. Got my order placed and went to find a seat. 
It seemed to take a little longer than normal for the order to come up, I know because I used to work at Arby's years ago. When I saw my order coming up, I walked up to get it. The lady who took my order was turning around and about to call my name when she saw me. She apologized for it taking a bit. Again, no worries. 
Sat down and my teenage niece got to try her first curly fry and jamocha shake, fry dipped in the shake, of course! Her eyes got big. She approved. Then she bit into her chicken cordon blue sandwich. Or I should say tried to. The chicken was weird she said as she was choking part of it down. I asked her what she meant. She said it was hard and handed it to me. She had bitten through the bun, cheese, ham, and coating on the chicken, but COULDN'T BITE THROUGH THE MEAT! It was tough, you could feel it, and the coating was browner than I've ever seen on one of their sandwiches. Ok, it happens. I walked up with it and gave it to the trainee who took it to the manager. She stuck her fingers into it, and looked at me and said it was fresh and they'd just made it. I let her know that it was tough to the point of being inedible. She actually asked me what I wanted her to do about it! I'm like, are you kidding me? She offered me a regular classic roast beef instead. Aside from the fact that she was offering me a sandwich that is about a buck fifty less than the rock sandwich we'd gotten, my niece doesn't eat beef. Otherwise I'd have gotten her one to begin with, because duh, they're the bomb. So I asked for a couple ham/cheese sliders. 
SHE ROLLED HER EYES AT ME AND SIGHED like a spoiled rich kid who is being asked to throw away their own trash! She calls out for two sliders. I waited. I saw them come up. So did she. But the order she was waiting for wasn't up yet so she walked away. Came back a minute later, PUSHED MY SLIDERS OUT OF HER WAY, and proceeded to bag up 3 other orders as they came up. She didn't touch them, and once all the other orders were passed out she started to turn to walk away. I looked at her and said "Really, you're just going to push my sliders aside and ignore them?" She got really snotty with me and said she'd get to them in a second. Not once during the whole exchange did she apologize for the inedible food. In fact, not once did she speak to me in any way other than snide, irritated, and rude. Finally gave me the tray and said here you go. I told her thanks for nothing. Then she said really loud and sarcastic "have a nice day!" 
This person, Michele D. should not be in customer service or food service if she can't deal with people without the attitude. I will still go to my beloved Arby's, just not this one! The two stars is because the other employees were pleasant, and my niece loved the food that she could eat. My roast beef was cold by the time I could eat. I took it home. My dog was very happy with it. 

Update: I got a call from the store manager today apologizing for what happened. She said she will talk to the employee to make sure it doesn't happen again. She assured me that it was not typical behavior. I know we all have bad days so I will give them another chance. I appreciate that my complaint was heard and dealt with. That's always a good sign in my book.

I've been taking my fur babies to Sun City Animal Hospital for twelve years.  Over the years treatment for my Chi babies has come from three different vets.  All were superb.  My senior Chi, Ginger, endured two cancer surgeries there.  She passed last April two months short of her 16th birthday.  I'm convinced that the care she received at SCAH helped her to live a long and healthy life.  One of the first things a doggie lover looks for is whether the Vet really loves dogs.  (You can always tell).  The entire staff at SCAH are doggie lovers extraordinaire.  The "extra gravy" with taking my Chi, Rosie, to SCAH is that I've developed a senior crush on Dr. Pollyann Johnson.  She is such a great vet, so loving to my Rosie and always makes me feel confident that my fur baby is in good hands.  I feel so fortunate to have found SCAH upon my move to the state in 2004.

This organization provides medical equipment free of charge to the residents of Sun City.  It is a non-profit organization run by volunteers.

They have provided a walker for my grandpa as well as a fancy chair, similar to a recliner, but completely motorized so it will tilt up and lift him from the seated position.

We recently came here to return my grandpa's walker.  The brake had come loose so we needed a new one.  A volunteer met us in the parking lot and took the broken walker and directed us to the office.  The office worker was very nice and efficient.  We were in and out in around 5 minutes and his new walker was waiting for us outside.  The volunteer then loaded it in the car for us.

They also have other things to borrow for when residents of Sun city have grandchildren visiting.  For instance, you can borrow a crib, stroller, diaper pail, etc.

Thank you for your awesome and generous service to the residents of Sun City!

We're regular diners at the Sunset Bistro. Ample portions are always value-priced. Daily specials are unique and tasty. Service is solid and accurate, servers very knowledgeable about the food and specials. They don't seem to push alcohol. Dinner salad is largest I've seen with a variety of fixings, and their Chicago Dog is the best west of Chicago. Small restaurant with an outdoor smoking/dining/drinking area.  Sincerely, Art Huseonica, Sun City, AZ.

Great Greek Food.  Very friendly service.  Had the greek combo plate.  Greek salad, falapel, dolomithes, and hummus. Went for linch.  Good portion size, and i am a relatively big eater.  Nice patio out front

I hired Floors N More to replace my kitchen floor. After a few 'bumps in the road' my floor is beautiful.  I can only thank Richard Sr. and Richard Jr for their fine professional workmanship. also Scott for his diligent follow up with some minor problems along the way.  I give Kudos to  the 'Richards' who really know what they are doing.  You cannot go wrong with that pair on your job.  lastly, I want to thank Matt for allowing Richard  to redo my floor to perfection.

I was referred here by a friend.  The quality of work is great and the customer service you get can not be matched.  The items I ordered had a quick turnaround peeps which is nice.  I was expecting a longer wait to get my order back.  Definitely recommend as a place to get office what's plaques or items.  A local business just is icing on the cake.

We asked Floors n More to review a complete master bedroom/bath remodel project.  After discussing our plans, Matt, with his insight and experience suggested something completely different than our plans.  Thank you very much for your suggestions.  The completed job came in ahead of schedule, thanks to his dedicated craftsmen and far exceeds our vision.  Working with Matt and his great staff (showroom and installers) was an easy and stress free experience. They will be asked to return to do several other jobs we have planned. If you are looking for a "TOP NOTCH" COMPANY to work with you on almost any tiling/flooring project, this is the one. Sy & Bob

I really enjoyed all my previous experiences with AZ EZ Pawn. I have purchased a few higher dollar items there and have used them for online firearm purchases. The gentleman with the long dreads (sorry I can't remember his name) has always been very attentive and friendly. Today was a totally different scenario. I had been bidding and watching several items on eBay they had listed, and was currently the high bidder on two of them. On the listing of a Damascus blade Bowie knife, I was the only bidder at the starting price of $0.99. With 20 minutes left on the auction, an extra day was added to it, either by the seller or an error by eBay, which the seller emailed me and said they did not do. 20 minutes after pointing this out to him, the item was removed. No where on their listing did they state that they reserved the right to end any auction early, or that the item would be sold in the store even if there was an active bid. Because the item was going to be won by me for less than a dollar, they removed it. This was their response:

"New message from: azezpawn  Top Rated Seller(3,416Red Star)
if we decide that we do not want to sell the item or end the listing early we pay a fee for that which ebay has already collected. as far as contacting the resolution center good luck with that. We will not be forced or threatened to sell you any item. we have the right to list or unlist any item we choose. We pay our fees just like everyone else."



I would have been completely satisfied if they sold have this listed on each of their items. I even agreed to purchase the knife from their store at a higher price. This was his response again as to why it was still available:

New message from: azezpawn  Top Rated Seller(3,416Red Star)
i would love to sell you the knife in store. I have no problem with that. We took it off because we thought it sold in the store because we had a huge sale. The last thing i wanted was an upset customer with no knife to ship. We did locate it so i'd rather sell it to you than to relist it. what's your offer.


I informed the seller that I would be in the next day (tomorrow) to pick it up, and that I was also bidding on a watch they had listed, which again, I was the high bidder. With 4 minutes left on the auction, I was outbid. When I went to increase my bid, I received the error message that the seller had prohibited me from bidding on their items, even though at one point I was the highest bidder.

I understand that AZ EZ Pawn is a for profit business, but I do not understand the business practices used today. Yes, they may have been losing out on $34 for selling me a $35 knife for $1, but your advertised price is the advertised price, as there were no other products available for a bait and switch. I hope they enjoy the $34 that they saved from the knife for ending their auction because they didn't make enough money and for blocking my bids on their watch, as I will never spend a penny more at their establishment. It is a shame that one person (the Internet eBay lister) can make such a bad impression on such a once friendly and respected establishment.

Not to sound like a complete nit picker, but the service was perfectly fine. Charging for extra sauce is a little annoying and the main issue was the yelling in the back of the store. Again, I'm not one to make mean reviews or what not, but I wish they wouldn't charge extra for small things

I like Arby's because they are different. Not your burger and fries fast food chain. My favorite is their chicken salad sandwich on wheat. This was an excellent sandwich. As you noticed I said WAS? They have now discontinued this sandwich. i have now noticed their menu is beginning to look like any other fast food chain. Arby's has chicken tenders, and it's not that good. They also now have jalapeno poppers, again not that good. They still have their roast beef selection and it's still and good alternate if your're tired of burgers. 

Now had a very decent experience at this location. Service was very fast, and courteous. Place was very clean. 

I hope Arby's isn't planning to go towards a menu like the other fast food chains. We already have them, be different and give us other options.

I can't say enough positive things about Sand Highway RV Rentals. The booking was made easily, even for our first time. We arrived to a warm greeting, the staff was extremely helpful getting us hitched up and on the road. The actual trailer we rented was a toy hauler. It was in great shape and ready to go for us. They walked us through all the ins-and-outs of how it functions and made us feel confident to hit the road. The return was smooth and convenient as well. We most definitely will utilize San Highway again on our next trip in the area. I did my research before choosing them and based on price, customer service and now first hand experience I feel confident recommending them to anyone who is new to the trailer world and want to give it a try or to those experienced with RVs. A+

I needed a battery replacement, and also my second hand had not been working properly for close to 3 years now. 

About 2 years ago I brought the second-hand issue to two different stores. First one quoted me $150 and 2+ weeks to send it out, etc., the second store quoted me $100 and had a 1 year warranty.  I went with option #2, it took a little over a week. Well, it was fixed just fine, but then the next battery switch it messed the second-hand again. I brought it back because it was still under warranty, but it only held up a few more months. 

So since then, I'd had a wonky second-hand and ultimately, last week, needed another battery.  I brought to New England Clock Shop, they immediately identified the issue. They said come back 3 days and it'll be fixed.

New battery and fixed dials on my Bulova = $2.75.
I feel like I won the lottery. 
Happy day for me :-)

I really like Arby's but I can't recommend this location.  Took the family for lunch this week and when we walked in we immediately lost our appetite.  The smell was so overpower of 'airport latrine' that we lost our appetites.  We moved from the front area to see if it was any better in the dining room and then we were confronted with crazy bad carpet smell.  I guess stick to the drive thru if you want to still have an appetite for Arby's at this location.

We have used this vet since we moved here in 2005, and have gone through a number of doctors.  We had Dr. Dawson, Dr. Flick, Dr. McCallister, Dr. Johnson, Dr. Dutson and now Dr. Ashworth.  All of them have been very good with our cats, and the service has been excellent.  They were very sympathetic when we had to put down 3 of our cats over the years, and sent us cards after the deaths.  Since the purchase, they have changed staff almost completely and the number of doctors and techs seem to have diminished, but that may just be an effect of the recession.  We currently go to Dr. Leah Ashworth who is very nice and concerned for the health of our pets.  My only real complaint is that they did away with the separate cat area and combined it into one waiting room.  It can get scary for cats there when there are a number of loud dogs in the room.  Hours have extended but the wait time is still pretty good.  Most of the doctors who have left have either retired or went part-time for family reason.  The overall atmosphere is very nice and the prices are comparable to other practices. We are very satisfied with them
What a great place for your best friends salon visit!!! So well run and everyone is sooo wonderful!! Salsa says thank you!!
Brought in a Dobe today that I just adopted a few days ago. He was so stinky and filthy. The Pet Lodge did a outstanding job on him. A+ job.

I remember first going to Sun Camera when I was a freshman in high school.
Eager to start my first photography class ever, I bought a Minolta X-700 SLR....still continuing with my passion for photography, today I shoot mostly digital, but I still (when I feel like shooting film) use that camera.

The employees here are all extremely helpful and really nice. I come here every so often still to get my Ilford B&W 400 speed film. They have a decent selection of films and a pretty vast selection of cameras for those who are looking to buy new or used. 

I love this shop.

Very pleased with the overall process from Floors N More. Would give them 10 stars if I could. If you want to be treated with respect and not a walking money sign then this is the place. They let you lead the buying process. Our material was delivered and installed promptly and we have zero complaints! Highly recommend!

This is a belated review of Valley Estate Sale Company's estate sale service.  This summer my elderly  father passed away leaving a home filled with 40 years worth of stuff--much of it junk, alot we would have trashed.  Add to the fact that the house was in need of a thorough cleaning and most of the stuff hadn't been touched since Mom passed in '94.  With only one of my siblings living in Phoenix and needing to clear out the house we were referred to Norbert and VESC.  Bless him and his staff--'don't worry honey we can take care of it.  Your trash will be someone elses treasure".

 In 10 days they sorted through our stuff, organized and priced it, cleaned up the house and held an estate sale at the house.  Any items not able to be sold were donated and we (my family) didn't have to do a thing.  We returned to an empty house (which was bittersweet) and had money to continue to maintain the house till we sell it.

This is a process that would have taken us weeks if not months and brought with it headaches and heartache.  In addition my nephew was living in the house so his stuff and room had to be segregated from the rest.  It wasn't easy and I'm sure in the heat of things Norbert wondered if he should have pass us up!  But in the end VESC did a great job for us and we will be forever grateful.

We have been going here since we moved to the area 2+ years ago. We take all 3 of our small dogs here, and they always look and smell so good! The prices are reasonable, and the staff is always very nice.

A very pleasant surprise indeed: a Middle Eastern restaurant tucked away in the Greenway shopping plaza in Sun City, Arizona. From fresh Greek salads, to chicken kebabs served over perfectly cooked basmati rice, to yummy garlicky gyros this place has some really good grub (as well as healthy) in the food desert that is Sun City. An added bonus, the owner and the server/bartender were very welcoming.
The Weapon Capital of Pawn Shops in Arizona.  Always  guns and knives for sale at excellent prices and at various times, auctions.
A friend recommended the New England Clock Shop to me when I needed a watch battery replaced. I was able to wait while they replaced the battery and they were very reasonably priced.

We were highly recommended to try this place, but our experience was very much less than satisfacory. Our waitress literally argued with us and still messed up the simplest of things. The food was decent, but nothing to write home about. 

Overall,  a bad experience and we WILL NOT be back!

The owner Dave and his staff definitely have this business in their back pocket. 

The shop has So much to choose from. ~90% of it being "Good" or Better quality 
So many rifles, being changed on a daily.  The jewelry selection is vast, spanning across 9 decades the day I went in.  (2) for $1 DVDS and Video Games.  Even found a nice turquoise buck knife :)

Be aware, once walking into AZEZPAWN you won't leave empty handed

Name a place where you can get your watch batteries replaced for for under $5!  I bet you can't!  I replaced 10 watch batteries!  

I love my watches and thanks to this place it was affordable to get new batteries!  They have a wide selection of clocks and watches in the store.  

If you love your watches and don't want to spend an arm and a leg on a battery come here and give them your business!  Friendly people greet you with a smile and you save money!  Win- Win!

I went to this Arby's for lunch today, and there was a problem with my order. It was moderately busy, though not packed. I placed an order at 11:50am, and sat down waiting for my name to be called. After 25 minutes, it never was. I went back to the counter and spoke with Tom (Management team member), I could see right away he was sorry and apologized. He immediately re-entered my order and asked if I would like a turnover on the house, which I declined. When he gave me my order, he had placed the original $10.40 charge back on the tray, again appologized and said "Please have this lunch on us". Wow! Accidents happen, no business is perfect. I wasn't asking for a free lunch but that's exactly what I got. That's customer service perfected. I will definately go back the next time "I'm thinking Arby's"!

This is the best keep secret in Sun City,  There wed and fri fish fry, be it one serving, is the best anywhere and very very well prices. The one regular waitress is amazing, I have been there when the lace is almost full, with a full service bar and a patio, and she never misses a beat.  There gyros are spectacular and try the Curry chicken soup, to die for. If you give it a try I guarantee, like me you will be back many times.

Great little Greek Bistro in the heart of Sun City. Both the Greek salad with gyro meat and the chicken gyro were excellent. Great, friendly service!! Will definitely be going back! The Greek appetizer was also very good, a little sampling of everything. The dolmas were perfect!!

Best place to take your dog to get groomed. Years ago I us to take my schnauzer to Petsmart and they cut her ear. She had to get it glued.  I felt so bad. She was terrified of that place. I was desperate to find an new groomer. I ended up discovering precious paws after we had some ice cream. I've been taking my baby there ever since then. That was about 5 years ago. This whole time Petsmart was cutting her hair wrong! Precious Paws knows how to cut my Schnauzer hair. They do an awesome job. She looks like a dog on tv when she comes out of that place. She gets SO many compliments at the dog park. She maybe a senor but looks better than most young dogs. People like her haircut so much I always give them precious paws info. One more thing my baby is having surgery and I took her to the vet the other day. Anyways they told me my schnauzer has really good skin and her ears are nice and cleaned. My Vet seem very impressed by how well groomed my dog was. She told me they are doing a good job because she does not have dry skin or hair in her ears. That made me happy at least I know I'm not wasting my money.

I was getting my car serviced two doors down, sitting in the waiting area with my dog, and I noticed my dog was bleeding from his nail. Another customer waiting suggested I walk two doors down to this animal hospital to see if they could examine my dog's nail while I was waiting on my car. I walk into the hospital holding my dog, and the employee sitting at the counter didn't acknowledge me at first. When she finally did, I told her that my dog's nail started bleeding while I was two doors down. She reached over the counter and grabbed his injured paw. He cried. I pulled him away so she wouldn't hurt him and asked if anyone could take a quick look at him since I was waiting on my car and couldn't take him anywhere else for the time being. She seemed annoyed and put me in an examination room with some paperwork. After I filled it out, she returned and said nobody had time to look at him and sent me on my way with a flyer for Emergency Animal Clinics. It's totally okay and makes perfect sense that they couldn't take my dog at such short notice, but in no way is it even remotely acceptable to grab my dog's injured paw over the counter. Where did these people learn how to handle animals?

I brought my recently rescued boxer in to have her nails clipped.  Being out of the shelter for only 3 1/2 weeks, I needed to see her reaction to having her nails done.  The women working on Miracle were amazing, working quickly and confidently.  It was obvious that Miracle loved the attention.  I recommend Precious Paws to everyone.
Rented the rzr 1000 turbo! Was a blast!!! Renting was easy and quick! No hassle! Will definitely refer friends and family!

I ventured into New China Super Buffet with a Chinese friend who was in need of comfort food from her motherland.  This joint was walking distance from her motel so we decided to give it a go.

An autographed poster of LaToya Jackson was the first thing I saw when I made my way to the buffet tables.  This, sadly, was the best part of the meal.  Well, the egg drop soup and chocolate pudding were good too.  Aside from that the food was abysmal.  Even the standard sweet and sour chicken was lackluster.  My friend stuck with white rice, broccoli and some noodles because the rest of what she picked over was not to her liking.  The staff, however, was able to serve her a glass of hot water that was to her liking.  In a desperate attempt to find an item to my liking I went for the American standard...pizza.  Even that was bad.  

The staff was friendly and accommodating and it's a shame the quality of food could not match up to the people working there.  I really hate to say it but New China Super Buffet is the worst Chinese buffet I have ever eaten in.  Because I enjoyed the soup and staff I will grant two stars upon this, er, fine establishment.

First visit was awesome! I was here from out of town and they were able to squeeze me in even though they were booked solid. My fur baby had two dog bites so it was important to me to have her seen quickly. Obviously it was important to them as well. Thank you so much for your kind and caring service. I will be back!

I must have missed something. The gentleman behind the counter was friendly enough, but the showroom left a lot to be desired. Tiny, not much inventory, and it looked like mostly older film cameras.

I was hoping to see some lighting options, but there was nothing to see. I'm thinking that they must do well with classes, developing and printing, and event photography as there just wasn't much hardware to see.   

I imagine that the Internet makes it difficult to compete, and it looked to me like this shop is on it's last legs.

I rented a 20' box trailer. The staff was very friendly and help full hooking up the hitch they had available. Awesome people to rent from.Thanks for being so accommodating! Will rent from them again.
They do a great job on our dog . Very nice and friendly . We have taken our dog here since we got him 2 years ago and he always looks great after grooming and smells good.

Romen's was not terrible but easily the worst kebab/gyro that I have ever paid for.  

My order took some time so I was expecting a delicious meal as I've found that great food often comes with a longer wait.  Instead I was treated to a small portion of bland meat, skimpy toppings and light on the sauce.  

I've paid less for more food and have had better kebab/gyro sandwiches at many places.  

It's a haul for anyone up in the Sun City/Surprise area but if you want a great Middle Eastern/Mediterrainian sandwich (or food in general) take a trip across Apache Blvd in Tempe and stop at one of the 5 or 6 places between Mill and McClintock.  They will not disappoint.
The gyros brings me back to Chicago Greek town. All meals are large, service is great and fast. One of my top spots.

My girlfriend recommended Lisa about 7 years ago, for a reasonable and attractive cut...  I searched (for hours) for some examples of how I wanted my hair to look... and took in front, side, and back views of Dame Judy Dench,  Lisa did a superb job, even though she said I had "5 times the hair."  Since then, I have returned faithfully to Lisa every 6 weeks or so, because she knows her stuff!  When it's a haircut you want, why pay exorbitant salon "styling" fees?  We like and trust Lisa so much, that we call ahead and make sure she's working the day we'd like to come in.

Recently tried to get an appointment for Dr. Ashworth to look at Buddy's ears because he wouldn't  allow us to put the medicine she prescribed in his ears any longer.  Called and explained the problem to the office staff and the best they could do was schedule an appointment for a week later.  Then I called another veterinarian and explained the problem and they were able to see him right away. When we arrived they examined his ears and immediately made a different treatment plan where they instill the medicine in his ears in two separate applications a week apart. This is obviously much less stressful for both Buddy and my husband and me.  As a result, we will no longer be taking Buddy to SCAH as the office staff there didn't recognize the obvious discomfort he was having since he wouldn't let us touch his ears and therefore they saw no reason to get him in to see Dr. Ashworth in a timely manner.

Well now Arby's has done it too . What you ask,well they messed up my order . I order one thing and they give me something else . I am so tired of having to drive back and forth because someone can't get an order straight .Two sandwiches and two pies shouldn't be that hard to put together and keep straight. The workers are nice enough but it wasn't really that busy to make good ups.
When are these idiots going to put parking spaces up next to the building? Some old people don't walk well but didn't bring a driver. It's sad to see them suffer.
Amazing, professional, quick service. This place is considered to go to for engraving!

Excellent customer service - excellent selection of products.

A pretty big "small quilt shop" with comparable prices to other local quilt shops. I disagree with the other reviewer - I do find that their fabrics are of great quality. They have many of the well known high quality brands. They are often getting in new things and are always happy to answer my questions when I have an issue with sewing. 

I have purchased thread, fabrics, and embroidery designs here. I have been happy with all of my purchases. But what makes them GREAT is the CUSTOMER SERVICE.

Lots of classes offered at comparable prices. I can't speak to the classes themselves with specifics much because my work schedule hasn't allowed me to attend. 

If I ever buy another sewing machine I will shop here for that as well. I have been eyeing a Bernina for some time. It is really important to buy from a shop that will give you support when you buy an expensive machine. They also sell Qnique long arm machines.

They set me up with the right size trailer for the car I was towing (Honda Civic). Trailer was in mint condition. Showed me how everything worked, including the electric brake controller (this is a must). Process to rent and return was easy. Will definitely rent from here again, they have a huge selection of products.

For bathroom, porta-potties or wheelchairs, Sunshine Services are the best.   Twice they have been called for various pieces of medical, or bathroom equipment.  Each time the answers were always YES, come visit us and we will load your needs.  Now and then a prescription my be needed, but usually not.  This a great service to the Sun City Community.   The service is great and ALWAYS FREE!

Found this place just south east of Bell & 99th Ave.  Lots of clocks, watches and accessories. Brought in a Bulova watch and had them replace the battery.  The ladies were very courteous and got the job done is less than 10 minutes.  Best of all it was unbelievably inexpensive.
Love Dr. Johnson. She's so caring and shes very patient. She's worth driving a the extra way,  to get good care for our pets.

Took my '95 Cady ETS in for the A/C to be recharged.  Casey and the team did a thorough inspection and helped me get the car running great!  

Over the weekend we noticed a wire hanging and took it back and Casey reattached a bracket that had come loose - all fixed, no charge!

Great service!

Dry Cleaning Side
I have been coming to them for years. Their services are acceptable, but they do not go out of their way to please. They probably only have one employee  working at a time. And sometimes it's just their children. They have lost clothes of mine before. Again I keep coming back, But today was it. After waiting around for 8 min before finally seeing someone only to be walked by without even being acknowledged, that was it. I come here Because they are the closest to me, even though their prices are high. They barely deserve two stars, but i'm  giving it to them.
I'm never coming again
I would have told them that they lost a loyal customer due to lack of service- but there was no one to tell it to. Nothing/no one to even stop me or anyone else from walking up and taking whatever one wanted and walking out. 
Don't come here.
Food is always good at Arby's. Something different than just having burgers. Stopped in this particular one for lunch, and the staff is super nice. I'll stop in this one again for sure.

I took our Yorkie, Marlee for a regular check-up and as usual we were treated cordially by the girls at the front desk. Marlee was called by name and her name was on a blackboard with other pets names coming in that day. Shortly we were greeted by a Tech who couldn't have been nicer to Marlee and then Dr.Johnson came in the room and did a thorough exam. We have been going to this clinic for many years and have never been disappointed, our pets are treated with loving kindness and professionalism. They may be slightly more than others but the extra care they give and by their going that extra mile makes it more than worthwhile. Thank you all!!! Donna Mumaw

I have contracted this company to do work for my home out of state.  The owner Matt is so friendly and is working within our budget to give us the best quality.  The tile arrive yesterday and it is beautiful.  They have kept us informed every step of the way.  This place is top quality and amazing customer service.  Thank you Matt for your professionalism and creativity!!!
These guys are great. Clean equipment, flexible and friendly people and great inventory selection. I've rented from them twice now and will again.

Can't give enough stars to convey this shops commitment to service.  Friendly, helpful, courteous too.  Went in for a frame for a 5 generation picture and was delighted with the finished product !  The company name says it all!

Every time I went to this buffet I swore it would be the last time. The food is... edible, but I worry about the cleanliness of the establishment. Everything is messy, including the areas around the hot foods, the ice cream bar (toppings EVERYWHERE), the floor, the bathrooms--if this is the front of the house, what does the kitchen look like? I don't even want to know. I went here because it was close to where I live, but no more. If you want really good Chinese food (though it's not a buffet) go to T&J's on Olive.

Where do I start...? Martine, you and your brother were so wonderful to me and my family.  Thank you for being so accommodating when we needed to take the dogs outside or leave the house, all while showing us where to step :).  Thank you, Patty, for continuously checking in on the job to check the progress and my general well-being.  You are truly a gem.  This company uses in-house tile installers and they showed up every day when they said they would.  Our job was just over 1,000 square feet (the entire downstairs of our 2-story home) and they completed it in just 4 days.  Thank you Floors n More for an overall great experience.  We are in still in awe every time we come home and look at the transformation from carpet to tile! (I will post before/after pics soon)
Ruban is great! He is very knowledgeable and very efficient. I've been using Ace for 4 years and am always happy with the service.

Great place to get watch batteries replaced.  The ladies working there are very professional and friendly.  I have never had a bad experience there.  A large inventory of inexpensive watches and expensive grandfather and musical clocks.

I found Dr. Brown and Paws at Peace during the most difficult time every pet parent faces, end of life care. My 14 year old had battled and beat cancer but was not as lucky with the neurological disease that slowly took away her mobility, and in the end her ability to live and enjoy life.

I contacted Dr Brown from her website, I left a message and received a call back within an hour. After discussing the situation and giving her my girls medical details and how she was doing we set up an appointment for the end of the next day.

It was a sad but peaceful day. We spent the day loving on and saying good bye to our girl. She was bathed in love surrounded by her human and canine family in the comfort of her own yard and home. 

Dr Brown arrived within the time she said, she had actually called to say she was running a little late with the previous emergency appt. which was appreciated. After our meeting I can see how this happens because she does not rush. Her empathy and care is clearly demonstrated in her actions and kindness for both her patient, and pet parents. I felt like she would have stayed with us all evening. She made sure we were informed and prepared for the procedure before, then allowed us time to process and deal with the after. She made a paw print plaque, which is not only really nice to have but was a really nice to do. For me it was a nice ritual to watch her making the plaque while we talked and I spent the last few moments with my girl. 

The actual procedure was peaceful, respectful and as good as saying good bye to someone you love can be. Dr Brown was compassionate, professional and efficient. My girl was comfortable and relaxed, peacefully falling asleep on my lap.

Dr Brown's professionalism, compassion and kindness made a difficult time not only bearable but peaceful and exactly what my amazing girl deserved. Dr Brown arrived a stranger during an incredibly difficult time but left a friend, and for that I cannot thank her enough.

We are new to the area and had not found a veterinarian yet. We found us in a spot where we needed a vet ASAP I googled and found this particular that Sun City Animal Hospital was very close to our house so I thought we would start there.  Jessica was very helpful on the phone and was able to get us in the next morning for a visit. Dr. Roe was very informed of our dogs medical condition and also very helpful. Our dog Zona seemed to really like her.  I am very comfortable going to them. I even called my old Vet back from Indiana and told them i was very happy with our new Vet. Thank you ladies we appreciate your help with Zona.

It had been over a year since I last visited this restaurant. I should have waited even longer. The place was empty which should have been an indication of how the food has changed - not for the better. 2 of us ordered the Gyros salad. How hard can that be to make? Gyro meat, lettuce, onions, 1 tomato slice and sauce. Unfortunately for us, apparently it was hard to do.  Because they seem to do little business, the lettuce was turning brown on some pieces. And the gyros meat had been on the spit a little too long. Pieces of it were crisp and hard to chew.  The meat really had no taste to it either. I won't be back. And from the looks of it, neither will many others.

A signed picture of a smiling LaToya Jackson greets you as you enter. The staff is friendly, the restaurant is spacious, and more than 80 items are offered, dessert included. But the food is far from memorable. A lot of the items were bland - even my favorite, fried chicken - and those which were not were sub par even for a buffet. And don't bother with the sushi; I've come to the conclusion that if you don't have a sushi chef preparing the sushi behind a sushi counter, it's probably not worth it. The establishment will probably survive, though. It looks like it's been there forever and seems to have a loyal customer base from Sun City. The perpetual bumper-to-bumper traffic on that part of Grand Avenue on the drive back to Phoenix was a fitting conclusion for this buffet excursion.

This is for the Dry Cleaning portion, not the laundry mat. 

I took two comforters to be dry cleaned, price was average at $25 each.  Went out of town to return to mistake in banking.  Was charged $238.49.  Which of course created lots of $5 charges as I kept using my debit card.  $5 fee each time to have money automatically transferred from over draft to checking.  

Called to let them know.  Didn't hear back, called back, my phone number was lost.  Took about a week total to get the money credited back.  At least it was credited back.

I know mistakes happen...  I was surprised that they didn't offer any sort of compensation.  Had to still pay the $50.  Luckily the bank credited the $5 fees back.  

Won't be using them again.

Wow.would give -5 stars for the customer service or lack there of.laura who i was corresponding with for a rzr rental first didnt want to honor a online price then agreed too.then said she would email insurance info to me but never did and gave me attitude saying she did.then wanted to collect deposit over the phone non refundable which would have been ok except she said the weekend i was renting the rzr nascar would be in town and there wouldnt be anyone there and i needed to come down and sign the papers before the pickup date.so i simply suggested ill pay the deposit when i come down and sign the papers. She preceeded to tell me i have attitude and this rental would not work out. What a b****.that's ok she managed to tack on so many extra fees that the rental was 7 dollars short of the price she typically charges.in so happy i didn't give the deposit,in sure they would have never been there for pickup and would have been out my deposit.i rented from OCTANE THRILLS! BETTER PRICE AND REAL CUSTOMER SERVICE....

I have taken my dogs to a Lotta groomers over the years. I took them to precious paws in Sun City. My brother was telling me who great they are, he has taking his dog there before. I took my dogs in thinking that this place was good? I got them the works, nails,hair,shampoo the works. They couldn't clip The female dog they said that she was trying to bite them, but I know this isn't true because I've had her for 15 years. she has never bitten anyone, The other dog they clipped him and did a bad job. They were supposed to clip his nails but never did. I would recommend you to these people to no one!!!!!

Since moving to Arizona, I've yet to find a Chinese restaurant as good as my favorites back home (Toledo, OH) and after experiencing the cuisine of Golden Star on Bell Rd, sadly, the search continues... 

I had my fingers crossed for Golden Star. The restaurant is fewer than two miles away AND THEY DELIVER! The menu is typical fare, and like the menus at every Chinese restaurant, doesn't bother to list the individual ingredients (vegetables) of each dish. Fortunately the person who answered the phone spoke wonderful English and spared me from getting the Hunan beef (cabbage, he said--YUCK!). 

I ordered Kung Pao Beef, extra spicy, General Tso's Chicken, extra spicy, and Chicken Egg Foo Young. The Kung Pao and the Egg Foo Young were combination dinners, which were 75 cents more but came with fried rice, crab puff and egg roll. The General Tso's included half a pint (I think) of white rice. Total bill including delivery charge and tip was $36, which averages out to $12/dish--too much. (Note: The menu said the combination dinners came with Egg Flower Soup--but I was informed that's a misprint.) 

I was told 30-35 minutes for delivery, but it was closer to 20. In the bag: three fortune cookies, a few packets of soy sauce, wontons, and two tiny containers of sweet & sour for the egg rolls--not even enough for one egg roll, never mind two. The nail in the coffin: No hot Chinese mustard! Unforgivable! The crab puffs and egg rolls were in the same containers as the entrees, and the moisture made them soggy. They could have easily been wrapped separately. Lastly, the entrees came in environmental unfriendly Styrofoam instead of the traditional cardboard.

The Kung Pao Beef was... decent. The sauce was gloopy and the diced vegetables (zucchini, water chestnuts, carrots, peas, celery) a replica of the meals served at Good China on Union Hills (another restaurant I don't much like). However, there was some spice to the beef as I requested. Not a lot of spice. And not a lot of beef. The ratio of meat to veg was heavily in favor of veg. 

The Egg Foo Young was like Egg Foo Young, Deconstructed. This dish typically has a patty topped with gravy, but this was two patties underneath an avalanche of vegetables (same as above) and chicken. These ingredients are supposed to be within the patty, like an omelet. Presentation aside, how did it taste? Well, frankly, it tasted BURNT.

Lastly, the General Tso's. I requested "extra spicy" but like a lot of the Chinese restaurants I've been to in the West Valley, Golden Star doesn't bring the heat. Mild, mild barely-there flavor. There were no vegetables in the dish, which means the saving grace was there was actually a lot of chicken. (Unlike the beef in my Kung Pao Beef.) 

Overall, a crushing disappointment. I can get better food for less money from Panda Express. If you're going to try Golden Star, my advice is to eat at the restaurant so you can send back the dishes that are displeasing and go for the slightly-more-reasonable lunch prices.

Sadly my excellent doctor ( here at Cigna ) had to retire because of his own health issues.  I haven't been happy since.  I knew they were going to move and where....I saw them building the new facilities.  However, we were never notified when each department moved from the old building.  The new facility is a nightmare.  Handicapped parking is a joke for anyone with a walker.  To put up a new building without a drive-through window for the pharmacy is idiotic and outdated.  What were they thinking.
Great shop. Nice selection of fabric. Super friendly and helpful staff. My new favorite shop!!
Dave has been my barber for nearly 10 years!

I agree that Ruben is very friendly and appears to be full of a lot of knowledge. However, I have a Deluxe T9600 Vision Fitness treadmill and he told me that the motor was dead. He was in fact, absolutely correct, and it would indeed cost me $1000 to buy and have one installed. He also told me (after charging me a $100) that in his opinion to just forget it because my treadmill was 9 years old and I should invest in a new one. What he failed to mention and I find it incredibly hard to believe that he did not know this: these motors are 100% covered under WARRANTY for a LIFETIME. I have since got my new FREE motor, had a friend install it, and my treadmill is as good as new!

I had several jewelry items stolen from me, and got wind that some may have been brought here. I did find one of my rings, which I bought back. The ring was at least 50 years old and had unusual stones and a heavy, solid band to it. I have a large sized finger but it had fit me perfectly. When I got it back I noticed right away how much thinner the band was in the back, and it was so tight I couldn't get it on. They obviously shaved a good bit of gold off the band. Besides the fact that they most definitely accept stolen jewelry, and probably other stolen items as well. The place gave me the creeps. I can't help but think these 5 star reviews are fake.

Nicole could not have been a more perfect pick. She handled all requests and last-minute changes with grace and graciousness, and was such a joy to work with. Her final products (including individual mason jarred succulents as wedding favors) helped bring the entire wedding's aesthetic together. Thank you, Nicole!

Dr. Chang is a great dentist. He has a great attitude and sense of humor. The office staff is friendly and extremely professional. Great atmosphere which helps ease any anxiety associated with going to a new dentist. I am happy with the level of service and would recommend Dr. Chang to family and friends.

Very sweet restaurant, fairly small. We take up almost half the place when we get a table for 8, but there is a patio area. I've been here a handful of times and have had no complaints. I've got their Chicken Kabob plate and their Italian Spaghetti I would recommend them to anyone. I think all the entrees come with soup or salads. The Greek salad is definitely the one I recommend the Vinegarette they use is delicious. I have not tried any dessert yet but only because they are anything but stingy with their portions.. I always am left very full and satisfied. . . Then we always stick around for karaoke 7 to 11 on Saturday nights.. there are some very talented people that show off their vocals here. Don't miss out!
FYI: The restaurant  does not have a restroom so you'll have to take a little walk outside by Little Italy. Not too far at all

I hope this is not a biased review, because I work next to this location, but you guys are truly great. I know you have to deal with a lot of frustrating customers, because of the location, but you guys are great. The food is always fresh and so amazing! Thank you for your great customer service and excellent food! One satisfied customer!!
Absolutely wonderful staff! Very knowledgeable and polite. Feels like a mom an pop shop instead of the lame pawn 1st that is over stuffed with TVs and bike's.

As I read these I'm glad they can help out the people that need help but as a consumer they are extremely over priced.  It is part of the fun in getting a good deal that we get up at the crack of dawn to hunt down that treasure. We want to feel like waiting in line at 7am when it's hot out was worth it.  We don't want to feel like we waited in line for  a retail shop to open with no sale prices on the racks. I think the prices would be better at a store on 7th. Where we can go at our leisure  perhaps after a nice lunch with friends.  The prices reflect the cute shops on 7th but don't offer the comfort of browsing to our hearts content.   My heart goes out to those that are undergoing hard times it really does but as a treasure hunter I'm going to look for my loot elsewhere.

Had a great first visit today.  Little Lucy is a ten week old labradoodle and very healthy!  Dr  Johnson was excellent in every way.  I actually picked her because of her education and it was the definite right decision.  She along with the staff made a huge fuss over Lucy and spent a good deal of time with her.  Of course Lucy slept the entire time!  I would definitely give them a chance if you are looking for a very considerate vet!

I have gone to several groomers in the area and none of them compare to Precious Paws.  They genuinely care about all pets that come in.  I have two furry kids (Shih Tzus) that need consistent grooming and this is the first place they have actually liked going to.  They are very professional and the studio is very clean.  I would definitely recommend them to anyone!

I too would give zero if that were an option. I have been trying to get list of my items taken to no avail. I went to Peoria store and saw some of my items without any markings that they belong to me. Tried to get address of all stores to get my items and no response. They have basically stolen my items at this point. Made complaint to BBB they didn't bother to respond also made a complaint to AG office. DO NOT USE.

UNPROFESSIONAL,  Came in for a tattoo  had it drawn up,  just needed to retrace an stick on me n get to work the guy started drawing something other then I wanted he then took my sister's drawing did printed something completely different,  after the lady started on my sister's she made a comment about where we wanted it does,  no confidence at all in tattooing behind our ears,  red flag for me, also the guy working on my tattoo just walked out the shop,  very unclean,  kids sleeping on there couches.  So glad I left do not go here. No worth it  I did see one good artist he was the only one busy.

I am a teacher and was looking for film containers for chips in my classroom and this store was so kind to give me enough for my whole class....free of charge! It's sometimes a daunting task to find odd teacher items and it so nice when you find a local business that is willing to help a teacher out!

I wish I would have gotten her name but the cashier went above and beyond for an elderly gentleman that was in line just after me.  he appeared to be a little confused and pretty  slow, the time she took with him without getting upset and frustrated was memorable and a perfect example how we should all treat one another.  He was ordering a few different sandwiches and then at end he was questioning why so much, she was confused and proceeded to go over the order and amounts, that is when he said he didn't want all that just a brisket sandwich.  Without so mush as a roll of her eyes, she deleted everything except the brisket.  I will try to stop back in when I am back in the area so I can get her name and give her the recognition she deserves.  Now as for the food everything was fantastic and i LOVED the fish!  Not greasy at all and very tasty! I will definitely know where to come now when I want fish!
This is a great place to get really high quality fresh spices. They also have tons of teas and herbs. Really great help from the staff and I love the spices  I got. I will definitely be back.
This is an update on my previous review from over two years ago.  The pad is holding up well and we are very happy with the carpet.
We have always had a decent meal at this location. Staff are pleasant, fast and outgoing. The restaurant could use some a remodel.

The staff was so nice, I was just reflecting. Its time for Mooshu to go back for her senior checkup. I feel she's comfortable with the Doctor and the location is terrific. No one rushed us and I appreciate that.  The Harpers

This quilt store may be known for their sale and service of Bernina sewing machines but not for quilt material. Save your self the drive and try the other quilt store nearby for a fantastic selection of fabric and patterns.
For over a decade, Dr Johnson has been taking care of my furry family members and doing an amazing job!  She has earned huge amounts of trust and respect and is an incredibly kind and caring woman!!

In September of 2012, my parents were going through a very tough time. Due to the economy there retirement fund was hit hard by the stock market crash. This caused them to have to sell their home and much of their belongings. In an effort to help them gain some income I suggested they have an estate sale. Lucky for us we found a great review on Yelp and I called The Valley Estate Sales Company. Norbert was the best.  He knew we were under a time crunch and even rearranged his schedule so he could fit us in a week after I talked to him.

The staff arrived on time and ready to work fast the morning of the sale. Norbert and his assistant continued to be very courteous and sympathetic towards my parents and their situation.   The amount of traffic they were able to generate was amazing and almost everything was sold in just 1 day.  The rest of the items Norbert took back to his store location and my parents are still receiving checks as the remaining items are sold.  

All in all I felt the team was very professional and left the house looking as good as when they entered it. Though this was a very painful time, Norbert and his staff made the experience pleasant and the total income from the sales helped them pay for the move. 

I will forever be thankful that I made the call to The Valley Estate Sales Company and I'm grateful there is a place like Yelp were people can find reviews they can trust.

I use to stop in here once in awhile back in '05/'06 when I had caseload with some homes out in the NW Valley, at which point I would have rated it a 4 or 5 star.  Now that I have been relocated to our new Peoria office, I decided to swing by for lunch and give it a try again. Unfortunately, after my revisit I would now only rank it a 3 star, as my food tasted pretty much like any other decent Chinese restaurant.  I do admit I may be partially to blame, as for some reason I chose to order one of the most Americanized dish in Chinese/American cuisine, Lemon Chicken.  The chicken is done in the nugget style, not the whole breast sliced style like I generally prefer Lemon Chicken.  Although it was nugget style, the pieces were not grease and the quality of the chicken was good.  However, the sauce was pretty bland with very little citrus flavor. I did get the lunch combo. The fried rice, soup, eggroll and wonton were all decent with no heavy grease taste.  Portions were a little smaller than most Chinese places in the valley, but it was a good lunch for $5.25. I will probably revisit soon and give another dish a try.

The service was great, they had my food out quickly and I was finished with lunch in about 40 minutes.  Lunch combos are $5.25-$6.25 and most diner entrees are $7-$10.  For Vegetarian/Vegan they have a few choices of the typical vegetable dishes found at most Chinese restaurants for about $7, but at lunch you'll have to ask for the dinner menu to order them.  Also, they are promoting their food as no MSG and low sodium, which with the smaller portion sizes probably makes this restaurant a slightly healthier choice for Chinese food.  If you are looking for a quick Chinese sit down or to go lunch at a good price in the NW valley, Golden Star is a good place to stop in.
I love this place! We always grab some good to go when in Sun City! Great food and staff.
They do an absolutely fantastic job every time! Denise does our Ellie's hair and always pleases with his she looks. They are all very friendly. Would recommend this place to everyone!

If you want to see some drop dead beautiful clocks, this is the place to go.  If you want to see some really cute clocks and watches, this is the place to go.  Great service and, I think, reasonable prices. I have an ooooold mantel clock that didn't work. They were so good about explaining the options I had to get the clock running.  If you need a watch battery or want to invest in a $4000 grandfather, this is the place to go.  Call before you go.  They are running on summer hours so they may not be open during their regular posted hours.

The staff is very rude. I called to get a copy of a prescription mailed for my mom and the person answering the phone was extremely rude. She had a condescending tone and didn't even confirm the address. My mom is the patient and tells me that staff throughout Cigna is rude every time. I hope the health care provided is better than the customer service.

Just got two of the new pizzas with pretzel and a chess are crust. Also,Parmesan garlic wings...and the chili wings. There was more,but these items stood out. The pizzas were the worst I have ever had from any Pizza Hut,and the wings had little flavor. Whoever owns this franchise needs to do something about this pathetic food.
Got a clock there for a wedding present of someone in the family. Great service overall but a little slow. Great deals on watch batteries.

My mother and I went to this laundry mat because we figured it would be nice and quiet since it is located in Sun City. Oh boy were we wrong... First thing first, I walked into this place and a good number of machines where not working, but hey there was one other person in there so I didn't mind. I began loading up machines and starting my laundry, one of the washing machines were open when I started loading it up with my clothing, so as i finished putting in my clothes, detergent, and quarters into the machine, I closed the lid and noticed it had a piece of tape on it saying "Out of Order". At that point i went over to the dry cleaning side and let the young man know what had happened, he informed a older gentleman (who i'm sure is his father). Anyway the older man opened the machine and gave me back my money. I switched everything into another machine and pushed in the quarters but for some reason it didn't work. So i let the owner know again... and at this point he came over to me and informed me that he has cameras in the laundry and will be looking at the footage. I was SO offended, like this man basically accused of me committing LAUNDRY FRAUD. I let him know that he can sit and look at the surveillance all he wants, and that i haven't stolen anything or done anything. He than put the money back into my machine and pushed it and the machine worked. I am assuming that he pushed it really hard which made it work, but when i did it I did not jam it like he did. (since i was trying to gentle with the machines because they are not my property... this is how i am with stuff that don't belong to him. 
After that I just waited for my laundry to finish and i met his wife and began to explain to her what had happened and how rude her husband was, to accuse me of doing something illegal without even knowing anything about. 
She had informed me that they were robbed a couple days ago and he was on edge, but still that is not a valid excuse in my opinion to be bias against anyone. 
His wife does seem to be a very nice lady, she unlike him, was very polite and courteous. Until you have caught someone in the action they are truly innocent, and I was VERY offended by that. Earlier when my mother and I walked into the laundromat my mother found a check that was addressed to the owner and brought it right away to him. 
So for this man to make the assumption that I am some kind of thief was APPALLING.
I will not be returning to this establishment and will be taking my laundry elsewhere.
His machines where over priced as well as his plastic garbage bags... 75 cents for one garbage bag...... FRIGGING RIDICULOUS 

OH and yes the bathroom is disgusting, it smells like urine and the door doesn't close.

This place has to be the nastiest laundromat I've ever been to! It deserves 0 stars! Filthy floors and broken down machines. Better to drive an extra 10 miles for another laundromat. Only here because our dryer broke and waiting on a new one.
What great individuals and awesome time. I look forward to coming here again one day. Thanks for the great memories!

I rented a Polaris RZR 1000 UTV for a long weekend and had an absolute blast. Scheduling was easy via their website and the pick-up was fast and hassle-free - paperwork and payment took just a few minutes and when it was done, the staff already had the trailer loaded and hooked to my car, so I was ready to head out.

The machine was practically new and handled three days of extreme desert use without any problems other than a flat tire from a sharp rock, which I was able to repair in less than five minutes thanks to the provided tire repair kit and air compressor they put in the glove box. 

When I returned it, the machine had some damage to the rocker panels from some boulders I chose to drive over instead of around - they were as understanding as they could be.  Overall, these are NICE people who are easy to do business with and I'll definitely be back.  THANKS for a great weekend of EXTREME FUN!
Fastest and cheapest place to get a watch battery replaced!! $2.75 to replace a battery while FastFix wanted $20.00! Very nice staff as well. Will definitely go back

I got my snake bites here, because my friend had told me they were awesome. Her mom had a good relationship with them so I said why not. I had NOTHING BUT ISSUES WITH MY SNAKE BITES. I took very good care of them too, cleaned them all the time and they were always irritated and bothered me. She also pierced them LOP SIDED. My snake bites were crooked and the bitch had the nerve to tell me it was my lips. My friend's respite provider got a tattoo here and it was infected for weeks. This place is disgusting and shitty.

These rates are amazing, the condition of everything seems brand new. The customer service is polite and friendly. I have already recommended them to two people. I will be back several times,the pontoon boat looks amazing.

Benny cut my hair and it looks really nice. He is a good friend and I was happy to come support his local business of 21 years. Everybody was so nice and friendly. I was the youngest person possibly to ever land foot in the store under the age of 60 (everyone was asking who's grandchild I was) but I had a lot of fun!

We rented an awesome RZR 1000 from Sand highway RV! We had so much fun! The machine performed perfect no issues The staff is kind friendly and courteous and wants you to enjoy your trip!! We highly recommend, what a great trip thanks again Sand Highway RV!!

My first visit -- and I'll definitely be back -- was an absolute delight. Jim, the owner, was friendly and helpful. He had a creative solution for my boneheaded problem (filter ring stuck on a lens) and handled the job in less than 10 minutes.

This is the type of shop that deserves our loyalty. I recommend Sun Camera whether you need a camera, a part, or a repair.

Thanks again, Jim!

Floors n More replaced the carpet in our three bedrooms and we could not be more pleased. Martine did an excellent job he was a complete professional and the results show! I would not hesitate to use them again and would highly recommend anyone needing flooring work to check them out

This cleaners ruined 3 of my expensive silk blouses & 2 pairs of my husbands slacks. He said he has been in business for 33 years, so it's a manufacturers problem. He refused to take responsibility for stretching them. He said  I should have the company take care of it. They fit until he had them.  Will never go to him again. Don Clayborn, owner,  refused to listen to what I told him. These blouses have been dry cleaned at other cleaners before. There was no problem with them. He was rude & disrespectful to me. The business was messy.  While I was there he had a little boy waiting on people when they came in. The boy wasn't wanting to work. He should have been outside playing on such a nice day. He said he wasn't at fault. I will pass this on to home owners assoc., BBB, & all our neighbors & friends.

The worst tattoo shop around.  The woman that did my tattoo completely messed quote and the date underneath . Entirely unprofessional. Never go here they dont listen unclean. Its gonna coat me hundreds of dollars to get it fix. 
 
It was a meaning full piece to me.. No stars this place is shit.  A friend suggested the place so that's why I went.

I've been to this cleaner at least five times and each time I go back because I want to support a small business owner. Every time I am disappointed. 
The last two times unfortunately made my decision clear that I won't be returning. 
- Chemical residue was left in the reaction with my skin
- Clothes never ready when promised. 

 I dropped off four pairs of pants on Monday and they were promised on Thursday. When I went to pickup my clothes- on Friday none of them were ready. The guy said that his father was feeling ill and was unable to finish my clothes. I understood that, he told me to come back Tuesday. 

The next time I dropped off 3 pairs of pants and came back over a week later and the father/son owners went to the back for a few min. and father came back to tell me they weren't ready. 2 of 3 were ready. 
After getting home i put the pants on and immediately started to itch...they felt like there was a chemical residue left on the inside of my pants. I took them off and it was a white powdery substance which had a terrible reaction with my skin. I asked the person at the place and he said that he didn't know why that would happen.
